description:
"Le Malade Imaginaire" by Les Incompressibles - Wellington, "Le Malade Imaginaire" by Les Incompressibles - Wellington
Les Incompressibles from New Caledonia bring a playful, improvised twist to Molière’s Le Malade Imaginaire this October in New Zealand.

About this Event

🎭The New Caledonian theatre group named Les Incompressibles, will be performing in New Zealand in October with a playful reinterpretation of Molière’s classic Le Malade Imaginaire.
Lucie Dorio and Sam Kagy, two actresses from New Caledonia are performing the timeless comedy with their own vibrant energy, surprises, and a generous dose of improvisation.
Synopsis: Two actresses, running late, arrive to perform Le Malade Imaginaire. In their haste, one of them forgets the costumes and props. Not wanting to cancel the performance, they rise to the challenge of performing without costumes and proper props, using all means at their disposal to make it work.
📅 Saturday, 11th October 2025
🕕 2pm-3.30pm
📍 Alliance Française Wellington | Level 3, 78 Victoria Street, Wellington
🎟️ Free entry
Many thanks to our sponsors and partners for their support: The French Institute, The French Embassy, The Government of New Caledonia, CREIPAC, The French Ministry of Culture, The Federation of French Alliances in New Zealand

description:
2:22 A Ghost Story, Do You Believe in Ghosts?

In a rapidly gentrifying part of London, a married couple are renovating their new home. But something strange and frightening can be heard at the same time every night. What forces have they disturbed? Jenny has become convinced the house is haunted. Husband Sam isn’t having a bar of it. Tension builds throughout a housewarming dinner with friends as the clock ticks closer to 2:22… when a shocking truth will be revealed.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
2:22 A Ghost Story, Do You Believe in Ghosts?
In a rapidly gentrifying part of London, a married couple are renovating their new home. But something strange and frightening can be heard at the same time every night. What forces have they disturbed? Jenny has become convinced the house is haunted. Husband Sam isn’t having a bar of it. Tension builds throughout a housewarming dinner with friends as the clock ticks closer to 2:22… when a shocking truth will be revealed.
“Sharp, quick, and cleverly layered with clues – a thunderous fright night.” - The Guardian

Regan Taylor
Pamela Sidhu
Jack Sergent-Shadbolt
Serena Cotton
With otherworldly design by Chris Reddington, Marcus McShane, Daniel Elliott and Shiloh Dobie, 2:22 A Ghost Story is set to be the most spook-tacular event of the year! BOOK NOW!

description:
7 Days Live - Wellington, 7 Days Live - Wellington
Every year, NZ’s fave comedy show hits the road, thrilling and enraging packed theatres nationwide. It’s 7 Days Live!

Jeremy Corbett, Dai Henwood, Hayley Sproull, Paul Ego, Josh Thomson, Ben Hurley, and Justine Smith break all the rules — no cameras, censors, or lawyers.

This November, they hit the best theatres and stadiums in Aotearoa, delivering quick-fire standup comedy, then unleashing a wild 7 Days game, new for your town.

Hold onto your pants!

All Tickets are Mobile Ticket Only. Mobile Tickets are like Print-at-Home tickets but instead of having to print off the tickets yourself, you can just show the barcode on your mobile phone. It is the easiest way to access tickets to your events.

Child Policy: This event is recommended 15+. All patrons must hold a vaild ticket for entry.

description:
ALTAR: The Drag Rite of Balance and Blasphemy, Join us at Fringe Bar for ALTAR, a spellbinding drag ritual honouring the turn of the seasons. As day and night stand in perfect balance, witness an evening of witchcraft, blasphemy, mythology, and queer magic brought to life by a fierce coven of drag kings, queens, monsters, and cryptids.
This equinox, we invoke the primal, the divine, and the forbidden. Expect offerings to old gods, sacrificial glamour, and performances steeped in folklore, resistance and radical ritual. ALTAR is a celebration of queer power, transgressive beauty, and the defiance of a world that seeks to burn us at the stake.
With Performances By:
Robin Yablind
Rover Stimulation
Misty Frequency
Darryl Parton
Rocky Rhodes
MANNNTIS
Judas Kiss
Aracella
Cailiah the Banshee
Come ready to worship. Come ready to sin.
Bring your rage, your devotion, your offerings, and lay them down at the ALTAR!
Doors open 7.30pm
Show starts 8pm

description:
Abbie Chatfield | Wellington, Australia’s favourite chronic over-sharer, podcaster, TV star, and unapologetic truth-teller Abbie Chatfield is hitting the stage again – raw, unfiltered, and funnier than ever.
Fans and critics called it “the most relatable live show of the year” – with The West Australian praising Abbie’s “vulnerability and hilarious insight” as the secret sauce behind this unforgettable night of laughs, truth bombs, and too-real storytelling.
Whether you're a long-time fan or new to the chaos, this is your chance to see Abbie live doing what she does best – keeping it real and keeping it funny.

description:
Airhorn Calms Down, Hi [said in a whisper], how are you, are you ready for Airhorn?
PLEASE READ. SHOW WARNING!
This is truly going to be a different Airhorn. Last month was intense, and we love intensity, but felt the need to bring it down. The focus for this month is calm. Chill. Relaxation. This is truly going to be the most gentle Airhorn you have seen.
There will be no flashing lights or threat of epilepsy. There will not be loud noises or gross out humour. There will not be airhorns! This is not a bit. We are sincerely concerned that folks are going to come to think this is a goof and expect the usual madcap, abrasive chaos of our comedy show.
There will be no abrasion. There will be no chaos. We are wanting to do the most experimental show we can do, which in our case is a low-key, cozy, warm-hearted hour of quiet reflection and gentle comedy.This is going to be a soft show for everyone who needs a minute to just breathe. You will laugh, but not enough to hurt your side or upset your neighbor. It will be a laugh held in the liminal space between a deep breath and a long sigh.
For folks in which this amount of calm is too stressful, we will also have a Stimulation Booth (provided by Wattie's) available at any time to provide the classic Airhorn jolt they need.
label: Arts & Theatre

That's right! We've gone political in honour of the upcoming elections. There will be maps, there will be tallies, there will be on the ground reporting, there will be topical quips. My fellow countryfriends, we've got it ALL.

But mostly, we got the jokes, from the likes of:

Alayne Dick
Anna Maclean
Booth the Clown
Lesa MacLeod-Whiting
Lily Catastrophe
Jak Darling
Zach Mandeville

and maybe some surprise guests?

Vote with your laughter (and dollars) by buying a ticket today!!!!!

description:
Annual Exhibition 2025, Annual Exhibition 2025
The exhibition is being held this year at the Thistle Hall in Cuba St and will run from 29 September to the 5th of October.
Our annual exhibition is the opportunity to showcase the best work of our members to family, friends and the public and we try to include work from each member.
Current members of WPS are invited to submit up to three images to be considered for selection for the exhibition.
Entry
Each member can submit up to three images.
Entries should be sent to comms@wps.org.nz by midnight, 30 August 2025.
File Specs: Full resolution under 12MB
File naming: First name, Last Name, Title (if any)
Colour Mode: RGB colour mode (not Grayscale)
Bit Depth: 8 bits/Channel
Colour Space: SRGB
JPEG Format: Baseline (“Standard”)
File Naming
To avoid mixing up each member’s files, each image should have a clear file naming structure. It just allows us to keep better track of the images.
- Number_FirstName_Surname_Title.jpg
Printing and matting
The exhibition will be shown in the club frames, which are 16 x 20 inches. We will arrange printing and mounting of selected images on your behalf. You may elect to print and matt your own images. If this is the case, Please contact us to discuss.
Exhibition dates and times
Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba Street, Te Aro
29 September – 5th October 2025
Opening night
Monday, 29 September | Time 7pm | Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba St, Te Aro. Please come and join us to celebrate the creative photos of your fellow club members and yourself – family and friends are welcome. Finger food and refreshments will be available.
Gallery roster
We are looking to establish a roster of volunteers to man the gallery during weekday afternoons and during the weekends. Please contact the committee via comms@wps.org.nz if you can volunteer.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Aotearoa Tūmanako 2025 Children's Artworks for a Peaceful World., Tūmanako 2025 is here!!
This is the 10th year of running Tūmanako, this year’s theme is: Nothing is more precious than peace
A community event encouraging young ones (under 18) to express their creativity and share their aspirations for a peaceful, inclusive, and nuclear-free world.
The exhibition will be hosted at the Waitohi Hub with an opening event on 22 August and the exhibition will be on display from the 23 August till13 September.
Come on down and spend some time viewing the art located on the lower ground of the Johnsonville library at Waitohi.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Artists for Nature: Imaginal Disc, Enter a portal to a realm where insects meet art. Here, each insect is cherished for their unique beauty, their importance to the ecosystem and their marvelous life processes.

Through their dazzling video artworks, local artist Em Flux shares their queer, autistic worldview of the invertebrate world. They will be sharing a number of invertebrate-based video artworks and discuss the queer ecologies of insects, posthumanism and how art can be a tool to celebrate biodiversity. In these artworks, even the least appreciated creatures get a chance to shine!

This event will be held in the Rātā Cafe Balcony on the second floor of the Visitor's Centre. Doors Open 5.15pm, overflow parking is available on Birdwood Street.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Athol McCredie - Spencer Digby Studio Collection, Athol McCredie is Curator of Photography at Te Papa. He will talk about the Spencer Digby Studio collection held by Te Papa. The studio was founded in 1931 by Spencer Digby and was taken over by Ron and Inge Woolf in 1960, who ran it under the same name until the mid-1970s.
It was a portrait studio where anybody who was anyone in (or visiting) Wellington was photographed, from prime ministers to debutantes.
Athol will also talk about early twentieth-century photographer Leslie Adkin, the subject of his most recent book, ‘Leslie Adkin: Farmer Photographer’.
Thursday, October 9th, Tararua Tramping Club (4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria), Doors Open at 7pm
If you’re curious about the Wellington Photographic Society, you’re welcome to attend two meetings for free before deciding whether to join. It’s a great way to meet the community and see what we’re all about!
https://wps.wps.org.nz/
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Auditions! Superior Donuts by Tracy Letts, Stagecraft presents: “Superior Donuts”
By Tracy Letts
Directed by James Kiesel
26 November – 6 December 2025
“What could be more human, than to be scared, and keep it a secret.”
Arthur Przybyszewski (that's (p)Shub-er-shef-ski), is the proprietor of a modest, behind-the-times donut shop in uptown Chicago. He can't seem to find joy in anything these days, not even the donuts he used to take such pride in making by hand. Vandals armed with spray paint, predatory landlords, and that nefarious Starbucks down the road all threaten to unceremoniously snuff out the only thing he's got left.
That is, until an upstart, ambitious young man shoulders his way into becoming a Superior Donuts employee, and an unlikely friendship (or is it a rivalry?) develops, inspiring both to face the demons they've been hiding from all this time.
This is a sharp-witted, heartfelt comedy by Pulitzer Prize winner Tracy Letts (“August: Osage County”) offering a warm and wry take on depression, diversity, and bravery that will leave you feeling all fluffy and sugary on the inside. Plus, who knows, you might get a donut!
Go to the Stagecraft website to book your spot!
https://www.stagecraft.co.nz/auditions
AUDITIONS:
Auditions will be on Saturday 13th & Sunday 14th September, with callbacks the evening of Monday 15th September.
To book an audition, please fill out the form by 10th September - we'll be in touch to confirm your audition date, time and location. If you have any questions please get in touch at auditions@stagecraft.co.nz.
Roles (just try your best with accents, coaching available once casting is complete)
Arthur Przybyszewski [Male, Polish, 50s - 60s]
The owner and operator of Superior Donuts. Old, grumpy, and more than a little depressed. Secretly an artisan and a scholar, he’s spent his whole life running from conflict. Until now? [Has a scene involving some violence]
Franco Wicks [Male, African-American, 20s]
Young, idealistic, a little pushy, and full of attitude and energy. Franco believes that good things will happen to him despite all odds, and evidence, to the contrary. A former employee of Luther.
Max [Male, Russian, 40s - 60s]
Owner of the DVD shop next door, Max is interested in buying Superior Donuts to expand his (tiny) capitalist empire. Fancies himself a self-made man. [Speaks in a Russian accent, along with some dialogue in Russian]
Randy [Female, Irish-American, 30s - 40s]
Raised in the middle of 7 brothers and working as a cop in the Chicago Police Department, Randy’s always been ‘one of the boys’. Big hockey fan. Has a soft spot for Arthur.
James [Male, African-American, 30s - 40s]
Another cop with the Chicago Police Department and Randy’s beat partner. Well-respected in the community and [not so] secretly a giant Star Trek nerd. [Will consider any and all BIPOC actors for this role]
Lady [Female, Irish-American, 60s - 70s]
Likely homeless and definitely a little hard-of-hearing, Lady is a well-known as a confusing-but-likeable, perhaps even mascot-like figure in the Uptown community. Well past the point of giving a crap about what other people think.
Luther [Male, Irish-American, 30s - 40s]
Local bookie and crime-syndicate everyman, Luther has scratched out his living taking money from gambling addicts, which he finds troubling because he’d like to consider himself a good, fair man. Has a stomach ulcer which is probably somehow representative of this inner conflict. [Has a scene involving some violence]
Kevin [Male, Irish, 20s]
Another of Luther’s employees, Kevin’s probably fallen into the wrong crowd as a young man, but it doesn’t seem to trouble him that much. Seems to care mostly about getting paid and drinking Coca-Cola.
Kiril [Male, Russian, 20s - 30s]
A shy man of few words (mostly ‘hello’), Kiril is an intimidating figure with a big soft heart beating beneath his tall muscular frame. Brought into the fold to be a construction worker and bodyguard, he’s mostly interested in falling in love with the local bartender. [Most dialogue is in Russian]
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
B.M.I : BAD MŌMONA INDIVIDUAL (playreading), B.M.I : BAD MŌMONA INDIVIDUAL (playreading)
Created by Īhaka Martyn. Play read by Kaisa Fa'atui.

Tired of having no room for self love? Maybe burning 50kgs in 50 minutes will change that.

Join our inspiring fitness guru as he shows the audience how to shed your ego and excess fat. By utilising the power of manifestation, you too can change your pathetic little impulses. In fact, when was the last time you went to the gym? Maybe you should just skip this show and hit the treadmill instead, yeah?

Filled with self-helpless tips, banging tunes and kōrero hōhonu, this playreading will dissect the fraught relationships we have with our tinana, and where those nasty thoughts are really coming from.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
BOOK LAUNCH! Downstream from Nowhere by Johnny Crawford, Join 5ever books for the celebration and launch of Johnny Crawford's 'Downstream from Nowhere'!
Trades Hall, 124 Vivian Street
Friday 29 August 2025
6:30PM - whenevz
Free entry, all welcome, nibbles and drinks available, accompanied with sentimental words and live serenades.
~~~~~~
In the two centuries since the first Pākehā set foot in what would go on to be known as the Messines Valley, it has seen its fair share of history. Music Festivals. Failed settlements. Paranormal phenomena.
As the stolen land passed through the hands of church and state and capital, each left its mark. ‘Downstream from Nowhere’ follows this course through the eyes of the valley’s least reputable visitors.
~~~~~~
"Crawford sends us running straight into a tornado of intergenerational colonial mindsets, jingoistic historicism, and pop-cultural epochs, with a goat's head in one hand and a kebab in the other" - Jordan Hamel
Art by Miriam Collins, Sam Low and Nabilah Husna Binte Abdul Rahman. Cover designed by Achille Segard.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
BUCK SCOURGE: LIVING NIGHTMARE, Beware - BUCK SCOURGE is loose… or are we trapped in their LIVING NIGHTMARE thunder cracks, a clown horn honks in the distance...

Dancing playfully on the line between being genuine and performing for others is our devilishly cheeky BUCK SCOURGE and his menagerie of characters. This show is for people happy to not quite know what’s going on and for those keen to yell at a stranger.

Sean is a clown from Wellington, New Zealand. After training in France at Ecole Philippe Gaulier they continue to bring it up unprompted. They eat cheese now (on principle) even though it causes pain (to Sean and to others). This clown (derogatory) is also responsible for other chaotic successes like the infamous MILK saga, the award-winning ratKing, the ever confused DIFFERENT shows: The Devils Are Coming and Dogs In The Hole.

Sean also was five-time award-nominated at the NZ Fringe 2024 for their startlingly human performance in the verbatim solo show about incels: blackpill. However, due them being snubbed at the awards, Sean has turned their back on earnest performance forever.


Clown: Sean Burnett Dugdale-Martin
Live Musician: Will Evans
Lighting Designer: Jacob Banks
Producer: Tom Smith
Publicist: Julia Bon-McDonald
label: Arts & Theatre

Before the Winter Ends, Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel, Before the Winter Ends, explores the relationship between mother and son across Aotearoa New Zealand, Somalia and Egypt as they search for understanding and try to bridge the distance between them. It’s a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family. Join her in conversation with writer and reviewer Melissa Oliver (Ngāti Porou).

___

description:
Behind the Headlines: Talking Books with Mike McRoberts, Mike McRoberts (Ngāti Kahungunu ki te Wairoa) is one of New Zealand's most respected journalists and broadcasters, with an award-winning career spanning four decades. Join us to hear him talk about the books that have shaped his life at this special fundraising event for Katherine Mansfield House & Garden.

After anchoring Newshub's 6pm bulletin for 20 years and reporting from conflict zones and natural disasters worldwide, Mike is a familiar face in New Zealand homes. His work involves telling other people’s stories, but what stories have influenced him? Books have played an important role in Mike’s life, taking him from student librarian to author of two books himself.

Mike’s latest book, Speaking My Language | Te Kōrero i Tōku Reo, explores his deeply personal journey into Te Reo Māori and Te Ao Māori - captured in his acclaimed documentary, Kia Ora, Good Evening.

The evening will begin with a glass of Hunter’s Wines’ award-winning MiruMiru™ and delicious canapés. A non-alcoholic option will also be available.

This event is being held to raise funds for our Category 1 Historic Place and writer’s museum in Thorndon, which is open six days a week. We offer an annual programme of events and activities designed to encourage creativity and we host school and tour groups to share the life, literature and legacy of Katherine Mansfield.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Bonfire, Created and directed by Matías Avaca
Bonfire is an intimate storytelling ritual where performers gather around the fire to share tales shaped by culture, memory, and imagination. Rooted in ancestral echoes, each story is poetic, powerful, and fleeting; never to be told the same way twice.
Inspired by the workshop The Stories That Made Us, the show blends magical realism, oral tradition, and ensemble connection.
With previous presentations in Auckland and Brisbane (as part of the 2025 Brisbane Improv Festival), Bonfire now arrives at the New Zealand Improv Festival, inviting audiences into a space of warmth, wonder, and shared humanity.
This show may include content related to family, identity, cultural heritage, and emotional themes. While performers are encouraged to approach these with care and sensitivity, the improvised nature of the show means themes may vary each night. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Book Launch | All Her Lives by Ingrid Horrocks, Join us to celebrate a new work from Ingrid Horrocks, and her first book of fiction! The book will be launched by Emily Perkins.
Thursday 9 October, 6pm
Unity Books Wellington
Free event – all welcome!
All Her Lives follows women across generations as they resist, nurture and transform. These are lives shaped by love and politics, motherhood and memory, constraint and defiance.
From girls raised in the garden of Plunket founder Truby King, to a queer university student at a mid-2000s Berlin rave, to a mother facing the cost of her son’s climate rebellion, the women of All Her Lives are complex, resilient and deeply human. Shadowing their stories is the early feminist writer Mary Wollstonecraft, whose journey of grief and revolution will become a vessel for what endures – and for finding hope.
Vast and intimate, All Her Lives explores the layered selfhood of women – all that they inherit, sacrifice, imagine and carry forward – and the power found in unravelling and reweaving those selves on their own terms.
'A wonderful collection that swims in and out of women's lives across time, exploring the struggle for freedom and love. I'll be thinking about it for a long time - a book of quiet force.' —Emily Perkins, author of Lioness
'All Her Lives is a reckoning. A stunning tour de force of women’s lives across centuries, continents and political movements. The collection reads as a protest song book, calling through the ages for change, revolution and peace. Horrocks is one of the most powerful storytellers of our time and All Her Lives is the author's most triumphant work.’ —Laura Jean McKay
Ingrid Horrocks’s books include the memoir Where We Swim (2021), a literary history, Women Wanderers and the Writing of Mobility (2017), and two collections of poetry. Her writing has appeared in Lithub, The Ninth Letter, The Sydney Review of Books, The Spinoff, Landfall, and the Guardian. In 2024 she was the Kaituhi Tarāwhare CNZ Writer in Residence at the International Institute of Modern Letters, and in 2025 she was awarded the Michael King Writers Centre Australian Residency at Varuna. Ingrid lives in Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Wellington, with her partner and twin daughters.
Cover: Sarah Wilkins
label: Arts & Theatre

Book Launch: South by South by Charles Ferrall, Join us to celebrate the publication of Charles Ferrall's South by South: New Zealand and the Heroic Age of Antarctic Exploration. The book will be launched by Harry Ricketts.
Free event, all welcome!
"South by South tells the story of New Zealand’s role in ‘the Heroic Age’, that wave of exploration beginning at the end of the nineteenth century in which men set out to traverse the continent of Antarctica and, if they survived, to bring home their findings. The members of this New Zealander triumvirate were all believers in the British Empire, but the southern voyages were to an uninhabited land."

description:
Box of Birds, Hailed as "the cutest little show in Aotearoa" (Hamilton Arts Festival 2024), award-winning theatre company Birdlife Productions have created this gorgeous theatre show designed especially for ages 4 to 9 years, Including exquisite puppetry, live interactive songs, projection and the teaching of a waiata, this work reflects our transformative connection to nature. Peter is reluctant to stay with nanna in the school holidays because she lives in the country and doesn't have a TV but Nanna finds ways to engage Peter in her love of the forest, especially the precious manu, when they build a nesting box for Ruru together. Peter is excited to see if Ruru will make her home in the box, waiting patiently while many other birds arrive to check out the box first! And after all that waiting, Nanna takes Peter on an exciting night time forest walk to find Ruru - in the dark! The bird characters are all familiar New Zealand locals, such as piwakawaka, kereru, tui and ruru, and the story highlights the importance of supporting them and the different needs they may have. Teachers and Parents have been ecstatic about this show and hundreds of New Zealand children have been transfixed by it.
As quoted by Theatreview: “This is truly a New Zealand show for New Zealand children and all those young-at-heart”.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Building the Stage We Stand On - Director's Talk & High Tea with Lyndee-Jane Rutherford, In this intimate conversation with Director Lyndee-Jane Rutherford, we will hear about what she looks for when selecting plays, how she works with her creative team and actors on big themes that resonate with audiences and how she approaches working with content of social and political power, and why this is important to the work she does.
Enjoy an Eat Your Art Out High Tea (included in your ticket price) while hearing Lyndee-Jane speak on leadership, legacy, creation, impact and theatre that changes the world.
Reviewed as “Succession meets Barbie” by Showcase Victoria, Monument explores the role that makeup and fashion play in how we perceive and receive women in power. Edith Aldridge is the youngest woman to be elected leader of her country. In a lush presidential suite, she has just ninety minutes to get ready for the most monumental day of her life. But things are not going to plan. Due to heavy fog, her team is stuck in another city. Enter Rosie, a twenty-two year old makeup artist from the David Jones counter, sent last minute to help Edith get camera ready.
From very different worlds, these two women, though face to face, do not see eye to eye in this provocative, slick and funny play that is “sparkling fresh and urgently of the now”.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Bull Rush, Bull Rush
THIS SHOW IS R13.

With a roster of Tāmaki Makaurau's best and brightest performers, expect spit-take-worthy gags, epic stories, heartbreaking tales, and live improvised music at Bull Rush.

So gather your mates for a night of never before seen, totally made up, improvised comedy.

Mess with the bull, feel the rush.

Since 2020, Bull Rush has been making it up as they go. With several seasons (Jingle Bull(Rush), Ghoul Rush, Bull Rush (1822) under their belt, these self-professed improv nerds know how to put on a bloody good show.

Winners of Best Improv Group at the 2024 NZ Comedy Guild Awards, among other accolades (not to brag).

“From start to finish, the show kept me laughing, and by the end, I found myself not only impressed by the performers' quick wit and timing but also rediscovering my appreciation for the art of theatre.”

95bfm.com

R13 - This show may contain potential references to sex, violence as death. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

Image credit: John Rata
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Cantina Comedy, Cantina Comedy is back at Raumati's entertainment hub, Sunday Cantina.

12 comedians will be walking under the spot light to bring you the LOLs. Who will it be? It could be an experienced comedian, a newbie, a local mirth maker or a touring trouble maker.

What you going to hear? Well rehearsed script, a work in progress, a brand new joke, puns, improv, props but it is all designed to make you laugh.

You can also get involved. Drop a topic in the jar and few comedians will try to blind riff off them as they are drawn at random. Could be comedy gold or a complete car crash.

description:
Catfish Trifecta presents: Improv on a plate, Welcome to Improv on a Plate, the comedy tasting menu no one ordered and everyone regrets.
In this unholy fusion of high-stakes improv and low-stakes judgment, three deranged guest chefs (aka format-pitchers) take the stage with one mission: serve up the most unhinged, impossible improv formats they can dream of. Enter Wellington comedy trio, Catfish Trifecta — your unsuspecting improv victims — who must swallow each cursed format whole and perform it on the spot.
No script. No escape. Just raw, unfiltered chaos served à la mode.
Tickets $10
Door sales while available.
Venue R18.

description:
Charlotte Grimshaw: The annual NZSA Janet Frame Memorial Lecture, In the 2025 New Zealand Society of Authors Janet Frame Memorial Lecture, Charlotte Grimshaw will report from the frontlines of fiction and memoir, discuss veracity, integrity and clarity in a so-called ‘post-truth world’, and share ideas she’s formed about authenticity after a whole life lived in fiction.
The frontlines of fiction and memoir
Charlotte Grimshaw will describe her ongoing quest for answers, including a recent personal discovery of material in the Turnbull Library archive that shattered some final illusions and fuelled her determination to go on expressing ideas and writing accurate human stories, no matter what.
Don't miss this one-off, very special event, presented in partnership with Verb Wellington, New Zealand Society of Authors Te Puni Kaituhi O Aotearoa (PEN NZ) Inc, and National Library of New Zealand Te Puna Mātauranga o Aotearoa.
Verb Wellington website
The New Zealand Society of Authors website
This event is free to attend, and will be followed by supper and light refreshments. Please register to secure your place. All welcome.
>>> Book your free ticket: https://events.humanitix.com/janet-frame-memorial-lecture... <<<
About the speaker
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Chloe's Revenge, Chloe's Revenge
Written and performed by Chloe Bettina.

Part love letter, part exposé, Chloe’s Revenge is a musical theatre-inspired show that pulls back the curtain on the pro-am musical theatre “industry” in Aotearoa. With biting wit, Chloe lays bare the heartbreak of rejection from the world she adores, and turns that pain into power. This is a story of survival, self-discovery, and the ultimate comeback: becoming the best version of yourself when the system says you don’t belong. You don't have to be a "musical theatre person" to enjoy this show. In fact, it's better if you're not.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Christmas in October, Presented by the New Zealand Improv Festival

It's nowhere near beginning to look anything like Christmas, but if October in Wellington is true to form, the weather outside is probably frightful, so we're celebrating anyway. Wear your best ugly sweater for this celebration of the Christmas season, featuring gifts (real), eggnog (imaginary) and warm feelings (both).

Featuring a found family of amazing performers from across the Festival, together on stage for the very first time.

“If you want to laugh till your belly hurts, watch wizards weave worlds out of thin air, and be a part of something special, inimitable, then catch as many NZIF shows as you can.” - Regional News

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Costuming Austen's Characters, Costuming Austen's Characters
Join us for a talk about dressing Jane Austen's characters for the stage

About this Event

Costuming Austen's Characters - Reschedule of May Event (slightly later start)
Following on from our panel discussion with the writers and directors of local Austen productions we welcome costumier Meredith Dooley who worked on dressing the actors for all those productions.
Meredith Dooley is a Wellington born and bred actor, director and costumier. She completed a BA in Theatre and Film at Victoria University of Wellington in the early 1990s, and then trained in acting and directing in London. In 2018-19 she gained a Diploma in Costume Construction at Toi Whakaari New Zealand Drama School and spent the next two Covid-affected years working on theatre, film and television productions such as Wellington Paranormal, Mr Corman, WOW, and Wellington Opera's Don Giovanni.
Meredith has returned to the office and over the last few years has created costumes for Stagecraft's Pride & Prejudice and Persuasion, and KAT Theatre's Sense and Sensibility, amongst others. Early in 2024 she dipped her toes back into professional theatre, working with cabaret star Meow Meow during the NZ Festival of the Arts.

Afternoon tea provided

description:
Create for a Cause, Create for a Cause
Create for a Cause” ART WEEK was a huge success over the three days, with the school buzzing with creativity, collaboration, and connection to our theme. Students worked in mixed-age Tuakana–Teina groups, producing artworks that were diverse in medium yet united by the kaupapa of belonging and place. There was a strong sense of whanaungatanga as boys collaborated, supported one another, and expressed their individuality through creative projects inspired by whenua and rangi.

Plans are now in place for the Residency & Student Art Exhibition, 2nd September, where all artworks and sculptures will be celebrated.

We are also excited to celebrate the conclusion of Dean Proudfoot’s Artist Residency, during which he has immersed himself in Wellesley’s culture and the stunning natural surroundings of Days Bay. Dean has created a captivating collection of works that reflect his experience here, which will be unveiled at the exhibition.

📅 Exhibition Details:

Date: Tuesday 2 September

Open viewing from: 3:00pm

Official opening: 7:00pm

We warmly invite all families to join us, celebrate the extraordinary creativity of our boys, and support the kaupapa by giving a koha for your son’s artwork, with all proceeds going to the Mental Health Foundation. The exhibition will also showcase the impressive sculptures created in art classes, alongside Dean Proudfoot’s captivating residency collection, which will be available to view and purchase, with proceeds supporting the Wellesley Foundation.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Curators' Talk - Me: Artists Paint Themselves, Join us for a conversation between Me: Artists Paint Themselves curators' Maddie Brooks Gillespie and Jaenine Parkinson.
Maddie Brooks Gillespie (she/her) is an emerging curator and academic based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She is a Master’s student in the Tāhuhu Kōrero Toi Art History programme at Te Herenga Waka Victoria University of Wellington, and her practice centres primarily around the interdisciplinary field of the Environmental Humanities, alongside explorations of memory, history, place and performance in art. She was the New Zealand Portrait Gallery Te Pūkenga Whakaata Liz Stringer Curatorial Intern for 2024.
Jaenine Parkinson is Head of Art at Te Papa Tongarewa Museum of New Zealand. She has held leadership roles across public galleries, local government, and project spaces in New Zealand and internationally. From 2017–2025, she was Director of the New Zealand Portrait Gallery Te Pūkenga Whakaata. Prior to that, she served as Arts, Museums and Heritage Advisor at Kāpiti Coast District Council and held directorial roles at Blue Oyster Art Project Space and an arts centre in Ottawa, Canada. Jaenine has also led numerous independent curatorial and writing projects.

description:
Dungeons and Demons: We're All Going To Super Hell, Dungeons and Demons: We're All Going To Super Hell
Hell is empty and all the devils are playing DnD

It’s time to face your demons. Wellington-based Dungeons and Dragons podcast Last In Initiative is back, and this time, things are getting spooky.

Come hell or high water, the team is locked in and ready to bring you two all new hellarious, hellish, and almost certainly heretic filled adventures. Join our four budding demonologists as they stumble their way into a summoning ritual, argue with a devil and, if they aren't careful, face the heat of hellfire.

Each night brings an all new adventure and new challenges, guaranteed to take you on a comedy-packed, action-filled romp to hell and back (handbasket not included).

This show follows the success of Dungeons and Delinquents, Dungeons and Da Vinci, and Dungeons and Decades, shows that had TTRPG nerds and novices alike laughing along.

description:
Dungeons and Demons: We're All Going To Super Hell, Presented by Last In Initiative, partnered with Duct Taped On.

It’s time to face your demons. Wellington-based Dungeons and Dragons podcast Last In Initiative is back, and this time, things are getting spooky.

Come hell or high water, the team is locked in and ready to bring you two all new hellarious, hellish, and almost certainly heretic filled adventures. Join our four budding demonologists as they stumble their way into a summoning ritual, argue with a devil and, if they aren't careful, face the heat of hellfire.

Each night brings an all new adventure and new challenges, guaranteed to take you on a comedy-packed, action-filled romp to hell and back (handbasket not included).

This show follows the success of Dungeons and Delinquents, Dungeons and Da Vinci, and Dungeons and Decades, shows that had TTRPG nerds and novices alike laughing along.

Last In Initiative is a character-focused actual play podcast where the stories are short, the rolls are low, and the hosts are stressed.

Hosted by Revena and Isabella, and starring their funniest friends with the most compatible schedules.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Echoes of the Past, Presented by Best on Tap

In keeping with the theme of the festival, Best on Tap ponders what has led us to 'be here now'?

What people, actions and objects have combined to shape this place we know as Wellington/Te Whanganui a Tara?

What paths have led us to make this our home?

What decisions, genes and character traits echo through generations to make us who we are today?

This show will traverse time to explore these rich themes, all with a good helping of Best on Tap truth based, grounded spontaneous theatre.

After all, what were our ancestors doing if not improvising?

Inspired by Felipe Ortiz (Colombia)

Best on Tap is a Wellington-based improvisation troupe who use truth-based play to create compelling and satisfying narratives. This is spontaneous theatre that honours and entertains.

As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

description: Exhibition Opening - In Each Other's Pockets, In Each Other’s Pockets opens on Friday 24 October 2025 at Toi Pōneke Gallery, Te Aro, Wellington. Through playful installation, contemporary jeweller Louise Hill examines the politics of pockets; the private spaces that shape the way we move through the world. Through her interactive installation Hill, explores what it means for some bodies to be equipped with tools they need, while others are not.

description:

Ghost Media and Support Your Local Collective are joining forces with Third Eye Hi-Fi to present one of our favourite producers of the last few years - FONZO

This Bristol local has been blazing a trail with their innovative productions based in garage, jungle and techno, with releases on some of our favourite labels including ec2a, Durkle Disco and No More Mailouts. Their dubs have been rinsed by almost every DJ we've booked and we've been waiting until they grace our shores.

Listen to Fonzo here: https://soundcloud.com/fonzox

We've pulled together a gold star support lineup, with performances incoming from UNWELL, FRONTA and WHAEA G

If you're into the sounds we've been curating for the last couple of years, this one is going to tickle your fancy.

$15 early birds are available from Humanitix - lock in now and prepare for a thunderous night of drums, bass and everything in between!

description:
Faulty Towers The Dining Experience - Wellington, They’re back!

After taking New Zealand by storm during their debut tour in 2024; Faulty Towers The Dining Experience returns in 2025. Don’t miss out on your chance to see the original multi award winning West End sensation taking the world by storm.

Basil, Manuel and Sybil are in town—and they’re bringing a healthy dose of mayhem to your door. Fully immersive, highly interactive and completely original, this is the show where anything can happen and usually does—and with 70% of the show improvised, it’s never the same twice. With two hours of comedy, three courses of food, and universal acclaim the world over, expect chaos, laughs, and a brilliant night out.

‘If you're looking for an evening of hilarity with a side of delicious nostalgia, this dining experience is not to be missed.’ BlackGuard Reviews – Auckland 2024
‘Deliciously unforgettable.” Regional News – Wellington 2024
‘A raucously hilarious and wonderfully chaotic dining experience.’ The Movie Army – Auckland 2024

Experience the world’s ♯1 experience!

Booking fee included in ticket price. All tickets include a 3-course meal and 2-hour interactive show.

description:
Feilding Market Fiasco - Opening Night, Feilding Market Fiasco - Opening Night
It’s Christmas in the town square, and the local artisans are setting up their market, filling the air with the scents of fine cheeses, fresh bread, and honey. But when a cattle truck loses control, the chaos of runaway sheep takes over the festive cheer!

Will the carolers keep their cool? Can the Christmas Grinch find her holiday spirit? And will the mistletoe spark unexpected romance? Find out in this hilarious and heartwarming holiday comedy!

Written by Alison Quigan— don’t miss this world premiere that will have you laughing into Christmas!

description:
Friday Laughs with Gabby Anderson and Cori Gonzalez-Macuer, Friday Laughs is a two hour comedy showcase of some top Kiwi talent, right in the heart of Wellington.

This month's show features headline act Cori Gonzalez-Macuer
7 Days regular and star of What We Do In The Shadows, Cori Gonzalez-Macuer has been performing his unique brand of self-deprecating observational and deadpan comedy since 2003.
In that time he's won the Billy T James Award, appeared on film and television, and performed in Australia, America, England, Scotland, Singapore and as far as the Middle East and South America, as well as appearing in Wellington Paranormal and the NZ Comedy Gala.

With MC Gabby Anderson
Gabby Anderson is a Wellington-based comedian, MC, improviser and teacher. She hit the scene running in 2018 winning the National Raw Comedy Quest. Her solo show Bad(ish) Teacher sold out at the 2023 NZ International Comedy Festival. One of NZ comedy's rising stars.

"Friendly, engaging, genuine and enthusiastically here for a good time" - Theatreview

description:
Funkin’ Donuts Vinyl Session at Parrotdog Bar, FLEX WEBSTER + DJ AUDIT [AK]
7" 45 SESSION
ALL STYLES, ALL SMILES
SAT 27 SEPT 2-10PM
FUNKIN’ DONUTS is a celebration of all things funky on the 7” 45 vinyl format.
The brand’s name comes from the records themselves - small, round, and with a large hole in the middle, they’ve long been nicknamed “donuts.”
Founded by Flex Webster in 2022, FUNKIN’ DONUTS began as a jam session with fellow 45 heads before evolving into a platform for original edits and future vinyl releases. With an ultimate vision of putting out 7” records, Flex has already released six albums of party edits under the brand, with plans for the first physical release coming soon.

Date: Saturday, 25 October 2025
Time: 7:30pm - 9:30pm
Location: Abandoned Taproom Petone, Lower Hutt, Wellington Region

Comedy icon GISH is back with a brand-new tour across Aotearoa. For over 20 years, GISH has been one of New Zealand’s most beloved comedians, famous for his outrageous parodies that mix six strings with dodgy things. Get ready for a night where no song is safe. Joining him is Canadian freestyle sensation Jesse Firebrand, a razor-sharp musical comedian known for lightning-fast improvisation comedy songs, tearing through the Australian scene, with no one in New Zealand doing what he does. Your host for the night is Anthony Wilson, an Auckland-based comic and crowd favourite who has performed across Aotearoa, Australia, and the UK, known for quick wit, polished storytelling, and pub-worthy tales. There will also be a special guest on the night.

description:
George Fenn is: Sexy Ghost Boy (Pōneke), Begin with a circle. Work your way up, slowly. Bravely. The Macarena happens to completion. Scream.
This is how you summon Sexy Ghost Boy, the award winning and hilariously f***able spirit, haunting Pōneke this October.
The show dissects the unspoken rituals and micro neurosis we have around Sex and the presentation of ourselves as sexual agents.
Using Clown and Burlesque this wordless performance inspires the audience to heroically rebel against insecurity.
Described by witnesses as a hot mess mash up of Mr Bean and Marina Abramović, this show has split the sides of audiences across New Zealand.
Organised Chaos Award / Auckland Fringe 2024
Bizarre and Charming Award / Hasting Fringe 2024
Nominated for Outstanding Performer / Dunedin Fringe 2025
Tickets $30 waged / $20 unwaged.
The show is strictly R18. It contains sexual themes and nudity up to underwear.
Creative team:
George Fenn (he/she/they) is a genre bending comedy theatre maker based in New Zealand who specializes in audience interaction. Their passion is inspired in opposition to the coercive trends of Comedic Interaction, and prioritises negotiating audience’s boundaries and building experiences where power is exchanged and humor is shared.
Anne Cunliffe (she/her) is an emerging producer and comedy nerd who is using the skills learned during her decade long public servant career to excel in Arts Management.
Martin Sagadin

description:
Grass Roots, Grass Roots
Written and performed by Raureti Ormond.

Grass Roots is a heartfelt and charming musical about the colossal culture of rugby. From club fields to Eden Park, a queer boy embarks on an epic odyssey through the New Zealand Rugby ages. Join him in this historical exploration of takatāpuitanga, masculinity, fatherhood, and what it means to grow up in Aotearoa. Created for rangatahi and whānau, this powerful story speaks to all generations.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
HEXAFLEXAGON, Directed by Jim Fishwick
A hexaflexagon is a brightly-coloured six-sided shape that folds in on and out of itself to reveal face upon face upon face.
This show is also a hexaflexagon.
Six brightly-coloured shape-shifting actors fold scenes in on and out of themselves to reveal face upon face upon face. We wear lip gloss and carry a sword and play Super Mario and explore the forest and cry wet tears and eat giant pink-frosted donuts and party until dawn. We’re hexaflexagons. And so are you.
HEXAFLEXAGON is a high-art, high-energy improv show drenched in neon colours and backed by a hyperpop soundtrack. Six actors improvise scenes that are simultaneously very silly and very earnest, angular and amorphous, which weave together and snap apart.
As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes beyond what is in the description above. The show may contain mature themes and language, but not gratuitously. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
Image credit: Kirsty McGuire

description:
Having Heard a Glow – Lewis Vivian Cosgrave, Here, everything was aglow - and everything was connected by a web of invisible thread… and this morning, a new strand - fine, but still perceptible - pulled lightly at her heels…
Lewis Vivian Cosgrave (Ngāti Pūkenga, b.1997) is a Te-Whanganui-a-Tara based artist primarily focused on the experience of the quotidian, a life found along concrete pavements and inner city gardens, his works blend an interest in painting, drawing and photographic practices. Cosgrave works to find intentional reticence through the alteration of collected and personal archive imagery. Erasing, saturating and muddying with a refined sense of surface and delicate use of colour, arriving eventually to a space that grants us momentary reflection on the ordinary rhythms of daily life.
A short story by Lucy Clara accompanies the show.
Opening Friday, 26 September at 5pm – kindly sponsored by Duncan’s Brewing, Almighty and The Garden Table. The exhibition runs from 27 September – 18 October 2025 at Twentysix Gallery.
Opening Hours:
Thursday 12pm - 6pm
Friday 12pm - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 4pm
Or by appointment
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Having Heard a Glow – Lewis Vivian Cosgrave, Twentysix is pleased to announce its first solo exhibition with Lewis Vivian Cosgrave (Ngāti Pūkenga, b.1997) whose work is primarily focused on experiences of the quotidian. It is the everyday—a frame caught while falling. Cropped into a leg mid step, a backyard blurred behind—a moment that becomes a memory. Intimate and undefined.
Cosgrave’s practice captures transitory moments—life found along concrete pavements, in the backseat of a car, in glimpses of inner city gardens, blending painting, drawing and photographic practices. Through a refined sense of surface and delicate use of colour, Cosgrave brings an intentional reticence to his work—altering collected and personal archive imagery through saturation, erasure and muddying. Arriving eventually to a space that grants us momentary reflection on our everyday—on the mundanity and transience that surrounds us.
A short story by Lucy Clara accompanies the show.
Join us for the opening celebration on Friday, 26 September at 5pm. Kindly sponsored by Duncan’s Brewing, Almighty and The Garden Table.

Opening Hours:
Thursday 12pm - 6pm
Friday 12pm - 6pm
Saturday 10am - 4pm
Or by appointment
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Having Heard a Glow – Opening, Here, everything was aglow - and everything was connected by a web of invisible thread… and this morning, a new strand - fine, but still perceptible - pulled lightly at her heels…
Lewis Vivian Cosgrave (Ngāti Pūkenga, b.1997) is a Te-Whanganui-a-Tara based artist primarily focused on the experience of the quotidian, a life found along concrete pavements and inner city gardens, his works blend an interest in painting, drawing and photographic practices. Cosgrave works to find intentional reticence through the alteration of collected and personal archive imagery. Erasing, saturating and muddying with a refined sense of surface and delicate use of colour, arriving eventually to a space that grants us momentary reflection on the ordinary rhythms of daily life.
A short story by Lucy Clara accompanies the show.
Opening Friday, 26 September at 5pm – kindly sponsored by Duncan’s Brewing, Almighty and The Garden Table. The exhibition runs from 27 September – 18 October 2025 at Twentysix Gallery.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Heartbreak Hotel, Heartbreak Hotel
This one's for the young hearts, the old hearts, and the broken hearts.

Direct from a season at London’s Soho Theatre, Circa Theatre and EBKM are delighted to present a limited season of the Heartbreak Hotel. 11 Shows Only.

‘One of the best productions I’ve seen this year.’
★★★★★ Time Out Melbourne

‘It hijacks your nervous system and fast tracks its way into your soul.’
★★★★ Scotsman

“A brilliant production which I loved”
Suzie Miller, writer of Tony award-winning Prima Facie

Story, science and a synth combine in an exhilarating new play that examines what happens in our bodies when we’re bereft.

From acclaimed Wellington-based theatre company EBKM, who brought their ground-breaking Gravity & Grace to Circa Theatre last year (Production of the Year, Wellington Theatre Awards 2024), Heartbreak Hotel tracks a woman’s broken heart in a wrenching and relatable journey that’s studded with classic break-up songs and razor-sharp observations on the physiology of love.

Featuring award-winning performances from Karin McCracken (Gravity & Grace, Yes Yes Yes) and Circa Theatre mainstay Simon Leary (Blithe Spirit, Gravity & Grace, Transmission Beta), as well as exquisite direction from Eleanor Bishop (Gravity & Grace, Girls and Boys), Heartbreak Hotel is a hilarious, honest take on a universal human experience.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Heartbreak Hotel, This one’s for the young hearts, the old hearts, and the broken hearts.

Direct from a season at London’s Soho Theatre, Circa Theatre and EBKM are delighted to present a limited season of ‘Heartbreak Hotel’.

‘One of the best productions I’ve seen this year.’ ★★★★★ Time Out Melbourne
‘It hijacks your nervous system and fast tracks its way into your soul.’ ★★★★ Scotsman
“A brilliant production which I loved” Suzie Miller, writer of Tony award-winning Prima Facie

Story, science and a synth combine in an exhilarating new play that examines what happens in our bodies when we’re bereft. Featuring Karin McCracken and Simon Leary. Winner Best Play, TimeOut Australia Arts and Culture Awards 2025.

From acclaimed Wellington-based theatre company EBKM, who brought their ground-breaking Gravity & Grace to Circa Theatre last year (Production of the Year, Wellington Theatre Awards 2024), Heartbreak Hotel tracks a woman’s broken heart in a wrenching and relatable journey that’s studded with classic break-up songs and razor-sharp observations on the physiology of love.

Featuring award-winning performances from Karin McCracken (Gravity & Grace, Yes Yes Yes) and Circa Theatre mainstay Simon Leary (Blithe Spirit, Gravity & Grace, Transmission Beta), as well as exquisite direction from Eleanor Bishop (Gravity & Grace, Girls and Boys), Heartbreak Hotel is a hilarious, honest take on a universal human experience.

Heartbreak Hotel comes to Circa Theatre fresh from smash-hit shows at Soho Theatre London, RISING Festival Melbourne, and Edinburgh Fringe Festival. Destined for international touring in 2026 and beyond, Heartbreak Hotel is only running at Circa for two weeks before the show must move on to other centres. Do not miss this special homecoming – it won’t happen again.

description:
Heathers the Musical, It’s Westerberg High, where popularity is a matter of life and death. Welcome to ‘Heathers the Musical”. Based on a movie with the same name, the show is a coming-of-age story dealing with love, heartache, defying expectations, and being true to yourself. It originally premiered in Los Angeles in 2013. Since then, the musical has had record-breaking seasons across the globe. It now makes its professional New Zealand debut in 2026, and Wellington is in line to join the school assembly. Described as a high-octane, black comedy rock musical, Heathers is packed with a mix of ballads and showstoppers. The catchy tunes are written by Kevin Murphy (Desperate Housewives) and Laurence O’Keefe (Legally Blonde: The Musical). 
The 1989 film starred Winona Ryder and Christian Slater. It quickly achieved cult status among audiences. Both the movie and musical follow high school student Veronica Sawyer. Veronica is just another nobody until she’s unexpectedly taken under the wings of the beautiful and cruel Heathers. When mysterious teen rebel J.D. arrives, Veronica learns that it might kill to be a nobody, but it's murder being a somebody. 
This special production will feature a stellar Australasian cast. So grab your scrunchies, break out the Corn Nuts and wait for the bell to ring.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Improv On a Plate - a Comedy Show, Welcome to Improv on a Plate, the comedy tasting menu no one ordered and everyone regrets. In this unholy fusion of high-stakes improv and low-stakes judgment, three deranged guest chefs (aka format-pitchers) take the stage with one mission: serve up the most unhinged, impossible improv formats they can dream of.

Enter: Catfish Trifecta — your unsuspecting improv victims — who must swallow each cursed format whole and perform it on the spot. No script. No escape. Just raw, unfiltered chaos served à la mode.

The pitchers then get to sit back, relax, and judge the madness they’ve unleashed. It’s improv. It’s pain. It’s Improv on a Plate.

One night only. No refunds. BYO palate cleanser.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Instant Theatre, Instant Theatre is a fully improvised, character-driven performance of real people in real situations—created spontaneously before your eyes.

With no scripts, no games, and nothing prepared, our four performers build a rich, interwoven world exploring the lives of these characters experiencing joy, heartbreak, unexpected life events, human connection, revelations of who they truly are.

Every show is a one-night-only window into these lives.

description:
Iron, Iron
By Rona Munro
Directed by Campbell Wright
27th August - 8th September
The Gryphon Theatre
Iron follows the rekindling of a relationship between Josie and her estranged mother Fay who is currently serving a life sentence for killing Josie's father. Josie seeks to understand the events that she barely has any memory of, while Fay attempts to live life vicariously through her. As the play develops, we discover how incarceration has affected all of the parties involved, including the prison guards.
The Cast
Faye - Karen Anslow
Josie - Ivana Palezevic
Guard 1 - James Bayliss
Guard 2 - Helen Mackenzie-Hughes

description:
John Bishop | Wellington, John Bishop | Wellington
Comedy superstar John Bishop is set to return to Australia & New Zealand with his new show 25 Years Of Stand Up, to celebrate his incredible 25-year career.

John Bishop said: “I can’t believe that next year it will be 25 years since I first performed at the Frog and Bucket in Manchester. It’s been a rollercoaster! And I can’t thank the fans enough who have supported me all the way. I really hope you can come and celebrate with me.”

John has achieved huge success with a number of his own comedy, entertainment and documentary TV shows including: ‘John Bishop’s Australia’, ‘John Bishop’s Britain’; ‘John Bishop’s Only Joking’; ‘The John Bishop Show’ (BBC1); ‘The John
Bishop Christmas Show’ and ‘John Bishop’s Gorilla Adventure’, ‘John Bishop’s Ireland’ and four series of the critically acclaimed ‘John Bishop: In Conversation With…’ which saw him chatting one to one with some of the biggest names in entertainment, music and sport. Other TV credits include two series of ’The John Bishop Show’, ‘Doctor Who’ and the documentary John & Joe Bishop: Life After Deaf.

Last year, John starred in the UK & Ireland tour of Mother Goose with Ian McKellen, which included a hugely successful run in London’s West End.

‘John Bishop has taken on the mantle of Britain’s top comic…the funniest two hours you’ll have any time soon’ ★★★★★ Daily Mirror

‘Bishop has funny bones… everything is infused with his startlingly natural personality’ ★★★★The Times

description:
Kiwis Big Hararei, Written by Catriona Tipene & Ryan Cundy
Produced by Horse With No Name with GRIDLEY by Victoria
Directed by Catriona Tipene

From the Land of the Long White Cloud to the Land Down Under!

Kiwi is going on his first big holiday from Aotearoa across to the golden shores of Brisbane. He’s got his backpack, a pocket full of worms, and a head full of dreams. The most exciting thing of all is that he might even get to go on a rollercoaster! With his Mum, Kiwi navigates air travel, hotels and conversations with marsupials as his world stretches from the home he knows, to the world over the horizon.

A tale that celebrates the connection between our two countries, featuring stunning costume designs by GRIDLEY by Victoria and fresh waiata by NZ singer-songwriter Benny Tipene. Brought to the stage by the multi-award winning companies Horse With No Name and GRIDLEY by Victoria, Kiwi’s Big Hararei is a story about spreading your wings and flying into the unknown.

Acclaim for Trees, Bees and Me (2024):

“I don’t even know where to start in telling you how absolutely captivating, magical and real this show is.” Tania Du Toit, Regional News

“every costume adds such a beautiful connection between the characters while the colours each beautifully blend so well together.” Brie Keatley, Art Murmurs

Acclaim for Land of the Long Long Drive (2023):

“Horse With No Name have come up with one of the best children’s theatre shows that Wellington has seen in quite some time.” Deborah Rea, Theatreview

Tuesday 23 September 2025 to Saturday 4 October 2025
Tues – Sat 10.00am and 11.30am
Meet the cast: Wednesday 24th September 11.30am and Wednesday 1st October 11.30am
Circa Two
$20 per person
$70 family pass (4 tickets)
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Kotahitanga: Artist Series | Riki Gooch and Bennett Pomana, Join Te Waka Huia for the final Kotahitanga event featuring a collaborative response to He Kura Toi Tangata from Wellington taonga Riki Gooch and Bennett Pomana.
Be prepared for textured sound and thought gymnastics with Riki on the drums and Bennett on the mic, closing out the series with one epic jam from these two legends.
5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum
Thursday 18 September | 6pm–8pm
Tickets: $25–$35

About Riki Gooch
Dr Riki Neihana Gooch lives in Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa. His work spans multiple disciplines, including composition, performance, sound art, production, and academic research. He has led and conducted large-scale ensemble projects, performed in a wide range of collaborative settings, and created work for both recorded and live contexts. His ongoing projects include solo and group performances, conduction ensembles, DJ sets, and sound-based installations. He is also involved in cultural leadership and mentorship roles, holding wānanga and contributing to intergenerational knowledge exchange within the arts.

About Bennett Pomana
Bennett Pomana (Te Aitanga-a-Māhaki, Ngāi Tāmanuhiri) is a musician raised in Upper Hutt, with roots in Tūranganui-a-Kiwa. A longtime contributor to Aotearoa’s hip hop legacy, he has been part of pioneering groups including Upper Hutt Posse and Dam Native. His work is deeply influenced by his Māori identity, drawing inspiration from whakapapa, lived experience, and the ongoing pursuit of justice and expression through sound.

This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Kotahitanga: Artist Series | Tusiata Avia, We are honoured to host acclaimed poet; Tusiata Avia who will be opening Kō Tahi Tanga with her response to He Kura Toi Tangata.
Expect nothing less than the power of the word steeped in truth and machete-sharpened wit from this New Zealand Samoan poetry pantheon.
5:30pm Doors open, bar open
6pm Artist response begins
6:30pm Interval
6:45pm Artist Q&A
7pm Closing Karakia and time to explore He Kura Toi Tangata exhibition
8pm Bar closes, event ends

Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum
Thursday 4 September | 6pm–8pm
Tickets: $25–$35

About Tusiata Avia
Tusiata Avia MNZM is a poet, writer and performer. She has published 5 books of poetry, children’s books, short film, radio documentary. Her iconic play Wild Dogs Under My Skirt showed Off-Broadway in 2020, where it won the Fringe Encore Outstanding Production of the Year. Her most recent play, The Savage Coloniser Show won Best New Play at Wellington Theatre Awards 2024. Both plays are based on books of poetry of the same name.
Tusiata was awarded a Member of the New Zealand Order of Merit for services to poetry and in 2024, the Prime Ministers Award for Literary Achievement: Poetry.

This event has been developed by Te Waka Huia Wellington Museum and is presented in collaboration with our programme partner Kāhui Legal.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Kōkōwai Wānanga, Facilitated by Tayla Hartemink & Rosalie Koko
at Toi Pōneke Gallery and the Hub
Join us for a hands-on wānanga where we’ll learn how to process, and create traditional paint using kōkōwai (earth pigment). Rooted in mātauranga Māori, this gathering invites you to connect with whenua through creative practice, explore the stories and significance of kōkōwai, and contribute to a collaborative artwork honouring mana wāhine. This event is designed for Māori and Tāngata Moana — no experience needed, just a willingness to get your hands in the earth and your heart in the kaupapa!
Places are limited. So bookings are essential. Please register through the following link to reserve your place.
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Kōrero Paki, Performed by Kōrero Paki

Crack open a cold one and get set for a night of mean kōrero and wild comedy from this spontaneous tira whakaari. Delight as our performers talk sh*t, share off the cuff stories, and take the show to wild places through improv. Like all good garage parties, this show will be jam-packed with crack up storytelling, cheeky banter, and plenty of laughs.

Kōrero Paki debuted at NZIF 2024 and had a successful run at the 2025 NZ International Comedy Festival.

Featuring:

Mo (Mamaeroa) Munn
Q Potts
Kipling DC
Lachlan Bowker
Viki Moananu

Kōrero Paki is a Māori and Pacifica improv group who have performed in the NZ International Comedy Fest and the NZ Improv Festival. A group of improvisers and stand up comedians, Kōrero Paki is focused on comedic storytelling improv.

The show contains adult themes and strong language. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.
label: Arts & Theatre

Kōrero Paki is a Māori and Pacifica improv group who have performed in the NZ International Comedy Fest and the NZ Improv Festival. A group of improvisers and stand up comedians, Kōrero Paki is focused on comedic storytelling improv.
The show contains adult themes and strong language. As this show is improvised, we cannot guarantee the presence or absence of specific content or themes. The show may contain voluntary audience interaction, such as giving a suggestion for a scene.

description:
Lads Lads Lads: A Drag King Show, Are you ready for a boisterous band of bros?
A hefty helping of handsome heirs?!
A smorgasbord of sweaty studs?!
Then grab the gang and head down to Fringe Bar on 6 June for Lads Lads Lads! A Drag King Show, and prepare yourselves for the most delightful, most glittery, most wholesome masculinity you ever did see (there will be no hazing here!)
Our dazzling cast of dashing dudes and extraordinarily hairy gentlemen are bound to leave your seats moistened, your gobs a gasp, and have you cheering “Yeah the boys!”
So buck up, grab the whole fraternity and head to Eventfinda to grab your tickets from just $20.
Support your local Drag Kings!
Lads Lads Lads!
June 6: Boy Bands
September 12: Rock Gods
November 21: Dapper Dudes
Venue, seating & show info
Cash only door sales are available if not sold out prior ($30.00 per ticket)
GA seating is unallocated, make sure to arrive early to nab a good vantage point.
Doors open one hour before showtime.
If you are part of a large group, contact us to save seats together, or you may be split up
Latecomers may not be admitted, you may be asked to wait before finding your seat if a performance is underway.
The event space is located up 6 upstairs, with narrow walkways between seating. The regular seating are black metal folding chairs, please contact us to discuss alternatives if this isn't an option for you. We will do what we can to accommodate as many bodies and abilities as possible.
Trigger warnings will be given before every show and we have a zero tolerance policy for abusive behaviour.
You can contact us at willysmackntush@gmail.com

Legally Blonde The Musical, Coasters Musical Theatre Brings "Legally Blonde the Musical" to Southwards Theatre

Coasters Musical Theatre presents "Legally Blonde the Musical" from October 2-11, 2025 at Southwards Theatre, Paraparaumu. This uplifting musical comedy follows Elle Woods' incredible journey from fashionable sorority queen to Harvard Law student, filled with catchy songs, dazzling choreography, and plenty of pink power.

Based on the beloved hit movie starring Reese Witherspoon, the show delivers an empowering message about believing in yourself, breaking stereotypes, and discovering your own strength and intelligence. Lauren Loghry makes her exciting Kapiti debut as the determined and vivacious Elle Woods in this feel-good production that promises to entertain and inspire audiences of all ages.

description:
Lip Sync Assassins: A Drag Show Smackdown, One Stage. No Mercy. Only Lip-Sync Legends Survive.

Get ready for a drag showdown like no other as Wellingtons Lip Sync Assassins hit the stage with high drama, higher heels, and killer performances that’ll leave you gagging for more! Our fiercest queens and kings are ready to slay the stage in a lip-sync battle to the death (joking of course)!

Over 3 rounds our talented performers will Lip Sync off against a random competitor chosen by the crowd - expect splits, and surprise tricks as each performer fights for the crown with charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and plenty of lip-gloss. Who will bring the passion? Who will bring the fire?

Watch as a lineup of unstoppable talent goes head-to-head in a night of iconic anthems, jaw-dropping moves, and show-stopping stunts. From power ballads to pop bangers, each number is a deadly display of pure performance power.

WHO WILL BE CROWNED WELLINGTONS LIP SYNC ASSASSIN?

description:
Living is Like, Directed by Andrea Ferpo
Once upon a time, there was someone who felt growing up was like constantly being at university, another for whom falling in love was like playing roulette in a casino, and another whose jealousy was like eating spicy food every day.
Living Is Like… harnesses the power of metaphor to unleash the hidden emotions behind our everyday actions, the way we think about ourselves, and how we view each other.

Expect the unexpected. Stay for the unhinged. And get ready for a comedy night unlike any other. Loosie Goosie is comedy uncaged.

description:
Lord of the Cock Rings - A comedy show, Two fools. One cock ring. Zero clue.
From the warped minds of Garbage City (aka comedians Mo and Joel) comes an unhinged, experimental comedy odyssey through a realm of fantasy, filth, and foolishness.
Armed with nothing but wit, wigs, and questionable props, our heroes set out on a perilous quest to uncover the true purpose of the mysterious One Cock Ring. Along the way, they’ll face dark forces, ancient secrets, and an unexpected enemy.
Will they survive the journey?
One show to rule them all. Probably.

description:
Lunchtime Author Talk: Jennifer Andrewes, Join Jennifer Andrewes, in conversation with Sinead Boucher, as she discusses her most recent book 'A Will & A Way: On Foot Across France'.
"An avid walker and Francophile, Jennifer Andrewes first joined a local walking group to meet people and explore the countryside while working in northern France. Thirty years later, she’s a convert to the power of walking to change your thinking – and your life."
All welcome, see you there!

description:
MAMIL 2: GOMIL, One of New Zealand’s most successful plays of all time, MAMIL (Middle Aged Man in Lycra) is hitting the road in a national tour of the long-awaited sequel GOMIL (Grumpy Old Man in Lycra).

Starring acting legend Mark Hadlow ONZM (King Kong, The Hobbit, SNAG) and written and directed by Gregory Cooper (MAMIL, That Bloody Woman), GOMIL reunites this dream team who is directly responsible for causing laughter lines on the faces of over 70,000 people who saw MAMIL!

“Fast-paced and slick” - Theatreview

GOMIL follows the journey of Wayne, the founder and team leader of the men's cycling group in MAMIL. A lot has happened to Wayne over the last 10 years. He has retired, his son has moved to London with his grandchildren and Maggie, his wife of 49 years, passed away suddenly a year ago. For Wayne, his family and his work were his life. They were the source of his life's pleasure and purpose and now he is having to cope with the loss of both.

The only thing left to take his mind off the pain is cycling with his MAMIL friends, especially Bryan, the central character of MAMIL. But a panic attack mid-ride and a crash with catastrophic consequences leads to a crisis of cycling confidence and the inability to do the thing he loves the most.

Like MAMIL, it takes an array of characters to help the central character rediscover what is truly important when their life seems adrift and meaningless. A relentlessly positive Scottish counsellor, a philosophical Romanian personal trainer, Wayne’s new arch-enemy in the form of an ocker Ozzie retirement village owner who grinds his gears and yes, even Pinarello -- the Italian bike of Bryan’s and Wayne’s nightmares -- all wittingly and unwittingly help Wayne get back on the bike and realise he still has something to offer, he still has a purpose and most importantly a reason to get out of bed every morning aside from going for a piss.

“An engaging and earnest work of art, packed with
label: Arts & Theatre

description:
MAMIL 2: GOMIL, The Lycra is back: GOMIL – the hilarious new sequel to MAMIL hits the road across New Zealand!

One of New Zealand’s biggest theatrical success stories is back in the saddle! Following the phenomenal popularity of MAMIL (Middle Aged Man in Lycra), which played to over 70,000 people across the country, comes its laugh-out-loud sequel: GOMIL – Grumpy Old Man in Lycra. And this time, it's going national.

From the comedic genius of writer and director Gregory Cooper (MAMIL, That Bloody Woman) and starring Kiwi acting royalty Mark Hadlow ONZM (King Kong, The Hobbit, SNAG), GOMIL is primed to bring a fresh wave of laughter, Lycra, and life’s mid-life absurdities to 14 cities throughout New Zealand in a major national tour kicking off this September.

After a critically acclaimed, sold-out debut season in Ōtautahi Christchurch, GOMIL is shifting gears and going full speed ahead across Aotearoa. Audiences who laughed (and winced) along with the unforgettable antics in MAMIL will now follow the journey of our favourite cyclist as he faces a new life stage: grumpier, greyer, and still clad in way too much Lycra.

Hadlow, one of the country’s most beloved performers, reprises his role with impeccable comic timing and emotional depth, bringing to life a story that’s not only hilarious, but also touching, timely, and unashamedly relatable.

Whether you're a weekend warrior, a reluctant spouse, or just someone who enjoys watching others sweat the small (and stretchy) stuff, GOMIL is a must-see. This show digs deep into the world of ageing men, fragile egos, friendship, family, and the undeniable need to keep moving—no matter how creaky your knees may be.

Get ready to laugh, reflect, and maybe even wince in recognition as GOMIL pedals its way across the country this spring. It’s more than a show—it’s a celebration of growing older (and slightly wider) with humour, heart, and a healthy dose of spandex.

Don’t miss the next chapter in this iconic Kiwi comedy saga. GOMIL is coming to a theatre near you - lycra, laughter and all.

--

label: Arts & Theatre

description:
Manage Your Expectations | Circa Theatre, Manage Your Expectations | Circa Theatre
You decide the ending...

Solo performer Eliza Sanders has a simple task: to tell you everything that will happen in the show, so you can decide if you would like to see it. Nothing is ever so simple.

This genre-defying work of dance, theatre, live film, clown and absurd philosophising takes the idea of the ‘trigger warning’ to its absurdist extreme to question how ‘informed’ consent can really be, and asking ‘How much do you really want to know?’

Created and performed by multi-award-winning maverick of the stage, Eliza Sanders, Manage Your Expectations helps us to see the limits of the power to communicate and our failures to say what we mean. Through movement, multimedia, and razor-sharp wit, it examines the impossibility of perfect communication, musing on the influence of context, identity and personal history while creating something beautiful from our collective mess.

"Clever, witty, evocative, subversive, immersive, despairing, poignant, personal and universal" — Deirdre Tarrant, Theatreview, 2024

"Beautifully vulnerable" - Chloe Jaques, Theatreview, 2024

Full of vigour, energy, chaos and a hint of confrontation, Manage Your Expectations is a mind (and body) bending show about how we connect in an increasingly complex world. And you decide the ending…

Content warning: this show contains explicit content, mild coarse language, heavy nudity, themes of abortion and rape.

WINNER: Best Performer, Whangārei Fringe 2024
WINNER: Outstanding Solo Performance, NZ Fringe 2024
WINNER: San Diego Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024
NOMINATION: Best in Fringe, NZ Fringe 2024

NOMINATION: Adelaide Tour Ready, NZ Fringe 2024

description:
Michelangelo — A Different View, There’s no need to look up to see true greatness. The intricate beauty of Michelangelo’s Sistine Chapel ceiling will be on full display at Tākina over summer. Michelangelo — A Different View invites you to experience the genius of the sixteenth-century artist from an entirely new perspective. You get to be above and up close. 
Under license from the Vatican Museums, this exhibition offers a complete and authentic reproduction of over 50 stunning works. This once-in-a-lifetime exhibition allows you to experience the colour and detail of multiple works from just two meters away.
