description:
After 5: Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay, After 5: Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay
Join us for an After 5 networking event with Bunnings Warehouse - Lyall Bay

About this Event

What does the future hold for local businesses in Aotearoa - and how can you take advantage of the opportunities on your doorstep? Join us for a special After 5 at Bunnings Lyall Bay, where we’ll look at new ways to grow, train, and connect as a business community.

You’ll hear about the exciting potential of the 2026 New Zealand Trade Expo, designed to open doors for business investment and international partnerships. You’ll also learn how the MBIE Management Capability Development Voucher Programme can provide funding and support to build your business skills and capability.

From a local perspective, we’ll showcase how Bunnings partners with businesses, schools, and community organisations - and how Chamber members can unlock exclusive savings and benefits with the Bunnings Power Pass.

Popular suppliers including Ryobi, AEG, and Ozito will also be in-store to answer questions and share product advice, making this session a rare and practical opportunity to get info that gets you ahead.

Most importantly, this After 5 is a chance to network with fellow Chamber members in a fresh setting, and take away practical opportunities to strengthen and grow your business.
label: Business & Networking

description:
Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25), Analytics Forum: Social Investment (Wellington, Tue 14 Oct 25)
New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum — Social Investment (in-person only at Social Investment Agency | Te Iho, 1 Bowen St, Wellington)

About this Event

Join us for an NZ Data Science + Analytics Forum event, hosted by the Social Investment Agency / Toi Hou Tāngata (SIA). This event will cover the Agency’s work using data and analytics to support evidence-based decision-making across the social sector, with four speakers each sharing their work, with opportunities for Q&A and networking.
This is a great opportunity to hear direct from SIA and connect with your peers in the Data Science and Analytics field, to learn from some of the leading voices in analytics, data engineering, evaluation, data-driven outcomes, and economic modelling.
Thanks to the Social Investment Agency for hosting this event.
Welcome and Introductions
Sara van der Velde, Chief Executive Officer (Acting), Nicholson Consulting, and Christopher Reid, Manager Pae Ora Data & Insights, Ara Poutama Aotearoa, for NZ Data Science & Analytics Forum
Kylie Reiri, Deputy Chief Executive – Transformation, Technology and Enabling Services, opening remarks for SIA
Speakers
1. - Manager, Evidence and Insight service
Social Investment and data driven decision making
Explore why data is the power behind social investment – – and how evidence, outcomes, and impact measurement are driving better insights for decision-makers.
2. - Data Engineer
Feedback loops and data tools
The importance of feedback loops in developing and delivering useful data products such as the Regional Data Explorer.
3. - Senior Analyst, Data Science
Analysis and accelerators
Discover how automation and tools like cost-benefit analysis are accelerating evidence-based decisions across the social sector, drawing on linked data using the Stats NZ Integrated Data Infrastructure (IDI) and beyond.
4. - Chief Economist
Learning and impact measurement
Exploring how the Social Investment Fund is moving from burdensome reporting to practical learning conversations that generate more useful insights for decision-making and provide a clear view of causal impact.

The New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum events are free to attend (with an Eventbrite ticket) and open to anyone that has an interest in Data Science and Analytics. Please note that SIA have an in-person event capacity cap of 65 tickets so those getting tickets early will get priority access. This is an in-person only event to allow for discussion and questions.
For more information on the New Zealand Data Science + Analytics Forum, check us out at https://analytics.org.nz/. Sign up to receive notifications of our future events!


Agenda


🕑: 03:00 PM - 03:30 PM
Arrival and tea/coffee networking

🕑: 03:30 PM - 03:40 PM
Welcome/opening remarks

🕑: 03:40 PM - 03:55 PM
Speaker 1: Louise - Social Investment and data driven decision making

🕑: 04:10 PM - 04:25 PM

description:
Beehive to Business with Hon. Todd McClay, Beehive to Business with Hon. Todd McClay
Wellington Chamber of Commerce & Allen + Clarke present our Beehive to Business with Hon. Todd McClay

About this Event

Join us on Thursday 13th November for a very special, final Beehive to Business event of the year, with Hon Todd McClay, Minister of Agriculture, Forestry, Trade & Investment and Associate Minister of Foreign Affairs.

In a year full of global geopolitical shocks, tariffs and increasing complexity for exporters – there is no Minister better positioned to deliver the insights and direction your business needs to know than Minister McClay.

Minister McClay is at the forefront of some of the most pressing issues for New Zealand’s economic position, be it new trade deals, the pressure facing our exporters or increasing Foreign Direct Investment through new agency InvestNZ.

If your business is chasing exports, or new capital from overseas – this final Beehive to Business is not one to be missed.

This event is part of an ongoing series made possible by our partnership with premier consulting firm Allen + Clarke. Proudly based in Wellington, Allen + Clarke is equally at home advising the Beehive or business alike.

Agenda:
7:15am- Standing breakfast, networking
7:45am- Address
8:10am- Q&A
8:30am- Event concludes

Can't make it? to register for the free livestream. Sign up and watch at a time convenient to you.

description:

That’s why CAANZ is here to give you the insights that last.
We asked CAANZ to go beyond the glossy brochures and give us the nitty-gritty details — and they delivered. This isn’t theory, it’s the unfiltered answers you’ve been waiting for.

Arrive at 9:45am to get the full experience.
💡 What makes this event different?
Exclusive behind-the-scenes access to CAANZ you won’t get at standard info nights.
Real conversations with CAANZ professionals answering the gritty questions others skip.
Practical tips and tricks to channel yourself into the profession with confidence.
⚡ Why you can’t miss this:
Spaces are extremely limited — first in, first served.
You’ll leave with real answers, not rehearsed lines.
You’ll gain actionable takeaways that help you stand out and future-proof your career.
💬 These aren’t your average student events. They’re designed to give you an authentic, unfiltered inside look at one of the most influential professional bodies in the world — preparing you for what comes next.

description:
Boost Your Business: Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing, Boost Your Business: Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing
Calling all Pasifika entrepreneurs, small business owners, and innovators in the Wellington region.

About this Event

Take the Stress Out of Digital Marketing
Calling all Pasifika entrepreneurs, small business owners, and innovators in the Wellington region.

Join us for a free, hands-on workshop led by Katie Brown. We’ll break down digital marketing and social media into clear, actionable tools you can use immediately. You’ll do this in a friendly and open environment, where you can ask questions, share ideas, and learn from others. Plus, enjoy refreshments and kai (catered by Amilagis) to keep you energised.

By the end of the workshop, you’ll leave with real, usable tools. This is perfect for anyone in Wellington wanting to build confidence online, make social media easier, and drive forward your business idea.

Attending these workshops gives you the chance to join the WLG NZ RPBN programme, where Katie’s full course supports your next steps in growing your digital presence. Spaces are limited, book your spot today and step into your digital strength!

**Doors open at 5.30pm, session begins at 6pm**

About the Speaker:
Katie Brown (Ngāti Whātua, Ngāti Raukawa) brings over 15+ years’ experience in social media, digital strategy, and communications. She’s the founder of Social Good and has held key roles in government and corporate spheres, including setting up ACC’s social media strategy and leading Aotearoa’s all-of-government digital communications response during COVID-19. Katie is also a certified Meta (Facebook) Community Trainer and regularly delivers workshops across Aotearoa, helping organisations to tell stronger digital stories.

A 4 hour, practice-based session with Hildy Gottlieb.

People whose mahi is to help organisations do their best work: capacity builders,
advisors, funders and philanthropy staff, backbone and collective impact teams,
council and agency community advisors, sector peak bodies, governance support roles, coaches, consultants and trainers.

description:
Client Management & Sales Planning, In today’s competitive market, staying ahead requires ensuring that every customer interaction is optimised. Understanding the psychological needs of the buying client, and what is needed to meet those needs within the sales interaction process is key. Alongside sales training expertise, anchored in the ‘real world’, this course will cover specific skills and techniques that will improve your sales processes and assist revenue growth.
Learning outcomes for Attendees
- Understanding buyer psychology from the first interaction throughout the sales process
- How to gain insight into what the client really needs
- How to match that need with your business offering
- How to clearly articulate what sets your business apart
- Develop confidence in overcoming client objections and moving the sales process to a conclusion
Learning outcomes.
- Connecting with the client
- Setting up the first interaction with the client
- Learning about the client’s needs
- Exploring challenges and opportunities

- Collaborating
- Articulating your business strengths
- Overcoming client concerns
- Asking for a commitment

Click here to see more info and to register

description:
Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass Wellington, Contract Law Fundamentals for Non Lawyers Masterclass is an intensely practical guide through the essentials of contract law, exploring such details as when a contract will be required, when you have a contract (and don’t necessarily know it), what types of contract exist and the effect of legislation on your contractual arrangements.
This masterclass also scrutinises what happens when things go wrong, including how you can get out of a contract, options for assessing damages and remedies for breach and looking at the contractual implications of working in an e-commerce environment. You will grasp the crucial ingredients required for a good contract, and gain tips to better understand and manage your contracts.

description:
Electra Business After Five - 4 November 2025, October/November Electra BA5 
Electra BA5 Business Under Pressure
How to safeguard, secure and stay ahead 
Join us for an informative evening designed to help local businesses navigate the financial and legal landscape of 2025. Our expert panel featuring a leading insurance broker, bank representative, lawyer, and accountant who will unpack the key issues shaping business resilience today.

Our panel brings together experienced professionals who work daily with New Zealand businesses navigating financial, legal, and operational challenges to provide insights. 

Topics include overviews on the latest Trust legislation and whether your trust is truly protecting you, the IRD’s $100 million investment in increased audits, and why 88% of liquidations and receiverships involve IRD debt. You’ll also gain crucial insights into insurance risks, and what movements in the OCR and interest rates mean for your business planning.

Hear from speakers from CS Law on trust protection, Grant Thornton on accounting and compliance trends, Insure Group on mitigating business and risks, and BNZ Business on preparing for lending and cashflow pressures.

This is a must-attend session for business owners, directors and advisors who want to stay informed, protect  assets and make smarter financial decisions in the year ahead.
Electra Business After Five
Tuesday 4th November 2025  
5.30-7pm $10+bf
Te Takeretanga o Kura-hau-pō, Levin

description:
Health and Safety Essentials for Small Business, The purpose of this course is to give you the oversight you need to ensure your business health and safety systems and processes reflect a best-practice approach. Each session comes with practical templates for you to use in your business to comply with the Health & Safety at Work Act 2015. It also supports your understanding of the core elements of a health and safety system.

Key Audience:
This course is suitable for people who own a small business and want to ensure they comply with health and safety best practice requirements. It is also good for those businesses without a health and safety committee and anyone who is required to be involved in health and safety in a small business.

Learning outcomes
Understand the core elements of a health and safety system.
Understand the key duty holders and their respective duties under the Act.
Understand essential health and safety components and how they relate to your legal duties.
Understand practical ways to increase the effectiveness of your health and safety system.

If you would like to register with Business Central directly and receive an invoice for payment, please contact our training team via training@businesscentral.org.nz.

Places are limited, so register today.

Course details
Duration: One day, in person.
Time: 9am - 4pm

Course includes
Workbook, arrival tea or coffee, morning tea, lunch and afternoon tea.
To view our Terms and Conditions click here.

description:
MAP IT Marketing Strategy Intensive - write your own marketing strategy, MAP IT Marketing Strategy Intensive - write your own marketing strategy
Create your small business marketing strategy and action plan in just two days, with marketing coach and strategist Rachel Klaver

About this Event




Create a marketing plan in just two days
Designed to fit YOUR business.
Designed for you to take action


Time is precious, so let's make it count.

Join marketing trainer and coach Rachel Klaver for an immersive two-day face-to-face workshop tailored for service-based businesses.
This event will take place on the 19th and 20th of November, at The Bolton Hotel, Wellington.

This is designed to transform your marketing strategy from the ground up.
Over two days you'll explore and learn up-to-date marketing practices and strategy, and write a strategy customised for your business.

You’ll then create a clear action plan designed to attract, engage and convert your ideal customers
Numbers are limited to ensure you can get individualised help and support.


Here's what we'll cover over the two days:
How to best explain what you do
Simplifying your message to cut through a busy marketplace
How to define your target market (beyond demographics)
Defining your positioning
A check on pricing and profitability pillars
Identifying gaps and differentiation from competitors
Unique selling proposition
Improving word of mouth, influencer and referral marketing
Customer experience and the customer journey
Who owns the marketing role
Appropriate use of AI in marketing
Website Optimisation
Email Marketing that works
Creating a social media strategy framework
Printing and branding needs
Traditional marketing (Radio/Print/Other)
PR, Expos, Conferences
Business owner brand

(Everything will be taught for small business needs, rather than large organisations.
We'll be covering the following in everyday language, explaining all the marketing terms as we go)


Here's what's also included:
Guided pre-workshop tasks to make the most of your time.
Individualised analysis of key marketing areas.
A marketing strategy and action plan workbook.
Templates, spreadsheets to support your plan.
Opportunity to discuss specific areas where needed.
A month of free access to video training and lessons, templates, and worksheets to help take action. (with an option to continue monthly access for a nominal fee)
A content marketing planner to help plan out your activity and take action.


Who is your marketing strategist and trainer?Introducing your Marketing Strategist Rachel Klaver

Welcome! I'm Rachel Klaver, content marketing coach, marketing strategist and small business owner.
I’ve worked with over a thousand small business owners on their marketing strategy either in small groups like this, or one-to-one.
I use real language, story, and simple explanations to break down marketing strategy.
I’m able to provide a range of options and ideas for you to use as you take action.
I want that for you.
(The other stuff: I work full time as a marketing strategist, coach and trainer. I co run our business Identify Marketing with my husband Rod. I've written 28 books, the last one on content marketing (it's called Be a Spider, Build a Web.). I write a fortnightly column for NZ's Stuff newspaper on marketing, and have two podcasts: MAP IT Marketing, and Confident Content. )

So... would you like to come join me?


Be prepared for VALUE - It's PACKED with goodness
This two-day programme is just $2,000+gst per person.
(limit of two per business)

This workshop is registered with the Regional Business Partner Network. To explore if your business may be eligible for support, so we can put you in touch with your local Regional Business Growth Advisor if appropriate to discuss further


DON'T MISS OUT ON THIS VALUE PACKED, two day intensive - AND THE POSITIVE IMAPACT ON YOUR BUSINESS


REFINE YOUR STRATEGY. CREATE YOUR ACTION PLAN
This two-day intensive will get you ready to make the next 12 months a year of growth, and more profit. Get a handle on your marketing, develop an action plan and know exactly what you need to do to create consistent marketing output targeted at the right people.

Marlborough’s tech community has big potential and it’s time to shape the next chapter together.

� Date: Thursday 18 September 2025
� Time: 10:00 am - 12:00 pm�
Location: Te Au Pūngao, cnr Arthur & Seymour Streets
Free to attend, registration is essential for catering purposes.

Join us for morning tea at Te Au Pūngao to connect with others working in technology, innovation, and startups, and help set the direction for our region’s tech future.

Parliament, as a venue, boasts four distinctive and elegant spaces and the team:

Grand Hall
Galleria

The HuiHui Function team will host 100 Wellington Event Professionals in the Grand Hall. With an early evening Panel discussion to kick us off. description:
The Effective Speaker, Auckland, 13th & 14th November, 2025, 1 or 2 Day Presentation Skills Workshop
Limited tickets available. Get in now so you don't miss out!
When effective presenters speak, they do more than inform - they influence, persuade, and inspire. That isn’t magic; it’s method. With the right tools, anyone can build genuine connection and move a room.
This workshop is for leaders, emerging leaders, technical specialists, and professionals who want practical tools and techniques for speaking in both formal and informal settings.
Short on time? Attend 1 Day (Foundations) for all the core skills. Ready for a bigger shift? Choose 2 Days (Advanced) for one on one coaching and deeper transformation. Pick what’s right for you.
You’ll leave with the tools to present more clearly, confidently, and with the influence your role demands. This is not just for the stage. You will use these skills everyday.
The workshop format
Small group format for maximum practice and feedback (no massive groups).
Learning is adapted and personalised for maximum value (no cookie-cutter approach).
Hands on, practical learning, with easy to apply tools and techniques (no sitting around listening to theory).
The Effective Speaker - One Day Workshop (Foundations):
A hands-on day where you’ll learn our step-by-step SpeakerMap™ system to plan valuable presentations quickly and with ease.
You’ll learn the principles behind useful visuals, how to manage nerves, and three delivery techniques you can use immediately.
Foundations is best for technical experts who know their stuff but struggle to get it across, and nervous presenters who want a safe, practical reset.
What you’ll learn
Plan engaging content (fast)
Use the SpeakerMap™ to develop a clear Key Message and structure that keeps audiences attentive without overload.
Plan faster, make better decisions about what to include (and what to ditch).
 Design useful slides (not wallpaper)
A simple but revolutionary way to design slides that support — not sabotage — your message.
Practical guidance on using AI to fast-track draft slides and create supporting documents.
How to use PowerPoint to keep you on track without putting your audience to sleep.
 Keep nerves under control
A proven psychological approach to calm the mental chatter that causes waffling, speed talking, and blank moments.
Build a personal plan to shift focus from “me” to the audience and the outcome you want.
 Deliver in a natural, engaging way
Three delivery techniques that help you look credible, be engaging and feel confident.
How to vary pace and emphasis so your key points actually land.
How to cut the filler - the “ums” and “ahs” - and keep your flow.
 Plenty of practice
You’ll practise each technique in pairs or threes — supportive, safe, and highly practical.
Includes
A full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
The Effective Speaker workbook
30minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $1,200 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $995+GST)
 
What past participants say:
"By far the best course i have attended in any organisation, either here in NZ or abroad. The format of the course was engaging and there was a great balance between listening, engaging and participating. I look forward to using the skills used presenting at our next Team Hui!"
Matthew Townsley, Medical Council of New Zealand


"Really great course, no pressure environment with a good mix of interactive and book work. Have walked away feeling more confident in how I am going to put my presentations together."

Jessica Stokes, Emergency Management Team, New Plymouth District Council
"It was good, practical and useful tools "not rules" for business comms and pressos. Good to learn some of the other things you don't often learn in traditional presentation skills training. Really good engagement and interaction - the team were impressed we were all engaged right until the end! Easily one of the best courses I have been on in this line of work. Keep up the good work! "
Brad Stansell, Channel Account Manager, Pax 8
The Effective Speaker - Two Day Workshop (Advanced)
Gain all the skills from Day One - and then take them further. If presenting is central to your career growth, this is the coaching workshop you need.
Over two full days, you’ll create a significant shift in your communication skills.
Day One gives you the foundations to make presenting easier and more effective.
Day Two consolidates and extends these skills. You’ll go deeper into content planning, adapt the tools to your real work presentations, and get personalised coaching to develop your own authentic style.
You’ll also learn strategies for handling even the toughest audiences. The workshop is practical, hands-on, and focused on learning by doing - presenting, receiving coaching, and observing your peers.
If you’re ready for lasting, transformative change in your communication skills, the two-day option is the best choice.
What you’ll learn
Everything from Day 1 (Foundations) PLUS
Go deeper with planning
Apply the SpeakerMap to plan an actual presentation that you can give. 
Dive deeper into crafting valuable messages that you can use in the future. 
Rehearse in a way that actually works
A practical way to prepare when time is tight — so you own your words.
Shift from competent to compelling
One-on-one coaching targeted to your specific needs.
Video feedback plus our inside-out coaching methodology to reconnect you with the techniques you use naturally in conversation.
How to use silence, pace, notes, and the remote without looking stiff or artificial.
How to speak with energy and authenticity, not speed and panic.
Eliminate “ums” and “ahs”, look confident (even when you’re not), and create a sense of commitment that audiences feel.
An understanding of your personal communication strengths and the areas you need to focus on for growth.

Handle audiences like a pro
Strategies for side chats, interruptions, distractions, disagreement, and the odd angry voice - while staying calm and in control.

Includes
Everything in Day 1, plus:
A second full day of training
All food and drinks during the workshop
Videos of your presenting and coaching sessions
The Effective Speaker workbook
60minute one on one follow up session
Investment: $2,500 + GST (Early Bird Pricing $2.200+GST)

I developed a newfound confidence in my ability to communicate effectively, learned how to captivate an audience, and discovered strategies for managing nerves and overcoming stage fright. I would recommend this effective speaking course to anyone looking to enhance their communication abilities. description:
Wairarapa Agritourism - November networking evening, Join us for another Agritourism networking event !

Wairarapa Agritourism – Exploring our opportunities
November networking evening.
This event is part of our agritourism network series, and is for anyone interested in agritourism within the Wairarapa and surrounding regions. This is a great opportunity to connect with like-minded people and become part of the local agritourism community.
We have two fabulous guest speakers at our November event, who will share their agritourism journeys and thoughts on the future.
Sonia Minnaar
Sonia Minnaar is co-founder of Canopy Camping Escapes. Canopy Camping Escapes partners with glamping hosts across New Zealand. Sonia will talk to us about the foundation and growth of Canopy Camping - how they started, what they do and how they work. We are excited to have Sonia Minnaar joining us for this event!
Their unique collection of hosted accommodation ranges from luxury safari tents to quirky off-grid cabins and modern luxe retreats – all immersed in nature and designed to help guests unplug and reconnect.
Sonia will share her insights around:
Industry trends and industry forecasts
Canopy Camping Guests (repeat/international) and Occupancy
Discussion around what make escapes successful
https://canopycamping.co.nz/
Tim Priest - Moonlight Peak
Tim & Summer Priest have owned the property near Carterton since February 2016. Tim is an Agri-Banker for Rabobank and a farmer. Summer manages Moonlight Peak accommodation, while also being a stay-at-home mum and a farmer.
For them, they love that the property is nestled just on the edge of the Tararua Ranges and overlooks the beautiful Wairarapa - from Mount Bruce all the way to the Cook Strait. It's the type of place where you feel like you're on top of the world, described as "somewhere between heaven and earth"!
The idea to set up glamping on their property came about when they came across Canopy Camping Escapes - and were inspired to set up their own retreat. Watching the moon and sunrise from the east above the Wairarapa is magical...and it's a delight for Summer and Tim to share it with their guests.
https://canopycamping.co.nz/moonlight-peak
Run of event:
6:30pm - arrival, drinks, nibbles and networking
6:45pm - talks start
8:00pm - talks finish, networking
8:30pm - Evening close
All welcome, see you there!
We will be hosted at Urla's Cellar Door, 140 Dakins Road, Gladstone. Urla will have drinks for you to purchase, with a selection of nibbles as a part of your ticket. Urla is a beautiful setting, you are welcome to come early to taste the wines and soak up this amazing venue.

description:
Wellington Vintage Machinery Open Days, Wellington Vintage Machinery Open Days
Get a close look and hands on experience with machinery of yesteryear. Weather permitting, we will have our Fowler Traction engine in steam too!

Find the machine that was used to make the 1950 Empire Games medals. Many of the machines have a association with the Wellington area.

Take a nostalgic trip through the vintage kitchen and other displays of household, and retail items from the past. Wellington Vintage Machinery is housed in an old Cheese Factory built in 1925. The factory has had an interesting past from cheese factory, to milk bottling plant, munitions store during WWII, and other uses before becoming home for the vintage machinery.

The building is one of the few remaining dairy factories designed by architects Duffill & Gibson of Hawera and built by CE Roebuck of New Plymouth.


Cost: Koha
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/wellington-vintage-machinery-open-days-25/


Health & Safety:
Please wear closed toe footwear and keep an eye on any children that you bring along.

Most of the display is wheelchair accessible, and an accessible toilet facility is also available.

description:
Workplace Wellbeing in Action: Practical Lessons from SiteSafe, Workplace Wellbeing in Action: Practical Lessons from SiteSafe
Event Details
📅 Date: Wednesday, 22 October 2025
🕐 Time: 5:00 PM – 6:30 PM
📍 Location: SiteSafe Headquarters, 23-25 Jarden Mile, Ngauranga, Wellington 6035
👥 Capacity and Cost: FREE, with a maximum of 20 attendees (NAWIC and non-NAWIC members welcome - bring a friend!)
🦺 PPE Requirements: No PPE required.
Join us for an engaging evening with SiteSafe, New Zealand’s leading experts in health, safety, and wellbeing. This session will offer a unique behind-the-scenes look at how SiteSafe cares for their own people, providing insight into the innovative initiatives they’ve implemented to support staff wellbeing, health, and safety.
This event is especially relevant for consultants, designers, and office-based professionals who want to see how a safety-focused culture can be successfully embedded within an organisation — even outside a construction site.
 Why attend:
Learn from their approach: Discover the specific HSE and wellbeing initiatives SiteSafe has introduced for their staff, including mental health support, proactive safety programs, and team engagement strategies. See how these approaches create a positive, resilient workplace culture.
Practical insights for your team: Whether you manage design teams, consult on projects, or work in office-based or site-based roles, learn actionable ideas to enhance wellbeing, safety awareness, and engagement within your own team.
Explore their offerings: Gain an overview of the courses, training, and advisory services SiteSafe provides, which can help organisations of any type embed stronger health, safety, and wellbeing practices.
Network in a relaxed environment: Connect with fellow industry professionals over snacks and drinks hosted by SiteSafe. Exchange ideas, share experiences, and enjoy informal conversations in a friendly setting.
SiteSafe is more than a site-safety organisation — they are a model for how to embed effective HSE and wellbeing practices that benefit staff, improve organisational culture, and support long-term project success. This event is an opportunity to see these practices in action, gain practical ideas for your own team, and connect with like-minded professionals in the industry.
🙏 Huge thanks to SiteSafe for offering us this opportunity!
 Please note: NAWIC is a voluntary organisation, committed to its obligations as a PCBU under the Health and Safety at Work Act 2015.   Amongst other things, this requires NAWIC to take all practicable steps to eliminate, isolate or minimize hazards that our event attendees are exposed to. Health and safety is a shared responsibility.

description:
YEPN Wellington - Sustainable Aviation Fuel: A Strategic Approach, The Young Energy Professionals Network is pleased to invite you to our next Wellington event, proudly hosted by Z Energy at their waterfront offices.
This event will feature a panel discussion on one of the toughest – and most important – challenges in the energy transition: decarbonising aviation through Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF)*.
Aviation is one of the most challenging sectors to decarbonise and by 2050, it could contribute more than a third of Aotearoa New Zealand’s total emissions. Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) is emerging as a critical decarbonisation tool, and momentum is building both locally and globally.
In this session, we’ll bring together voices from across the aviation ecosystem – industry leaders, suppliers and customers – to explore how SAF is being adopted, scaled and supported in Aotearoa and overseas. From feedstocks and policy settings to operational realities and investment signals, we’ll unpack what’s driving demand, what barriers remain, and where the biggest opportunities lie.
Whether you're curious about the technology, the economics, or the practicalities of adoption, this is your chance to take a deep dive into an important fuel in the energy transition.
Panelists include:
Julian Hughes, GM Supply, Z Energy
Billie Moore, Chief Executive, NZ Airports Association
Peter van Cingel, Business Development Manager, Channel Infrastructure NZ

Drinks and nibbles provided
Spaces are limited — register below to secure your spot.
* 'Sustainable Aviation Fuel' is an industry term used to describe fuels manufactured using waste and purpose grown feedstocks, including used cooking oil (UCO), tallow and canola oil, and can provide carbon emissions reductions on a life cycle basis.

As part of the wider Wellington Heritage Festival, this 2-hour author-led walking tour of the CBD guides you through highlights from the new Te Papa Press book, 'Capital Trees'. The book and tour trace the living legacies of the city’s rich tree heritage, including arguments around heritage tree listing, the native versus exotics debate, biodiversity, trees as monuments and more.
Starting at the Supreme Court, the tour takes in Parliament grounds, The Terrace and Plimmer Steps before ending up at Unity Books.

description:
2-Day Kali Seminar with Stephen Brown from Inosanto Academy in CA, 2-Day Kali Seminar with Stephen Brown from Inosanto Academy in CA
Want to learn the exact martial art skills as used in the Bourne films? Wellington this is your chance...

Tactical Survival Academy is hosting Senior Instructor Stephen Brown from the renowned Inosanto Academy of Martial Arts in Marina Del Rey, Los Angeles!

With over 40 years of martial arts experience and 36 years training under Guro Dan Inosanto, Stephen is one of only two instructors currently teaching Kali classes at the academy alongside Guro Dan Inosanto himself.

Stephen specializes in the Filipino Martial Art of Kali, as passed down through Guro Inosanto’s lineage. His training background also includes extensive experience in Muay Thai, Silat, Western Boxing, Jeet Kune Do, Savate and Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

Over the decades, Stephen has worked with:
* Multiple branches of Law Enforcement, Military units and Special Forces.
* Actors, stunt performers, and executives in the film and television industry.
* As a fight choreographer for screen productions.

Known for his precision, adaptability, and deep respect for the cultural roots of the arts he teaches, Stephen brings a wealth of knowledge and embodied experience to every seminar.

Currently based in Marina Del Rey, CA, Stephen is excited to share the Kali method of Guro Inosanto with the New Zealand martial arts community.

• Location: Mt Cook School Hall, 160 Tory Street, Te Aro
• Dates: Sat Sept 6 + Sun Sept 7
• Time: 1:30pm – 4:30pm (both days)
• Cost: One Day Only (Sat or Sun) $140 / Both Days $260
• Registration Closing Date: Wed Sept 3rd

description:
2026 Wellington POCUS Fundamentals Course / EGLS Course, POCUS Fundamentals + EGLS
2 Days of Comprehensive POCUS education for Acute Care Clinicians
Take part in a flexible learning experience designed for real-world acute care:
Day 1: POCUS Fundamentals
Master the essentials – focus on AAA & eFAST.
Day 2: EGLS (Echo Guided Life Support)
Confidently assess and manage the shocked patient using focused cardiac and lung ultrasound.
Attend either day independently, or combine both for a complete acute care ultrasound experience.

Day 1 – POCUS Fundamentals
Focus on essential diagnostic ultrasound skills with Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm (AAA) & eFAST (extended Focused Assessment with Sonography in Trauma) modules. This is ideal for clinicians seeking to build confidence and competence in core applications that can be immediately applied in clinical practice.
https://www.emugs.org/pocusfundamentals
Day 2 – EGLS (Echo-Guided Life Support)
Take your resuscitation skills to the next level with EGLS. Learn a structured, protocolised approach to using cardiac and lung ultrasound in the assessment and management of shock and respiratory failure. This course is designed to empower acute care clinicians with the practical skills to make rapid, life-saving decisions.
https://www.emugs.org/egls
Combo of Fundamentals + EGLS - Whether you're new to ultrasound or looking to enhance your skills, this comprehensive two-day course  is ideal for acute care clinicians aiming to integrate POCUS into daily practice.
You'll cover the core emergency medicine ultrasound modules: FELS, eFAST, AAA, and lung. The course aligns with ACEM and ASUM credentialing requirements for core ultrasound modalities.
By the end, you'll be proficient in four essential techniques: focused echo in life support (FELS), extended FAST, aortic scanning, and lung/thoracic ultrasound.
The program includes online pre-course work, brief lectures, image review, hands-on scanning, and networking opportunities—all within a supportive learning environment.
Suitable for all experience levels:
ACEM trainees beginning their ultrasound journey
Acute care doctors looking to upskill
Clinicians in critical care, rural, and urgent care settings
Beginners will build a solid foundation; experienced users can refine skills with expert feedback

description:
3 Steps for Life Training, Learn CPR for your loved one.

This Shocktober Hato Hone, St John, is on a mission to provide CPR & AED awareness training to as many people as they can. 3 Steps for Life is free training designed to give you the confidence to take action if someone suffers a cardiac arrest by:

Calling 111
Starting CPR
Using an AED
Come along to this 3 Steps for Life workshop from 10am-11am, Wednesday 22 October at the City Centre Library.

This workshop is free to attend and no bookings are required.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
6-12 In person PLD, The story of Communication and Signs is one of the five great stories which scaffold the learning in Montessori classrooms for the 6-12 year old child. It traces the beginnings of human communication and the development of writing.
How can we as educators encourage writing in our Montessori environments and ensure collaborations and an understanding of the basic writing processes, bring success and enthusiasm to the telling of powerful stories?
What are some of the stumbling blocks for children when researching? How can we provide strategies and structure to enable lively and informative information writing?
In this day-long face to face workshop, with a focus on guidance for narrative and information writing, participants will be invited into the world of learning to write. Strategies and exercises to stimulate interest and action for writers will be given, alongside challenges and advanced crafting lessons for more fluent writers in 6-9 and 9-12 classrooms. We will examine elements of structuring, elaboration, character and place, revision, and author techniques. Note taking and writing for research will be included in an information writing session.
Day 2: Sunday 14th September
Come prepared to share your collective wisdom while we align NZC History curriculum to what we do in our classrooms to ensure that everything is covered. By September we will also have a better idea of where the conventional system is headed with the new-look maths coming out. We will spend time unpacking the the WHY we do what we do.
This is an opportunity for you to discuss, share ideas and gain ideas for ways forward.

Info about the teacher:
Guinean percussionist Sibo Bangoura grew up in Matam – the heart of Conakry’s arts precinct – surrounded by a family of griots. His mother was a singer and his father abalafon player. Sibo absorbed the rhythm from his infancy and began to study percussion formally at the age of 12. At 14, he joined Boka Junior ensemble and then played with Ballet Matam for many years, until he moved to Australia.
Sibo currently resides in Sydney and travels to China, Japan, Singapore and Thailand to teach and perform. He plays with his brothers Mohamed and Epizo Bangoura and has a successful 8-piece band Keyim Ba

description:
Abstract Painting, Abstract painting offers many facets and values. One of the most interesting is its versatility as a means of direct expression.
In this course students will explore the elements that contribute to making this form of expression more effective. The focus will include investigating 'sources of inspiration' as well as:
- Colour and form
- Composition
- Brushwork and materiality

This course is for all levels - beginners to advanced. Basic materials provided.

Monday evenings, 5:30 - 8 pm, 13 October - 8 December.

- Selections
- Layers
- Painting tools
- Image sizing
- Colour systems
- Masks and channels

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

Prerequisites.
Good computer skills essential.

Presented by Paul Messervy

description:
Advanced Claw Setting in Two Days, This two-day class will run on two Sundays, 24 and 31 August, 10am - 1pm. It is designed for advanced students and focuses on teaching a range of claw setting techniques, along with straightforward construction methods to securely hold gemstones of various shapes and sizes. The emphasis is on mastering the techniques rather than creating polished, finished jewellery pieces.
Students are encouraged to bring along their own particular tools, metal and stones if they would like to. They can also bring their own half made ring shanks or other projects to set into.
They will start by creating claw settings for flat-bottomed stones on plate to gain an understanding of how claws work.
Students will then move on to faceted stones and be shown how to construct their own settings in a number of styles, and how to secure their stones in settings. Finally, they will be taught the dos and don’ts of finishing settings to a salable level.
The workshop will also look at how to use pre-made claw settings to best advantage.
Workshop fee $245, Early bird $221 till 27 July.

description:
Advanced/Technique Social Dance Classes, Course 5, Wanting to work on improving your social dance skills and technique? Come to this fun course of open classes, practising drills and exercises to perfect your American Smooth and Rhythm dancing. Classes tailored to accommodate all levels. No partner required.
COURSE: Eight weeks
STARTING: 3 September 2025
TIME: Wednesdays, 8-9pm
PLACE: Level 2, 110 Hutt Rd, Kaiwharawhara, Wellington
COST: $120 per person
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Anyone Can Draw - Observational, Learn to create a realistic drawing from what you see. This introductory class teaches the technical skills of observational drawing using a variety of media, including pen and ink, charcoal, pencil and pastel.

Students will learn a range of formal skills through exercises in the following:

- Quality of line
- Accurate observation of shape
- Gesture drawing
- Use of negative and positive shapes
- Using tone well
- Direct observation of spaces such as interiors, buildings or landscapes

With expert guidance from Denise you will learn a broad range of skills that can serve as a basis for advancing into classes in painting and assist and finding your own means of expression.

All materials provided.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Anyone Can Draw - Structural, In this course you will examine structural drawing with a careful helpful approach, focusing on simple perspective drawing and the value of geometric shapes and solids. Both these structural approaches contribute greatly to the success of your drawing.

Geometric shapes can simplify a subject, unify a drawing and make compositions dynamic. Geometric solids will help render any subject in three dimensions and transition to perspective.

A good working knowledge of the concepts of perspective will help you draw any subject with correct dimensionality. It can also help in your realist drawing, painting and invented subjects and environments. These concepts are also used in most two dimensional art because it enables us to realise great spatial effects, making it an invaluable tool to add to your skill set.

8 x weekly morning or afternoon sessions. All basic materials supplied.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

description:
Argentine Tango course -Monday in Wellington, Argentine Tango course -Monday in Wellington
New Argentine Tango course in Churton Park, Wellington.
Term four 2025 starts: 22nd September to 27th October 2025
*Must register before 18th September*

Back from Buenos Aires!
with intensive training from the best of the best!
Denise & Alex White with over 25 years teaching experience!

Course bookings essential as numbers are limited.

Held at George's Garage Milonga Studio, 25 Silverbirch grove, Churton Park, Wellington.
(parking is available down driveway, on-site next to the studio)

7:30pm to 8.30pm Open to all Levels
* Beginners to Advanced Argentine Tango

fees:
Casual/per class $20. (Provided not fully booked)
6-week course $110

Argentine Tango:

Courses mainly focus on Argentine Tango. Other Tango dance styles Milonga and Vals (aka tango waltz) are also taught, with a mix of traditional with modern styles of Tango music - no screechy ones!

A suitable foundation for both social dancing and performance/stage tango dancing developed more as you advance to be a versatile dancer able to dance each style with ease.

Other useful info:
Please wear clean socks or suitable smooth soled shoes with good ankle support. highly recommend a drink bottle as well.

This course has a minimum number to go ahead, also a maximum number of students to ensure quality of teaching. Bookings are essential.
signup online
https://www.dancetango.co.nz
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Aromatherapy Candle-Making Workshops, To celebrate WOW (World of Wearable Art) season here in Wellington, we're offering two beautiful aromatherapy candle-making workshops, to be held at Wellington Apothecary. These will be held in the afternoon so you can do something fun before the show or before dinner during your stay here in Wellington.

What to expect?
Discover the natural beauty of therapeutic essential oils, learn about scent layering, design your own signature scent and make a clean-burning aromatherapy candle.

When? Friday 19 September, 3pm to 5pm and Friday 3 October, 4pm to 6pm
Where? Wellington Apothecary, Cuba Mall, Wellington

____

What's included in the workshop...

Be guided by Melanie of Poet Botanicals and discover the natural beauty of over 40 pure essential oils
Learn about scent layering and how to create your own essential oil blends at home
Step-by-step guidance on how to make a clean-burning aromatherapy candle
Locally produced refreshments

Investment per person ~ $125. Bookings essential. Suitable for ages 14 years and over. Not recommended if you're pregnant due to the nature of some essential oils.

Please note that your candle will need to cure overnight and will be available for either pickup from Wellington Apothecary or we can courier it to you (cost of courier included in workshop fee). Thank you.

____

Cancellation policy
If you can no longer attend the workshop please contact us at least 72 hours prior for a full refund. If you cancel within 72 hours we can only provide a refund or move you to another date, if we're able to rebook your spot. Thank you.
label: Classes & Workshops

description: Astrophotography Session with the award-winning Chris Murphy, Come along to see award winning shots taken by Chris Murphy of Last Quarter Photography & Under the Stars . Chris is a finalist in the 2025 New Zealand Geographic Photographer of the Year competition and he will share hints and tips on capturing the magic of the dark skies.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Astrophotography Workshop at the Courthouse, Astrophotography Workshop at the Courthouse
Learn how to capture the night sky in this hands-on Astrophotography Workshop, part of Carterton Space Week 2025. Hosted in the historic Courthouse, the evening will feature local and guest astrophotographers, including Sam Leske and Haritina Mogoșanu, with more experts to be announced.

You’ll be guided through the basics of photographing stars, planets, and deep-sky wonders — from camera settings and lenses to composition and editing. If you have a DSLR or mirrorless camera, bring it along for practical tips; if not, come to be inspired and learn how astrophotographers transform the dark Wairarapa skies into works of art.

Audience:

Amateur and aspiring astrophotographers
Stargazers who want to try a new skill
Anyone curious about night sky photography
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Author Talk: Mike McRoberts, Join us for what will no doubt be a fascinating and informative author talk as Mike McRoberts speaks to his memoir Speaking My Language | Te Kōrero I Tōku Reo with political reporter Llyod Burr.
Well-known journalist and presenter Mike McRoberts opens up about his experiences of reconnection to te ao Maori and learning te reo, and encourages others to do the same.
In Speaking My Language / Te Korero i Toku Reo Mike shares his story of that journey to speak te reo Maori and reclaim his identity. His book is an invitation for all New Zealanders to take the first step to understand why speaking our Maori language and treasuring our culture matters.
All welcome!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
BLACK DOG BBQ Masterclass, American Style BBQ Masterclass
20th September 2025
This class will cover everything from meat selection & trimming, fire control, charcoal & wood, the cook, cutting & serving. Along with loads of other tips and trick to upskill your BBQ game leading into summer.
You will be served a six course barbecue meal during the day & we will demonstrate the trim & cook of each protein before serving.
This will include chicken nibbles & chorizo, reverse seared ribeye steaks with chimichurri, pork ribs, sliced smoked brisket & pulled pork tacos.
Finishing with a classic American dessert.
A range of smokers will be fired up during the day, including an Oklahoma Joe Bronco, Traeger Ironwood XL and our massive offset smoker. Alcoholic and other drinks available to purchase during the day.

description:

The BSLA team is excited to be hosting a refresher session in Wairarapa, where they will showcase new resources (e.g. Better Spelling), include assessment website updates and cover links to the refreshed curriculum. Secure your spot and register now. The BSLA team are looking forward to connecting with you soon!

description:
Bailamos Bachata! Latin Dance Party (with free lesson), Please note: the event is free but it can only continue if we support the Southern Cross by buying food or drinks

Wellington’s favourite monthly Bachata Latin dance party

Join us for an awesome mix of bachata, focusing on the best sensual tracks and remixes, along with salsa and a smattering of kizomba and zouk. We welcome everyone, from the absolute beginner to the most experienced dancer. We’re all about the joy of social dancing together.
And what makes a free party with great people even better? A free beginners’ bachata lesson with some of Wellington‘s best Latin dance teachers. If you’ve never danced bachata, Latin dance or even any other dance style before then this is the perfect lesson for you. We will have you dancing like a pro in no time!
Bailamos Bachata is hosted free of charge by the Southern Cross. They love the atmosphere we bring but we also need to support them in return. We’re asking everyone attending to purchase soft drinks, food or alcohol from the bar. It’s vital we show our gratitude.
1800-1830 social
1830-1900 free lesson
1900-2100 social
Q&A
Q. What is bachata?
A. Bachata is a popular and fun Latin couples dance. It started in the Dominican Republic, then travelled to Europe and the rest of the world. It now includes a wide range of music styles and dance influences and is still changing and evolving.
Q. I haven’t danced before, is that a problem?
A. Not at all! That’s exactly what the lesson is for – everyone has to start somewhere and we’re a very welcoming crowd for beginners.
Q. Is bachata a difficult dance to learn?
A. Its origins as a party/community dance mean the basics can be learnt quite quickly, so you’ll be enjoying yourself in no time.
Q. Who are the capital bachata collective?
A. We are the combined Wellington dance schools and people teaching bachata and we really want to share this dance with everyone. We love bachata, we love our community and we want to share it with you
￼

description:
Balfolk Class - Newtown, Balfolk Class - Newtown
Balfolk is a folk dance and music movement from Europe that gives new life to traditional dances. A ‘Bal Folk’ is a social dance event that brings people of all ages and walks of life together through group and partner dances to have fun and connect. It's a friendly, social and energising space.

The class will run over 6 weeks. We will learn and practice different group and partner dances you would commonly find in a Bal Folk.
Dances are simple and easy to learn but also have depth so once you have learnt the basics, we can explore and play around with variations.
Balfolk is accessible to people with all skill levels. You don’t need any previous dance experience, curiosity is all you need 😊

When: Wednesdays from 6:00 to 7:30pm

Location: Newtown Community Centre

Price: $60 for the block of 6 classes
$15/class for casual attendance
Students/concession/unwaged: koha

description:
Beekeeping - Beginners, Always wanted to keep bees but thought it's not possible in the city? Richard can explain how in this very popular course!

By the end of the workshop, you'll be able to:
- Describe how a bee colony functions
- List the components of a hive
- State the key steps involved in setting up a beehive

description:
Beeswax Candle Making, Come along and find out how easy it is to make your very own beeswax candles to give your home a delightful ambience!

Have you always admired the beauty and fragrance of beeswax candles and wondered how they are made? Join Jill in this 2-hour workshop where you will learn how to make three different styles of these candles using beeswax sheets. Come along and immerse yourself in this fun and relaxing workshop as you discover how to create your own candles. These are great for gifting as well!

All materials included in course fee, bring a pen and paper to take notes if you wish.

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

Make three styles of candles
Know where to source wax and wick to continue making your own at home
Be proud of a home-made product created with your own hands

description:
Beginner jewellery-making in 8 weeks: Mondays - Wellington, Our popular weeknight classes are the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment. The block starts on Mon 25 August and runs for 8 weeks until Mon 13 October, 5.30pm - 8pm.
The stone setting process teaches you many fundamental techniques in one project!
We start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.
Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).
Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.
Course fee $440, early bird $396 till 27 July.
Included in the class fee are a copper and brass pack for practising on, a sterling silver pack, 2 gemstones and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and materials are available for purchase in the studio.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Beginner's Weekend - Afternoon session, A fabulous and fun introduction to jewellery making over two afternoons, this is our most popular short workshop! Give yourself a gift of a new creative hobby (or maybe even a career?) this spring!

The students start with basic ring making in copper or brass. We begin with ring making as this process teaches students many fundamental techniques in one project, measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, soldering and finishing are all included in this one ring.

Students will learn how to measure their fingers to get an accurately sized ring, later they will also learn how to take sizing from existing rings. They are shown how to use a jeweller’s saw to cut their metal to the correct length, how to form it up and how to solder.

Then they learn how to shape their rings and finish them up into a wearable piece of jewellery, all in the first class!

In the first session they are also shown how to texture metals, cut and layer shapes, melt balls of silver and other techniques to create decorative elements.

Students can spend their evening thinking about and planning their design in silver for the next day. We encourage them to carefully plan this project and think about how they might make their piece before they begin, including creating drawings and notes. (We always say drawings don’t need to be “good”, they just need to make sense to the student and their tutor!). This project can be another ring, or earrings or pendants. We have a great selection of example pieces in the workshop so they can see what’s achievable in the 3-hour time frame. Sometimes students can make more than one silver piece if they have enough time.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, up to 8 grams of sterling silver and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and chains are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids 12 and up are welcome in this class, any person under 16 years old must be accompanied by an enrolled caregiver.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Beginner's Weekend - October - Wellington, A fabulous and fun introduction to jewellery making over two afternoons, this is our most popular short workshop!
The students start with basic ring-making in copper or brass. We begin with ring making as this process teaches students many fundamental techniques in one project, measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting, soldering and finishing are all included in this one ring.
Students will learn how to measure their fingers to get an accurately sized ring, later they will also learn how to take sizing from existing rings. They are shown how to use a jeweller’s saw to cut their metal to the correct length, how to form it up and how to solder.
Then they learn how to shape their rings and finish them up into a wearable piece of jewellery, all in the first class!
In the first morning they are also shown how to texture metals, cut and layer shapes, melt balls of silver and other techniques to create decorative elements.
Students can spend their afternoon and evening thinking about and planning their design in silver for the next day. We encourage them to carefully plan this project and think about how they might make their piece before they begin, including creating drawings and notes. (We always say drawings don’t need to be “good”, they just need to make sense to the student and their tutor!). This project can be another ring, or earrings or pendants. We have a great selection of example pieces in the workshop so they can see what’s achievable in the 3-hour time frame. Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a selection of sterling silver packs to choose from (depending on your project) and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals and chains are available for purchase in the studio.

description:
Beginners Sewing Class, Come to our beginners sewing class and you can walk away with your very own handmade patchwork bag! Learning all the skills needed to start sewing right from threading the machine, you need zero prior sewing skills - this is the perfect course for all levels of beginners. You will learn how to handle fabrics, how to use the machine smoothly and effectively, and even get to put in a zip! Making a bag and a cushion cover, you get the chance to take away TWO items that you have made and learn great foundation sewing skills, all while having a blast with a lovely group of people.

Everything needed for the course is provided, just bring yourself and your sewing machine if you have one. If you have a machine we do recommend learning with it as it will help you to become familiar with your particular machine’s quirks, however we also have machines available to borrow.

**Our machine numbers are limited, so please let us know if you will be needing one!**

description: Beginners Thai Kickboxing Class, Experience fun and energetic Muay Thai class with a passionate and experienced trainer. The first trial class is free. You will learn kicks and punches on pads and bags and get a great workout. Students to get the full physical and mental benefits of Thai Boxing without the need for fighting and you'll definitely leave with a smile.

description:
Bikespace - Road Ready Workshop, With the arrival of Spring what better time to get your bike ready for the road.
We’re continuing our series of one hour workshops targeted at those who want to learn a bit more about how their bike works and how to maintain & repair it to keep it running at its best.
This workshop is more general than some of our other more topic specific sessions. We will cover:
* Road Readiness. A front to back check for safety and performance
* Drivetrain tuning and maintenance
* Brake tuning and maintenance
* Tyres & Tubes. Pressures and repair.
Sunday, September 21st from 9:00am to 10:00am at the Bikespace workshop.
We'll spend most of the hour with interactive learning followed by time to work on individuals bicycles. To allow hands-on participation we are limiting the numbers to this workshop to 8 people and their bikes. Please indicate in the comments if you would like to attend and we will confirm attendees for this session.
We have a number of people indicate interest and then not attend the session. Please make every effort to attend if you sign up.
Due to our lack of covered outdoor space there is always the possibility that we have to reschedule if the weather is really uncooperative.
Bikespace is a Wellington City Council initiative allowing us to offer all our services at no cost to participants.

Take home a treasured art piece and new ideas.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Botanical Blues - Photographic cyanotype, Explore the historic photographic process of the cyanotype and create luminous blueprints of leaves and flowers.

In this workshop, you’ll discover the beautiful 19th-century photographic process of the cyanotype (often called a blueprint), known for its striking Prussian blue tones. In its earliest form, the cyanotype was used to record botanical specimens. During our workshop, you’ll collect plants or foliage from the garden (or bring your own) to create delicate contact prints on watercolour paper. We’ll coat paper with light-sensitive chemistry, expose your designs in the sunlight, and develop and tone your prints with tea (!) to add depth and variation to your series of finished images.

All materials included.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Botanical Oddities - Guided Walk, In this one-hour walk will we will see a plant that can’t decide whether it’s a lily or an asparagus, tree trunks that are not really tree trunks, plants that photosynthesise only at night, and a deadly poisonous plant that yields potent cancer-fighting drugs. And discover more on this relaxing downhill amble.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run twice monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

description:
Brazilian Zouk Dance Classes - Beginners Block C, Connect with other like minded people that have a love of dance.
Brazilian Zouk was developed in Rio de Janeiro in the mid 90s, and is now becoming more and more popular
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DfhRHnEAbak
..............
This is stunning to watch and even more fun to dance! It is based on the original Lambada dance but adapted to more modern music with a slow-quick-quick beat. It can be danced to a wide variety of music including R&B, Rock and Pop.
In this block of 5 classes you will discover the fundamental techniques, movements and sequences of Brazilian Zouk to get you up and running on the dance floor.
This includes:
Week 1: Passo basico + elastico push
Week 2: lateral
Week 3: elástico upright (lead walking around)
Week 4: abertura e giro
Week 5:Combination
They are designed so you can start this block as a complete newbie, or you can continue on as an existing student from the last block.
There are 4 blocks of classes (A, B, C, D) in the complete Fundamentals course. Once these are done, you can progress to the Improvers classes.

description:
Breathe & Draw 'Where creativity meets inner peace', Breathe & Draw 'Where creativity meets inner peace'
Breathe & Draw
Where creativity meets inner peace


Saturday 27th of September
10:00 am - 11:30 am
@Hey Coastie 42 Tutere Street, Waikanae Beach


Join our (totally beginner-friendly) Breathe and Draw workshop. An art class focusing on drawing itself rather than the outcome of your work. This month's class is all about turning inner chaos into calm, visual order through mindful drawing. Starting with simple, spontaneous lines and adding as we go.

Why people do it:
Reduces stress and anxiety
Helps process emotions
Supports mindfulness

We start each class with some interactive drawing exercises before we start our final piece.
$25 fee, includes all supplies.
We meet at Hey Coasties at Waikanae Beach by the Banana trees. We will be in the outdoor area if the weather is fine, please bring a jacket just in case.
Spots are limited, please get in touch to book in advance.

description:
Budgeting Brainstorming Workshop for NZ Fringe 2026, Do you have some questions about budgeting for your upcoming NZ Fringe 2026 season? Want to know how to write a budget for our upcoming Kākano or FATU funding rounds?
Well, this workshop will answer all these questions and more! Join Creative Capital Art Trust's CE Kim Bailey and NZ Fringe Festival Director Vanessa Stacey, as they break down all things budgeting and answer any of your burning questions!
We look forward to seeing you at Te Auaha 30th of Sept at 6pm!

description:
Bulgarian Folk Dance Class, Bulgarian Folk Dance Class
Join Bulgarian Ensemble Horo and Discover the Joy of Bulgarian Folk Dance!
No partner? No problem! Our dances are performed in open circles, so everyone is welcome.
Come and experience the vibrant rhythms and rich traditions of Bulgarian music and dance!
Our group regularly performs at multicultural festivals and Bulgarian cultural events around Wellington.
About Our Teacher – Lilia Petrova de Castro:
Lilia began dancing Bulgarian folk at just 8 years old. With 15 years of experience performing across Bulgaria and Europe with Dance Ensemble "Svetlina" and the renowned folk ensemble "Sredetz", she brings deep knowledge and passion to every class. Lilia believes dancing is one of the best ways to energize your body and uplift your mind and she loves sharing that joy with others!

description:
COFFEE & CLAY Hand build your own ceramic butter dish, Join us for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you'll create your very own ceramic butter dish in a working pottery studio. Over two inspiring hours, you'll learn the basics of hand-building with clay, guided step-by-step by a ceramic artist.
Enjoy fresh coffee and a home-baked morning tea as you get creative with shaping, decorating, and embellishing your piece. You'll finish by choosing your preferred glaze colours, and we'll take care of the firing process. Your finished butter dish will be ready to collect approximately four weeks later.
This small group workshop is perfect for absolute beginners—no experience needed. Come solo and meet like-minded creatives, or bring a friend for a fun and mindful morning.
You’ll be amazed at how calming it is to get out of your head and into your hands!

description:
Café Scientifique - Space: What Is Our Place In the Cosmos?, Join us for a new Café Scientifique series hosted by Pūtaiao ki te Pāpori—School of Science in Society.

At this first event in September, astrophysicist Dr Yvette Perrott and novelist Dr Tim Corballis will discuss the evolving picture physics gives us about the nature of the universe, and the ways people find their place in it.

Café Scientifique is a place where, for the price of a cup of coffee or a glass of wine, anyone can come to explore the latest ideas in science and technology in a relaxed, friendly environment.

The evening will start with a short introduction from the speakers, followed by a question-and-answer conversation.

Doors open at 5.30 pm, talks begin at 6 pm. All welcome—free entry, nibbles provided.

Please note: anyone under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian.
For further information, please contact scienceinsociety@vuw.ac.nz.

Grab a friend and join us for an evening of creativity, socializing, and learning new skills - all while supporting a great cause.
You’ll receive expert guidance in cake decorating techniques and leave with your own delicious 6-inch round cake (serving 8).
Enjoy complimentary drinks and tasty nibbles as you create your masterpiece.

We look forward to seeing you there for a sweet evening of creativity and community.

description:
Cake Decorating Workshop, Cale Decorating Workshop
Join cake expert, Lina, for a hands-on cake building and decorating workshop where creativity meets craftsmanship!
With over 20 years of experience in the culinary and hospitality industries - from managing restaurants across Europe and Asia to running her own cake design business - Lina brings not only technical expertise, but also a genuine passion for sharing the joy of decorating.
Known for her friendly, engaging style and eye for detail, Lina will guide you through each step of the process - from building cakes and decorating including palette knife and  gum-paste techniques, to using buttercream and creating a centrepiece.
Whether you're a complete beginner or simply want to sharpen your decorating skills, you'll leave with new techniques, confidence, and of course, your own edible masterpiece.
Let’s make something beautiful - and delicious - together!
You will leave with a tall 6” decorated cake in its own cake box to take home and enjoy. All ingredients included in course fee - just bring an apron and a couple of teatowels.
Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. Whether you’re fundraising, raising awareness, or advocating for change, this workshop will give you the tools to design content that supports your kaupapa and makes an impact.
You’ll learn the basics of Canva, how to bring your posts to life on social media, and ways to work with the algorithm, plus plenty of useful tips and tricks to make your content more effective.

Car Maintenance - The Basics Course, Get to grips with basic maintenance of your vehicle, find out what to look for in the event of a breakdown and more.

Learn what makes your car go, basic maintenance of your vehicle including servicing a vehicle, checking fuses and changing a tyre.

Please note that part of this workshop is held outdoors so please dress according to the weather – sun hats in summer and warm clothes in winter. (If the weather is very bad in the afternoon and the practical part can't happen, this will be rescheduled).

By the end of the one-day workshop, you'll be able to:
- Describe the routine service tasks required to maintain a vehicle
- Undertake minor maintenance on your vehicle
- Describe safety considerations when working with vehicles
- Undertake minor “trouble shooting” when an issue arises

description:
Carry Me Close: Make a wearable pocket for your phone, Join contemporary jeweller Louise Hill for a relaxed, hands-on workshop where you’ll create your own cross-body pocket bag to carry your phone close. Participants will construct, embellish, and personalise their pockets while exploring the themes behind Louise’s exhibition – pockets as sites of practicality, power, and absence. Together we’ll consider who gets pockets, who doesn’t, and what that says about our histories and identities. Come ready to make, chat, and carry your ideas with you.
What’s provided: All materials and tools needed to create your take-home pocket bag.
What to bring: Any ideas or embellishments you’d like to incorporate into your design.
Who this workshop is for: Craft lovers.
Places are limited so bookings essential.

description:
Celebrating the champion — Maurice Gee’s contribution to children’s literature, Join us for a panel presentation focusing on the children’s writing of Maurice Gee, the celebrated New Zealand writer who died in June of this year, aged 93.
Speakers: NZ’s Reading Ambassador Kate de Goldi, commentator and award-winning writer for children Claire Mabey, poet Anna Jackson, memoirist and poet Harry Ricketts, and scholars Dr Tatjana Schaefer and Dr Vivien van Rij. The discussion will be introduced by Emeritus Professor Kathryn Walls.
This free event is hosted jointly by the Friends of the Dorothy Neal White Collection and Victoria University’s International Institute of Modern Letters.
All are welcome. Light refreshments will be served.
Date: Tuesday 23 September 2025
Time: 5.30 – 7:00pm (approx.) We shall begin with tea and coffee; the presentation will begin at 6.00 pm.
Place: Floor 12, Rutherford House, Bunny Street, Wellington
Enquiries to : Kathryn.Walls@vuw.ac.nz

description:
Chain Maille Course, Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.
This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.
Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.
There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.
Course Outline:
Week 01 - 18th September
101: Basic Skills and Discovery
At this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.
Opening & closing rings properly
Trying out some simple structures
Begin exploring material options and how to make your own rings
Homework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille
Week 02 - 25th September
Play and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projects
Playing with recycled & foraged materials
Homework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class
Week 03 - 2nd October
Mathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.
Math of designing chain maille
Theory & pre-planning
Discussion about ideas for individual projects
Identify materials needed to execute individual designs
Homework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.
Week 04 - 16th October
By this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.
Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th October
These classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.
Week 07 - 6th November
At this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.
