description:
Mixology 101 Cocktail Class, Join Tonic's co-owner and lead bartender, Michael McLane, for an afternoon of shaking, stirring, layering and, of course, tasting some of our favourites from our menu. Michael will guide you through making the drinks and provide tips on choosing and even making your own ingredients while offering up a bit of cocktail history. Shaken or stirred? What's so simple about simple syrup? Who was Count Negroni? And what's so old fashioned about the Old Fashioned anyway? We'll talk about all of this and more all while tantalising those tastebuds with a little mixology.

Courses will include a welcome drink and you will be led through process of making two drinks of your own. In some cases, you will also be able to sample variations of drinks that we will demo so you can see how different techniques affect what happens in the glass. You'll receive some of our delicious snacks to pair up with your drinks as well.

Whether you're holiday in Martinborough and looking a little more interactive bar experience or coming to town on a work do and looking for a perfect ice breaker with colleagues, these classes are a great way to shake and break the ice.

Mosaic Design, Discover the delights of mosaic design and learn how to use materials such as broken tiles, china, and shells to make a mosaic frame, pot plant holder, or other simple objects.

You'll be able to make several pieces of mosaic to your own design and after the completion of the course, will feel confident to carry on working on your own projects.

A list of materials and tools required (approximate cost $65) will be sent out when course numbers are confirmed. Please wear clothing and footwear suitable for a workshop environment.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:

Demonstrate the basic principles/techniques of mosaic design

Break and cut tiles correctly

Place tiles on the object

Stick pieces to flat and curved surfaces

Grout a mosaic piece

Use stones and shells in mosaics

description:
Musicality Workshop Series Part II – Understanding the Music, Come to this workshop and look at the relationship between the dance and the music. Find out what makes the different dance types unique and how the music contributes to these distinctions.
The workshop will also look at how musicians think and how dancers can better relate to the music through this thinking. Simply put, come and learn the language of "Musician"!
Date: Saturday, 13 September 2025
Time: 2:30-5:30pm
Cost: $40
Location: Level 2, 110 Hutt Rd, Kaiwharawhara, Wellington
Afternoon tea included
This workshop is the second of our four-part series in Musicality. The other workshops cover musical appreciation, engaging the music, and finally embodying the music. While all parts build on the learning of the other parts of the series, they also stand alone. The first part is not a prerequisite for attending this course.
Partners not required although always most very welcome.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Māori, Christianity & the Spirit World — Public lecture by Bradford Haami, In lecture theatre 2 (GBLT2) in the Law School at Victoria University / Te Herenga Waka.
Ramsey Library presents a public lecture by Bradford Haami.
What happens when vastly different ways of being meet? Dame Anne Salmond writes of ‘competing cosmologies’ and ‘ontological collisions’ — European missionaries arriving in Aotearoa in the early 19th century brought a Biblical cosmology that began such a collision. In this public lecture Bradford Haami will explore the interactions between Biblical and Māori cultural and spiritual worldviews that continue to evolve up to the present.
* How do Biblical and Māori cultural and spiritual beliefs and thought relate?
* How 19th century rangatira negotiate between traditional beliefs and the Biblical narratives?
* Where do Christian and Māori ways of knowing and seeing clash, compete or enrich each other?
* What does being Māori and Christian look like today?

Bradford Haami (Ngāti Awa) is a Māori historian, researcher and author with research interests in Māori worldviews, spirituality, Christianity and cultural preservation. He is Pou Amorangi (Māori Director) at Laidlaw College in Auckland, New Zealand, where he lectures in biculturalism and sits on the governing board of the college. Haami has written several books on Māori history, culture and spirituality, with recent works including Urban Māori: The Second Great Migration (Oratia Media 2018) and Bringing Culture into Care (Huia 2019). He was the Māori curator/expert on the acclaimed Te Taiao / Nature exhibition at Te Papa Tongarewa Museum.
--
To browse the Ramsey Library catalogue, and sign up to borrow books (free), go to https://library.chaplaincyvuw.org.nz

- Introduce yourself, greet other people and exchange personal information
- Demonstrate strategies for: getting attention, asking for clarification, correction and repetition

- Use numbers (0 – 20) and simple time phrases
- Express basic needs and wants
- Use a basic signing vocabulary

description:
Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants - Christmas session!, Natural Texture Earrings and Pendants - Christmas session!
A quick taster class that’s ideal as a fun outing for friends, or as a treat for you! In three short hours, learn to craft an amazing pair of textured silver, brass and/or copper earrings - from scratch!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. After completing this class, you will have one pair of beautiful earrings to wear away or gift to someone special!

You will practice on smaller texture samples to work out what texture and what metal you want to go with, and then move on to creating your earrings in metal.

Your class materials pack includes everything you need for the class to make a super cool pair of earrings. Extra silver can be purchased in the class if you wish to go bigger.

We use quality pre-made sterling silver earring wires, or earring posts with silicone stud backs for these taster classes so that you can focus on making the main part of the earrings and know that your findings will be just perfect.

The outcome for this taster class is to have one pair of completed earrings to wear away or gift to someone special.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

Workshop fee is $128, Early Bird $115 - ends 9 November.

description:
Natural Textured Rings - Wellington, Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special!
Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!
Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!
Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.
Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.
Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

description:
Nature Journaling with Sandra Morris, Observe, draw, and write from nature. 9 November.

Reconnect with the natural world in this mindful workshop led by award-winning botanical artist and illustrator Sandra Morris. Set in the historic garden and visitor center of Nairn Street Cottage, you’ll learn how to observe, draw, and write from nature, whether for identification or simply for pleasure.

Nature journaling invites us to notice the intricate relationships between plant and creature, decay and growth, and the quiet beauty often missed in the rush of daily life. Through sketches, diagrams, poems, lists, or prose, you’ll discover your own way of recording the world around you.

All materials provided, however, please feel free to bring your own preferred drawing tools, such as watercolour pens, colour pencils and your own journal if you already have one underway.

Sunday 9 November, 10am-12:30pm
Tickets $65.00
Bookings essential

Sandra will also be doing an Introduction to Botanical Drawing and Plant Inks workshop on Saturday, 8 November. Make a weekend of it and book both to receive a $20 discount. On the booking details page, you’ll have the option to add a second workshop with Sandra Morris. When both are selected, the discount will be applied automatically.

description:
Niho Taniwha - Equity and Excellence: Wellington, November 2025, Mana Taurite, Mana Ako | Equity and Excellence is a new one-day workshop designed for kaiako and leaders ready to deepen their impact. You’ll explore how to raise achievement and reduce disparity by amplifying student voice, challenging deficit thinking, and embedding culturally responsive assessment and teaching practice.
Through the inquiry process — Whai, Ako, Mau, Tipu — you’ll critically reflect, challenge bias, and apply strategies that uplift equity and excellence. Walk away with frameworks, resources, and actions to drive meaningful change for your learners and community.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
One Day with Footnote - Workshop, One Day with Footnote is a full day dance workshop tailored for youth and young dancers aged 13-18. This event promises participants an immersive experience into the world of contemporary dance, offering a unique opportunity to learn from seasoned professionals in a supportive environment.
Experience Creativity and Energy: Participants can expect to be swept up in the boundless creativity and infectious energy of the Footnote company dancers. Through a series of dynamic workshops, attendees will explore current creative practices and performance techniques that are shaping the landscape of contemporary dance today. From innovative choreography to expressive movement, this workshop is designed to inspire and challenge young dancers of all levels.

SCHEDULE
9.30-11am Floor work & contemporary improvisation
Discover new pathways to smooth out your floor work and dive into the exciting world of improvisation.
11.30-12.30pm Company Repertoire
Learn current company repertoire and experience the performative and physical range of Footnote shows
1.30-2.15pm Performance Practice
Fine tune your performance skills and learn how to connect with the audience
2.30-3.30pm Choreographic Practice
Explore different creative tasks and gain confidence when creating new movement through guided provocations.
4.30pm Open Studio Sharing + Q&A
Friends and family are welcome to pop in and see what we have been up to!
Register through the link below.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Open Dance Kapiti, Open Dance Kapiti
Term Four is just around the corner, and spaces are limited. book now for WIDance's Kapiti Open Dance classes!

Designed to be accessible and engaging for all skill levels, these classes provide a safe and inclusive environment where you can experience joy and laughter through movement.

We nurture creative curiosity and build social connections through a variety of dance activities, including improvisation, dance-based games, and composition.

Our classes enhance body and spatial awareness and foster an understanding of basic dance concepts, all while promoting social interactions through movement.

When: Wednesdays, 6.30 to 8 pm. 8th October to 26th November (8 sessions).
Cost: $12 per session/$80 per term.
To Book: Email
OR phone Sumara 021 050 1565

Who are we?

WIDance is one of Wellington's leading inclusive dance providers, striving to provide equal opportunities for all to dance. Established in 2010, we run open classes, workshops, and performance events throughout the Wellington region.
Our mission is to provide equal opportunities to dance experiences for diverse communities, advocating for inclusion and empowerment

description:
Open workshop series 2025, with RNZB, Bookings are now open!
Mark your calendars for Tuesday, 21st October and join WIDance for our final delightful evening of Ballet in 2025 with the esteemed Royal New Zealand Dance Educators.
Join us as we glide into a welcoming and supportive environment where the magic of ballet unfolds. Starting with a traditional barre warm-up, progressing to the grace of center work, then delve into learning a captivating snippet of choreography from the RNZB's upcoming season of The Nutcracker premiering on 30th October 2025.
This workshop warmly welcomes participants of all levels and backgrounds. Join us for an unforgettable evening celebrating movement, grace, and the joy of dance.
Cost $15 per person per workshop (support person attends free)
Limited places, bookings are essential.
To Book:
Phone 021 050 1565
Email: sumara@widance.nz

PADI Open Water Diver Course, PADI Open Water Diver Course
Don't miss your opportunity to get ready for a dive-filled summer.
Gain your PADI Open Water Diver certificate this spring.

Learn to dive over two weekends. Learn the skills in the pool the 1st weekend before putting your skills into practice the 2nd weekend.

Pool Sessions: 8am - 3pm

$850 includes all the gear you need for the course and for up to 6 fun dives after certification.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
PADI Open Water Diver Course, PADI Open Water Diver Course
“Ever Since I Was A Kid I’ve Wanted To Learn To SCUBA Dive…”

PADI is by far the largest and most popular Scuba diver certifying system in the world and for good reason. Courses are fun safe relevant and packed with excitement! No matter what country you are in your PADI qualification will be recognised.

To learn to dive first complete the medical questionnaire to make sure you are medically fit to dive. Next pay your deposit and select your course dates. You will receive your PADI eLearning theory which must be completed before you attend the first practical session. This simple and fun eLearning program will give you the knowledge you need to understand the reason for the skills you will learn.

The practical part of your Open Water Scuba Diver course takes just four days! During the first weekend we make it very easy and convenient for you with our on-site dive pool (the only one in the Wellington Region). Our pool is where you learn to dive so we can go at your pace no matter how long it takes. During the first weekend you learn and practice all the necessary dive skills. Once completed you will be ready for the sea dives.

During the second weekend you complete four sea dives two per day. This is where we confirm and practice the skills you learnt in our pool – all under direct supervision. You will also complete a simple 300m swim (no time limit and wearing wetsuit mask snorkel and fins).

Once you are a certified diver you will receive an eCard on your PADI App showing your qualification – and any PADI Dive Centre will be able to confirm your certification online. You will also be qualified to attend the PADI Advanced Open Water Diver course and our regular Dive Days.
Our aim is to prepare you for the fascinating adventure of diving. We want to make your diving safe and enjoyable. Welcome to the exciting world of Scuba diving!

If you have any questions please call email or stop by our Dive Store.
 
PPADI Open Water Diver course at a glance
Digital theory: Open Water Diver eLearning Course (allow 8-14 hours)
Practical: One weekend pool training one weekend with four sea dives
Options: One-on-one or unscheduled dates – additional costs apply.
Start Time: Be at NZ Sea Adventures by 8.30am each day.

Location
We are located at 9 Marina View Mana Porirua; just north of the Paremata bridge on SH1. Look for the big yellow building. Our Location

Prerequisites
Be at least 10 years old (special conditions apply for 10 and 11-year-olds)
Be able to swim 300m (mask snorkel and fins no time limit) and swim/float for 10 minutes.
Be medically fit to dive. Check the Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire. If you answer YES to any of the questions or have any doubts a visit to your doctor is required.
eLearning must be completed before your pool training can begin.
Complete the Optional RDP Tables Quiz and Exam after the final exam if you don’t have a dive computer.

What to Bring
Completed Diver Medical Participant Questionnaire.
If Under 18 years – bring a Parent or Legal Guardian to sign your forms.
A pen swimming costume towel and a snack for the breaks.
Any personal dive equipment you wish to use.
The $450.00 balance of your course fee.

Cost
Scheduled Open Water Diver Course Fee: total is $750.00; deposit is $300.00.
Includes: PADI eLearning Course Dive Gear Rental Pool Sessions and Sea Dives. Rental wetsuits are available in stock sizes only. Other sizes are available for purchase. Made-to-measure options can be ordered and purchased.
10% off all in-store purchases during your course. Does not include packages.
$20 off your course fee for every person you get to sign on with you.

When
Our PADI Open Water Diver Courses are scheduled year-round. See our online calendar for scheduled course dates or ask in store. Booking early guarantees your place and price.

Looking for different dates or smaller classes? Ask about our one-off course options. Let us know what you need and we will do our best to help (conditions may apply).

Booking your course
Course bookings can be made in-store via email online or over the phone
The deposit of $300.00 secures your place on a course and purchases your eLearning course.
Deposits are transferable to another person but are not refundable.
eLearning courses once redeemed cannot be transferred.
Before we can send you the eLearning link we require your full name date of birth a valid personal email address and phone number.
Your course balance is to be paid before we can begin your pool training.

Activities For Certified PADI Open Water Divers
Local Diving; It’s a good idea to keep diving regularly especially in the weeks following your course. We’re here to help with advice on dive sites and gear rental. Want a guide? Join us for Dive Days!
Advanced Open Water course; Further your dive skills and continue your underwater adventures with the PADI Advanced Open Water course you can start straight after your Open Water Diver course.
As a certified PADI Open Water Diver you can take the following Specialty Diver courses alongside those available to non-divers; Altitude Diver – AWARE Fish ID diver – Boat Diver – Digital Underwater Photographer – Diver Propulsion Vehicle Diver – Drift Diver – Drysuit Diver – Enriched Air/Nitrox Diver – Equipment Specialist – Night Diver – Peak Performance Buoyancy – Sidemount Diver – Underwater Naturalist – Underwater Navigation

description:
Painting in Oils, This class is open to all levels of students interested in exploring the possibilities of this traditional medium. The main exercises will be based on a still life, however students are free to explore subjects of their choice.

This course focuses on the technique of oil painting. You will learn to

- Choose a colour palette
- Choose and prepare supports on which to paint on with oils
- Create a composition according to the subject selected
- Learn how to render volume and form
- Learn expressive qualities of colour and brushwork
- Students will also learn to stretch their own canvas

If you want to explore the possibilities of painting in oils then this is the course for you.

Tuesday mornings 10 am - 1 pm, 14 October - 2 December.

Basic materials are included.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Papermaking using native plants, Papermaking using native plants
Discover the hidden beauty of native plant fibre and learn how to make your own harakeke paper from scratch.

Following an introduction to basic papermaking techniques, participants will hone their skills through several projects including sheets of paper, cards, letter writing stationery and more.

In addition to the practical skills, the workshop will cover technical aspects of preparing your own pulp using simple household appliances and commonly found plants.

Finished harakeke paper typically has a light straw colour and its own unique texture and feel. The paper is suitable for a wide range of uses.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Paraparaumu Makeup Masterclass - 1.11 @9.15 am, About this event
Join Nikki, a Professional Makeup Artist & Colour Expert with over 14 years of experience, for an engaging and practical Makeup Masterclass. Nikki and her team focus on enhancing natural beauty and making makeup easy for everyone.
As we journey through life, our skin and style evolve. The best way to update your look and learn techniques that suit your unique face shape, style, and colouring is to attend one of our masterclasses. Whether you're a performer on stage, a busy professional, or a multitasking mum, this class will teach you how to apply your makeup quickly, flawlessly, and with confidence.
During the class, Nikki will demonstrate step-by-step techniques on a model while you get to apply your own makeup. You'll have access to professional products and tools to follow along and create your flawless everyday look. It’s fun, interactive, and designed for all skill levels.
"I can’t wait to share my knowledge with you and help you create a makeup routine that leaves you feeling fabulous and confident every day!" – Nikki
What You Need to Know:
No equipment required! We’ll provide all makeup products, brushes, and mirrors.
Bring a willingness to learn and a positive attitude.
Classes are capped at 12-15 participants to ensure personalised guidance.
Arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled.
Please come with a clean, makeup-free face so you can get the best results.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Paraparaumu Soft Glam Makeup Masterclass - 1:11 @2pm, About this event
Take your Makeup Skills to the next level! Learn how to create your perfect smokey eye, sculpted cheeks with creme contouring, false lashes and ombre lips!
We love the no-makeup makeup look, however, sometimes you want just a little more GLAM. Enter our Glam Makeup Masterclass...
Nikki is a Professional Makeup Artist & Colour Expert with over 14 years experience. Her make-up techniques have been developed to amplify natural beauty; from a natural glow to a glamorous cut crease, Nikki believes in enhancing your features to create your perfect look in your best colours.
Nikki will teach you how to apply makeup so you look & feel fabulous, ready for a special event or a night out with the girls.
In this hands-on class, you’ll apply your own makeup while Nikki demonstrates on a model. This interactive approach ensures you leave with skills you can recreate with confidence at home.
"I can’t wait to share my expertise with you and help you create a unique glam look ready for your next big event!" – Nikki
Learn How to Apply
* Full Coverage Foundation
* Concealer
* Cream Contour
* Powder
* Blush & Highlighter
* Eye Shadow - Smokey Eye Trend + Shimmer Cut Crease
* Koh or Liquid Eyeliner
* Mascara
* False Lashes
* Lipstick + Lip Liner
What you receive:
* 3hr lesson with Professional Makeup Artist Nikki Pindur
* Makeup Workbook
* Makeup Face Chart
* Reusable False Lashes
* Colour Coding Chart
* One-on-one consultation at the end of class

Requirements:
• Nothing!
• We will have makeup products and mirrors and brush sets for you to use during the class.
• A willingness to learn and have fun :)
• Classes are limited to 10 people.
• Please arrive 10-15 minutes before the session.
• Please come with no makeup on.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Paraparaumu West Community Response Practice: DIY Workshop, Discover practical, low-cost, and creative ways to prepare for emergencies at your local Community Emergency Hub.

This hands-on workshop will show you how everyday items can be turned into simple tools to help you, and your neighbours get through a natural disaster. You'll also learn more about community emergency hubs, a place where you and your neighbours can go to help each other in a major emergency.

See demonstrations and take home easy “make-it” guides for:

• DIY washing machines
• Headlamp lanterns
• Sand “battery” heaters
• Clay pot refrigerators for vegetables
• Solar ovens

Everyone who comes along will go in the draw to win a 200L water tank worth $129!

Join us at the Paraparaumu East Community Emergency Hub and find out the many ways you can help your community thrive in tough times.

Part of Kāpiti Coast District Council’s Sustainable Spring programme: https://www.kapiticoast.govt.nz/explore-kapiti/things-to-do-in-kapiti/key-council-events/sustainable-spring
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Pasifika Careers Evening at VUW, Pasifika Careers Evening is open to the public, with a particular focus on current Pasifika students in high schools and tertiary institutions, as well as their families.
Stallholders will be Pasifika professionals from a range of organisations across both the private and public sectors. This is an opportunity for our communities to hear directly from Pasifika brothers and sisters who are doing incredible mahi in their respective fields.
Venue: Rutherford House, Ground floor, Pipitea campus
33 Bunny Street, Pipitea
Free entry and open to the public!
Light refreshments will be provided!

description:
Petals & Pastries: Roses & Rosè, Celebrate winter’s quiet beauty in the warmth of the Longbush Cottage glasshouse with a luxurious afternoon of flower-making and indulgence. In this guided workshop, you’ll learn how to craft stunning crepe paper roses — from gently curling petals to forming elegant buds and assembling your own everlasting bouquet. As you create, enjoy a spread of fresh pastries alongside a glass of blushing rosé wine. With the soft light of the garden outside and the warmth of good company within, this is a joyful, hands-on way to embrace the season and take home handmade blooms.
Date & Time: Sunday 31st August - 10am-1pm
Location: 1023 Longbush Road, Longbush 5884
(20 min scenic drive from Martinborough)
Price: $129
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Photograms: Paper, Light & Shadow, Discover the hidden beauty of everyday objects in the darkroom, through the camera-less process of the photogram.

Explore the surreal beauty of everyday objects through the historic photographic process of the photogram. Working in the darkroom, you’ll create striking black-and-white images without a camera – using light, photo paper, chemistry, and carefully chosen small items. Bring along objects and items to work with – jewellery, mementos, small ornaments – particularly those with interesting edges, varying translucency, or the ability to reflect or filter light. We’ll experiment with pattern, tone, and shadow, and you’ll leave with a series of prints which provide a new perspective on the familiar.

All materials included.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Photography - Beginners, Description
If you want to get the best results from your camera, you need to learn the fundamental skills and theory of good photography.

Bring your fully manual-capable (D)SLR or mirrorless camera and owner's manual (if you have one) to the first session.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Operate your camera in manual mode with more confidence
- Use your camera controls such as shutter speed and aperture with confidence
 Determine a correct exposure
- Present and discuss images in a group environment
- Demonstrate technical concepts through their practical application

A condition of enrolment is that you must provide photo ID when you attend.

NOTE: Compact cameras are not suitable for this course. Includes a Saturday field trip at a date and time to be advised - check individual course details.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".


5 sessions, 4 x Thu 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM plus Saturday morning field trip
Wellington High School
Presented by John Williams
$159. incl. GST

description:
Photography - Street and Urban, Street and urban settings provide many opportunities for unique and exciting photographs to be taken. This course shows you how to capture candid and rich street and urban scenes. Includes a Saturday field trip.


Description
Join David of D Jensen photography, as he takes you to the city streets and into urban life to take candid and exciting street photography photos. Street photography candidly captures people in everyday life, taking place in public places. Urban photography is not only limited to photographing people and is concerned with urban scenes and spaces. These two distinct genres naturally complement each other in this fresh course.

Includes an evening field trip.

Note: Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. description:
Photography - Travel, Planning a trip? Unhappy with the photographs from the last one? Get the skills to turn disappointing holiday snaps into stunning travel photographs. Includes a Saturday field trip.

We'll combine practical skills with artistic use of light to develop your travel photography for that next trip.

Note: Not for beginners - you should be competent using your camera in manual exposure mode and be familiar with basic principles of photography. Includes a Saturday field trip, check individual courses for details.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Critically examine travel photographs
- Explore techniques for better landscape travel photographs
- Explore techniques for better portrait travel photographs
- Use light creatively to enhance your images
- Be better photographically prepared and more confident for your next trip
- Bring your camera to the first session.

5 session: 4 x Tue 7:30 PM – 9:30 PM plus a field trip.
Presenter: John Williams

description:
Piano Keyboards - Beginners, Get the basics of playing the piano in a fun group which will set you on your own musical path. Keyboards provided.

Enrol early as the course is limited to eight participants.
Learn to play the piano in a fun, small-group setting - complete beginners welcome!

Enrol early as the course is limited to eight participants.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to: -
-Read single-note melodies in both hands
- Accompany right-hand (RH) melodies with left hand chords
- Clap common rhythms accurately
- Understand the black keys on the piano and read music on a page
- Play a number of hands-together pieces, working towards a performance Keyboards provided.

8 weeks, Tue 6:00 PM to 7:00pm or 7:00pm-8:00pm
Wellington High School

description:
Plant Proteins Cooking Class Wellington, Plant Proteins Cooking Class Wellington
Discover the delicious power of plants! Join this class for a fun, community discussion and hands-on cooking class where you'll learn how to make tasty, protein-packed meals using ingredients like beans, lentils, tofu, tempeh, and more. Perfect for beginners, food lovers, and anyone curious about plant-based eating!
No experience needed – just bring your appetite!
🍽️ Recipes included | 🌿 All skill levels welcome
tickets are $45 from www.hagarozri.co.nz

description:
Plant and Learn in the WELLfed Garden, Plant and Learn in the WELLfed Garden
ALL WELCOME! Join us for "Plant and Learn" in the WELLfed Garden

Join the WELLfed Garden crew each Wednesday morning to spend some time gardening and learning!

No experience or skills are necessary - our awesome team can teach you about when and how garden tasks need doing and lots of skills you can use in your own garden.

Garden tasks include composting, seed starting, seed sowing, plant health, biology first gardening (working with nature).
Sharing morning tea (delicious WELLfed snacks provided!) is also a great chance to connect with other awesome humans in our community.

Pre-schoolers are welcome during term time and during the school holidays you are welcome to bring school-aged kids. They can get stuck in and connect with Papatunuku as well, or there is space for outdoor play. Children must be supervised by their caregivers whilst onsite.

Plant and Learn session are weather and staffing dependent - we will post in the event if we won't be gardening due to rain or sickness.

description:
Plants and Human Health - Guided Walk, Plants and Human Health - Guided Walk
What are the connections between kōwhai and lung health; tōtara and eye health; yew, flax and cancer suppression; pōhutukawa, koromiko and gut health; and more. In this one-hour downhill walk we will ‘get up close’ to both native and exotic plants to talk about these connections.

Meet at the Cable Car Entrance Lookout, Upland Road, Kelburn.
Cost: $5 (cash only, please). or free for Friends.

This is part of the regular walks run by the Friends of the Wellington Botanic Garden, they run monthly throughout the year with a different topic every time.
Join the Friends for only $30 a year and all the walks will be free, as well as other great benefits.

description:
Polish Folk Dance Workshops, Polish Folk Dance Workshops
We’re thrilled to welcome Maciej Wilczyński to Wellington this September! Maciej is a renowned dancer, choreographer, and cultural ambassador for Polish folk traditions.

Currently collaborating with Poland’s National Song and Dance Ensemble “Silesia” through the Zatańcz z Nami project, he has created over 50 stage arrangements and conducted more than 40 dance workshops across Europe, North America, and Asia.

In 2022, he received the prestigious Creative Scholarship of the City of Kraków for his contributions to folk culture.

Workshop Focus: The dances and traditions of the Cieszyn region

Maciej will lead two sessions tailored for different age groups:

 Workshop 1 - 4:30pm – 6:00pm

Children aged 5–10 years

(All Polish children welcome!)

 Workshop 2 - 6:30pm – 9:00pm

Open to all dancers and enthusiasts

Register here: https://www.jotform.com/build/251928442219056

Cost: $10 per participant

description:
Polymer Clay Jewellery Workshop, Step right up and join the magic of the Greytown Festival of Christmas with our whimsical,
carnival inspired creative workshops! 

Starting from the 28th of June and running through every weekend in July, these happy little workshops are your chance to make up to three beautiful handmade treasures—choose from unique jewellery from modern pieces to novelty, colourful bookmarks featuring dainty little books, charming pot plant pendants, or eye-catching pieces perfect for necklaces or key chains. With a palette of beautiful pastels and bright colours and materials to spark your imagination, this hands-on experience is perfect for adults of all skill levels.

Whether you’re looking to get crafty with friends, make meaningful gifts, or simply try something new, this is one festive activity you won’t want to miss. Spaces are limited and workshops will book up fast—so get in quick to secure your spot! All adults are welcome; Suitable for ages 10+ with a participating adult (separate ticket required for each attendee). Let the fun begin!
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Pottery Wheel Throwing & Hand Building - Creative Arts Holiday Program, Explore the techniques of pottery making including creating a mug using handbuilding processes and making a small bowl using throwing techniques on a pottery wheel. Students will be shown how to centre clay and make a small bowl on the wheel and trim it. Cups and bowls will be glazed by the tutor and ready for pickup approximately 3-4 weeks later depending on drying conditions.

This workshop is limited to three students only to ensure each person has individualised attention.

Suitable for ages 12+.

Tuesday - Thursday, 30 Sept - 2 October, 10 am - 12 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Pottery with Sophie Arbuckle, This course caters to absolute beginners to advanced abilities in clay. Beginners will be guided through basic hand building techniques, while more experienced potters are encouraged to bring along their ideas and projects for assistance. On day 1 we collectively decide on a few focal techniques for the term, meaning every term will give you different skills to add to your working knowledge of clay. We have 3 potters wheels, open for use to those who’ve done a prior course on the wheel.

This course will:

- Gain a wide working knowledge and understanding of clay hand building, decorating, and basic glazing techniques
- Have the opportunity to work on your own ideas and projects
- Receive guidance from an award winning Wellington ceramic artist.
- Take home a variety of finished and ready to use pieces.
- Have access to equipment, a suitable amount of clay to learn the techniques taught in class (more available for purchase), selection of glazes, fired and finished pieces to take home.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Pottery workshop Make a vase or cup and saucer At Big Mac Slabs, Pottery workshop Make a vase or cup and saucer At Big Mac Slabs
Make a vase or cup and saucer
When: 21st of September at 10.30am
Where: Big Mac Slab, Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu
How long: 2 hours
What it bring: just yourself

This vase or cup and saucer making workshop is a fun way to be introduced to slab building with clay. Fiona your tutor will show how to roll out a slab, add decoration by imprinting patterns into the surface. All materials are provided and each participant chooses a glaze colour for their items to be glazed. Fiona takes the items back to Whanganui to dry and then she fires and glazes them the colours chosen. Each participant will be given approximately 1kg of tan coloured clay and equipment needed to make the vase or cup and saucer.

description:
Pottery: Wheel Throwing Lessons, Learn the techniques of throwing clay on a pottery wheel in the historic Inverlochy workers' cottage. These are four lessons giving you individualised attention to help you learn to centre clay on the wheel and the basics of throwing to create the foundational shapes of cylinders and bowls.

This includes four x 90 minute sessions, a suitable amount of clay, low firing and glazing the finished objects.

Teenagers booking this course must be a minimum 16 years of age or attend with an adult who has also booked the accompanying spot.

description:
Power BI for Beginners, Join our Power BI expert and master this comprehensive tool so that you can maximise your skills and combine powerful data cleaning and modelling capabilities with an intuitive, drag-and-drop interface for creating stunning visualizations.
 Power BI is a powerful and accessible tool for data analysis and dashboarding, widely used across many industries. This beginner friendly course is designed to be practical and hands on, covering subjects such as:
* Connecting to data sources
* Using Power Query for data transformation
* Introduction to DAX
* Creating relationships between tables
* Building interactive visualizations
Note: All computer courses are run in the school computer labs and you are required to use the school desktops for the duration of the course (you are not able to use your own laptop).  Some of the courses may require you to login onto the network. 
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
Property Education Night: Smart Property, Smarter Retirement!, Property Education Seminar: Smart Property, Smarter Retirement
Are you between 30 and 55 years old?
Do you have a clear plan for a financially comfortable retirement?
At our free property investment seminar, you’ll discover how smart strategies can help you:

Build a reliable income stream for and in retirement
Protect your financial future with debt reduction
Live comfortably in retirement from long term rental income

Bonus for Attendees
You’ll be entitled to book a FREE one-on-one consultation with our licensed financial advisers and if qualified, a full financial plan (valued $995 - $1999). This starts with a discovery session to understand your financial situation and goals. From there, our property team can assess the best available property options and present those that align perfectly with your objectives.
Seats are limited — don’t miss this opportunity.

description:
Puck Lane Creative Workshop - Woodblock Artwork with Mixed Media, Puck Lane Creative Workshops
Puck Lane Creative Workshops
Woodblock Artwork + Mixed Media
In collaboration with Treacle Lane and House of Puck, we invite you to a super fun evening of creative chaos—in the best possible way.
This workshop? We're building bold, beautiful mixed media artwork with woodblocks, nails, thread, and collage. It’s part art, part alchemy—all materials included, no stress required.
Just book your spot, show up, and let your inner maker run wild. The space is ambient, the vibes are high, and the snacks are not messing around. Sip something nice, hammer something gently, and create something you didn’t know you had in you.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Pukeahu Archaeology Tour, What lies beneath Pukeahu?

The construction of Pukeahu National War Memorial Park revealed a wealth of archaeological discoveries, some expected, others surprising.

Join Principal Archaeologists Sarah Phear and Richard Shakles from Underground Overground Archaeology for a special guided tour of the park. Hear firsthand about the excavation process, uncover the stories behind the artefacts, and view a selection of conserved items unearthed from beneath Pukeahu.

The tour begins at the fountain below the Tomb of the Unknown Warrior.
This is an accessible tour. Bring clothing for the weather and any burning questions.

No experience is needed, just bring your energy, curiosity, and a willingness to have fun! Perfect for all ages and backgrounds, this is a rare chance to learn from true cultural ambassadors of the island.
Spaces are limited
RSVP Required
Koha/Donation Entry

description:
Ready to Ride: Bike Basics Maintenance Workshop, Learn the basics of bike maintenance at Te Aro Zero Waste!
Want to feel more confident looking after your bike? This hands-on workshop facilitated by EkeRua ReBicycle is the perfect place to start. Whether you’re a daily commuter, weekend rider, or just pulling an old bike out of the shed, EkeRua ReBicycle will walk you through the essentials to keep your wheels spinning smoothly.
This workshop will cover how to:
- Maintain and clean your chain
- Deal with a puncture and change a tyre
- Check your bike is safe and road-ready
You’re encouraged to bring your own bike so you can learn by doing, but it’s totally fine if you don’t - there will be demonstrations and plenty of chances to get involved.
Spaces are limited so book your space below to come along and get your hands a little dirty, and leave with the practical skills to keep your bike in great shape. No prior experience needed - just a willingness to learn!

description:
Ring Making Workshop in Wellington, Limited Spaces! One Date Only – Book Now!
Monday, 3 November
Create a unique piece of jewellery using wax and set with gemstones. After the session, each participant's wax piece will be cast in silver, meticulously filed, polished, and mailed to them in a gift box.
In this single-session workshop, you'll be introduced to the lost wax casting process and be guided by a certified jewellery maker in creating a custom-designed ring from wax.
WORKSHOP HIGHLIGHTS:
Creative Experience: Design and create your own sterling silver jewellery with cast-in-place gemstones.
Expert Guidance: Learn from a certified jewellery maker in a supportive and inspiring environment.
All-Inclusive: The workshop provides all the necessary tools and materials, ensuring a seamless experience.
Finished Product: Receive a beautifully handcrafted piece of jewellery, creating lasting memories and a unique keepsake.
WHO SHOULD ATTEND:
Hobbyists and craft enthusiasts
Individuals seeking unique, handmade jewellery
Couples, friends, or mothers & daughters looking for a creative bonding activity
Anyone searching for a unique and thoughtful gift
WHAT TO EXPECT:
Guidance on creating a simple wax band
Stone setting in wax using mixed gemstones
Support in creating a personalised design with stones
INCLUDES IN THE WORKSHOP:
Use of all necessary tools
A selection of gemstones (precious stones available for an extra fee)
Wax for creating jewellery pieces
Sterling silver (up to 15 grams per piece)
Option to order your piece in gold (for an extra fee)
Casting, filing, and polishing of your wax piece
Final product mailed to your provided address
ADDITIONAL INFO:
If you have a specific design or material in mind (perhaps a diamond for an engagement ring?) and would like to discuss it beforehand, please email craftyfingersworkshop@yahoo.com.
Join us for a unique and unforgettable jewellery-making experience. Create a piece of jewellery that reflects your personal style and creativity!
Please bring your glasses to see the small details well, or an additional light (headlamp).
PLEASE NOTE: We reserve the right to cancel or postpone the workshop if the minimum number of attendees is not met.

description:
SUP Knowledge Sessions, We will have Bill Dawes from SUPNZ in Wellington for a couple of days helping run these sessions with us.
Come and learn from the best. You will get to hear all about the amazing world of Stand Up Paddle-boarding, lots of simple safety tips and tricks, paddling techniques and gear information.
Weather permitting we will also get out on the water for a paddle as well. This is where learning more about technique can really help with paddler confidence allowing you to get the most out of your time on the water.
This is expected to last around 1-2hours but please allow some flexibility for this.
This is perfect for beginners looking to get into stand up paddle boarding through to paddlers who want to up skill on their knowledge especially around local water safety.
No gear required for the beach portion but please bring your paddle board, PFD and gear of you want to paddle on the water with us.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Safeguarding week @ the Y, Join us to mark Child Safeguarding week!!!!

Every child deserves to be safe, and the Y strives to create strong, safe practice within our organisation. Today we are celebrating the importance of Safeguarding, and this year's theme of " Parenting in a digital world".
Kathryn Berkett, NZ renowned educational psychologist, will join us to speak about the effects of devices on the brain. We will release the newest version of " the Y way", our safeguarding expectations for Y staff working with children and young people, and will have the first viewing of our new, child friendly safeguarding video.

This is a great opportunity for those that work, live and interact with children and young people.

For more information email: safeguarding@ycentral.nz
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Safer Venues Workshop - September 2025, Safer Venues - The Road to Beervana
Safer Venues is a program designed for hospitality staff and operators to enhance awareness, skills, and confidence in actively reducing and intervening in harmful sexual behaviour within licensed venues.
The program offers a comprehensive approach to supporting hospitality, offering in-person workshops and consultations to help integrate sexual violence prevention practices into night-to-night operations.
Safer Venues is available to all hospitality operators and staff in Pōneke. This includes venue owners, managers, front of house, door staff and late-night services.
Safer Venues is a joint initiative between Hospitality NZ, RespectEd Aotearoa, and Wellington City Council and is providing this workshop for all venues participating in the Road to Beervana.
Register your Front of House and Management team to attend this workshop.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Samoan - Introductory 2 / Ongoing, Samoan - Introductory 2
For those who have done Introductory 1 (16 hours) or have equivalent knowledge e.g. who may have picked up some basic survival language through travel.
By the end of the course, you will: 
• Build on the language and grammar skills learned in the Introductory 1 course
• Have sufficient grammar and vocabulary to conduct a basic conversation in Samoan on everyday topics
• Be able to describe and use (at a basic level) correct sentence structure in Samoan
• Be able to describe traditional Samoan protocols and use these in practice 
NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session.

description:
Samoan - Ongoing, Samoan - Ongoing
This ongoing class is aimed at those who have some basic knowledge of Samoan language and will help you improve your spoken language skills and build confidence and vocabulary through practical language use and classroom role play scenarios.

description:
Sandcasting Day - Wellington, Join us for this wonderful intro to sand casting - it is a great opportunity to make some gorgeous lasting jewellery gifts for yourself or your loved ones!
Students are shown the ancient technique of sand casting, using a wax to make a simple hard model or found objects such as buttons or simple small forms - create your simple 2-part mould and melt and pour sterling silver or shibuichi (a different mix of silver and copper) to cast into the sand.
The model you have made or found enables you to make multiple pours possible, until you either get the result you are after or to create multiple pieces. This is a fun process for those who just want to try their hand at it, or a very useful low-tech process for those who are making jewellery into a career or creative activity.
This course aims to get each student at least one successful cast, and to teach the finishing techniques so that you finish up with a gorgeous wearable piece at the end of the day.
Course cost includes 9g silver but students are welcome to buy more metal as needed.
Workshop fee is $248, Early Bird pricing $225 till 12 October.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Saturday morning pottery, In this course you will:

- Gain a wide working knowledge and understanding of clay hand building, decorating, and basic glazing techniques
- Have the opportunity to work on your own ideas and projects
- Receive guidance on the wheel for those who have attended previous wheel throwing courses or workshops. Pottery wheels available for shared use.
- Take home a variety of finished and ready to use pieces.
- Have access to equipment, a suitable amount of clay to learn the techniques taught in class (more available for purchase), selection of glazes, fired and finished pieces to take home

Bring an ice cream or used plastic container for collecting your clay scraps

Teenagers booking this course must be a minimum 16 years of age.

description:
Screen Printing on Fabric and Paper, Whether you want to create a piece of fine art or just print your own t-shirts this course is for you. Course projects are suitable for beginners while experienced students will be extended.

Students will learn:

- How to apply images to screens using a range of stencil and photo-emulsion techniques.
- To print your own photos and art on to paper, canvas, fabric and t-shirts.
- How to apply three colours(only) to paper, canvas, fabric and t-shirts.
- Bring along your own design ideas and Simon will help you bring them to fruition.

Tuesday evenings, 14 October - 2 December, 6-8:30 pm.

label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Sea glass jewellery - one day silver ring making workshop, Design and create a unique ring with foraged sea glass ‘gems’ while learning and developing core jewellery fabrication techniques. An opportunity to engage in creative recycling by turning seaside flotsam into precious wearable treasures. Experiment with ring textures and forms in silver, brass and/or copper, then set your unique glass ‘gemstone’. Finish up with your choice of polish, including high lustre gloss, steel brushed satin, or darkened antique finishes.

If you can, please beachcomb and bring along some sea glass options - ideally around 1cm wide, and with a flat back. Glass provided if you are in need.


Techniques:

- Create a ring with one bezel set foraged sea glass ‘gem’
- Use jeweller’s callipers to measure and prepare metal
- Use jeweller’s saws or snips to cut and shape metal
- Use files and sanding to refine and smooth metal edges and surfaces
- Use jeweller’s flame torches to solder join metal pieces
- Use Dremel & bench polishers to refine & finish metal casts into wearable jewellery

Materials Provided: Sea Glass, Copper, Brass, Sterling Silver

description:
Silk Aquatint Printmaking, Discover the silk aquatint, an accessible, non-toxic alternative print technique similar to collagraph printing whereby the texture of woven silk on the plate provides a ground to start building a design with varying tonal qualities. The outcome can be wonderfully detailed and painterly.

In this workshop you will learn -

- To identify appropriate silk to create an aquatint plate
- The importance of preparing an appropriate matrix for the silk
- About the different effects created by different types of media applied to the print matrix
- To make an aquatint plate
- To print an aquatint plate
- This workshop is open to beginners as well as seasoned printers.

Basic materials included. Bring drawings or designs to help you get started and wear clothes you are not precious about.

Half hour break for lunch. Bring your own packed lunch to have in the historic Inverlochy house or explore the local Te Aro cafes.

You must be at least 16 years of age to attend this course.

Two day workshop, Saturday 18 October - Sunday 19 October, 10 am - 3 pm daily.

This demonstration will take you through the whole process from the beginning to end with all the bits in between, including:
🍞Why sourdough?
🍞Getting your starter going and starter care
🍞Making your dough, including info about flours and gluten sensitivity
🍞Fermentation
🍞Dough turning
🍞Baking
🍞Storage of your bread and uses
🍞Recipe, sourdough schedule, and useful links resource to take home

Cups of tea & coffee, connection and much more!

Maria attended a demonstration last year and here’s what she said….
"I had wanted to try making sourdough for a while but had always thought it looked too complicated. Charlotte’s class helped explain and simplify so many things. It was such a great morning and I would highly recommend this class for beginners. Lots of great tips! I am now hooked!" Thanks again Charlotte 🙂

Charlotte x

description:
Spring Container Planting Workshop, Grow Your Own Kai - In Containers From Your Own Compost
Want to grow your own fresh kai but only have a balcony, patio, or courtyard? This hands-on workshop will show you how to grow spring vegetables and herbs in containers - a flexible, low-cost way to turn even the smallest space into a productive garden. Following on from our winter edition, this is the second workshop in our seasonal container growing series, with a focus on getting your spring garden thriving using your own compost.
This workshop will cover:
- What to grow in spring, including leafy greens, herbs, and root vegetables
- How to set up containers - choosing the right size, drainage, potting mix, and using your own compost or bokashi soil
- Feeding your plants with DIY fertilisers, spotting nutrient gaps, and refreshing tired soil
- Creating ideal growing conditions with sunlight, watering tips, wind protection, and natural pest control
- Keeping your garden productive by harvesting, replanting, and rotating crops throughout the season
Please bring your own container(s) - buckets, storage bins, flexi tubs, or old drawers all welcome. We will show you how to safely repurpose them.
label: Classes & Workshops

description:
Spring Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop 12th October 2025, Join expert forager Felicity Joy of Wild Botanica for a comprehensive Wild Edible Weeds Foraging Workshop in the beautiful community gardens of Mount Victoria, Wellington.
This inspiring experience will open your eyes to the abundance of edible wild plants growing right under your nose.
We’ll unlock the secrets of foraging, connecting with the land, and turning humble "weeds" into delicious, nourishing food. You’ll gain confidence in identifying common edible plants, learn their botanical names, and understand their medicinal and nutritional benefits. We’ll also explore ethical foraging practices, how to spot toxic lookalikes, and share simple, practical ways to incorporate wild foods into your daily meals.
This isn’t just about food: it’s about sustainability, resilience, and reconnecting with the environment in a meaningful way. You'll leave with a deeper appreciation for the land, new skills to support local food security, and the knowledge to make your own simple meals from wild ingredients.
Class sizes are limited, so book early to secure your spot.
For more details and bookings, visit
www.wildbotanica.co.nz
follow @wild.botanica.nz on social media.
For questions, email felicity@wildbotanica.co.nz.
Join my email newsletter to hear about upcoming foraging workshops: https://www.wildbotanica.co.nz/pages/newsletter

description:
Stacking Rings - Wellington - September session, Create your own ring stack from copper, brass and silver in this fast and fun workshop! Perfect for an outing with friends or as a treat for yourself
This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.
Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new rings will be ready to wear.
Students can choose to use silver, copper and brass wire to make a textural and multi-tonal ring stack.
Included in the class fee is a materials pack including silver, copper and brass wires.
Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio. Workshop fee $128, Early bird pricing $115 available until 24 August.
Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

description:
Taina (beginner) Hataitai community centre Raranga, Te Motu Kairangi, with the support of Hataitai Centre & Community House, warmly invites you to:
Monthly beginner Flax Weaving Wānanga
Experience the joy of learning, sharing, and reconnecting with the art of weaving.
Whether you’re a first-time weaver or returning to refresh your skills, all are welcome. We’ll cover basic weaving techniques and tikanga (customs) and provide a supportive, creative space to connect with Māori arts and crafts alongside others.
Session Times
• Beginners: 11:00am – 1:30pm (pack down starts at 1:15pm)
What to Bring
• New weavers: 5–10 rau (blades) of harakeke, sharp scissors,
• an old towel (if you have one)
• Bring a bag, as you must take away leftover harakeke
Koha appreciated, not required
If you would like to support the kaupapa, please email us at temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com for koha details.
Come and enjoy weaving, learning, and connection in a beautiful, relaxed setting.
Contact
via facebook https://www.facebook.com/TMKhuihui
Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com
If you would like to koha to TMK, please email (Email temotukairangi.huihui@gmail.com) for the account details.

description:
Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1, Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: 
• Have a basic understanding of the Māori spiritual and natural worlds (mana atua, mana whenua), and our important connections to them
• Identify the sounds of Māori letters and pronounce letter combinations using correct intonation and stress patterns
• Confidently greet people, introduce yourself and communicate basic personal information in an informal context
• Identify and respond to phrases in the classroom including basic commands/instructions
• Confidently describe the day/date, time, and the weather
NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.
Note:  Courses need a minimum number to go ahead so if we don't have enough enrolments a few days before the start date, we have to cancel. We'll let you know by email so please check yours regularly. If you need to cancel your registration, here are our terms and conditions: "What You Need to Know".

description:
Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1, This course is for beginners who have no prior knowledge of te reo Māori or Māori culture. (NZ Citizens and residents pay $109 with ID, all others pay $199).

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Have a basic understanding of the Māori spiritual and natural worlds (mana atua, mana whenua), and our important connections to them
- Identify the sounds of Māori letters and pronounce letter combinations using correct intonation and stress patterns
- Confidently greet people, introduce yourself and communicate basic personal information in an informal context

description:
Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1, This course is for beginners who have no prior knowledge of te reo Māori or Māori culture. (NZ Citizens and residents pay $109 with ID, all others pay $199).

Description
Te Reo Māori - Introductory 1

By the end of the course, you’ll be able to:

- Have a basic understanding of the Māori spiritual and natural worlds (mana atua, mana whenua), and our important connections to them
- Identify the sounds of Māori letters and pronounce letter combinations using correct intonation and stress patterns
- Confidently greet people, introduce yourself and communicate basic personal information in an informal context
- Identify and respond to phrases in the classroom including basic commands/instructions
- Confidently describe the day/date, time, and the weather

NOTE: This course is subsidised with funding from the Tertiary Education Commission (TEC) and you must provide photo ID when you attend your first session, if applicable.

description:
Te Reo Māori - Introductory 2, Te Reo Māori - Introductory 2
By the end of the course, you’ll be able to: 
• Discuss our responsibilities as a bi-cultural nation under ‘Te Tiriti o Waitangi’ and identify underlying Māori values such as: whanaungatanga, pepehā and tikanga
• Discuss the significance of whakapapa as a fundamental Māori world view and confidently describe your family and relationships through this lens
• Form simple sentences to describe parts of your face and body
• Discuss protocol on the marae
• Recognise the importance and use of karakia and be able to recite one correctly
• Recognise the cultural values inherent within different whakataukī (proverbs) and kīwaha (idioms) and be able to correctly recite one of each

description:
Textured Rings - Welcome Spring!, Make your own personalised ring - a gift for yourself or someone special! :-)

Learn the basic technique first in copper or brass, and then craft your final piece in silver!

Over this taster class, you’ll be guided through the process of heating and texturing metal, cutting and shaping with traditional jewellery tools. Use feathers, leaves, or fabrics to create a unique texture for a beautiful ring!

Learn to measure your finger, cut metal to length and texture it without rolling mill, hammers and punches. Then use a jewellers torch, sandpaper and polishing, and your beautiful new ring will be ready to wear.

This 3-hour class is ideal for beginners, groups of friends and visitors to the city.

Included in the class fee are copper and brass for practising on, a sterling silver ring strip and all consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals. Extra metals are available for purchase in the studio.

Kids aged 12 (or so) are welcome to attend the class, but any person under the age of 16 must be accompanied by an enrolled parent or caregiver.

description:
The Art of Mending, This class is cared for by the whimsical Aisha, a multidisciplinary artist with a passion for empowering the mending process. Each month on Wednesday evenings Aisha will introduce us to a different technique for reviving our beloved textile pieces. If you're like us and have a box of clothing in need of repairs that never seems to empty... this is the club for you. With three events a month we'll inspire each other to creatively care for those pieces we love! This club is also perfect for anyone who loves learning new skills. Techniques we'll cover are lino printing, patching, darning, felting, embroidery, beading, sashiko, fabric painting and more! All materials and tools are supplied at each class - but you are welcome to bring your own and we highly encourage bringing a textile item (or many!) to fix up.
In August we're lino printing!
Class 01: 13th August
In this class we'll get an introduction to lino printing on fabric and best practice for using this process to cover stains. Pre cut designs and all other tools are supplied. Please bring either clothing you would like to print on or some fabric scrap to make lino printed patches!
Class 02: 20th August
At this class Aisha will take us through the process of designing and cutting our own lino to print with! You're welcome to keep going with the pre cut designs as well. Lino and carving tools will be supplied.
Class 03: 27th August
This class will be open to what you want to work on! Bring in larger project items, print with the lino cuts you made in the previous week, or cut some fresh ones!

The Art of the Bloom- Make a Giant Flower, Step into the cozy charm of the Ventana studio and spend a hands-on crafternoon learning to create your very own voluminous, oversized crepé paper flower- a sculptural statement piece that’s equal parts art and joy.
In this immersive workshop, you’ll be guided through every step of the process from choosing the perfect colour palette to cutting, curling, shaping, and assembling each petal by hand. It’s a meditative, rewarding craft that requires patience, but with the right techniques (and a few of my favourite tricks!), you’ll be amazed at what you can create.

This is a dynamic class where, apart from the tutor’s guidance, the input from the students is encouraged and valued in the weekly critique of the work created. This course offers the opportunity to work your skills in drawing, composition, description of volume, mixing of colours, technique and most important, personal expression.

This course is appropriate for all levels.

Students must bring their own materials ( i.e. paint oil or acrylic, paper, canvases, brushes).

In this course you will learn:

- How to mix skin tones
- How to describe light and shade for volume
- How to convey expression in painting a portrait

description:
Together in Dialogue: Te Tiriti o Waitangi and Pacific Partnerships, Talanoa Tai Learning is a new collection of learning experiences. They're designed to help you build your cultural responsiveness and improve your ability to engage meaningfully with Pacific communities. Talanoa is a Pacific style of deep dialogue, with a focus on how we connect to each other and strengthen relationships, while still being able to share honest and effective insights. If you want to strengthen your capability in this space, to create transformational change, and to enhance your relationships with people from different communities - this workshop is your chance to grow.
What will I gain from Together in Dialogue?
In Together in Dialogue, you will share meaningful conversations around Te Tiriti o Waitangi and the role and responsibilities of Pasifika as allies. By engaging in deep talanoa, you will explore cultural, historical, and contemporary implications of Te Tiriti o Waitangi and how Pasifika people can strengthen this unique relationship and promote cultural awareness.
This is a 3 hour in-person learning experience.
Who is this workshop for?
These learning experiences are for both Paciﬁc professionals and those from other communities. You don’t need to have prior knowledge or experience in this area - we’ll meet you where you are and provide a welcoming, supportive environment for you to learn.
Cultural responsiveness is for everyone. Whether you’re in social work, education, government, community sectors or beyond, these learning experiences have been designed to help everyone build their skills. If you think this professional development might be right for you, it is!
Cost
When work is busy and budgets are tight, cultural responsiveness can often take a backseat. But this is an aﬀordable investment that will help you address the challenges that so many of us share, like how to build engagement and trust, and avoid relationship missteps. It’s not a buzzword; it’s a vital skill if you want to better meet the needs of the people you serve. Price: $170 (inc GST) per person, including morning tea.
Facilitator
Our team’s extensive research and experience feed into these sessions, with a focus on interactive activities and practical, real-life examples. Our team has decades of experience across a range of ﬁelds, in particular social development, education, and research. We have worked with organisations and businesses across the Paciﬁc, and our engagement with diﬀerent Paciﬁc languages, cultures, and communities means we oﬀer robust, informed perspectives. Fa’aeafale’upolu (Polu) Samuelu is the facilitator of this Talanoa Tai Learning experience.

description:
Tools Workshop - Wellington Term 3, A practical, hands-on workshop where clinicians can upskill around the latest AAC systems available for trial and assessment consideration. 
This workshop will focus on low, mid and high-tech options for clients who meet CAT Level 1 criteria. The day focusses on using SETT to inform decision making, identifying important features and functions of specific AAC tools and working through case examples to combine SETT and tool knowledge.

description:
Torch Fired Enamels - 4 Weeks course, This is a 4 week's block focusing on beautiful glass enamels on copper and silver using the Torch Fired Glass Enamel technique. It is a wonderful way to add colour to your work! The course starts on Sun 4 October and runs for 4 weeks until 25 October, 10am-1pm.

Beginners to jewellery work can use pre-formed shapes to apply their enamels to so they can focus on creating an excellent result. They will be shown how to apply textures and small alterations to the pieces using either hammers or roll printed textures before prepping the metal for the glass enamel.

Those with some metalwork experience can take on a more advanced piece, exploring more complex techniques such as cloisonne.

High quality silver findings are supplied for one to two projects and more are available to purchase if required.

Sterling silver chains are also available if you want to complete the finish of a pendant.

Build your foundational jewellery making skill with this deep dive into enamel technique!

Beginners and advanced students are welcome.

description:
Try Dancing West Coast Swing in October - 5-week Beginner Course, Come learn to dance West Coast with Swing Central!! Our next 5-week beginner block course runs 8.15pm on Tuesdays starting 7th October. Come up the lifts to Studio 1 on Level 5 at Te Auaha (65 Dixon Street)
These classes are an introduction covering some basic patterns and the fundamentals of our dance style, designed for people new to dance or those coming from another style
Stick around after class to chat and dance for another hour. Then join us for for Sweet Treat Central - gelato or sorbet at Kaffee Eis. All 5 classes at the special price of $39. For 5 Tuesdays from 7th October to 4th November
What do I need?
We recommend comfortable, flat shoes and a bottle of water. No partner required.
What if I can't come every week?
Casual rates are also available. If you can’t make it every week, you can come when you can. We have classes for newcomers (Level 1), Level 2 and Level 3 every Tuesday.
How do I get a ticket?
You can purchase the block course through our website (through the events page), or in cash in person at class, or via internet banking (we'll give you the account details in class).
Where is class?
At Te Auaha - Studio One, level 5, on Dixon Street

description:
Visual Takes: An evening with Getty Images (Wellington), Visual Takes: An evening with Getty Images
You know the story you want to tell. Getty Images will help you find the content to bring it to life.
After a successful event in Auckland, we are bringing this kaupapa down to Pōneke! Come along for an insider's look at Getty Images' comprehensive suite of services designed for directors, producers, art departments, researchers, and creative professionals across the industry. Whether it’s scripted or factual, Getty Images helps find the right content (fast), access archival gems or fresh contemporary visuals, navigate licensing and clearance, negotiating and pricing, and much more.
Our panelists are:
Arran Birchenough For over 25 years, Arran has been working with TV and Film producers in NZ, Australia, and APAC, and has been based in NZ for the last 20 years. Arran is responsible for the teams at Getty Images that support producers in NZ and across APAC with the range of Getty Images services and support, including free access to content to support getting funded, free research including from the TVNZ, BBC, NBC and ITN archives, advice on clearance, copyright, legal and licensing, and developing offerings to meet the needs of scripted and unscripted producers alike.
Sarah Bailey-Harper from Tenzing, The Luminaries and Sparticus joins to bring perspective from the art, set design, costume and textile departments of scripted productions, sharing her experience and knowledge when using creative content in pre-production and production.
Ruth Korver is an experienced producer who has worked across the full spectrum of content. Her production company Useful Media focuses mainly on factual content. Ruth has produced a number of TV series, documentaries and feature films for TV and cinema. Her most recent work includes feature documentary The Stolen Children of Aotearoa for Awa Films and premium factual series Hua Parakore - Fixing our broken food systems for Storybox. Ruth was a senior producer at creative agency Storybox for eight years and in that time worked on a number of commercial campaigns and visitor experiences.
Date: Wednesday 15th October
Location: Wētā Workshop Group Space, 129 Park Road, Miramar, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
Time: 6:15pm
We look forward to a relaxed, insightful evening and discussing how Getty Images can support WIFT members with their upcoming/current projects.
Snacks and drinks will be provided.
Free to WIFT members and $20 for non-members.

description:
Waikanae Makeup Masterclass - 19.10 @2.00pm, About this event
Join Nikki, a Professional Makeup Artist & Colour Expert with over 14 years of experience, for an engaging and practical Makeup Masterclass. Nikki and her team focus on enhancing natural beauty and making makeup easy for everyone.
As we journey through life, our skin and style evolve. The best way to update your look and learn techniques that suit your unique face shape, style, and colouring is to attend one of our masterclasses. Whether you're a performer on stage, a busy professional, or a multitasking mum, this class will teach you how to apply your makeup quickly, flawlessly, and with confidence.
During the class, Nikki will demonstrate step-by-step techniques on a model while you get to apply your own makeup. You'll have access to professional products and tools to follow along and create your flawless everyday look. It’s fun, interactive, and designed for all skill levels.
"I can’t wait to share my knowledge with you and help you create a makeup routine that leaves you feeling fabulous and confident every day!" – Nikki
What You Need to Know:
No equipment required! We’ll provide all makeup products, brushes, and mirrors.
Bring a willingness to learn and a positive attitude.
Classes are capped at 12-15 participants to ensure personalised guidance.
Arrive 10–15 minutes early to get settled.
Please come with a clean, makeup-free face so you can get the best results.

description:
Wednesday Morning Jewellery-making In 8 Weeks, This NEW block of morning classes is the best way for beginners to get into jewellery making in a lively, warm and friendly environment. It will run from Wednesday 8 October for 8 weeks until Wednesday 26 November from 10am - 12.30pm.

This class is mixed level, allowing beginners to work alongside advanced students.

Beginners start with basic ring making in copper or brass, students will learn measuring, texturing, shaping, cutting and soldering.

Then we move on to making a practice ring set with a cabochon stone (cabochon means it has a flat bottom and a smooth domed top).

Once your first setting is completed you can move to working in silver and produce another stone set ring with more interesting design elements.

Level 2 students explore chainmaking as a way to develop their fine soldering skills. Their silver project can be a pendant on a handmade chain or a piece of their own design.

Level 3 and above students are encouraged to work on their design skills and try new and challenging techniques.

Included in the class fee are:
Beginners: a materials pack that includes copper and brass for practising on, 2 gemstones and enough sterling and fine silver to complete the cabochon ring project.

Advanced: students receive a generous credit to spend on materials as they choose. All consumables such as sandpaper, solder and chemicals are also included. Extra metals and materials are available for purchase in the studio.

Our booking system asks for full payment to be made via credit card, PayPal or AfterPay on booking. If you do not have access to these payment methods or need to pay your course fee over time please email us to arrange this.
