description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Beat the Lotto, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Dublin International Film Festival 2025 -

Beat the Lotto is a rip-roaring tale about the mathematician who, along with a ragtag syndicate, plotted to fix Ireland’s National Lottery in 1992, captivating the nation and sparking rabid debate.

In Ireland, the public became obsessed when the National Lottery arrived, none more so than mathematician and avid stamp-collector Stefan Klincewicz. Using mathematical analysis, he reckoned the system could be beaten if he could just gather enough people to form a syndicate to buy every single ticket combination – and front up all the cash, of course.

Director Ross Whitaker fashions this unbelievable true story into a gripping thriller, mirroring the tension felt by the public as the lottery authorities caught wind of the plan.

With insightful interviews and fantastic archival footage, Beat the Lotto is a look back at Ireland in the 1990s and a compelling tale of one man’s attempt to outsmart the system.
Director
Ross Whitaker
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Christy, Seventeen-year-old Christy is at a crossroads. He’s just been thrown out of his pleasant suburban foster home and moved in with his estranged older brother Shane. As far as Shane is concerned this is a temporary arrangement, but Christy begins to feel at home on Cork’s working class north side. As he makes friends and begins to let the community in, he also reconnects with his past through his seemingly more corrupting extended family, despite Shane’s efforts to steer him away from this crowd.

Shane wants something better for Christy at any cost – even if it means he has to push him away. After so many years apart, the brothers need to now reconcile their turbulent past whilst deciding what the future looks like.

Christy draws inspiration from the lived experiences of the young people involved, assembling much of its ensemble cast from the Kabin Studio in Cork, a non-profit community space that has grown out of a love for hip hop and art.

Winner of The Grand Prix at this year’s Berlin International Film Festival, as well as Best Irish Film at the Galway Film Fleadh, Christy is a punchy drama not to be missed.
Director
Brendan Canty
Cast
Danny Power, Diarmuid Noyes, Emma Willis, Cara Cullen
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Dead of Winter, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Locarno Film Festival 2025 -

Witness British screen-legend Emma Thompson as you’ve never seen her before in this tense, gripping, and icy thriller...

When she’s unexpectedly hit by a blizzard, grief-stricken loner Barb (Thompson) gets lost among the backroads near a Minnesotan lake.

While stopping to ask for help at a remote cabin in the woods, Barb discovers a young woman (Laurel Marsden), who has been kidnapped by an armed and desperate couple (Judy Greer, Marc Menchaca), intent on murder.

Isolated in the desolate frozen wilds and without cell service, Barb realises she is this woman’s only hope of survival.

From Irish director Brian Kirk (My Boy Jack) and featuring a career-best performance from Thompson, this gritty, pulse-pounding trip is guaranteed to have you on the edge of your seat.
Director:
Brian Kirk
Cast:
Emma Thompson, Judy Greer, Marc Menchaca, Laurel Marsden
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Four Mothers, - WINNER: Audience Award, BFI London Film Festival 2024 -

Edward (James McArdle, Mary Queen of Scots, Mare of Easttown), a novelist saddled with caring for his elderly mother, Alma (Fionnula Flanagan, Waking Ned Devine) finally finds himself on the brink of literary success.

With pressure to go on a US book tour mounting, the last thing Edward needs is his friends jetting off to Spain for an impromptu Pride holiday, leaving their mothers on his doorstep!

Over a chaotic weekend, he has to juggle his burgeoning career with the care of four eccentric, combative, and wildly different ladies.

An Irish twist on the acclaimed Italian hit Mid-August Lunch, this uplifting comedy and tender drama takes an unlikely found family on an emotionally charged journey of self-discovery and acceptance.

Book your tickets now for this Irish charmer, winner of the BFI London Film Festival Audience Award!
Director
Darren Thornton
Cast
James McArdle, Fionnula Flanagan, Niamh Cusack, Dearbhla Molloy
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Lollipop, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Edinburgh International Film Festival 2024 -

In this absorbing drama, Posy Sterling (The Outrun) delivers a powerful performance as Molly, a young mum from East London who has lost everything while in prison.

After serving four months, Molly assumes it will be a matter of hours before she can collect her kids from foster care - but she now faces a longer ordeal than anticipated...

Molly finds herself in the mother of all catch-22s: she can’t get housing because she doesn’t have her kids living with her; but she can’t get them back without a roof over her head.

Molly has just six months to get housing and turn her life around before a judge in the family court makes the final determination whether her children will remain in long-term foster care, or return to live with her.

A glimmer of hope in Molly’s world is reconnecting with her best friend from school, Amina, who also finds herself on hard times. Leaning on their friendship, can Molly and Amina beat the system and take destiny into their own hands?

Book now for this incredibly passionate and moving tale.
Director
Daisy-May Hudson
Cast
Posy Sterling, Idil Ahmed, TerriAnn Cousins
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Moss & Freud, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: BFI London Film Festival 2025 -

Ellie Bamber (also starring in Words of War at this year’s Festival) and Derek Jacobi bring the respective supermodel and painter to life in this exquisite drama.

Set in 2002, Kate Moss is at the height of her success and at a moment of transition as she prepares for motherhood. After revealing that one of her life goals is to have her portrait painted by Lucian Freud, the enigmatic artist invites Moss to his studio.

Infamously private and fiercely guarded, Freud begins to unravel Moss’ hidden depths, and as the two British cultural icons converge, a lasting bond is formed.

As their mesmerising rapport develops, Kate discovers her true self, and Freud finds his eternal muse.

Bamber and Jacobi wonderfully portray these iconic figures, enabling audiences to witness the personal interaction that took place behind closed doors.

This impressive feature debut from Oscar-winning New Zealand writer/director James Lucas (the film is a UK/NZ co-production) is a tender portrait of self-reflection and an unexpectedly transformative friendship.

Don’t miss the gorgeous visuals, elegant writing and captivating performances of Moss & Freud!
Director
James Lucas
Cast
Ellie Bamber, Derek Jacobi
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - Re-Creation, - OFFICIAL SELECTION: Tribeca Film Festival 2025 -

Part courtroom drama, part true crime documentary, the extraordinarily inventive Re-Creation delves into one of Ireland’s most shocking unsolved crimes.

In 1996, French filmmaker Sophie Toscan Du Plantier was murdered at her holiday home in West Cork. English journalist Ian Bailey was investigated by Irish authorities, but never faced trial in Ireland - despite the fact he was tried and convicted in absentia by the French government.

Re-Creation directors Jim Sheridan (My Left Foot, In the Name of the Father) and David Merriman have constructed a fascinating mix of fiction and reality that explores the question: what if Bailey had been tried in Ireland?

The film skilfully brings audiences into the room as a fictional jury sorts through the facts, inconsistencies and inconvenient truths that make the case so intriguing to this day.

With spectacular performances from the ensemble cast, headed by the remarkable Vicky Krieps (Phantom Thread), Re-Creation is an unmissable entry in this year’s line-up.
Rating
Offensive language & content that may disturb
Director
Jim Sheridan and David Merriman
Cast
Vicky Krieps, Jim Sheridan, Aidan Gillen, Colm Meaney
label: Film & Media

description:
British and Irish Film Festival - The North, Prepare to be transported to the striking beauty of the Scottish wilderness in The North, a visceral journey through sheets of rain, craggy cliffs and lonesome beaches.

A decade after being best friends and roommates, Chris and Lluis set out on a 600 kilometre hike through the Scottish Highlands. Following the West Highland Way and The Cape Wrath Trail, they spend 30 days together in nature - hoping to rekindle their once-powerful friendship.

But while Chris remains preoccupied with work and life back at home, Lluis is determined to finish the trail to prove he can do it. The solitude and silence of the Highlands forces them to confront harsh truths about themselves, their friendship, and what it truly means to stand still and listen.

Set against the pace and demands of long-distance hiking, The North depicts the intricacies and challenges of both friendship and internal human struggles against the backdrop of the beautifully stark landscapes of the Highlands.

Director Bart Schrijver was inspired to make the film after walking New Zealand’s own Te Araroa hike.
Rating
Offensive language
Director
Bart Schrijver
Cast
Bart Harder, Carles Pulido
label: Film & Media

description:
Film screening: GAGA, Gaga《哈勇家》(2022)
Directed by Laha Mebow 112 mins, Mandarin/Atayal/Taiwanese, English subtitles
Among the Atayal indigenous people of Taiwan, gaga is the traditional law and custom, the way of living with the land and organising society, the source of values. When Hayung, the patriarch of an Atayal family, and the senior knowledge-keeper, dies, his oldest son Payang decides to run for election as head of the local district. The film Gaga follows this election, in its raw democratic, and occasionally corrupt, form and the ways – sometimes serious, sometimes hilarious – that it affects the extended family. A groundbreaking film, Gaga is mostly in Atayal language and presents the life and social interactions of these contemporary indigenous Taiwanese people unsentimentally, with humour, with compassion, and with the sharp eye of a brilliant film-maker.
Gaga won Best Director and Best Supporting Actress at the 59th Taipei Golden Horse Film Festival in 2022. Beyond Taiwan, it won the Best Director at the 2022 Singapore International Film Festival - Asian Feature Competition and has been screened at film festivals in Hawaii, Los Angeles, Melbourne, Auckland and New York.
Q&A with Film Director Laha Mebow
We are delighted that Film Director Laha Mebow, Taiwan's first indigenous female director, will be attending the screening and take part in Q&A afterwards.
Laha Mebow is the first female director from Taiwan to win Best Director at the Golden Horse Awards, the most prestigious film award in the Chinese-speaking world. An Indigenous filmmaker of the Tayal people, she is also the first Indigenous woman in Taiwan to direct a narrative feature. Her films explore spiritual inheritance, family trauma, and Indigenous identity through a deeply personal yet cinematic lens.
She has directed three feature films. Finding Sayun (2011) reimagines a colonial-era legend from an Indigenous perspective. Lokah Laqi! (2016), a coming-of-age tale of three Indigenous boys, was selected as Taiwan’s official submission for Best Foreign Language Film at the Academy Awards. Her third feature, Gaga (2022), won Best Film at the Singapore International Film Festival and delves into generational shifts and cultural survival within an Indigenous family.
Laha’s body of work continues to break new ground for Indigenous representation in Asian cinema. Her unique voice bridges traditional storytelling and contemporary filmmaking, making her one of the most important and anticipated directors from Taiwan today.
label: Film & Media

description:
Mystery 35mm Movie Marathon, Mystery 35mm Movie Marathon
Surprise we are running a 35mm Mystery Marathon very soon! We have had some exciting news that we cannot share for now but as a result we must move our beautiful 35mm from its usual location into storage for a bit. We are not sure when it will be set back up so to celebrate we are running a marathon of six 35mm features across one Saturday!

We will kick off the first film at 1:30pm sharp on Saturday and will have a short dinner break after the third film. All going to plan we should be done by around 12:30am.

In terms of the features, we have films from the 1960s through to the early 2000s with a mix of comedies, sci-fi, horror and cult classics! Granted not all of these films would be considered masterpieces but there is nothing more fun than sitting in a crowd not knowing what could be coming next!

We will have a snack menu you can pre-order before the first film so aim to arrive around 1:00pm to order. The breaks between films will be very short (probably just enough time for the projectionist to thread up the next film) so make sure you come prepared for back-to-back screenings.

This event has strictly no digital projection, it’s all film all the time. Now in theory it should all playback without a hitch as we are bringing in some of the best projectionist’s Wellington has. But 35mm is a strange beast that can sometimes throw up the odd issue.

All tickets are $50

Seating is general admission and cinema entrance will be determined by earliest ticket purchase times.
label: Film & Media

The profit from your ticket will be used to help fund a welcome pack of basic supplies for a new refugee family arriving in Wellington.

description:

A car thief is forced to steal 50 luxury vehicles in one night in order to save the life of his brother, who has fallen foul of a dangerous crime lord. His task is further hampered by a rival band of thieves and, of course, the local police.

description:
Roxy Retro | Twilight, Step back into the world of vampires and werewolves, celebrating Bella's birthday on September the 13th we're bringing Twilight back on cinemas. To revive this love triangle debate, what would you be sipping? 'Team Edward' and 'Team Jacob' cocktails available to pre-order with your tickets. Can't decide? We'll have enough to upgrade you that night.
High-school student Bella Swan, always a bit of a misfit, doesn't expect life to change much when she moves from sunny Arizona to rainy Washington state. Then she meets Edward Cullen, a handsome but mysterious teen whose eyes seem to peer directly into her soul. Edward is a vampire whose family does not drink blood, and Bella, far from being frightened, enters into a dangerous romance with her immortal soulmate. ---
label: Film & Media

description:
Seen The Film - Wellington, NZ. A Fundraiser for Te Aro School., We live in an age where, as parents and caregivers, there is more information than ever before. How much screen time is the right amount of screen time for our children? How best can we manage our children's daily meltdowns? Time in, time out, clear boundaries, feel all the feelings - what's best? We are hearing more and more reactive advice on how best to manage our children, yet we are missing the root cause and solution.
SEEN is a groundbreaking feature-length documentary that not only explores the transformative power of personal healing for parents, but also delves into the scientifically supported effects of such healing on parenting and its impact on child brain development.
movie trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bZPQXpw6kT0
label: Film & Media

Where: Vogelmorn Bowling Club UPSTAIRS, 93 Mornington Road, Wellington.
This is a fundraising event for an outdoor learning space for Te Aro School children.
Be part of an inspiring and thought-provoking morning as we screen SEEN: The Film, a powerful documentary exploring the long-term impact of childhood trauma and the journey of healing to create stronger, healthier families.
Tickets: Reserve your seat now – spaces are limited!
📍 Don’t miss this chance to join the conversation and the movement to create a brighter future for children and families.
Grab your ticket today and help us create change, one story at a time.

description:
Twin Peaks Wellington: Season 2 - Episodes 14, 15, 16, If the sound of watching Twin Peaks together with a bunch of like minded fans sounds like a good idea, then you've come to the right place!
Twin Peaks is full of mystery and questions, with very few answers, but these next 3 episodes may well be the most "revealing" and arguably momentous episodes of all. You seriously do not want to miss this one! So come along and experience it first hand with your fellow fans!

This is what we will be watching :
Episode 14: "Lonely Souls"  (47mins)
Episode 15: "Drive with a Dead Girl"  (47mins)
Intermission
Episode 16: "ARBITRARY LAW"  (46mins)
With all Log Lady Intros!
WHERE: The mini cinema in Te Auaha. 65 Dixon St. Te Aro.

(Take the lift or stairs to Level 1 and turn left.)
The mini cinema's specs: 4K projection, Screen size 4450mm x 2500mm, Aspect ratio 16:9 with 7.1 surround sound.

Here is a link to Te Auaha's cinema so you know what to expect.
https://www.teauahaevents.com/our-spaces/cinema

WHEN: Meet at 10:30am on Saturday 4th Oct. 2025. in the Bar area. The bar will be closed but you are welcome to bring your own snacks/drink.
Chat with other Twin peakies and the show will start on the dot at 11:00am

COST: Tickets are $10 per person

Tickets will be capped/limited so that everyone can have a decent seat; so grab those tickets ASAP and don't miss out on experiencing these truly shocking episodes in a room full of your people that love Twin Peaks!

RULES:
1. Tickets are per person. There will be NO door sales, so DO purchase it beforehand please. 
2. All attendees MUST be 18yo +
3. This is a safe, friendly, INCLUSIVE place. There is ZERO tolerance for discrimination, disrespect or creepy gross behavior of any kind. By attending you agree to the Code of Conduct.
4. Please clean up after yourself if you are snacking and help keep the mini cinema clean as a whistle. 
Thank you! And hope to see you there.

description:
WPF presents: The Hunger (1983), Three of the most beautiful actors to ever live - Catherine Deneuve, David Bowie and Susan Sarandon- star in this ‘80s cult classic about a vampire couple posing as wealthy classical music teachers.
The Hunger is full camp; queer tension and complexity. And beware: the encounters in this movie do not stick to heterosexual norms.
Underworld Tavern in Mt Victoria is hosting this screening in their suitably dark, macabre and industrial surrounds. Prizes will be awarded to the darkest and most vampiric ensemble. A full bar service will be available throughout.
Continuing our run of film fundraisers, The Hunger allows us queers and our allies to engage with a pillar of queer culture. These screenings are organised and hosted by the community for the community. More than just a screening, this will be a queer horror experience.
The event begins at 3pm but come early to get comfortable. The film will start at 3.30. A short comfort break will be provided. Stay for a drink to discuss and dissect.
The Hunger is rated R18. No one under the age of 18 is permitted. Its running length is 97 minutes.
Tickets are $20 waged, $13 unwaged.
ACCESSIBILITY
- Underworld Tavern is fully wheelchair accessible
- The movie will include closed captions

description:
Wellington Timebank fundraiser screening of Tinā, Get your tickets here - https://events.humanitix.com/wtb-fundraiser-screening-of...
Join us for this special screening of this award winning Aotearoa-made film - Tinā (2024). If you missed it in the cinemas the first time round, you can now watch it from the comfort of the Newtown Community Centre!
Doors open at 5pm
Film starts at 6pm (running time is 2 hours 4 minutes)
Tickets are just $25 waged / $20 unwaged (all tickets include snacks) and proceeds go toward keeping your Timebank in operation.
About the film:
Award-winning writer/director Miki Magasiva (The Panthers, We Are Still Here) makes his feature debut with Tinā (Samoan for "mother"). Samoan music teacher Mareta (Anapela Polataivao) is plunged into grief after losing her daughter in the Christchurch quakes. Mareta takes a relieving role at an elite private school, where she inspires her students to perform at a big choral competition. In the trailer Mareta faces a condescending interview at Saint Francis, and her growing relationship with "spoiled, rich kids" annoys a family member. Tinā was chosen to open the 2024 Hawai’i International Film Festival.

This time last year, Kneecap premiered at the Wellington Film Festival - but not enough people got to see it. Some films deserve the big screen experience, so I’m bringing it back!

Come along for a movie night supporting a great cause while enjoying this epic film. Set in Belfast, this wild, witty, and politically charged story follows the rise of the real-life rap trio Kneecap, blending music, humour, and rebellion in a way only the Irish can.

Your ticket includes the screening plus a raffle with a twist 😉 - and every dollar goes towards my campaign - it will help me get to the finish line and helping to cover those last few expenses. Imagine the good we can do for our communities if I’m elected!

Location: Lighthouse Cinema Cuba Street

It’s a perfect chance to laugh and cry - imagine Derry Girls, Trainspotting and Spinal Tap combined - it will change you for the better and help make a difference – so gather your mates and join us for some great craic!

description:
2 Course Lunch at Le Cordon Bleu | 24 OCTOBER 2025, This 2-Course lunch expertly prepared by our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students is not to be missed.

Ticket Information
IMPORTANT NOTE: Tables are arranged per order. If you purchase tickets separately you need to e-mail nz@cordonbleu.edu to advise which other ticket holders you wish to be seated with.
Date: Friday 24th October
Price: $45 per person
Booking Times: 12:00pm | 12:30pm | 1:00pm
Dietary Requirements: Our menu is set and we are unable to make any menu alterations or cater to any specific dietary requirements (including religious diets) or food allergies. We apologise for any inconvenience this may cause.
The Menu: will not be released before the event. Please be aware that the menu will include fish, meat and shellfish components.
Tickets are allocated for specific seating times, please ensure you arrive promptly at the time indicated on your ticket.
The estimated time to enjoy the full Le Cordon Bleu 2 course dining experience is 1 hour. We invite you to sit back, relax and enjoy our students' creations.

Watch our recap of last years service below
What is Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu?
Brasserie Le Cordon Bleu is our training restaurant where our students get practical experience in a real restaurant environment - all under the expert guidance of their chef lecturers. In the kitchen, we have students from our Diplôme de Cuisine programme. In the dining room we have our Bachelor of Culinary Arts and Business students serving you and putting their theory skills into practice.
Brasserie & High Tea Refund Policy
• No refunds are provided unless the event is cancelled by Le Cordon Bleu NZ.
• Customers can arrange for someone else to take their place.

description:
Chance Luck & Magic 2024 Release, Be the first to taste Chance, Luck & Magic 2024, the latest iteration of one of our proudest achievements.

On Saturday 18 October, you can come and taste the beer in our Wild Workshop, the place where it was made. Brewers Pete and Dave will be on hand from 2pm to raise the first toast and tell you all a little about how this year’s blend came to be. We’ll also pull a couple of other goodies from the cellar to keep you and CLM company.

And, to top it off, our friends at Nomames Tacos will be here for the edible pairings.

This beer is the ultimate expression of Wild Workshop’s inner-city terroir, and the 2024 bottle is no different; a blend of five years of 100% spontaneously fermented brews, aged in French oak. The result is a complex and truly unique drop that harnesses the natural character of Pōneke.

We love this beer, and we’re so chuffed that other people do too - we’re very honoured that Chance, Luck & Magic, in its various vintages, has garnered global recognition and become one of our most prestigious creations:
Silver medals at both the 2023 and 2024 World Beer Cup (huge!)
Four consecutive gold medals at the New Zealand Beer Awards, as well as two trophies for Champion European Ale, and the Champion Beer title in 2022
Champion International Beer at the 2024 Australian International Beer Awards

The release of each new edition has become a landmark annual event for us, a chance to take a moment and appreciate the beautiful things that come from the wild workings of the environment.

Come and celebrate with us!
label: Food & Drink

Terms and Conditions & Cancellation Policy

Our Hearty High Tea cannot be modified for dietary requirements. However, our Classic High Tea is available in a Vegetarian, Vegan and Gluten Free version. Please note, we are unable to accommodate dietary requirements without prior notice.

If not already stated and confirmed at the time of reservation, guest numbers must be confirmed 48 hours prior to arrival.

A credit card must be provided at the time of reservation to secure the booking.

High Tea reservations cancelled within 24 hours prior to arrival will incur a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.

No-shows will be charged a cancellation fee of 100% of the total booking.

Decreases in attendee numbers will not be accepted within 24 hours before arrival, and charges will apply based on the confirmed final count.

description:
NZCFS Wellington Branch October Meeting: Mooncake Making, The Mid-Autumn Festival (simplified Chinese: 中秋节; traditional Chinese: 中秋節), also known as Moon Festival or Mooncake Festival, is a traditional festival celebrated by Chinese people and also other East and Southeast Asian people. It is the second-most important holiday after Chinese New Year with a history dating back 3,000 years.
The festival is held on the 15th day of the 8th month of the Chinese luni-solar calen-dar with a full moon at night. On this day, the moon is at its brightest and fullest size, coinciding with harvest time in the middle of Autumn. This year, the Moon Festival is on 6 October. We will be making mooncakes at our October monthly meet-ing to celebrate this festival.
Our secretary Vera will demonstrate the flaky Suzhou-style savoury mooncake with pork. We will also make some sweet ones using redbean paste filling.
If you are coming to the session, please bring $5.00 entry fee, a plate and cutlery for the mooncake tasting.

description:
Urban Wine Walk | Pōneke Wellington (NZ), The streets and laneways of Pōneke Wellington are set to come alive this Spring as a line-up of eight venues each play host to an incredible winemaker, who'll be there ready to pour and chat you through an unforgettable afternoon.

HOW IT WORKS
Kick things off at your chosen starting spot with something to eat, and then let the adventure unfold. Wander at your own pace, glass in hand, discovering incredible wines and venues along the way.
With a stellar line-up of winemakers, good vibes at every stop, and a guaranteed sell-out crowd, the Urban Wine Walk is the ultimate self-guided tasting experience you and your crew won’t want to miss!

PARTICIPATING VENUES & WINEMAKERS
1 - Choice Bros Ft. Coney Wines (NZ)
2 - Glou Glou Ft. Halite (NZ)
3 - Little Beer Quarter Ft. Hopes Grove & Aard (NZ)
4 - Lulu Bar Ft. Margrain Vineyard (NZ)
5 - Noble Rot Ft. VALLI (NZ)
6 - Panhead Tory St Ft. The Good Way (NZ)
7 - The Arborist Rooftop Bar Ft. Matawhero (NZ)
8 - The Tasting Room Ft. Tettonica Wines (NZ)
*Please note that traditional venue menus may vary due to the nature of the event.

TICKETS
Vino Lover Pass – $79 + Booking Fee (Limited Availability)
WHAT’S INCLUDED
Wine Tastings – Up to 3 wines per winemaker along the trail
$10 Food Voucher – Redeem at your nominated starting venue (before 1pm)
$25 Wine Voucher – Put towards event-day wine orders (six-pack minimum, participating producers only)
Event Essentials – Your official wristband & keepsake tasting glass

EVENT REGISTRATION & COLLECTION
Before heading to your nominated starting venue, swing by the official registration point to collect your wristband, tasting glass & vouchers.
Where: Panhead Tory St (1 Tory St)
When: Saturday 18th October | 11am – 1pm
Please note: The Urban Wine Walk officially runs from 12-4pm. Arrive early to grab your event pack and avoid the rush!

REFUND POLICY
Tickets are non-refundable (we’re all in for good times rain, hail or shine!). The only exception is if the event is cancelled or postponed by the organisers – then we’ve got you covered.

GETTING AROUND
One of the best parts about the Urban Wine Walk...? It’s totally self-guided! After checking in at your nominated starting venue, the day is yours! Wander at your own pace, discover new spots and sip your way through the trail however you like.

**Sorry kids, Urban Wine Walk is strictly 18 Years and Over!

Mac 'n' Cheese pop-up! Kaibosh X Everybody Eats collab for Welly On A Plate, We
Mac 'n' Cheese! A feast with purpose, where every bowl makes a difference. Celebrate the final day of Visa Wellington On a Plate and the end of winter with the ultimate comfort food: mac 'n' cheese, served all day long.
At just $10 per serve, every bowl will help raise funds for Everybody Eats and Kaibosh - two of Wellington’s legendary food rescue and community dining champions. Help us hit our target of 2,000 bowls in one day!
WHEN: Sunday 31 August, 1-8pm (or sold out)
WHERE: 60 Dixon Street (upstairs)
COST: $10 per bowl (pay-what-you-can options available).
Walk-in only, dine-in or takeaway.
Vegan and Gluten Free options available.
Bring your friends, whānau, or the whole flat!
You'll be able to customise your mac 'n' cheese with a range of toppings and flavours which have been made with rescued food, showcasing just how delicious food recovery can be. From rainbow pickles to herby crunchy crumb, extra #FoodRescue flavour bombs to spice up your mac!
As official charity partners of the Wellington On A Plate Festival, Everybody Eats and Kaibosh turn comfort food into real impact for our communities.
We
kai. We
Welly.
Share your
with Welly.

Thank you to Fonterra's Doing Good Together programme, PAK'nSAVE Kilbirnie, Harrington's and All Good for supporting us with this event which is a joint fundraiser for our two charities.

description:
2025 Taiwan Update Lectures, 2025 Taiwan Update Lectures
Join us for three talks by experts on different aspects of Taiwan

About this Event

Taiwan’s Multidimensional Energy Security Challenges
Professor Chyungly Lee
A stable and reliable energy supply is essential for a nation’s economic growth and development. In selecting fuel sources, nowadays almost all countries have taken climate change into account, adopted sensible clean energy transition plans, and designed a schedule to meet the goal of Net Zero. While pursuing a 3-E (energy-economic-environmental) balanced energy supply strategy, Taiwan, lacking indigenous resources, faces unique challenges of supply disruptions from over dependence on energy imports and possible blockade, quarantine, or invasion from Beijing. Any disruption of power supply or surge of energy costs could not only threaten Taiwan’s competitive edge in the global high-tech market but also undermine Taiwan’s internal stability and the nation’s survival. In this talk, Dr. Chyungly Lee will first present fact sheets on Taiwan’s energy status, summarize Taiwan’s current energy strategy, and then discuss dilemmas and vulnerabilities that Taiwan might face in the next few years.


What does Taiwan’s two-level politics tell us?
Professor Alex Tan
This presentation examines Taiwan as a critical case study for understanding the evolving challenges to democracy in the 21st century. Arguing that Taiwan serves as a “canary in the coalmine,” the analysis highlights how the island’s early and persistent political polarization—rooted in identity politics and the legacies of authoritarian rule—prefigures trends now visible in established democracies worldwide. The research explores how deep divisions between the Kuomintang (KMT) and Democratic Progressive Party (DPP), reinforced by institutional and social factors, have led to legislative gridlock, declining trust in political institutions, and a “democratic ceiling” that constrains further democratic development. Taiwan’s precarious geopolitical position, facing constant pressure from the People’s Republic of China, intensifies the dilemma of balancing national security with the protection of civil liberties. The presentation analyzes Taiwan’s innovative responses to disinformation, foreign interference, and public health crises, illustrating both the resilience and fragility of democratic systems under external and internal stress.


Gaming Taiwan: Indigenous Epistemologies in Play
Associate Professor Chia-rong Wu
This research explores how Indigenous knowledge systems in Taiwan are being revitalized through video games. Far from mere entertainment, these games draw on tribal traditions, ancestral stories, and deep connections to the land to create meaningful digital experiences. By blending oral storytelling with interactive gameplay, Taiwanese Indigenous game developers are preserving cultural memory while challenging colonial legacies. Titles like Princess Baleng, Tayal, VuVu, and Gadvia show how games can empower communities and pass down wisdom to younger generations in innovative and engaging ways. Gamers not only play a game but also immerse themselves in digital environments shaped by Indigenous perspectives and values. This study encourages all engaged audiences, including educators and students, to consider video games as powerful tools for cultural resurgence and learning. Focusing on Indigenous Taiwan, it highlights how digital games integrate historical consciousness and interactivity to reimagine the past and future of the island.


Agenda


🕑: 01:00 PM - 02:00 PM

It’s in the Ballot” is a community-led awareness and participation initiative. We aim to increase voter interest in the general and council elections nationally.
By using broadcasting and web-based technologies to deliver in-studio; online on Facebook, YouTube and Twitch; and edited as YouTube videos we aim to enable voters to make informed voting decisions.
This means you can send the weblink of the YouTube Video of your electorate show to your friends and whanau to encourage them to watch the show before they cast their votes.
Voting papers are sent to voters on Tuesday 9th September 2025 and must be delivered into a voting dropbox by 12pm Saturday 11th October 2025

description:
Re-imagine Pōneke: Co-design our city, What would Wellington look like if it truly reflected our hopes for a just, sustainable, and thriving city – not in 30 years, but right now?
Join us for Re-imagine Pōneke, a half-day unconference where Wellingtonians will come together to dream big, share ideas, and co-create a bold vision for the future of our city. Through participant-led breakout sessions and live illustration, we’ll collectively map out what a better Wellington could be – from housing and climate action to transport, community spaces, and beyond.
This event is part of Stronger Together, a youth-led campaign making local democracy real and relevant in Pōneke. As local elections approach, it’s time to reimagine how our city works for us all and explore the power of community-driven ideas.
Why come along?
Connect: Meet others who care deeply about the future of our city.
Create: Contribute your vision to a live, visual representation of a better Wellington.
Collaborate: Join participant-driven sessions on issues that matter most to you.
Inspire change: Leave with practical ideas and energy to take forward.
Whether you’re a seasoned organiser, new to local politics, or simply passionate about Wellington’s future, this event is for you.
Tickets: Free and koha-based (pay what you can).

description:
Taiwan’s Economic Statecraft and the future of Liberal International Order, Abstract
Over the last decade, China has punished countries that undermine its territorial claims and foreign policy goals with measures such as restricting trade, encouraging popular boycotts, and cutting off tourism. These coercive measures have caused significant economic damage to U.S. partners such as Japan, the Philippines, Taiwan, and Australia. This talk focuses on Taiwan’s response to China’s economic sanctions, highlighting the agency of medium-sized countries in the shadow of a great power.
The second part of this presentation will propose a common understanding of the liberal international order in which state and non-state actors follow rules, norms, and legal procedures in conducting international affairs. This rule-based practice is an essential part of the Asian regional order. If Taiwan were integrated into the multilateral institutions in Asia, the chance of conflict would be greatly reduced. The future of Taiwan also depends on the resilience of the liberal international order and other middle-power states in the Asia Pacific.
Bio
Christina Lai is an Associate Research Fellow in the Institute of Political Science at Academia Sinica, Taiwan. Dr. Lai received her Ph.D. in Government from Georgetown University. In 2015-2016, she was a post-doctoral fellow in China and the World Program at Princeton University. She is interested in U.S.-China-Taiwan Relations, Chinese Foreign Policy, East Asian politics, and Qualitative Research Methods. Her works have appeared in the Politics, International Politics, Political Science, PS: Political Science & Politics, Journal of Contemporary China, Pacific Review, and Asian Security.

description:
5-Week Ultimate Calm Forest-Yoga Series, 5-Week Ultimate Calm Forest-Yoga Series
Last class series for 2025. Starts 12 October. Ancient, easy, calm, beautiful and gentle yoga practices to regulate your nervous system and change your internal state. Imagine if you could be calm, anywhere, anytime.

Break the cycle of moving through life stressed, anxious, unsure or unable to deeply recover from illness. We cannot heal when we are stressed - healing only happens when we are relaxed.

This is not strenuous leg-behind-your-head yoga. This beautiful series is guided meditation, gentle stretches, letting every muscle go as you lay over soft bolsters, deep breathing and calming down. These classes return yoga to it's roots - meditation, silent stillness, and experiencing the world without tension.

The impact of each 1.5 hour class will stay with you. And the by the end of the course, you will:

1. Understand more about your stress and relaxation responses
2. Learn easy ways to switch your nervous system over to rest
3. Learn breathing techniques to immediately calm you down
4. Remind your body what is feels like to be at ease
5. Support your mind to naturally and easily take a back seat
6. Learn to better transition to sleep
7. Slow down long enough to listen to what you truly need
8. Have access to audio and video recordings for life
9. Have unlimited support and curiosity throughout the course
10. Create your own home practice after the series.

The world is getting faster. We don't need to. Fast and productive is not not our natural state!

These classes are led by Janie Walker who has experienced chronic stress and long-covid. She teaches from her own experience. You will truly feel supported. You will also crave coming to BeCalmed Studio's little haven in the forest. You can rest here.

Here's what people have said about these BeCalm Yourself classes:

https://www.becalmedstudio.com/.../how-becalm-yourself

Your booking is for all FIVE WEEKLY CLASSES in the series.
Bookings essential.. https://www.becalmedstudio.com/studio-classes

Just 2-3 per class. If this time of week does not suit you, please contact Janie as there may be others wanting a different time slot.

And don't let money be a barrier - we can work something out.

Be calm.

description:
8 week Pre Xmas Beginners Yoga Course, The Beginners Course teaches the “Sarva Hitta Asanas” from Level 1 - postures that are good for everyone. The Course covers all the foundations you need for an ongoing yoga practice as well as plenty of time for guided relaxation. Loosening your body, the joints, and your mind, the exercises are designed for the complete balance and awakening of energy in body, mind and soul. Experience yoga postures, breath techniques, meditation and relaxation, along with knowledge about basic yoga philosophy and a healthy lifestyle. description:
Beyond Sight: The Power of Dyad Meditation, Beyond Sight: The Power of Dyad Meditation
What happens when we strip away the surface layers of small talk, social roles, and even sight itself?

In this unique evening, you’ll step into the practice of Dyad Meditation — a powerful form of authentic relating where two people take turns speaking and listening in complete presence. One person shares, the other simply listens. No interruptions. No fixing. No judgment. Just the rare experience of being fully seen and fully heard.

The twist? You’ll be blindfolded.
By closing our eyes to the outer world, we drop our guards and tune into something deeper. This creates space for vulnerability, openness, and raw connection that we don’t often experience in daily life.

Expect an evening that’s real, grounding, and surprisingly freeing — a chance to connect with yourself and with others in ways that go beyond sight.

You don’t need to bring a partner or a friend — in fact, coming on your own is part of the experience. Everyone will be paired up on the night, so it’s all about connecting beyond familiar circles.

Afterwards, we’ll share reflections over a nourishing plant-based dinner, keeping the conversation alive in a relaxed space.

Meet Andre, your host
Andre has been exploring the art of authentic connection since his teens, when a rite of passage in Golden Bay first sparked his passion for circle work. Since then, he has been creating spaces that invite honesty, vulnerability, and depth — guiding people into experiences of being truly seen and heard. A multi-instrumental musician, poet, and breathwork facilitator, Andre brings creativity and presence to all his offerings, inspired by the question of what it really means to be human.

description:
Botanical Insights talk - Pharmaceutical Botany, What are the connections between kōwhai and lung health; tōtara and eye health; yew, flax, rosy periwinkle and cancer suppression; fox glove and heart health; pōhutukawa, koromiko and gut health; and more. This one-hour talk may bring a few surprises!

Located in the Treehouse Seminar Room, Wellington Botanic Garden ki Paekākā.
Free of charge. You’re welcome to bring along your own ‘brown bag’ lunch to enjoy during the talk.

The speaker is Reg Harris, a volunteer guide [botany] at Wellington Botanic Garden.
Reg delivers botany lectures for diverse audiences, delving into plant interactions, adaptive radiation, tropisms, and more. As a dedicated volunteer guide at Wellington Botanic Garden (WBG), he pioneered collaborations between WBG and Victoria University, organizing annual field labs for biology students.

description:
Breathwork: A Gentle Reset, Breathwork: A Gentle Reset

Take a pause from the noise of daily life.

This breathwork journey begins with gentle movement to awaken the body and open the breath. Through slow, mindful stretches, we begin softening tension and grounding into the present.

You’ll then be guided through two styles of breathwork — each offering a unique pathway inward. There’s no pressure or expectation, just the freedom to explore what feels right for you:

A dynamic, connected breath for those who wish to build energy, move emotion, or break through internal blockages

A slow, rhythmic breath for those seeking stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches invite a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and inner clarity.

To gently close the session, we’ll move into a quiet, nurturing meditation to support integration and leave you feeling steady, clear, and connected.

Afterwards, stay and enjoy a nourishing plant-based dinner and dessert, lovingly prepared to complement the experience — because healing is also about how we feed and care for ourselves.

Why Breathwork?

Breathwork has helped so many shift from a state of tension and overwhelm into a place of ease, clarity, and resilience — often after just one session. It’s a simple, powerful practice that reconnects you to your body, your breath, and your inner stillness.

You’ll leave feeling more grounded, more present, and more like yourself again.

Meet Karla, your host
Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

description:
Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System, Burnout to Breath: A Somatic Reset for the Nervous System

If you’re running on fumes, stuck in overdrive, or feeling wired and tired, this session is for you. Even if you’ve tried resting, you might still feel tense, foggy, or emotionally flat. This session is designed for those ready to reconnect to their body, regulate their nervous system, and rediscover their energy.

You might notice these signs:

Waking up tired, even after a full night’s sleep

Overthinking decisions and feeling emotionally reactive

Craving peace but feeling disconnected from your body

Often feeling “on” and unable to fully relax

Workshop Details:
Through guided somatic breathwork, gentle movement, and nervous system education, you’ll be supported to safely release stored tension, calm your system, and access clarity from within.

What to bring/prepare:

Comfortable clothing for movement

Water bottle and journal

Yoga mat provided

Optional: blanket, eye pillow, essential oils

Arrive: 5–10 minutes early to settle in

Unwind further with a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert, a nurturing way to ground yourself and enjoy a sense of calm and connection after the session.

Contraindications for Breathwork:
Breathwork can be a powerful tool but may not be suitable for everyone. Please consult your healthcare provider before participating if you have:

Cardiovascular issues (e.g., high blood pressure, heart disease)

Respiratory conditions (e.g., asthma, COPD)

A history of seizures or epilepsy

Diagnosed mental health conditions (e.g., schizophrenia, bipolar disorder)

Pregnancy (some breath patterns may need modification)

Recent surgery or physical injuries that limit movement

You are always welcome to participate in the somatic and movement elements without engaging in deep breathwork—your safety and well-being are our priority.

About Lynofuro:
Lynofuro is an Integrative Somatic Coach and Breathwork Facilitator who helps intuitive, high-performing people overcome emotional burnout and restore energetic balance. Her work blends somatics, breath, and energy alignment to support lasting transformation.
What past participants say:
“I walked in overwhelmed and walked out feeling like myself again.”
“This was the first time I felt fully present and peaceful in weeks.”

Email: hi@lynofuro.co.nz | Website: www.lynofuro.co.nz

Satay Seitan Skewer

Gado Gado salad with peanut sauce

Rice

Banana cake with Caramel suace

Hot Chocolate Drink

description:
Cacao + Movement + Yin, Cacao + Movement + Yin
Welcome to an hour and a half of uninterrupted YOU time!

Lift your energy with ceremonial cacao, dance into joy with an energizing movement practice, and close with yin inspired stretches and meditation - a journey of connection, movement and renewal.

Hosted by Heidi Firth & Kae-Lynn Sorensen.

What to expect:
Cacao - Ceremonial Cacao drink to foster heart-opening, emotional connection, and creative flow. We'll open with mindfully drinking "Cacao Ambassador" Cacao to bring awareness to our hearts & bodies.

The Movement - Easy to follow choreography with modifications. Where intentional movement meets empowering music.
Think of it as an hour just for YOU – to sweat, move however you need to, laugh, release and feel amazing in mind, body + soul.

A space where you can leave your judgements at the door, reconnect with yourself and have some fun!

Yin Yoga - A slow-paced style of yoga that emphasizes passive stretching and longer-held poses. It targets the deeper connective tissues of the body, such as ligaments and fascia, rather than the muscles, promoting flexibility, joint health, and relaxation. The practice encourages mindfulness and introspection, creating a calming contrast to more vigorous, dynamic forms of yoga.

Sunday 19 October 2025
10:30am - 12pm
Central Rugby Club, 34 Lansdown Street, Mayfair
$45 pp

Bookings Essential
Follow the ticket link to reserve your space
Your booking is confirmed once payment is made.

https://kaelynnsofferings.as.me/schedule/8fa42429


About Heidi
I love holding spaces that feel like a deep exhale, where we can melt into Yin shapes, sip cacao, and let our whole system soften. My love is supporting people to feel good in their bodies and to remember that health can be both deeply healing and beautifully simple.


About Kae-Lynn
Hello I’m Kae-Lynn!

I lead The Movement because, I believe everyone deserves a non judgmental space to catch their breath and, be reminded of their spark.

When Mel first shared The Movement with me I was so I was burnt out, numb, and deeply disconnected. I was busy trying to love and please everyone else that I completely lost myself.

During my first class something shifted. The music — the movements — Reminded me of that spark within me. It felt like my soul finally had permission to shine again. For that one hour, I could breathe. No pressure, no expectations, no noise from the world or my mind. Just movement, music, and freedom to be me.

I believe fitness should be intentional, empowering and fun.

Come give it a go!

description:
Conscious & Connected Breathwork, Conscious & Connected Breathwork

Step out of autopilot and into your own rhythm — this session is about tuning in again.

We begin with gentle movement and mindful stretches to awaken the body, open the breath, and release tension. You’ll then be guided through two complementary styles of breathwork, allowing you to explore what feels most nourishing for you:

A dynamic, flowing breath to energise, release emotion, and move through internal blockages

A slow, steady breath to cultivate stillness, calm, and deeper grounding

Both approaches create a sense of spaciousness — physically, mentally, and emotionally — while supporting nervous system balance and clarity of mind. The session closes with a quiet, nurturing meditation, helping you integrate the experience and leave feeling steady, connected, and present.

Stay afterwards to enjoy a wholesome plant-based dinner and dessert included in your ticket — a simple way to nourish your body and complement your practice.

Meet Your Host: Karla

Karla is a breathwork and trauma-somatic facilitator based in Aotearoa (New Zealand), originally from Malta. With over a decade of experience in Reiki and three years facilitating trauma-informed, science-based breathwork, Karla combines holistic tools, meditation, and conscious breathing to support nervous system regulation and deep emotional healing. Her offerings help release stored trauma, reduce stress and anxiety, and activate oxytocin—the “love hormone”—fostering connection, vitality, and a sense of wholeness. She currently holds regular classes, workshops, and transformative retreats that nurture the mind, body, and spirit.

description:
Conscious Dance with Janni, I am creating a space to freeform dance – or ‘conscious dance’, where you can nourish your mind, body and spirit through mindful movement.
I’m offering 10 spots (first in) for anyone to come along for free in return for giving some feedback and agreeing to being in some non-intrusive photos to help us plan future events. Details will be provided via email in the next few days.
In this practice, we open and close with gentle, easy movements. You then explore and find your dance flow as we progress into the peak and beyond. The whole experience is yours to create in whatever way, shape or form that feels best for you. It may be fast or slow, wild or contained or alone or with others. You will move and dance to a range of music and there will be minimal guidance from me, as the facilitator.
Dance helps to energise and invigorate us. It has incredible health benefits which will become evident as you get comfortable and curious, build confidence and open your heart and mind to possibility.
If I can't offer a spot on this occasion, I will let you know when our ongoing events commence.
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Courageous Communication™ | 1-day Workshop | Wellington | 11 Nov 2025, Has this ever happened to you?
You’re sitting in a meeting and there are 50 elephants in the room with you that nobody is mentioning, and you’re doing the strategic plan but everyone knows it’s never going to work because the team don’t have the capability or the capacity and that one person never follows through and that other person thinks her work is better than it is, but nobody says anything and as you leave you think well THAT'S three hours I’m never gonna get back…
It’s hard to say the hard thing.
But saying the hard thing is the only way we can deal with what’s actually going on.
The number one indicator of a lack of courage is an inability to have hard conversations.
Hard conversations are scary. Our hearts start pounding, our tummies clench, our mouths go dry.
Hard conversations feel dangerous. If I say this thing, he’ll be offended! She’ll be angry! I’ll get in trouble!
Hard conversations are tempting to avoid. Nobody else is mentioning these elephants. Why should I?
But what if you were great at them?
What would it mean for your relationships?
What would it mean for your career?
What would it mean for your life?
Kaila Colbin has worked with more than 4,000 people to grow courage as a core competency and a clear framework has emerged from that experience.
In this 1-day workshop, you’ll build the skill and muscle to get great at having hard conversations.
We’ll cover the specific elements of how to communicate and what to communicate.

When: Tuesday, 11 November 2025, 9 am-4:30 pm
Where: Rangimarie Room, Te Papa Museum, 55 Cable Street, Wellington 6011
Lunch, afternoon tea and all-day tea and coffee are included in the registration.

Need help with the cost?
If you are an Educator or at a Not-for-Profit, you can automatically access a special rate of $745 + GST when you register (a $250 discount off our standard General Admission rates).

Our Health and Safety Plan
Boma is committed to delivering safe events. We follow best practices suggested by the New Zealand health authorities and work closely with our suppliers to prioritise health and wellbeing.
Our comprehensive health and safety plans ensure you can book with certainty and attend with confidence.

Our refund policy
For details on event refunds and transfers, please see our refund policy.

About the Kaila Colbin
Kaila Colbin is founder and CEO of Boma, an organisation building a world of intentional, intelligent, courageous leaders.
An award-winning leader renowned for impact, Kaila developed TEDxChristchurch into New Zealand’s flagship TEDx event and brought Singularity University to New Zealand and Australia, supporting thousands of people to engage with exponentially accelerating technologies and their impact on humanity. She trained with Dr Brené Brown as a Certified Dare to Lead™ Facilitator.
As a founder of the non-profit Ministry of Awesome, Kaila played a critical role in developing Christchurch’s startup ecosystem. She has extensive governance experience, and has been involved with mergers, capital raises, and company sales in the US and NZ.
A native New Yorker, Kaila’s work to champion Aotearoa New Zealand on a global stage saw her given the 2022 Kea World Class New Zealand “Friend of New Zealand” award. Her purpose in life is to be an uplifting presence.

If you have any questions about this event, please email us at hello@boma.global.

description:
Draw It Out - Adults workshop 25 Nov, A gentle yet powerful tool for wellness (adults 18+) to access inner guidance.
Theme: Re-finding your spark
Learn how to listen to your feelings and find guidance from within, using a gentle powerful tool called Interactive Drawing Therapy.
This single workshop focuses on the theme of re-finding your spark, and connecting to what it is that is driving you. Great if going through change or curious about something new.
Date
This is a single workshop
6.30pm-8.00pm
Tuesday 25 November
Cost
$46 total
Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.
About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

$184 total ($46 per session)

Included in each session
You will be guided by Lara Phillips, a trained creative facilitator in Interactive Drawing Therapy, through drawing prompts (similar to a guided meditation or journaling) to draw out where you are at and draw out your own inner guidance. No art skills are needed, more simple mark making.
This gentle yet powerful tool uses drawing and writing as a way to access your subconscious and to listen to your heart rather than your head for guidance. A tool often used in therapy, it is made accessible for self-care and community wellness through these workshops.

About Lara Phillips
Lara Phillips is a creative facilitator trained in Interactive Drawing Therapy. With a 20 year career in creative copywriting in design and communication, she shares drawing and writing as a mode for wellness and self-care, to promote preventative and proactive mental health measures through creativity.
“We all have the wisdom within to help ourselves, if given the space.”
For more workshops or to book individual sessions visit www.drawitout.co.nz.

Liability disclaimer
Draw It Out offers creativity for wellbeing. It is not intended as therapy nor does it replace counselling, therapy, or any other medical or clinical professional help. Participants are guided to draw out where they are at, whilst drawing out their own inner resources for support and guidance.
Participants understand it is their own responsibility to manage their mental and physical health during sessions, to opt in and out of activities as they see fit, and make the facilitator aware if further support is required.

description:
Ecstatic Dance Wellington, Ecstatic Dance Wellington
💫 Move. Release. Connect. 💫

🌟✨ Ecstatic Dance Wellington ✨🌟

With DJ Kimba Jade @ Thistle Hall, Wellington

Kimba Jade & Bernie Cruise are thrilled to be hosting Ecstatic Dance Wellington! 🎉

💫 What is Ecstatic Dance?
A freeform, drug- and alcohol-free dance experience where you move however your body wants. The music flows like a wave — starting slow, rising to ecstatic peaks, then softening into stillness. It’s therapeutic, uplifting, and a powerful way to connect with yourself and community.

Please note, that this Ecstatic Dance is not verbally guided, we let the music guide you 😊. Dance freely how your body moves you.

🎶 This Dance Floor
Guided by DJ Kimba Jade, expect an immersive journey through deep bass, tribal rhythms, and global soundscapes that awaken both body and spirit. With over 24 years behind the decks—including 8 years dedicated to Ecstatic Dance—Kimba crafts transformative spaces of joy, release, and connection. Originally from Auckland, she curated Alchemic Dance Floor events for 5 years, now co-runs the Ecstatic Dance Festival, and teaches Alchemic Ecstatic Dance DJ Trainings. She’s thrilled to share her magic and move with you on the dance floor!

🎶 The Sound System
Here at Ecstatic Dance Wellington, we believe in using a phat sound system with lots of bass for our dances. We will be bringing an ultra vibey and super bassy experience for you!


🗓 Event Details
📍 Thistle Hall, 293 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington
🕖 7:00pm – Opening Circle
🕢 7:15pm – Ecstatic Dance
🕘 8:45pm – Closing Circle
🕘 9:00pm – Chai & Chocolate (for those wanting to socialise)

🎟 Tickets
$25 online
https://events.humanitix.com/ecstatic-dance-wellington-l2sqbn9j

$30 cash on the door

**If you would like to come but are unwaged or struggling, please send us a message directly, we'd love to help.

☀️ Extra Info
- Beanbags are provided for the end relaxation.
- Doors will open at 6.45pm for you to socialise in the lobby, we'll start promptly at 7pm.

We are very much looking forward to joining the conscious dance community in Wellington and sharing our magic.

❤️ What to Bring

Water bottle

Loose, comfy clothes

Warm layers for afterwards

A friend!

🌟 Guidelines

Drug & alcohol free event

Silence on the dance floor

No phones/cameras on the dance floor

Respect the space & each other 😊

🎧 Tune into Kimba’s ED sets:
Mixcloud: https://www.mixcloud.com/kimbajade/

✨ Come dance with us at Ecstatic Dance Wellington — a night of music, movement & magic. ✨
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Elebreath® Somatic Breath + Sound Journey, Join Lynn Tiang for a powerful in-person ceremony blending cacao, breathwork, sound, and intuitive movement. Release emotional tension, reset your nervous system, and reconnect with the wisdom of your body.
Through the Elebreath® five-phase arc — grounding, activation, cathartic release, integration, and soulful reflection — you’ll be guided into a state of deep presence where breath, sound, and movement awaken what’s been waiting to be felt.
What to expect:
* Somatic breathwork to clear stored emotions & reset nervous rhythms
* Live soundscapes & intuitive movement for release and integration
*Ceremonial cacao opening to connect with heart energy
*Oracle card pulling + journaling to anchor insights
*Light kai to ground and nourish after the session
Who this is for:
*Anyone navigating emotional fatigue, life transitions, or inner misalignment
*Those seeking nervous system recalibration and emotional release
*People longing for a safe space to soften, release, and reconnect with their body’s wisdom
What’s Included:
*Elebreath® five-phase somatic breathwork journey
*Trauma-informed, nervous system–aware facilitation
*Live sound journey & curated sonic support
*Cacao opening ritual
*Journaling + oracle reflection
*Closing with kai and community space
*Integration Breathwork practices that you can access anytime at your own timing
*Fatigue-free mini-course integration
Details:
Saturday, 27 September, 11:45am - 2:15pm at AWHI Yoga & Wellbeing, Level 2, 15 Johnston Street, Wellington Central
Investment:
Early Bird Pricing for first 8 sign-ups. Limited spaces available, so book in fast!
**PLEASE NOTE** This is a private event for which AWHI is providing the space and promotional support only. All bookings and inquiries must be directed to the host, Lynn Tiang at @lynofuro !

description:
Embodied practices for ADHD, Discover how somatic practices and embodied awareness can offer meaningful support for living with ADHD.
Through somatic enquiry, you’ll be guided to develop a deeper understanding of your unique experience, and discover body-based practices that support living with more ease, alignment, and self-awareness.
Together, we’ll explore practices such as somatic enquiry, sensory and movement-based exploration, embodied mindfulness, and cultivating self-compassion. Along the way, we’ll engage with themes including motivation, emotional and nervous system regulation, sensory processing, overwhelm, and balancing rest with activity.
All are welcome — whether you are diagnosed, self-identified, or exploring the possibility.
Please feel free to reach out with any questions.
****************
Bookings:
https://www.trybooking.com/nz/events/landing/16768?embed
Or email amyeliserichards@gmail.com
Ticket prices range from $50-$75, if finance is a barrier please reach out.
****************
Amy Richards is a yoga teacher based in Pōneke, with a Certificate in MindBody Therapy. She is drawn to the ways intentional movement and embodied awareness can shape our inner experience and relationships. Grounded in a trauma-informed approach, her work invites exploration of connection with sensation and emotion through the body.
Her practice is influenced by Tantric Shaivism, contact improvisation, Open Floor dance, Hakomi somatic psychotherapy, Somatic Experiencing, Authentic Relating, and Nonviolent Communication.

description:
Embrace the Breath, Embrace the Breath
Join Sarah for an evening of mindfulness, breathing and meditation.

Breathwork is a conscious manipulation of the breath to bring about a change in consciousness.

The doors open at 7.15pm (when you arrive, please wait in the waiting room at the entrance, Sarah will come and get you when the studio is ready), with the journey beginning promptly at 7.30pm, with mindfulness, a 45-60 min journey with the breath, followed by connection and sharing.

Sarah Bradnock is a local multi-modality practitioner of energy, bodywork, plant medicine, now working utilising the the breath with SoulSide Breathwork.

Book your space today! Only 10 available.
$55 per person
bring a friend (2 tickets) $100

Registration closes on Wednesday 23 September, if not sold out before then!

What do you need to bring:
- yoga mat or other mat to lay on
- bolster (optional)
- eye pillow
- socks
- jersey or warm top
- water bottle
- journal and pen

If you've never participated in breathwork before, here are a few contraindications:
Physical Contraindications
-Cardiovascular issues
-Glaucoma
-High blood pressure (Over time, if untreated, it can cause health conditions, such as heart disease and stroke) Deep-breathing lowers blood pressure.
-Epilepsy
-Detached Retina (Retinal detachment separates the retinal cells from the layer of blood vessels that provides oxygen and nourishment).
-History of strokes or seizures
-Aneurysm or family history of aneurysm. (Burst blood vessels in the brain).
-Blood thinning medication. (Unfortunately, the blood thinners used to prevent such blood clots can increase the risk of bleeding in the brain, a cause of hemorrhagic stroke).
-Pregnancy or possible pregnancy
-Asthma
-Mental Contraindications
-Substance dependence & addiction (Deep breathwork journeys are not always appropriate for those who are still addicted to a substance, as it tends to raise suppressed or repressed material for processing. However, if you’re currently in recovery, this can be extremely healing, and help you discover the deeper patterns that gave rise to this addiction. (Grof, 1985: 267 – 268).
-Bipolar disorder, schizophrenia or psychosis
-Hospitalisation for emotional crises in the last 10 years
-Psychological conditions and diagnoses, which preclude safe emotional release.

If you are affected by any of the above, please inform Sarah.

*Tickets are non-refundable, but are transferrable with 24 hours notice required.

description:
Gong Bath at Newtown Community Centre, ***$20***
Limited door sales for $25
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket for maximum comfort and warmth*
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and frequencies of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.
**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 20 PEOPLE ONLY**
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice

Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.

**THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 40 PEOPLE ONLY**

🔔About Me🔔
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington, *Limited door sales for $25*
*Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket - or whatever it is you need to feel most warm and comfortable *
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. description: Ground Werk, Eureka presents ‘GroundWerk’, a line-up built to shake the floorboards of Pōneke nightlife, stripping things back to pure energy and forward momentum. CEE begins the night with a deep hypnotic set with a steady pulse, setting the tone for the journey ahead. Doobie shifts gears with a high-pressure set full of movement and tension, pushing boundaries while keeping the floor locked in. Tunneling into late-night pressure with an unpredictable edge, Missthankyou flips the script with sharp, high-energy rhythms built to move bodies and twist minds in her signature style. Closing the night is Unwinworld, a chaotic duo known for blistering speed and raw intensity, engineered for total dancefloor eruption.

description:
Gut Health - With Nutritionist Lucy Edwards, Do you suffer from bloating, constipation, stomach cramps, weight gain, stubborn fat, or a low mood? Or do you just want you and your family to be healthier?

Did you know your gut influences every aspect of you health and wellbeing?

In this fun, relaxing, educational and interactive workshop, you will learn from one of New Zealand's leading Nutritionists Lucy Edwards. Lucy will guide you through some easy and effective tips that you can use to improve your health today. You will also be provided organic herbal teas to sip on chosen especially for gut health.

More about your host Nutritionist Lucy Edwards
A qualified Nutritionist, Natural Therapist and health and wellness expert with more than 20 years experience. She is also an author of 'The Grumbles' a children's book about having a positive mindset.

Lucy is also available to provide workshops and wellness retreats both in person and online, on a range of health-related topics. She will tailor these to suit the participants and the topics they are most interested in or concerned about, such as popular diet and exercise trends and the research around these, or information regarding Health and Nutrition in general. Some of her high end clients include Shortland Street Actors, International Comedians, Olympic Athletes and NZ Army Fitness Instructors.

Hurry last time this workshop sold out quickly!

(*Please note, no refunds are issued if unable to attend, you may either pass your ticket on to someone else or a credit will be issued for a future event.)

description:
Healing Trauma and Nervous System Ancient wisdom for modern resilience, Tuesday Wellbeing Seminars

Healing Trauma and the Nervous System- Ancient wisdom for modern resilience
Stress and struggle leave their mark on both body and mind, sometimes in ways we can’t easily undo. Just as knots form in the body, impressions and tensions accumulate in the mind. While we can’t change the past, the Bhagavad-gita teaches that we can shape our future—what we choose to cultivate now carries us forward.
In this one-hour workshop, we’ll explore how philosophical and spiritual wisdom can help us rise above the tangles of trauma and anxiety. Through practical insights, open discussion, and guidance from the Gita’s philosophy, we’ll look at how to build resilience—not only by steadying the nervous system, but by exploring the deeper self beyond the changing body and mind.

Meet your host, Sivananda

Sivananda’s background is in both science and music, holding a Master's Degree in Data Science, a Bachelor of Science in Physics and a long history of playing and performing on the double bass. His passion for philosophy, music, good food and community attracted him to the bhakti lifestyle. Having studied and practiced the science of the ‘self’ for six years now, he thrives on drawing insights from contemporary science and combining it with yoga wisdom to encourage others to explore new perspectives.

6.15pm Tuesday 28th of October

End the session on a high note with a delicious plant-based dinner, dessert, and good conversation.

Bhakti Lounge 1/175 Vivian Street, Te Aro, Wellington. http://www.bhaktilounge.org.nz
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Healthy Hospo Stress and Taking Back Control: A Breathwork Experience for Hospo - Christchurch, Stress and Taking Back Control: A Breathwork Experience for Hospo
Get peak season ready — with tools to take back control of stress.
We’re all told that stress is bad. Chronic stress can lead to burnout and even serious health issues. But what if stress itself isn’t the enemy? What if learning how to work with stress could actually make it a powerful tool for performance, resilience, and wellbeing?
With hospitality gearing up for peak season, there’s no better time to reset and equip yourself with tools that help you stay calm, focused, and in control. No matter how busy it gets.
At Healthy Hospo, we know the pressure this industry faces. That’s why we’re bringing you an interactive session designed to help you and your teams:
·       Understand the science of stress (and how it can work for you)
·       Experience guided breathwork to reset your body and mind
·       Walk away with practical tools you can use in everyday hospo life
Join us for a 2-hour interactive workshop with our resident Breathwork & Physiology expert, Josh Fankhauser, and discover how to transform stress from something that drains you into something that fuels you.
Yoga mats provided.
What you need to bring:
·       A notebook.
·       A pen.
Thanks to funding through Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ the cost of $35 per person is fully sponsored.
Spaces are limited, and as all spaces are completely funded by Healthy Hospo NZ and Hospitality NZ, you'll need to secure your spot early!
