description:
Emerald, Emerald
Bringing a huge variety of music and singing as well as a seemingly unlimited supply of energy, and an ease amongst people that comes with lengthy experience in the entertainment industry. Your night is sure to contain a lot of dancing and singing, and a good time is to be had by all.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
End of Year Party Time with The Closet, Save the Date: Saturday, December 13!

The rumours are true… after much soul-searching (and to give our neighbours a breather!) The Closet is taking a year off from Kiwiburn. BUT ~ don’t worry the closet doors aren’t closing just yet… we're throwing an end of year party for you all to keep the fruity vibes alive!
We're bringing the pre-burn heat early this year with an epic night at our fabulous friends Champagnaria bar Otto, and we want your beautifully creative minds to help create the party…
Theme TBD >>>>
We want YOU to dream up the wildest, weirdest, most wonderful party themes you can think of. Send us your ideas & the top picks will go to a public vote.
Winner scores two FREE tickets + a bottle of bubbles to pop at the party!
The Lineup so far is already looking epic:
• Seraph – delivering her signature melodic uplifting magic
• Tori – back with the booty-shaking, baddy bass we all crave
• More DJs to be announced soon!
While we won’t be fundraising for the Burn this time, we are raising funds to secure long-term storage for our fabulous clothes & infrastructure… So The Closet can return next year bigger, better, and even more fabulous.
Stay tuned. Start dreaming. Get ready to party like its the end of 2025!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Enjoy Singing? Open Night with Hutt City Chorale, Join us for a fun night of choral singing. Come along to our open night at St Marks Church, 58 Woburn Road, Lower Hutt. You will be very welcome to join us in our warm ups and singing.

We’ll provide you with music for the evening. Meet our fun and creative Music Director Jonathan Berkahn and talented pianist Phillip O’Malley plus our friendly choir, for an enjoyable evening of singing.

We start the evening with our vocal warm ups at 7.15pm, sing beautiful music together, stop for a delicious supper half way through, then continue singing until 9.15pm. If you would like to return, you can join us for up to four free visits. After that time, you can decide whether you would like to join Hutt City Chorale as a member.

We welcome new members and invite you to join us in 2025. Contact Prue, our chairperson, with any questions huttcitychorale@gmail.com or visit www.facebook.com/HuttCityChorale. We look forward to seeing you there and singing together. Join us for an enjoyable evening.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6, Sign up here: https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6
F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington!

WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?
FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!
Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!

HOW TO JOIN?
Take 2 minutes to fill out our form

https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6
Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma

HOW MUCH IS IT?
The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:
3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
Also includes those pesky ticket fees!

WHERE IS IT?
We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.

WHAT THEY SAY
“Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias

“This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya

“F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika

“I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda

"it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara

“Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz

Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7

FAQ
• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.

• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings

• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences.
This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us

• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!

• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.

• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form
--

𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙.
* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit
)

This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket

We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver.

--
Stay in touch
Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forest, Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forest
Registrations open NOW

What to expect

This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.

Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.

Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.

Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.

The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).

No Dogs Allowed sorry

Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.

Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.
label: Hobbies & Interests

Flesh & Blood: Super Slam Pre-Release @ Cerberus Games, GET IN THE RING!
Round up the goons and head for your local game store from September 19-28! Choose one of the new Brute or Guardian heroes and step into the Deathmatch Arena with nothing but ya fists and ya wits! Make the crowd cheer as the Revered role, or play dirty as the Reviled role and whip 'em into a frenzy!
Super Slam Pre-Release uses Sealed Deck format, with 8 packs per player. Build a deck of exactly 30 cards, shuffle up, then get ready to lay a smackdown so tough it'll make the crowd go wild!

Food Drops, Fine Weather, and Serious Falls: A 34-Day Solo Trip in Westland | WTMC Club night, Ever wondered what it takes to complete a 34-day solo tramping trip? Come hear WTMC club member Regan McGillicuddy share stories from his epic adventure in Westland, where he hiked in his own food drops and visited 38 huts across some of the most rugged and remote parts of the West Coast.
Doors open 6:30pm, talk beginning at 7:00pm.

description:
Free BBQ and chat with Council & Kāpiti Mountain Bike Club, Council staff and Kapiti MTB club have been around Waikanae Park hill, checking out some of the do-it-yourself bike tracks that have been popping up. We’ve been walking the hills (and jumping into a few of the holes!) to get a real sense of the terrain, the steep drops, and the jump locations, and yes, photos never quite do the scale justice!
While some of the current tracks and features are unsafe and need to be removed, we get it, this isn’t about shutting down fun. It’s about ensuring the space can work better for everyone, now and in the future, through best practices.
That’s why this Sunday, we’re inviting local young riders and their whānau to come down for a Free BBQ and kōrero.
Meet the crew, share your thoughts, and be part of the conversation about what mountain biking in the park could look like moving forward, using the NZ MTB guidelines to inform good track-building practices.
Where: Waikanae Park, end of the rugby fields
When: Sunday, 5 October at 12pm
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Friday-Night Magic Draft: Guilds of Ravnica @ Cerberus Games, Stand With Your Guild!
It is autumn on Ravnica. The story gears up for the final showdown with Nicol Bolas. He is trying to slowly influence Ravnica and warp it to his needs. The guilds fight internally between the forces pulling them toward or away from Bolas's influence.
Here are the event details:
Start time: 6:30pm
Entry Fee: $35

description:
Heritage tour at the Haunted Inverlochy House, Celebrate Halloween with a cuppa and a historic tour of the haunted Inverlochy House. Inverlochy House is a Victorian mansion designed by local architect Thomas Turnbull for a prominent local family in the late 1870s. In the early 1900s until 1980 it was divided into nine flats and known as the Inverlochy Flats. Since 1987 it has been the home of Inverlochy Art School. Inverlochy House has had a reputation for being haunted since the 1970s and has been the subject of an ongoing paranormal investigation by several NZ and international groups over the years.

Tour runs for approximately one hour. Stay in town to enjoy dinner at the local cafes in Te Aro.

description:
Jonathan Kay - Massey University Lecturer/Master of Fine Arts Coordinator, Jonathan Kay is a photographic artist, researcher, and lecturer based at Massey University in Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington. His work explores the intersection of art and science, using photography to reveal the unseen and challenge conventional notions of landscape. Over the past seven years, his research has focused on developing a site-specific and responsive approach to photographic interventions within the landscape.
Drawing inspiration from scientific 'fieldwork,' Kay’s practice involves close observation and data collection, using these methods to uncover new insights into specific environments. However, his approach extends beyond the typical scientific framework by leveraging the unique possibilities of the photographic medium. This process enables him to move beyond the traditional, idealized representation of landscapes, offering deeper, more complex interpretations.
September 25, Tararua Tramping Club (4 Moncrieff St, Mt Victoria), Doors Open at 7pm
If you’re curious about the Wellington Photographic Society, you’re welcome to attend two meetings for free before deciding whether to join. It’s a great way to meet the community and see what we’re all about!
https://wps.wps.org.nz/

description:
Meet the Moa, Come meet Nunu, the friendly moa puppet! Nunu will be roaming the garden during two special sessions: 11:00–11:45am and 12:15–1:00pm. Feed him some leaves, give him a cuddle, and enjoy this fun, interactive experience bringing Wellington’s prehistoric past to life.
Nunu will be roaming around the Collections, this is the top section around the Visitors Centre and overt he canopy walkway to below the lookout. You can pick up an Ōtari Native Botanic Garden brochure and map at any entrance.
This event is part of the Wellington Gardens Te Wā o te Kōanga - Spring Festival 2025. Join us in celebrating spring with free events throughout September. Full line-up on our website.

description:
Monthly Life Drawing, Unleash your artistic side at our koha Life Drawing sessions, hosted monthly at the Gallery.
With a mix of timed short and long poses, you are invited to bring your own materials or use the basic supplies we provide.
The sessions run from 2 pm to 4 pm—please arrive early to set up. We'll take a short kaputī break halfway through. This is a koha event, with all contributions going directly to our models. Friends and whānau are welcome!
Accessibility Information: The New Zealand Portrait Gallery is an accessible venue, all on one level. There is an accessible wharepaku at the back of the venue. The gallery has automatic sliding doors and glass doors that can be pushed or pulled to enter. We have a wheelchair available for use within the gallery, and there is low stool seating throughout. If you have any questions regarding accessibility or if there is something we could do to make your visit easier, please get in touch.

description:
NZAC Wellington: Three Terrific Talks, This section night we're delighted to host four of our wonderful club members to share three talks on their respective adventures this alpine season.

Talk one: Cumulonimbus Corner by James Sales
James tells us about his trip up the Cumulonimbus corner on the South Face of Girdlestone, a tricky ascent requiring skills in rock and ice climbing!
Talk two: Taranaki East Ridge by Jon Keyzer
A group trip whittled down to two. Jon tells us about the mission up Taranaki's infamous East Ridge, the decision to keep going and the challenging conditions at the top.
Talk three: Angelus Hut - Leon Lim & Jim
Leon and Jim tell us about their adventure to Angelus Hut just last weekend! A trip down south and three days in the stunning Nelson Lakes area.

Join us for these exciting talks and our usual section night pizzas
We look forward to seeing you there!
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025, New Zealand Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025 – Upper Hutt


Get ready for the cutest competition in New Zealand – the Nationwide Guinea Pig Double Show 2025, happening in Upper Hutt on Saturday, 11th October 2025. This one-of-a-kind event brings together pet lovers, breeders, and guinea pig enthusiasts from across the country for a full day celebrating our much-loved cavies.

Hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs in collaboration with the Capital Cavy Club, the show features two major events in one day:

Pedigree Guinea Pig Show – showcasing the very best cavies bred to national standards.
Pet Guinea Pig Show – where family pets take the spotlight for their charm, personality, and cuteness.
Whether you’re a seasoned exhibitor, a first-time participant, or simply a guinea pig fan, this is the perfect opportunity to:

- Meet and connect with other guinea pig owners and breeders.
- Learn more about cavy care, breeds, and showing standards.
- Enjoy a fun family-friendly day out in the heart of Upper Hutt.
- See some of New Zealand’s most beautiful and beloved guinea pigs.


Event Details:
Date: Saturday, 11th October 2025
Venue: Upper Hutt Uniting Parish, 1 Benzie Avenue, Upper Hutt
Time: 9:30am arrival for the main show | Pet Show starts at 2:00pm

Exhibitors from all cavy clubs across New Zealand are welcome, with special sections for junior members and pet owners.

With support from Topflite and hosted by North Canterbury Guinea Pigs, the Nationwide Cavy Show is one of the biggest guinea pig events in New Zealand – and one you won’t want to miss!

New Year Camp at Paraparaumu Beach, New Year Camp at Paraparaumu Beach
Join us for a relaxed New Years camp at Paraparaumu Beach Sea Scouts site. Its just a short walk to the beach, estuary and local shops, and beside a large park and sports area.
The site is suitable for tents and camping vehicles. The scout hall has toilets, a shower and a basic kitchen.

There is limited space on the site, so if you are planning to camp with us, please RSVP in advance using the button below.

$5 per adult per night for members. $8 for non-members. Children free and discounted rate of $4 per night for members who bring children with them.

description:
One Drop Taproom Takeover at the Horseshoe, We're super excited about our first tap takeover and are going all out with deals, competitions and entertainment. Lots to share so read on for the details or TLDR *Like *Tag your mates *Share *Come along!

The main event:
7 beers on from star Sydney brewery One Drop Brewing Co. This brewery has a large cult following and made a great name for itself internationally, only occasionally available in NZ. How did we get them... let's just say we have connections.

Accommodation:
Want to attend from out of town? We have teamed up with Copthorne Solway Park to offer a great bed and breakfast special for $140 (based on two adults), available between Oct 16th and 22nd. Call or book direct with the code 'ONEDROP'. We've even arranged pick up from the hotel on Saturday and we can drop you back. Too easy!

Competitions:
*Like this post
*Tag friends you'd like to attend with
* Share this post
You could win a weekend for two at the Copthorne Solway Park for this event, winner announced Oct 16th. Plus we have four $50 vouchers up for grabs! We'll let you know if you got one of those on the 17th.

Entertainment:
The Featherston Vinyl Club will be spinning the disks for us all, these folks are presently fund raising for a New sound system so Koha is appreciated!

The Beers:
Pints range from only $11 to $17!
We only have 20 Litres of most of these so they WILL run out, luckily we also have these (and more) in cans for drink in or takeaway.
Walk a Talk - 6% Hazy IPA
Home Land and Sea 2 - 8.2% IIPA - Colab with Garage Project
Chill Pils - 4.2% Czech Pils
Do You Know Better - 6.4% Smoothie Sour Ale
Built For This - 6.5% Penta-fruited Sour Ale
Courtside - 6.1% Smoothie Cream Sour Ale
Watermelon Double Take - 10.1% Fruit Sour

See you at The Horseshoe Taproom on the 18th!

description:
One Night, Two Lit Events, ONE NIGHT, TWO LIT EVENTS
Bad Diaries Salon + Starling’s 10th Birthday
Verb is thrilled to host two sparkling events in one night this November with our tremendous friends, Bad Diaries Salon and Starling. A fresh batch of bad diaries will start the evening, followed by a line-up of not one, not ten, but twenty poets in celebration of Starling’s 20th issue and 10th birthday.

You have the option of coming to either event but you know you want to come to both. There will be cake! 
___
Friday 7 November at Meow. 
Tickets: $15 for one event / $25 for both. 
Verb Community members receive a 10% discount (check your ReVerb e-newsletter for the discount code, or email community@verbwellington.nz)
BAD DIARIES SALON – STAR 
6pm – 7pm, Friday 7 November at Meow
Tickets: $15 (or purchase the double-bill ticket for $25 and go to Starling’s birthday party, too)
Four courageous, starry writers – Kate Camp, Jo Randerson, Michelle Duff and Elizabeth Knox – read from their unpublished diaries on the salon theme, STAR. This is Verb's eighth annual edition of Bad Diaries Salon, hosted by Tracy Farr. What happens in salon stays in salon, so come, witness, celebrate.
Bad Diaries Salon is raw, raucous, unedited and candid: the written word, rediscovered and shared.
Starling: RELAY
7.30pm–9pm, Friday 7 November at Meow
Tickets: $15 (or purchase the double-bill ticket for $25 and go to Bad Diaries Salon, too)
Join us to celebrate TEN YEARS of Starling with a relay of readers from Issue 20 through to Issue 1. An evening of infectious energy, this is also the sign-off for editors Francis Cooke and Louise Wallace, handing over to the incomparable Tate Fountain and Maddie Ballard. A new chapter of Starling awaits!

description:
Paint and Wine Night in Waikanae - The Bach, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Mt Maunganui! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: FRIST DRINK IS INCLUDED IN THE TICKET PRICE

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

If you're keen to read some of your own original material, come sign up at 6:30pm, or express interest by emailing wesleywritesthings@gmail.com. Performance spots are 6 mins each. Bring poetry (or read something else you've written, like a short story) and koha for the venue please!

description:
Poetry Slam: Regional Heat #1, This PIM event is a Poetry Slam! The first of three regional heats leading to the regional finals at the National Library on October 11th.
This Poetry In Motion Slam is the first heat for the 2025 Wellington Poetry Slam Champs. The top three scoring poets from this event will gain a spot in the regional finals!
Poets who want to sign up for the slam, please drop an email to:
travis.cottreau@gmail.com
subject: slam heat #1
What is a slam?
A Poetry Slam is a competitive poetry event where poets compete for points. Five random audience members are tasked with being the judges and they score each poem out of 10 to one decimal place.
The number of poets involved and number of rounds can change event-to-event, but there are some universal rules – no props, no costumes, poems must be three minutes or less, poets must read original work, and no punching down or hate speech.
Price on the door is $5
The top four poets from each heat will go through to the Wellington Poetry Slam Champs at the National Library of New Zealand on October 11th.
Other heats:
Sunday the 21st Sept
Thursday the 2nd October
Finals: Saturday, 11th October.

description:
Pre Paid Carparking tickets, Get your Sky Stadium car park sorted in advance for the Blackcaps v England ODI on Saturday 1 November. Secure your spot early and avoid the hassle of finding a park on the day.
If you require a mobility car park space, please complete the online form here.
Online parking sales close one hour prior to the car park open time.
Car parking EZY tickets will need to be printed and be ready to show on your arrival to the car park. Once parked, please display clearly on your dashboard.
Standard size vehicles only up to 2m wide x 5.4m long x 2.2m high. Larger vehicles may be turned away at the owners' risk. Please contact Sky Stadium in advance should you wish to bring a large vehicle.
Please note: parking refunds will only be given if the match is called off prior to gates opening.
Car park open: 10:00am
Gates open: 12:30pm
Match starts: 2:00pm

description:
Pukeahu Archaeology Tour, What lies beneath Pukeahu?
The construction of Pukeahu National War Memorial Park revealed a wealth of archaeological discoveries, some expected, others surprising.
Join Principal Archaeologists Sarah Phear and Richard Shakles from Underground Overground Archaeology for a special guided tour of the park. Hear firsthand about the excavation process, uncover the stories behind the artefacts, and view a selection of conserved items unearthed from beneath Pukeahu.
The tour begins at the fountain below the Tomb of the Unknown Warrior.
This is an accessible tour. Bring clothing for the weather and any burning questions.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Pukeahu Park Tour, Whether you visit Pukeahu every Anzac Day or pass through on your daily commute, have you ever paused to look closer?
Join us for a walk through the park led by an expert guide, and gain a deeper understanding of Pukeahu, the memorials, and the people they honour.

This special guided tour covers a broad range of narratives, whether you’re interested in design and architecture, place-based histories or want to reflect on New Zealand’s military experiences. This tour will leave you with a lasting understanding of why Pukeahu is such a significant place for all New Zealanders.

The tour begins at the fountain below the Tomb of the Unknown Warrior.
This is an accessible tour. Bring clothing for the weather and any burning questions.
label: Hobbies & Interests

This year marks 50 years since the establishment of SGI in Guam — a powerful milestone in our movement for peace and happiness!
To commemorate this historic occasion, the SGINZ General Meeting will be held - broadcast live to Whare Soka Buddha!
Let’s gather together in unity and determination as we soar towards 2030 with hope and courage.
Everyone is warmly invited to join us at the Whare for this special event!
Let’s be the sunrise that brightens the future!

description:
Social Sewing Saturday - November, Social Sewing Saturday - November
Come join us for a fun filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts and Crafts!

About this Event

Come join us for a fun-filled day of sewing and socializing at Karori Arts & Crafts! Whether you're a seasoned pro or just starting out, this event is perfect for anyone who loves to sew. Bring your latest project or start something new - either way, you'll have a blast chatting with fellow sewing enthusiasts. Bring your current project or get inspired by others' creations at our friendly gathering. Share tips, tricks, and stories while working on our projects together.
Don't forget to pack your sewing machine, fabric, and any other supplies you'll need. We can't wait to see what you create! You will need to bring your own machine and materials. Please bring an extension lead and multipoint box if you have one. (Don't worry, though—we have some in the centre, too!) We'll supply an iron and ironing board to share, as well as a table and relatively comfy chair each. There are also spare cutting-out tables at a taller height. You are welcome to come along and work on hand-sewing projects.
A kitchen is available on site and supermarkets as well as cafes are very close by.Parking is free and there are 3 dedicated spaces for the centre as well as others closeby.
Cost: Free for members of the Karori Arts Centre or $15 per person payable directly to KACC. (Membership of the centre is $105 annually and also gives you reductions on classes and access to other groups)
Please do NOT attend if you are sick (even just a little bit!)
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
Special event - Herd Bathing, A Sharing of my horse herd in a unique experience - enjoying being in amongst a gentle herd of horses and sharing the afternoon, just being together.
Join me for a peaceful experience of being among my 8 horses. Soaking up their special presence, enjoying the country sounds while having a moment away from our busy lives. A moment to slow everything down and connect with a horse in a very different way.
(No horse experience necessary. )
This is approx 1.5 hour event. After a safety briefing we will enter the herds space, down by the river. There will be seats available or you can bring your own.
$50 per person, max 8 people in one sitting.
You will be in amongst 8 horses so wear appropriate clothing for the weather, and good footwear ie warm jackets and closed shoes/gumboots. Welcome to bring a blanket to keep warm. Will be postponed if weather isn’t suitable.
Looking forward to this

Message me to register

description:
Spelljammer and Beyond Campaign, Spelljammer and Beyond Campaign
Welcome to the Astral Sea - the starlit realm that surrounds the worlds of the Dungeons & Dragons multiverse. When a cosmic enemy threatens to destroy their world, brave heroes must do everything in their power to save it. This quest will take them across the teeming oceans of Wildspace to the silvery void of the Astral Sea and beyond.

Can they save their world before time runs out?

Matthew Gee (He/him) is a friendly and welcoming DM to anyone who pulls up a chair. If you're looking for engaging adventures look no further! Happy to put on a show with character voices and indulge party shenanigans, while still hooking you into the ongoing narrative and challenging the party through roleplay, lore, traps and maybe a puzzle or two. With a mixture of theater of the mind and mini combat there's never a dull moment in his games. Matthew has a wealth of experience DM'ing numerous genres and systems to create immersive and entertaining sessions for all ages.

Sit back and enjoy being taken on a detailed tour of the night sky with our high-definition laser projectors.

- Access to Space Place’s galleries and interactive exhibits
- 20% discount at Space Place Shop

description:
Talk the Walk: Preparing for An Overnight Tramp, This talk is aimed at people considering their first overnight tramp. Celia Wade-Brown walked Te Araroa in 2017, and will be leading the Wairarapa Walking Festival two-day tramp from Waiohine to Holdsworth on 21st - 22nd November 2025. Celia will bring her overnight backpack and show the gear she is taking on the tramp.

The talk will cover: food and drink, hut wear, toileting tips, keeping your sleeping bag dry, emergency communications, and looking after your feet.

Bring your questions!
Adam Philps from Masterton Foot Clinic, a festival sponsor will be joining us to talk feet and things to consider.

Murray Johnston, chair of Wairarapa Land Search and Rescue will also be speaking. Please bring a gold coin to donate to WaiLandSAR.

Please register for this session.

description:
The Dancing & Drinking Society plus support - William Jackmann, The Dancing & Drinking Society (or DADS for short), is New Zealand’s premier exponent of authentic 1920s Blues & Jass.
Their repertoire includes many of the Rags, Rambles, Shuffles, Drags, and Blues that our great-grandparents would have shimmied to in the juke joints, speakeasies, woolsheds and Memorial Halls of 1920s New Zealand.
Although this combo has a mere 4 members, it has the impact of a full Syncopating-Orchestra, with multiple instruments being played simultaneously by multiple band members.
Blair “Sweet-Lips” Latham - Clarinet, Bass Clarinet, Tenor Saxophone
Mat “Mon Colonel” Enright - Trumpet, Resonator Guitar, Vocals
Adrian “AJ” Jensen - Gypsy Guitar, Bass Drum
Daniel “Pappy” Yeabsley -Tuba, Hi-Hat.
William Jackman will be supporting He will be on at 8.30, and The DADS about 9.15.

Join 150+ party-goers in freaky costumes as we crawl through the best party bars in town

About this Event

THE EPIC ZOMBIE BAR TOUR!
Saturday 1st November

Wellington’s BIGGEST ZOMBIE Bar Tour
Prepare yourself for a spine-chilling night like no other! Get ready to experience the ultimate Halloween thrill with 150+ party-goers, all dressed in their freakiest, blood-curdling costumes, crawling through Wellington's best party bars. This event will leave you shaking in your boots while having the time of your (undead) life!
The night kicks off at Vinyl Bar, where you'll be transported to a haunted 1980s retro-themed Halloween drink experience that will have your hair standing on end. Then we creep up Courtenay Place to the Saint Diablo for a Mexican "Day of the Dead" fiesta that will have your soul howling for more. From there, we'll descend into the darkness of Shady Lady, where the scariest surprises lurk around every corner.
But it doesn’t end there! The ghostly tour continues with a visit to El Barrio for another sinister "Day of the Dead" celebration. Finally, brace yourself as we crawl to our final destination, Eva Pub, for Wellington's BIGGEST Halloween Party, where DJ DKAV and special guests will be delivering electrifying beats that will raise the dead!

description:
The Napier Escape, The Napier Escape
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in December 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.

Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.

Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.

The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.

Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.

- A Deco Deep Dive - a look into Napier's Art Deco history and culture and a tour of the city!

- Sip and Savour - Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.

- Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace.

Ticket pricing start at...

Departing Paekakariki/Paraparaumu/Waikanae/Otaki/Levin
Adult 13+ yrs - $159
Child 2-12yrs - $139

Departing Palmerston North/Woodville
Adult 13+ yrs - $139
Child 2-12yrs - $119

More info and tickets available at www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/

description:
Thorburn 1K - Community Weeding Competition, Kia ora e te whanau!
We kick off the community weeding season with a competition: The Thorburn 1k. Evergreen buckthorn - or Rhamnus alaternus - is a big threat to te taiao on Te Raekaihau. It prevents native plants from establishing by forming dense stands of salt and wind tolerant bushes that grow on steep escarpments. Join us to help remove 1000 of these plants across two weeding sessions! A point schedule helps you to get motivated and compete for the highly coveted Thorburn 1k medal.
Please meet at the intersection of Te Ranga-a-Hiwi and Ruru tracks. We will provide tools and gloves but please bring your own if you have some. We will finish at the Alice Krebs lodge for hot drinks and kai and there will be time for community consultation.
In the event of bad weather forecast, the day will be moved forward to Saturday.

description:
Urbanerds October - Ngāti Toa Developments, Urbanerds Special Guest - Ngāti Toa Developments

*Urbanerds is a community of people who build epic cities.*

What started as a regular drinks catchup with like-minded nerdy friends has become a movement for growing epic towns and cities, from the citizens up. We have chapters around New Zealand (and soon the world!) that meet regularly to jam, discuss, envision, feel into and nerd out what better urban living could look like.

We're into: Kids on bikes, street parties, affordable homes, belonging, universal accessibility, knowing your neighbour, indigenous urbanism, green infrastructure, effortless public transport, beautiful buildings, thriving streets, urban civics, spaces that kids find exciting!

description:
WAS October meeting: The Science of Science Fiction - Prof. Jan Eldridge, WAS October 2025 Society meeting
Anyone is welcome to come along to this presentation.
Also accessible online through Zoom.
https://us06web.zoom.us/j/86837857650...
This month's meeting will contain the following:
1. Night sky in October
2. Astronomy News
3. Main talk at 7:50 pm
Title: The Science of Science Fiction - Professor Jan Eldridge
From Lost in Space and The Jetsons to Interstellar, the science behind science fiction films and television series is pretty variable, ranging from rubbish to … quite interesting. Much of it is simply an adjunct to the special effects.The great writers (Jules Verne, H.G. Wells, Isaac Asimov, Arthur C. Clarke, Philip K. Dick, Robert Heinlein, Ursula le Guin, Richard Morgan, William Gibson, and Neal Stephenson) have expanded our views of what could be. Often their work did not survive contact with Hollywood.
A few films and TV series are truly memorable: 'Beam me up, Scotty!’; ‘The red pill’; 'Exterminate!’; and ‘It’s life, Jim – but not as we know it.’ But the books are better.
This month’s speaker is an esteemed astrophysicist (and neither a replicant nor a sleeve) who can provide a detailed rationale for her views.
label: Hobbies & Interests

description:
WCC "Tequila and Salsa night!", WCC "Tequila and Salsa night!"
Hello again bartenders from all walks of life! Brush up on your Tequila knowledge and your Salsa recipes because the next Wellington Cocktail Competition is just around the corner!
As to the theme for this WCC, it is “Tequila and Salsa food pairing” The hero spirit this time around will be a surprise tequila on the night, but I can tell you it will be a reposado. The catch is, you have to pair it with a salsa that you make yourself. There are no limits on the style of cocktail you want this time around, so get creative!
If you would like to participate, get in touch with me or Dan ASAp as we were running low on time to organize this time around.
Minimum 30ml of Tequila must be used in the drink and as always must be the hero spirit of the night.
You will be making two drinks for the judges to try and 5 minutes to make two servings of your cocktail and serve your salsa.
The judges may also be coerced with bribes and favours during your presentation.
The event will be on 28th of September and the competition will start at 6pm.
If you have any questions about the competition, please ask either me or Dan.
The main aim of this cocktail competition is to help those who may not have entered comps before, gain a bit of confidence and experience, or for people who haven’t entered a comp in a while, to shake off those cobwebs.
It also a chance to meet new people and introduce newcomers to the Wellington bar scene. Most of all the idea is to have fun!
Each competitor will have 5 minutes to make and present two servings of their drink.
All Tequila and corn chips for your salsa will be provided, but you will have to source your own ingredients including citrus and sugar syrup. Glassware and ice will be provided, you are more than welcome to bring specialty equipment and ingredients, however you will be marked on how easy your drink is to replicate.
The competition will be judged by a panel of 3 judges. While knowing your stuff is important, brand knowledge is not the key here. This comp is to engage bartenders in a fun comp environment, so drink and personality are just as important.
Competitors will be first come first serve, so message either me or Dan if you want to be entered, there are 10 spots for the night and there will be prizes for the winner.
There will be drink deals on the night, and make sure you bring your friends, workmates, parents ect ect to cheer you on and heckle the other competitors…
See you all there!

description: Watch the Stars Megagame, In Watch the Stars, players represent governments that are members of a galactic council, struggling to resolve their competing interests in trade and colonisation, while at the same time facing a crisis caused by mysterious raids on border colonies. Players are in teams of 2-4 people, with game roles focused on leadership, military command, trade and economic development, and scientific research. Gameplay can be frenetic, with strict time limits on diplomatic negotiations, and no two megagames will every be alike, as players can create special actions in every game.

description:
Watercolour Basics, A chance to experiment with watercolour paints and different sorts of paper - no experience needed and all materials provided.

Find out more about the fascinating medium that is watercolour. No experience is required - you'll look at your favourite landscape and portrait artists and learn to be more confident with watercolour as you develop your own style.

All materials included in course fee.

By the end of the course, you'll be able to:
- Pencil a basic sketch with simple perspective
- Demonstrate the workings of watercolour brushes and paint
- Describe the different weights of paper and their effects
- Gain more insight into the use of colour
- Become more confident in the watercolour medium

4 weeks,
Presented by Charlotte Hird.

description:
Watercolour Paint and Wine Night in Wellington - Midnight Kitty, The concept is simple - take a brush in one hand, a drink in the other and let’s paint a masterpiece!

Join us for a creative night of drinking and painting in the heart of Wellington! No previous painting experience necessary. Get your creative juices flowing and your brush strokes going!

Drinks: NO DRINKS are included in the ticket price, but drinks are available for purchase.

Food: A delicious menu will be available to purchase throughout the event.

What is Paintvine?
It’s a fun social painting class where our artists will run you through step-by-step instructions on how to create your very own masterpiece in a fun and relaxed bar setting. Perfect for dates, catching up with mates or for meeting new friends!

We provide all the materials you need (high-quality canvas, acrylic paint, brushes). All you need to bring is your creative spirit (or find some at the bottom of a glass). At the end of the night you will leave with your own painting ready to hang up on your wall.

For tickets, future events, FAQs and more info head to the Paintvine website.

description:
Wellington Heritage Festival - Crematorium Open Day, Built in 1982, Whenua Tapu Crematorium is a beautiful facility that has served thousands of families.

Hear about the history of the chapel and what it’s like to operate a crematorium from the staff that operate it. You can also do a walk-through of the crematorium (optional).

Cremation is the common choice in NZ when it comes to death, with over 70% of Kiwis choosing it. Traditionally Māori and Pacifica families always chose burial, however there is a slow change happening in that space also. We are passionate about de mystifying what cremation is so families can feel informed about the choices they make.

Come along as we open Whenua Tapu Crematorium to the public and answer any questions you may have.

description:
Wellington Motogymkhana, Wondered what Moto Gymkhana is?
Keen to build confidence on your bike and improve your handling skills?
One of the hundred people who have "always been meaning to check it out"? Then this Thursday is your night! Come join us at the Tawa Outlet Mall for an evening of Motogymkhana.
All skill levels are welcome. We've designed beginner course for the summer, that isn't too technical and is a good introduction to the sport. (We've even tested it with a new rider!) And if anyone is struggling, we have a group of well-practiced riders to give you some pointers and help you out. Our only expectation is you're confident to ride on the road. The rest should come with a little bit of Thursday night practice.
If you're not comfortable doing it on your own pride and joy, there are club bikes that can be rented for the night. We just ask for a donation to help us cover rent, fuel and broken levers.
Unfortunately, due to changes in our circumstances this year, we're a little short on cash-flow, and are asking for a gold-coin donation from anyone riding to help keep the lights on.

description:
Wellington NZIPP Annual 10-10-10 Evening, The annual 10-10-10 NZIPP evening is a wonderfully varied and fascinating look at photography from around the Wellington region.

Ten photographers. Ten images. Ten minutes.

You’ll hear from ten photographers for ten minutes each, showcasing ten images from their portfolio. It’s an engaging show-and-tell style night, with something for anyone interested in photography.

Join us from 6.30pm for a 7pm start at the Penthouse Cinema in Brooklyn. There will be a short break halfway through for pizza, with non-alcoholic drinks provided and buy-your-own alcoholic beverage options from the Penthouse bar.

We’ll be introducing this year’s presenters one by one, so keep an eye on our Facebook page for details.

The evening is always popular, so make sure you register to reserve your ticket and encourage your friends too. We’d love to fill the cinema for our ten photographers!

This is an awesome social occasion for the NZIPP and wider photography community.

description:
World Chase Tag Casual Game Night, Come play Chase Tag at the Kilbirnie Recreation Center.
Come along to our casual game sessions. These will be open to anyone wanting to play and will be social, casual based rather than keeping score. We will play various versions of tag games: such as Ultimate Tag (which involves multiple evaders), Flight Club (which involves king of the hill format), and Chase-Off (the team version, as seen in World Chase Tag competition videos).
World Chase Tag was formed by Christian Devaux in 2012 after a game of Tag with his son in their back garden. A year later, he was joined by his brother, Damien, and together they set about turning the oldest game into the newest sport.

Cost:
-$4.50

description:
Zamageddon October 17-19 2025, Zamageddon 2025 - Team, Lock in the dates of 17th to 19th of October, because Zamageddon is on again. Details are still to be confirmed but the high level itinerary is -
17th - Cambridge Hotel for wolf juice and a couple of red bulls, prior to heading out to Mish Mosh for a couple of quiet low alcohol beverages and some food before retiring and getting good nights rest before the most anticipated game of the year
18th - because no one actually has any self discipline in this club, everyone stumbles out of the Cambo at around 10am for a bus to the Rimutaka Tavern where we arrive at around 11am for a few stretches before the game at upper hutt for a 12 pm kick off. From there its back to the Cambo to re-hydrate before heading out again.
19th - typically everyone drags their sorry souls to the airport (broken bones or not) for the relaxing flight back to Auckland with foggy details being "remembered" and discussed for the next 12 months before doing it all again.
If you are interested, Please reach out to Preston Marra or myself to confirm attendance as we will need to finalise numbers and costs sooner rather than later.
Lets make this year a big one! We already have a number of people who have booked flights, so get in early so you don't miss out.
Cheers!
Kyle

description:
A Marvellous Miramar Christmas: 29 November (3 sessions), We've designed a Christmas experience for the whole family!
Come along and get into the Christmas spirit by joining in a marvellous Miramar Christmas extravaganza! As a family, come along and enter our amazing, indoor, interactive Christmas festival!
Enjoy hands-on crafts and activities together, get into some fun games at your own pace, listen and singalong to live music, let the younger tamariki have their space in a free-play area, tuck into our delish loaded free hot chocolates and cookie bar, get your annual whanau photo in our dress up photobooth, hear Christmas stories, take time to remember someone special at the remembrance tree... and many more merry and marvellous festivities!
Timing note: This year's Christmas event is a 'go-at-your-own-pace' session and you are welcome to leave when needed. Sessions/festival conclude 90mins after the start time.
Market note: While this event is designed to feel like a Christmas market/fair or festival - all experiences and crafts while in your session have no additional cost/are included. The only fee is the initial ticket fee.

TICKET DETAILS:
A Marvellous Miramar Christmas is all about getting into the Christmas spirit - our hope is that we can support families in the Miramar community through this event!
Tickets are $3 per child or adult / $13 for a group of 5.
Please note: if you require more than 5 tickets, please add any additional individual or group tickets to make up your group total.
All proceeds from this event will go towards providing Christmas gifts and support for families in the Miramar community. Thank you for your support!
Simply book tickets for your prefered session using this website! Please reserve tickets for any adults AND kids attending.


SESSION TIMES:
There are three A Marvellous Miramar Christmas sessions over the weekend. Each session is up to 90mins.
Saturday 29 November: 9.30 - 11am
Saturday 29 November: 11am - 12.30pm
Saturday 29 November: 1.30pm - 3pm
Please note: All children under the age of 13 must be accompanied by an adult.

RESERVE YOUR TICKETS ONLINE TODAY!
 Any queries, contact us on Facebook or email miramar.corps@salvationarmy.org.nz or call 04 388 8284

The Craft Fair will be a unique display of gifted craftspeople from around NZ exhibiting their work in a beautiful environment.

Wellington Naturist Club is holding a Craft Day to celebrate its 75th Anniversary.

You can also take a tour of the gardens, a guided bush walk or browse the plant stall and find something for your garden. Tea and coffee will be available for a gold coin donation.

The craft fair will be held rain or shine and will be a clothed event for our members and visitors.


Cost: Free
Event information here: https://wellingtonheritagefestival.co.nz/event/wellington-naturist-club-artisan-craft-fair/


Health & Safety:
Sturdy footwear if undertaking the bush walks.

description:

The Artisan Craft Market is a premium handmade event that takes place across various locations in the broader Wellington region. This high-quality market is designed to foster a welcoming and friendly atmosphere.

Our vision at Artisan Craft Market is to make the market accessible to those who appreciate shopping locally. We aim to provide a platform that supports local artisans, allowing them to showcase their meticulously crafted, high-quality products. By bringing the market directly to the people, we hope to celebrate and promote the unique talents of our community’s skilled artisans.

description:
Creepy Cute Market - Halloween Special, The Creepy Cute Market – Halloween Edition
Saturday 25 October 2025 | 9:30am – 2:30pm
Level 1, Thistle Hall, Upper Cuba Street, Wellington
Back by popular demand, the Creepy Cute Market returns for a Halloween special, and this time we're teaming up with the Skullduggery Art Show at Thistle Hall to bring you a delightfully eerie day of art, oddities, and all things spooky-sweet!
Explore a curated collection of stalls featuring:
Alternative & pastel goth fashion
Handmade jewellery with creepy or whimsical twists
Spooky-cute original art, prints & stickers
Unique homewares & decor (think skull planters, bat pillows, potion bottles)
Horror-kawaii plushies & accessories
Candles, curiosities & mystical creations
Gothic baked goods & Halloween-themed treats
Whether you're into dark aesthetics, cute oddities, or just love Halloween, this market is the perfect place to find something a little weird, a little wonderful, and totally one-of-a-kind.
Free entry |
Costumes encouraged |
All ages welcome
label: Markets & Fairs

description:
Creepy Cute Market, The Creepy Cute Market Returns to Wellington!
Get ready, Wellington! The Creepy Cute Market is coming back to town!
When: Saturday, 30 August 2025, 9:30am – 2:30pm
Where: Thistle Hall, Upper Cuba Street, Wellington
Indulge your love for the weird, whimsical, and wonderfully wicked at a market where spooky meets sweet. After a hauntingly successful run last time, we're thrilled to return with even more delightfully dark treasures for all you macabre-loving misfits.
Expect:
Spine-tingling art & prints
Spooktacular fashion & accessories
Morbidly cute homewares
Handcrafted oddities by local makers
And everything your gothic heart desires
Whether you're a long time lover of the bizarre or just creepily curious, this market is for you. Meet fellow oddity enthusiasts, shop from passionate creators, and embrace your spooky side in the heart of Wellington.
Free entry | All ages welcome | Costumes encouraged!
Don’t miss the return of the Creepy Cute Market. It's going to be wicked fun.

HELL-O-WEEK & FRIDAY FLASH DAY @ CUBA STREET TATTOO, Join us this Halloween week 2025 at Cuba Street Tattoo!
We love the spooky season and have decided to this year make a party of it with lots of specials on piercings, flash tattoos, and even offering UV tattoos for the week only!
The entire week will comprise of our *new* shirts at discount price, flash deals, and of
course candy to be had!
On Friday the 31st Flash Day *all* piercings are $50 and to finish off the week we are hosting a Halloween afterparty and dress up competition at our mates Rouge and Vagabond just across the street beginning at 7:30PM, with giveaways and even prizes to be won for 1st, 2nd and 3rd place for best dressed including tattoo vouchers, bar tabs and lots of other fun free things in prizes.
Bring all your mates and celebrate with us, we look forward to having you!

description:
Hutt Japan Day 2025, Hutt Japan Day is back!

Join us for a vibrant celebration of Japanese culture at the Hutt Japan Day festival, held at the Lower Hutt Town Hall, Dowse Square & Dowse Art Gallery on Sunday, 9 November.

Celebrating 30 Years of Friendship
This year's event is extra special, marking 30 years of partnership with Minoh City, our sister city in Osaka, Japan. The festival is organised by the Hutt Minoh House Friendship Trust, with support from the Hutt City Council and the Embassy of Japan.

What’s on offer?
• Be captivated by an array of Japanese performances and demonstrations
• Engage in hands-on activities and workshops
• Immerse yourself in the exhilarating rhythms of taiko drumming
• Indulge in delectable Japanese cuisine from one of our food vendors/stalls
• Explore our market area for unique Japanese treasures

Save the Date - Sunday, 9 November 2025
Lower Hutt Town Hall, Dowse Square & The Dowse Art Museum
We look forward to celebrating the richness of Japanese culture with you!

description:

Nestled against the charming backdrop of Khandallah Town Hall, this vibrant market is the perfect place to explore an eclectic mix of arts, crafts, plants, and unique gifts.
Discover a wide variety of high-quality items from talented local stallholders, including:
• Beautiful plants, fresh flowers, and seedlings
• Handcrafted jewellery, clothing, bags, and accessories
• Cozy crochet and knitted toys, wool products, and homewares
• Scented candles, skincare, soaps, and wheat bags
• Pottery, ceramics, wooden products, and carvings
• Pet accessories, baby and children's items, and much more!
Come enjoy the evening sun, sample delicious local food, and get a head start on your holiday shopping!
Most stalls will accept cash or Eftpos, but it's best to bring cash as well.
We look forward to seeing you there!

Oh The Horror! Spooky Halloween Craft, Trinket and Art Market (All Ages), Welcome to Oh! The Horror - A Spooky Halloween Market For All Ages!
Date: October 13, 2025
Time: 10:00 AM
Venue: Ngaio Town Hall, 1 Ottawa Road, Ngaio, Wellington 6035, New Zealand.
Calling all fans of the macabre and spooktacular! Get ready for a wickedly delightful experience at our Halloween market. From lollies for big and little monsters to an eerie assortment of wares, this event is a must-visit for all ages.
Dive into the underworld of horror with a tantalizing selection of items such as records, art illustrations, plushies, jewelry, horror DVDs, and more. Whether you're into face painting or fascinated by taxidermy and crystals, this market has something to invoke the dark side within.
Immerse yourself in the chilling ambiance as Mistress Vinyella from On The Record spins a delightfully moody playlist featuring iconic bands like Joy Division, Bauhaus, Sisters of Mercy, A Certain Ratio, and The Cramps. Let the music of the night guide you through the shadows of Halloween.

description:
Old St Paul's Craft & Curio Market, Discover Wellington’s Most Enchanting Market!
Set against the breathtaking backdrop of one of Te Whanganui-a-Tara’s most iconic heritage landmarks, the Old St Paul’s Craft & Curio Market is a boutique shopping experience like no other.
As part of this year’s Wellington Heritage Festival, the grounds of Old St Paul’s will be transformed into a vibrant marketplace filled with handpicked stalls offering treasures and treats you won’t find anywhere else. Explore lovingly crafted leather goods, upcycled garments, wellness creations, handmade chocolates, collectibles and curiosities, houseplants, dyed wool, children’s accessories, fine embroidery, jams and preserves, artisan breads and baked goods, Christmas decorations, candles, and so much more.
But it’s not just shopping – this is a day steeped in atmosphere. The lawn and forecourt will come alive with heritage-themed games and activities, alongside captivating live demonstrations from the Wellington Embroiderers’ Guild and the Wellington Combined Society of Bellringers.
With its central location just minutes from the Railway Station and bus hub – and plenty of on-street parking – this is your chance to enjoy a heritage day out that’s easy to get to, and unforgettable once you arrive.
Fun for the whole whānau, supporting the ongoing care of this national treasure.
Koha entry. Refreshments available.

description:
Plant Sale, I have had great success with NZ and imported seed propagation this year so we have a wonderful range of plants ready to go in the ground now.
Some varieties are extremely limited due to the cost of the imported seed and the tiny amount of seeds per packet (only 5 in some cases).
We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
$7.50 each or multiples of 3 $20
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale. We aim to open in approximately 5 weeks but it depends how the tulips progress.
As other plants reach maturity we will make them available for sale on our open days. We have decided to have a pre season sale to make room for more beauties.
Abutilon - a range of mixed colours including peach, rose and lemon.
Dwarf Agapanthus - a fine leaved pale blue variety. Great for edging paths and beds. Will not take over.
Aubretia - Lavender trailing plant for rock walls and garden edges.
Arabis - White blooming Spring groundcover
Ajuga - Pink and purple varieties. Great November blooming groundcover for damp areas.
Aster - Early summer flowering variety in blue/lavender
Calamintha - new for us so I shall borrow the Chiltern seeds description. This is a most pleasant plant for your border or herb garden. Heavily scented with a fragrance described as pennyroyal-like, it is an erect perennial with small, somewhat hairy leaves. In summer it bears numerous whorled spikes of tiny blue flowers with long purple bracts. The herb can be used for flavouring. Flowers the first year from seed. 1½ft (45cm).
Campanula glomerata - deep purple
Cerastium - grey trailing leaves smothered in white blooms in Spring. (These have just been cut back)
Cerinthe - By popular demand. Technically an annual but a non invasive self sowing one so once its in your garden you'll have more each year. Glaucous foliage and interesting pendular purple blooms.
Dianthus - Grey leaves and red blooms
Erigeron multiradiatus - A beautiful evergreen groundcover with yellow centred purple/blue daisies from late spring.
Erysimum - a specialty for us as we love them so much. What's not to love? Front to mid border, semi shrubby evergreen perennial, glorious scented blooms and we have individual named colours.
Ivory, Purple bi-colour, Fire King, Vulcan, Ellen Willmott, Primrose, Ruby gem, Siberian allionii and the brand new Tangerine Titan.
Euphorbia - golden foam. Another newbie for us but we love the the chartreuse euphorbias add to the garden so we had to give it a go.
Euphorbia characias - the blue leaved evergreen semi shrubs with huge chartreuse heads that grace our garden every spring.
Geum - Yes, you guessed it, another favourite of ours. We have a good stock of the common types plus some more unusual ones.
Tall - Yellow, Red and Orange (Firestorm).
Dwarf - Deep orange/red, Lemon with hints of pink, blush (very pale pink) and the original geum rivale in a beautiful coppery peach.
Lunaria (Honesty). Two types available. Chedglow the purple leaf version that has taken Chelsea by storm the last couple of years. Variegata - the green leaves become edged in white in their second year before blooming with the typical mauve flowers.
Lysimachia nummularis - yellow creeping jenny. Great lime leaf trailing plant for part shady damp areas. One only.
Orlaya grandiflora - another favourite among designers. A self sowing annual that will provide weeks of beautiful white lacecap flowers. Perfect for filling in border spaces until the summer perennials fill in or to give a light airy feel to meadows and spring plantings. Seedlings will return year after year.
Pelargonium - Deep red
Pulmonaria - Raspberry splash
Romulea - small bulbs grow fine grassy leaves before erupting into a mass of deep rosy purple crocus type flowers in late spring.
Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.

description:
Wellington Botanist Expo, Wellington, get ready for the ultimate green-meets-brews experience!

The Wellington Botanist Expo is hitting Brewtown, Upper Hutt on Sunday, 26 October 2025, and it's going to be a bloomin’ brilliant day out!

Whether you’ve got a jungle at home or you're just starting your plant parent journey, this is THE botanical event you don’t want to miss. Set in the heart of Brewtown, with its buzzing vibe and family-friendly fun, it’s your one-stop destination for plants, pints, and pure inspiration.

Here’s what’s waiting for you:

* A paradise of indoor & outdoor plants, seedlings, seeds & greenery galore
* Gorgeous pots, planters & plant accessories to style your space
* Stunning dried flower arrangements & botanical crafts
* Eye-catching garden sculptures, outdoor art & furniture ideas
* Unique creations from local artists & plant-loving crafters

And yes – it’s Brewtown, so there’s plenty of craft beer and good vibes to enjoy while you shop!

* Getting here is easy – hop on the train from Wellington City and arrive right at the venue, hassle-free.
* Ample FREE parking also available for drivers.
* Food, drinks & licensed venues onsite
* Family-friendly fun for all ages!

Come for the plants, stay for the brews, and leave totally inspired.

It’s the botanical event of the season – don’t miss out!

Entry: Free
Come and browse a treasure trove of vintage and modern fabric, patterns, haberdashery and sewing supplies. Whether you are a seasoned sewist, a quilter or just love collecting beautiful textiles, there is something for everyone.

description:
A night of jazz & deep house fused with live violin, A night of jazz & deep house fused with live violin
Presenting a specially curated set - a deeply emotive journey through funk, jazz and deep house to create a rich immersive soundscape, String House Project (SHP) brings their unique blend of jazz house fusion accompanied by live violin to Wellington.

Auckland DJ Lady Fee and Wellington violinist Ana Henderson unite their talents through a shared love of hypnotic beats, soaring melodies, and emotive dancefloor experiences. Lady Fee’s meticulously mixed sets are complimented by Ana’s classically trained violin, adding a soulful, improvisational edge, shaped by influences from Balkan folk and gypsy jazz to Americana and swing.

For this one-night-only show, they’re joined by Hunter (MAURI - Live Essence Events) and Stu (Sandwiches), bringing you an unforgettable night of infectious beats, grooves and heart felt celebration.

Tickets available at Undertheradar

https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/ticket/30381/String-House-Project.utr

description:
AWE Partnership Concert: Double Helix with Benjamin Baker and Yura Lee, Experience Double Helix with Benjamin Baker and Yura Lee!
NOTICE OF VENUE CHANGE: Venue changed to St Andrew's on the Terrace.
We’ll be hosting an intimate violin and viola recital of international talents Benjamin Baker and Yura Lee at one of Wellington's best-known chamber music venues in the heart of the CBD. Our recent venue change to St Andrew's on the Terrace has opened up more seats than originally planned for this concert, which we are rather excited about!
Opening with Chicago composer Augusta Read Thomas’ Double Helix, this programme explores how two equal spirits intertwine, navigating a shared musical journey like a spiraling helix. International award-winning violin and viola soloist Yura Lee joins AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for an intimate exploration of both instruments — together and apart — through works by Bach, Ysaÿe, Martinů, and Mozart, interwoven with music from Aotearoa by John Psathas and Salina Fisher.
Doors open 5.15pm, concert begins at 6pm. Approx end time 7pm. Tickets $55.
An Incredible Partnership with At The World's Edge Festival!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge (AWE) Festival, Orchestra Wellington is presenting a three-part series featuring AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee and AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for a mini-series of concerts and a masterclass here in Wellington in addition to featuring these incredible artists' live performances with us on our subscription series concerts in September and October!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
AWE Partnership Masterclass for Violists and Violinists with Yura Lee, Join us for a Masterclass!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge Festival, Orchestra Wellington will host AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee to present a masterclass for violinists and violists in Wellington.
Anyone can register to attend and observe the masterclass!
Visit https://orchestrawellington.co.nz/event/awe-masterclass-2025 to register to attend and observe the masterclass for FREE!
Violinist/violist Yura Lee is a multifaceted musician, as a soloist and as a chamber musician, and one of the very few that is equally virtuosic on both violin and viola. Her career spans three decades and takes her all over the world, captivating audiences through various musical mediums from baroque to modern, and enjoying a career that spans three decades and takes her all over the world. She has performed with major orchestras including those of New York, Chicago, Baltimore, Cleveland, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and given recitals in London’s Wigmore Hall, Vienna’s Musikverein, Salzburg’s Mozarteum, the Palais des BeauxArts in Brussels, and the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam.
At age 12, she became the youngest artist ever to receive the Debut Artist of the Year prize at the Performance Today awards given by National Public Radio. She is the recipient of a 2007 Avery Fisher Career Grant; she has received numerous other international prizes, including top prizes in the Mozart, Indianapolis, Hannover, Kreisler, Bashmet, and Paganini competitions. Yura Lee was the only first prize winner awarded across four categories at the 2013 ARD Competition in Germany.
An Incredible Partnership with At The World's Edge Festival!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge (AWE) Festival, Orchestra Wellington is presenting a three-part series featuring AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee and AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for a mini-series of concerts and a masterclass here in Wellington in addition to featuring these incredible artists' live performances with us on our subscription series concerts in September and October!

description:
Air Force in Concert Featuring Hollie Smith, The Royal New Zealand Air Force (RNZAF) Band is set to blast some big sounds in November. The Wellington-based band joins forces with New Zealand soul singer Hollie Smith. Together, they will take over the Michael Fowler Centre with a diverse repertoire. The RNZAF Band will perform hits from symphonic masterworks and marches to jazz standards and pop classics. Hollie will shine with several of her own famous soul songs. 
Hollie Smith is a prodigious songwriter. She has three number-one solo albums and an abundance of awards under her belt. Fat Freddy’s Drop, Trinity Roots, Anika Moa, and Boh Runga are just a few of her many collaborators. 
The RNZAF Band is a reserve force military band. It regularly welcomes dignitaries at Government House and Parliament, and provides music for commemorations at Pukeahu National War Memorial. Many of its members perform in the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra Wellington, Shapeshifter, and the Rodger Fox Big Band.
Tickets available to the public from 8am on Monday, 8 September.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Album Release | Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra, After receiving glowing international reviews for his debut album ‘Questions in Red’, flamboyant saxophonist / multi-instrumentalist Oscar Lavën is excited to release another exciting album, drawing together a vibrant collection of all-star musicians from various backgrounds under one roof in thrilling new original music, drawing influence from early American swing, blues, classical music, spiritual jazz and 50’s bar-walking rock & roll saxophone.

Prepare to be swept into a surreal cinematic world by the Elegant Calamity Orchestra; strings, woodwinds, brass, virtuosic percussionists and a deep-digging rhythm section, combining kaleidoscopic orchestral colours with the dangerous spontaneity of a small group. A momentous album release not to be missed.

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

description:
Album Release: Oscar Lavën's Elegant Calamity Orchestra, "You could drop the needle on any spot of Questions In Red and find satisfying, thoroughly involving music." - London Jazz News
After receiving glowing international reviews for his debut album Questions in Red, flamboyant saxophonist and multi-instrumentalist Oscar Lavën is thrilled to release another exciting album, "Elegant Calamity", drawing together a vibrant collection of all-star musicians from various backgrounds under one roof, drawing influence from early American swing, blues, classical music, french cinema, spiritual jazz and 50’s bar-walking rock and roll saxophone.
Prepare to be swept into a surreal, cinematic world by the Elegant Calamity Orchestra; strings, woodwinds, brass, virtuosic percussionists and a deep-digging rhythm section, combining kaleidoscopic orchestral colours with the dangerous spontaneity of a small group. A momentous album release not to be missed.

description:
Alex Trask Presents | Coltrane's Soprano, Alex Trask presents a special tribute to John Coltrane, performing tunes that he played on soprano saxophone. ‘Coltrane’s soprano has been hugely influential to me as an alto player and musician. His sound on the instrument is so unique and special, it’s been a touchstone for me for years. I remember being absolutely captivated by his playing on the untitled originals when Both Directions at Once came out, when I was still a beginner player. My Favourite Things is one of my most loved albums, and Everytime We Say Goodbye from that record is some of my favourite saxophone playing ever.’

The band will play classics such as My Favourite Things and Greensleeves, as well as tunes from the albums Both Directions at Once, Duke Ellington & John Coltrane, and Impressions.

Personnel:
Alex Trask – soprano saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
Rick Cranson – drums

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Alexandr Misko - The International Guitar Sensation LIVE at Old St Paul’s | Wellington, The international guitar sensation brings his groundbreaking stage show to New Zealand shores for the very first time!
May 31 at Old St Paul's, Wellington
2:30pm doors / 3:00pm show
Seated Concert
FAMILY FRIENDLY with $20 tickets for under 18s
Hailed as “the future of guitar” (Total Guitar), Misko is a globally renowned virtuoso known for his jaw-dropping technique, emotional depth, and genre-defying style. Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications. With lightning-fast fingerpicking, percussive tapping, and masterful arrangements, he transforms a single acoustic guitar into an entire musical universe — live and without loops.
A must-see for fans of instrumental brilliance, next-level guitar playing, and world-class musical storytelling!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“Misko is the future of guitar.” — Total Guitar
“A one-of-a-kind performance that will leave you speechless.” — The Guardian
“Alexandr Misko redefines guitar playing with every note he plays.” — MusicRadar
“A mesmerizing display of technical brilliance and raw emotion.” — Rolling Stone “A true guitar prodigy.” — Guitar World
“An artist who combines virtuosic technique with deep musical expression.” — Guitar Player
Tickets are VERY limited for these intimate concerts — don’t miss out on seeing live music at its finest!
Old St Paul’s is a stunning example of Gothic Revival architecture, constructed entirely from native timbers and consecrated in 1866. Its soaring wooden arches, stained glass windows, and rich acoustics make it a sought-after venue for a variety of events. The church offers seating for up to 460 guests, with facilities including a grand piano, organ, and a bar licence. While on-site catering isn't available, nearby venues such as Loaves & Fishes Hall, the Royal Society of New Zealand, and the Thistle Inn provide excellent options for receptions and gatherings. Located at 34 Mulgrave Street in Thorndon, Old St Paul’s is easily accessible by public transport and offers a serene setting for weddings, concerts, memorials, and other significant events.
label: Music & Concerts
