Hailed as “the future of guitar” (Total Guitar), Misko is a globally renowned virtuoso known for his jaw-dropping technique, emotional depth, and genre-defying style. Fusing classical precision with elements of jazz, rock, and modern fingerstyle, his performances are both technically astonishing and deeply moving.
Misko’s self-taught, boundary-pushing approach has captivated millions online, earning him a massive global following and praise from some of the world’s top music publications. With lightning-fast fingerpicking, percussive tapping, and masterful arrangements, he transforms a single acoustic guitar into an entire musical universe — live and without loops.
A must-see for fans of instrumental brilliance, next-level guitar playing, and world-class musical storytelling!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY
“Misko is the future of guitar.” — Total Guitar
“A one-of-a-kind performance that will leave you speechless.” — The Guardian
“Alexandr Misko redefines guitar playing with every note he plays.” — MusicRadar
“A mesmerizing display of technical brilliance and raw emotion.” — Rolling Stone “A true guitar prodigy.” — Guitar World
“An artist who combines virtuosic technique with deep musical expression.” — Guitar Player
Tickets are VERY limited for these intimate concerts — don’t miss out on seeing live music at its finest!
St Peter’s Hall in Paekakariki is a welcoming community space that combines timeless charm with practical versatility. Its bright, open interiors and flexible layout make it perfect for a wide range of events—from concerts and theatre to meetings and celebrations. The main hall offers a stage area with quality sound and lighting, creating a comfortable setting for performances of all kinds. Additional rooms provide space for smaller gatherings or workshops, making the venue adaptable to many needs. Whether you’re attending a lively show or a community meeting, St Peter’s Hall offers a warm, inviting atmosphere that truly brings people together.

Amped Up, New Zealand’s loudest night of mean as metal mayhem is locked and loaded.
Join us here at Brewtown for AMPED UP 2025, featuring NZs heaviest double-header!

AND

WITH support from Shepherds Reign - completing this un-holy trinity with their commanding, tribal-infused metal.

Three bands. One stage. No second chances.

As always, Brewtown will be serving up heaps of unbeatable beverage options from our festival bars ft. craft beer, bourbon, wine, non-alcs and more.
And we’ve got a line-up of serious feeds from some of the regions top foodies.

Score your ticket. Feel the volume. Get AMPED UP!

description:
Amélie the Musical, ‘Amélie the Musical’ is set to enchant Wellington for its Australasian premiere. The show will play at The Hannah theatre in November. The Grammy and Olivier Award-nominated adaptation follows shy Amélie Poulain, who carries out small acts of kindness for those around her. 
Wellington’s Rachel McSweeney, who played Sophie in the 2025 production of ‘Mamma Mia!’, stars as Amélie. Gemma Hoskins is Amélie’s mother, and William Duignan plays the pop icon Elton John. A cast of thirteen takes on many roles, from greengrocers to goldfish. Produced by WITCH Music Theatre, the show captures the whimsy of the film that made Amélie a global favourite. It features a Grammy-nominated score by Daniel Messé and Nathan Tyson, as well as a witty book by Craig Lucas. Directors Maya Handa Naff and Nick Lerew, with music director Hayden Taylor, bring Amélie’s quirky world to life. The Guardian has described the musical as “a magical and emotional triumph”.

description:
Antipodes, Antipodes is a quintet of musicians from Sydney and Te Whanganui-a-Tara/Wellington that playfully moves between the arty/cerebral and the folksy/earthy elements of jazz and improvised music. Sometimes delicate and considered, sometimes brawny and muscular, the intent that brings their performances together is a commitment to the song: each composition is a glistening artefact, brought to dynamic life by the ensemble.

Originally formed in Berlin and drawing influences from New York to Stockholm, Antipodes has, over 10 years of touring and recording, forged their own identity: a unique triptych of North American, Northern European, and South Pacific sounds that captivates audiences, offering them a shared journey into their dreamlike and evocative co-creations.

Featuring:

Jake Baxendale (saxophone)
Callum Allardice (guitar)
Luke Sweeting (piano)
Tom Botting (bass)
Tim Geldens (drums)

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Antu Marama, The Undercurrent presents Antu Marama!

Wellington band Antü Mārama brings you the vibrant evocative folk music of Latin America, with traditional tunes and original compositions. From Chile, the UK, New Zealand and the Canary Islands the group's ethos is represented by the name - Antü is the Mapudungún word for sun, while Mārama is the Te reo Māori word for Moon.

The group combines both the life-giving energy and vitality of the sun with the deeper emotions and more reflective energy of the Moon. Antü Mārama is a synthesis of the group's diverse backgrounds and musical experiences, united by a love of playing music, and a desire to share the rich folk tradition of Latin America with a local audience.

Watch them perform here:
https://www.instagram.com/reel/DHcrQc2Rf0O/?igsh=bGV5cHdpeTVqMzB2⁩

Saturday 6th September
Doors 7pm/ Gig 7:30pm
$15
Tickets available online and on the door

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

See you there!

description:
Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra - The Nutcracker Suite tickets, Witness a defining moment in this country’s jazz scene as the Aotearoa Jazz Orchestra (AoJO) makes its highly anticipated debut at Meow Nui.
Born from a collective vision championed and inspired by jazz legend Rodger Fox, AoJO represents the shared aspirations of the jazz community – honouring our jazz lineage while serving as a platform for its future. This newly formed, and proudly national ensemble brings our country’s jazz talent and legacy into focus.
Led by Musical Director John Rae and Concert Master Oscar Lavën, with Mike Taylor (lead trumpet) and Kaito Walley (lead trombone), this concert features Duke Ellington and Billy Strayhorn’s vibrant reimagining of Tchaikovsky's The Nutcracker Suite. A groundbreaking fusion of classical and jazz, it’s hailed as one of Ellington’s most inventive works. Together Strayhorn and Ellington showcase the familiar themes of Tchaikovsky’s ballet through the expressive power of jazz in orchestral form.
Prepare to be captivated by lush orchestration and melodic innovation as the AoJO takes to the stage for the very first time.

description:
Aunty Records Presents: Jazmine Nikitta [AUS] with Benny Salvador, Aunty Records Presents: Jazmine Nikitta [AUS] with Benny Salvador
Caribbean-Australian DJ Jazmine Nikitta is one of the most exciting names in global dance music right now. Fresh off her first world tour, she supported SiR across Europe and headlined parties across North and South America. She’s shared the stage with Brent Faiyaz, Bryson Tiller, Davido, Tems, and became the first Australian DJ to tour with Soulection, performing across Miami and Jamaica. Festival highlights include Splendour in the Grass, Dark MOFO, and a headline slot at Promiseland between Ms. Lauryn Hill and Tems.


Beyond the decks, Jazmine served as Spotify AUNZ’s exclusive Hip-Hop and R&B Editor (2021–24), launching Australia’s first Afrobeats and Amapiano playlist, Afro Fusion, and curating the platform’s biggest local dance playlists. She also hosted A1 The Show, a Spotify-exclusive podcast, interviewing artists like Uncle Waffles, Central Cee, and Saweetie.


She’s joined by Wellington’s Benny Salvador — DJ, producer, multi-instrumentalist, and one of New Zealand’s most exciting young talents. Benny’s eclectic sets blend house, techno, disco-funk, dub, and electro, with releases on Rush Hour, Racquet Club, Juke Bounce Werk, and his own Aunty Records.


Support from Awa.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Aunty Records Presents: Mark Farina [USA] with Benny Salvador, Aunty Records Presents: Mark Farina [USA] with Benny Salvador
Get ready, Wellington—one of the most influential figures in house music is landing in the capital for a night of deep grooves, soulful rhythms, and undeniable dancefloor magic at Meow NUI.

===Tickets on sale Friday 22 August at 12.00PM====

Mark Farina is a global dance music icon whose name resonates across the scene. Known for his Mushroom Jazz series, deep house sets, and marathon all-night performances, Farina has built a career on innovation, consistency, and a relentless touring schedule of over 100 shows a year. He has collaborated with legendary venues and record labels, showcasing both classic and new school producers in his sets.

With his recent YouTube series with Defected Records and continued worldwide performances, Farina connects with both longtime fans and new audiences alike, delivering unforgettable journeys through house, jazz-infused grooves, and eclectic beats.

Supporting him is Wellington’s Benny Salvador — one of New Zealand’s most exciting young talents. A DJ, producer, multi-instrumentalist, radio host, and event promoter, Benny has shared stages with Marcellus Pittman and Courtesy and played major festivals including Splore, Beacon, and Catacombs. He has recorded mixes for Planet Trip Records, NTS, Balamii, Related Articles, and Friendly Potential Radio, and released music on Racquet Club, Rush Hour, Love Above Records, Juke Bounce Werk, and his own Aunty Records. Benny’s eclectic sets blend house, techno, disco-funk, dub, and electro, drawing on jazz and funk influences while showcasing his crate-digging, collaborative approach.

This is a rare chance to experience two generations of dance music mastery under one roof. From Farina’s world-renowned grooves to Benny’s forward-thinking, genre-spanning sets, the night promises a journey through sound that will move the floor and leave a lasting impression. For fans of house, jazz-infused beats, and cutting-edge underground sounds, this is a must-attend event at Meow Nui.

Saturday 18th October
Doors 9:30 PM
label: Music & Concerts

description:
BANDIT QUEEN @ The Boathouse, Nelson, BANDIT QUEEN is NZ's finest (likely only) tribute to the music of The Decemberists.A Tribute to the Decemberists? BUT WHO ARE THE DECEMBERISTS?
Hailing from Portland Oregon, The Decemberists is an indie-alt folk rock band that write epic songs and have 9 studio albums to their credit. They are renowned for their musical style and unique storytelling with many song lyrics based on historical incidents and folklore. Perhaps drawing musical influence from the likes of The Beatles, Tom Waits, REM, Morrisey, their songs are exquisitely constructed and effortlessly combine folk-rock with elements of pop creating the infectious sound that is The Decemberists.
And who is BANDIT QUEEN? Experienced Christchurch based musos - Tim Kent (vocals, acoustic guitar); Justin 'Rusty' White (lead guitar); Jo-Anne Davern Fuller (vocals, keyboard); Chiara Lowe (violin, vocals); Adam Lowe (bass); Mark Newburn (drums, percussion).
The members of BANDIT QUEEN are passionate about this project and invite you to come experience and enjoy the eclectic music of USA indie-rock band THE DECEMBERISTS.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
BEN WILCOCK AND THE JELLY ROLLS, Ben Wilcock and The Jelly Rolls have been a mainstay on the Aotearoa jazz scene for the last 15 years. Their two studio albums are a collection of piano trio jazz, with the pervasive pianistic influences of Erroll Garner, Fats Waller, Oscar Peterson and Ahmad Jamal.
They have toured New Zealand extensively and performed internationally, including a sold-out performance at The Edinburgh Jazz Festival in 2019. Along with unique interpretations of jazz piano standards, the trio's repertoire includes original material from Wilcock's recently released album The River Tethys, as well as the solo piano album Goodnight T.V.

description:
BRANT BJORK TRIO, Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable. Over the past two decades, he has produced albums for other artists, launched numerous side projects, built an extensive solo career as a singer, guitarist, and bandleader, and founded his own record label. His story is one of relentless, boundary-pushing creativity.

Doors at 8pm - Tickets: $60 from WaxstarTouring

description:
Back To The Hillside with Breaches & Molipane, A night of shoegaze, post-punk & grunge in the capital city.
Tickets $15 from Undertheradar or $20 on the door. First band at 8:30pm.
Back to the Hillside: Underground alt-rock/grungegaze/post-punk band from Auckland. Started off making indie pop/rock songs, Back To The Hillside are now exploring other elements. Inspired by bands/artists like The Smashing Pumpkins, Team Sleep, The Smiths, Joy Division, Titlefight & Deftones.
Breaches: Pōneke post-punk duo Breaches mix rural aggression with dance floor romance to share tales of love, death and the spaces in-between. They fuse dark electronics with the raw energy of guitars to bring a new sound that is both brooding and urgent.
Molipane: shoegaze solo act from Wellington known for dreamy, ethereal soundscapes that evoke calm and introspection.

description:
Beth Britten - with Eilish Wilson and Michael Howell, Bassist and vocalist Beth Britten brings a collection of original improvised music, together with saxophonist Eilish Wilson and guitarist Michael Howell. With the intention to enjoy the moments and interactions that music presents us with, this project is a playful exploration of small compositions through the musical conversation of the trio.

Beth Britten presented this music at her gig 'Not What I Planned' with a quartet in Tāmaki Makaurau earlier this year. She is excited to be bringing this explorative music to Pōneke in a trio format for the Wellington Jazz Festival.

Doors: 6:45pm
Gig starts: 7pm

description:
Big Country (Scotland) Greatest Hits Tour | San Fran, Wellington, Big Country (Scotland) Greatest Hits Tour | San Fran, Wellington
BIG COUNTRY, the Legendary Scottish Celtic Rock band, return for the first time since 2019 for The Greatest Hits Tour. Setlist includes – In A Big Country, Chance, Fields of Fire, Look Away, Wonderland plus much more

Featuring the band’s de facto theme song — “In a Big Country”, their debut album, The Crossing, combined anthemic post-punk with folk-inspired guitar sounds to become the leading representative of 80’s Celtic Rock. It was a surprisingly influential mix that would inspire an entirely new wave of British rock artists who openly embraced their Celtic heritage. BIG COUNTRY achieved major international success plus two Grammy nominations and for a time rivalled fellow “big sounding” British guitar rock acts U2 and Simple Minds.

Big guitars, big drums, big checks on their shirts, BIG COUNTRY were well named!

Swing by for a Big Tin (or a big glass) of beer at the Abandoned Taproom in Petone and round off your weekend with the music of Big Tin Band on the final day of the Wellington Jazz Festival.

Featuring Charlotte Barrand on alto saxophone, Felix Hayes-Tourelle on tenor saxophone, Robin Baek on guitar, Connor McAneny on piano, Will Goodinson on bass and special guest on drums.

description:
Bill Hickman's Deadly Sins, Dirty country folk meets blues-soaked storytelling in this powerhouse trio led by Wellington’s own Bill Hickman.

Joined by Tommy Joass and Adam Crawford, the Deadly Sins serve up tales of hard times, hard habits, and the kind of love that leaves a mark.

For those who are meeting Bill for the first time, if the smokier, darker edge of alt-country is where you like to dwell, if the likes of Steve Earle, Michael Stipe, Bruce Springsteen or Elvis Costello feature heavily on your favourite playlist then it’s time to check out Bill Hickman.

Tickets $20. Capital Blues Inc members, tickets are $10, and 10% discount at the bar.

description:
Bill Hickman, Cindy Muggeridge & Neil Billington play Hilltop, First Set; Bill Hickman - Opening the show is Wellington singer-songwriter Bill Hickman, known for his strong gravel dragged voice, driving guitar work, and honest, well-crafted songs. Blending folk, country and roots influences, Bill’s set moves between grit and tenderness, with stories of outlaws, love, and life hard-lived.

Second Set; Cindy Muggeridge & Neil Billington - The second part of this special show features the queen of the blues and boogie piano, Cindy Muggeridge, together with the firebrand of the blues harp, Neil Billington, performing their own unique brand of blues, boogies and ballads.

Not for profit, supporting our dedicated musicians. Suggested donation $30

Teas, coffee and snacks provided. You're welcome to bring anything you'd like to eat or drink.
Parking available in the Coupon zones of Upland Rd & Glasgow St free after 6pm weekdays and all through the weekends. The Wilson Carpark at the top of the Cable Car charges 24/7.

More information at www.hilltophouseconcerts.co.nz/upcoming-gigs/

description:
Bill Lake's Slow Bake, The Undercurrent presents Bill Lake's Slow Bake!

Join us for a night of swinging blues!

Guitarist, singer and songwriter Bill Lake is one of New Zealand’s most respected and long-serving practitioners. For more than four decades the singer and guitarist led the iconic country-blues band The Windy City Strugglers, as well as playing with pioneering rock group Mammal in the 70s and fronting brassy funk-rockers The Pelicans in the 80s. His songs have been covered by Midge Marsden, Darren Watson, Kokomo, Rag Poets and Marg Layton.
Bassist Steve Hemmens played with Bill in Mammal. Recently returned from many years in the UK, he adds warmth and swing to the mix.
Long time popular musician Alan Norman plays percussion, accordion, guitar and occasional piano. He is a member of both NZ’s seminal Country band The Warratahs, and Wellington band Rag Poets.

Sunday 14th September
Doors 5pm/ Gig 5:30pm
$15
Tickets available online and on the door

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

description:
Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton, Bob McNeill & Emily Roughton are two of New Zealand's best-known folk musicians. They bring their deep musical connection to festivals across New Zealand, playing their favourite songs and tunes collected over years of playing together at festivals, stages and late into the night at kitchen tables.
Based in Wellington, Bob is one of NZ's best known folk songwriters. His songs have been covered by artists in NZ, Australia, the UK and USA. New Zealand Musician magazine compared his songwriting to Bruce Springsteen and Mark Knopfler; the Dominion Post likened him to Jackson Brown, James Taylor, Luka Bloom and Dougie Ma­cLean. A guitarist, he is known for both his open-tuned acoustic fingerstyle style and electric guitar playing. He has toured widely in NZ, Australia, Canada, Ireland, the UK and USA. His latest album, released in June 2024, is Lost Stars, an extended release on CD and download featuring new recordings and rarities, with Emily on violin and piano.
From Whangarei, Emily is a virtuoso violinist inspired by the Scottish tradition and the modern trad movement. Classically trained, she is infinitely adaptable with her gorgeous stylings and fiery tune playing and the perfect foil for Bob's lyrical songs.
Don't miss a chance to see these two consummate musicians share their footstomping collection of banging tunes, favourite songs and stolen moments from the last 20 years.
Tickets $25 from Eventfinda or book by text to 02102361951
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Body Ocean, Body Ocean, a dynamic force in the realm of electronic music, specialises in crafting immersive and kinetic house music. Their sonic journey explores the interplay between organic and artificial elements, navigating contrasts between personality and dissolution, as well as the push and pull of extraversion and introspection.

With an impressive catalogue of releases on influential labels such as Size, Black Book Records, Mad Decent, Dirtybird, Box of Cats, and STMPD RCRDS, Body Ocean has firmly established themselves as a notable presence in the electronic music scene. They've also left a lasting mark with remixes for acclaimed artists including Steve Angello, Valentino Khan, Alison Wonderland, Ane Brun, and Mija.

Their commitment to pushing sonic boundaries and exploring diverse musical dimensions sets them apart — fuelling a growing reputation as innovators within the industry.

As they gear up for 2024, Body Ocean is poised to captivate dancefloors with a compelling fusion of sound and a vision that looks firmly to the future of electronic music.

Catch Body Ocean live at Meow on Friday 22nd August — support to be announced.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Boogie Wonderland Presents: The Music of Earth, Wind & Fire, Experience the ultimate tribute to Earth, Wind & Fire with Boogie Wonderland! This powerhouse 11- piece band, created by saxophonist Bryn van Vliet for the Wellington Jazz Festival 2023, electrifies the stage with the iconic group’s legendary sounds. Featuring stunning vocals from Lisa Tomlins and LJ Crichton, and supported by a dynamic 4-piece horn section and a tight 5-piece rhythm section comprised of members from NZ's most iconic bands Fat Freddy's Drop, Kora, Shapeshifter, Lord Echo, LAB, Rhombus, TOI, and more, Boogie Wonderland delivers all the classic hits you love. Get ready to dance the night away and relive the magic of Earth, Wind & Fire like never before! 

San Fran holds a Supervised License. Minors are welcome to attend events at San Fran so long as they are accompanied by a legal guardian at all times whilst at the venue.

description:
Brant Bjork Trio, Brant Bjork Trio
In 2025, the trio heads to New Zealand for three exclusive shows celebrating their latest album, Once Upon a Time in the Desert. This is a rare chance to catch a true icon of desert rock live—an experience not to be missed.

Brant Bjork has spent over a quarter of a century at the heart of California’s desert rock scene. From cutting his teeth as the drummer and songwriter for Kyuss’s legendary early albums to carrying the torch for fuzz-driven rock with Fu Manchu from 1994 to 2001, Bjork’s impact is undeniable.

In 2024, Bjork re-formed the Brant Bjork Trio, teaming up with Michael Amster (Nebula, Mondo Generator) on drums and longtime friend—and desert rock pioneer—Mario Lalli on bass.

Joining them on all three dates are Australian rockers Full Tone Generator. Born on the beaches of Australia by Andy Fernando and brought to life in the Californian desert, Full Tone Generator brings the heat with a powerful blend of riff-heavy rock and raw energy.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Brazilian Experience, Brazilian Experience is an unforgettable trip into some fabulous Latin music.
With her distinctive voice, Alda Rezende has collaborated with legendary Brazilian artists such as Elza Soares and João Bosco, recorded acclaimed albums, and headlined major festivals in New Zealand, Australia, and the USA.
Juliana Sian, a passionate interpreter of Bossa Nova and Samba, blends her own compositions with classics by Tom Jobim, Milton Nascimento, and Hermeto Pascoal, honed through over 20 years of performing and teaching.
Performing at the Jazz Festival as Brazilian Experience, Alda and Juliana are joined by renowned Brazilian and New Zealand musicians to deliver an authentic and dynamic show. Expect to dance to beloved Brazilian classics and vibrant original arrangements — a celebration of Brazil’s rich musical heritage with a unique New Zealand twist.

description:
Brock & Brie, Introducing two of Poneke’s brightest songwriting talents: Brock & Brie!
Multi instrumentalist Brock Alexander singing lyrical and intimate songs about love and death plays his own music solo for the first time ever. Drawing from Folk, Indie and Soul traditions featuring a rich baritone and a soft melting falsetto.
Bri Louise is a multi-instrumentalist studying music in Wellington, Aotearoa. They have roots in Gospel and Neo-Soul, and now lean heavily on jazz, Hip-Hop, and R&B, with influences of Ambient and Classical music that keep their creative mind always in an experimental, imaginative mindset (for better or for worse).

$15

description:
Broken River album release, Join the Wooden Box Band to celebrate the launch of their latest album Broken River. Recorded under the expert guidance of Lee Prebble at the Surgery in Newtown.
Written over the course of several years, the songs of Broken River tell stories of turbulence, change, immense loss and hope. They remind us to commune with our natural world and to remain steadfast in our commitments to each other.
Come together, join us in music. A salve to thrive in these confounding times, and to build the community we need.
Doors open at 7pm, music from 7:30pm
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Brooke Fransen - Live in Concert, Brooke Fransen - Live in Concert
An Unmissable Night of Music & Worship – Live at Whirinaki Whare Taonga

Join us for an unforgettable evening of live music in the stunning surrounds of the Whirinaki Whare Taonga Theatre on Friday, September 27.

I’ll be taking the stage with my full band for a powerful, heartfelt, and deeply worshipful night of music — and you’re invited.

We’ll be playing a full set of songs you’ll know and love, plus a few favourite covers and some brand new, never-heard-before tracks that I’m so excited to share with you for the very first time. These new songs are fresh from the heart — honest, worshipful, and full of faith.

This night is going to be so special. A space to breathe, reflect, worship, and encounter God through music. Thoughtful. Hopeful. Beautiful.

Bring your friends, your youth group, your church, your family — come and be a part of something beautiful.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Brynzilian Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival, Brynzilian Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival
The Brynzilian Big Band is a 17-piece powerhouse jazz orchestra founded and led by saxophonist Bryn van Vliet.

Based in Wellington, Bryn is a multi-disciplinary artist known for his dynamic career as an instrumentalist (saxophone, woodwinds, vocals), performer, composer, arranger, and educator.

As a founding member of TOI and former lead alto saxophonist for the Rodger Fox Big Band, he has earned a reputation as a versatile and sought-after musician.

The Brynzilian Big Band presents fresh, vibrant compositions inspired by iconic Brazilian music styles such as Samba, Bossa Nova, and Forró. Bryn’s writing reflects his deep affection for
Brazilian music, while honoring its traditional roots and spirit.

Featuring 17 of Wellington’s finest musicians, the Brynzilian Big Band promises a performance that will make you dance,
laugh, shout, cry — and maybe even hug your neighbour.


Check out some footage of the band here:

description:
Bullfrog Rata and The Cuba Express, Bullfrog Rata is a seasoned blues performer. For this show he will be joined by his band, The Cuba Express.
They perform a fast-paced danceable set of blues tunes along with many of the tunes from the One Fine Day and Chasing the Gazelle albums.
Both albums feature a number of personal, not self-indulgent, but highly musical and uplifting tunes.
Cuba Express is Patrick Bleakley on bass, Abe Bailey on drums and Geoff Culverwell on trumpet and keys.
Bullfrog Rata has performed with many well-known acts including Midge Marsden and The Chills, international blues acts like Taj Mahal, Watermelon Slim as well as mega stars Tina Turner, Charlie Pride, and Jethro Tull.

Hosted by Festival Co-Director Tama Waipara (Ngāti Ruapani, Rongowhakaata, Ngāti Porou) this is a unique opportunity to hear two artists share their insights, experiences and love for music up close
With thanks to Te Kawa a Māui and The New Zealand School of Music—Te Kōkī for their support.

description:
Burgin, Kerr, & Norman, Burgin, Kerr, & Norman
The Undercurrent presents Burgin, Kerr & Norman

A swampy melting pot of country, folk, americana and blues, they combine a mutual love of story-telling and rhythmic grooves with narratives about the human experience. Original material from each member, with a wide range of instrumentation including piano, acoustic and Weissenborn guitars, accordion, bodhran, and percussion.

Paddy Burgin (The Wooden Box Band, The Zimmermans), Andrew Kerr (ex. Jacky Tar) and Alan Norman (The Warratahs, The Rag Poets) are now a trio and have been gently gathering crowds around the greater Wellington area for the past 18 months. Alan and Andrew have a long history as a duo and Paddy was a member of ‘The Scarborough Connection’ featuring on Andrew and Alan’s critically acclaimed 2023 release ‘For the Record.’

“…..one of the year’s best albums in Americana/folk ….a thoughtful, passionate, and
musically rich collection that holds up under repeated listens….”
- Anne Hollister ⁦(www.theindiesource.com⁩)

“I’m struck by the smoothness of the production, the delicate precision of the
arrangements…what a great set of songs. What wonderful playing..”
- Simon Sweetman.

⁦
⁩

To be clear, this is not a movie screening - it's a feast for the eyes and ears, featuring spellbinding burlesque, draglesque and vocal performances from our multi award-winning cast.

Sweeten the experience by getting dolled up and arriving early to grab drinks and nibbles from the bar!

description:
BØLZER - Southern Tempest Tour: Wellington - This week, BØLZER [bœlˈtsr] ~ He who strikes like lightning – with sudden, decisive force or implications.
BØLZER - SOUTHERN TEMPEST TOUR
20/08 - Wellington; Valhalla
21/08 - Auckland; Whammy Bar
Tickets on sale from: https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/97050/BLZER.utr
An intuitive art project born from raw passion;
musical ecstasy fueled by impulsive composition
and enactment. Whilst wielding a lyrical and musical
medium largely inspired by – and seeking to
channel – the primeval essence of the human experience,
flashes of illumination will descend the sky
from which there shall be no shelter.
Forged of an intense understanding between drummer
Fabian Wyrsch and guitarist Okoi Jones, the
project first took physical form in 2008. Before
long, the dualistic significance of their musical partnership
outshone any need for a bass player and
has since served to both challenge and empower the
band’s creativity. Following their 2010 live debut in
Zürich, BØLZER soon made a name for themselves
as the remarkable Swiss-Antipodean duo capable of
conjuring up mighty barriers of sound with nothing
but a ten-stringed guitar and an almost ritualistic
percussion style. The pair describe their own stage
experience as a form of spiritual rapture, an atavistic
vortex woven together from the profound union
of spectacle meeting spectator on a deeper plane.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
C'mon Masterton! an Evening of Music and Memories With Suzanne Lynch, Step back into the golden era of Kiwi pop with Suzanne Lynch – one half of the iconic sister duo The Chicks and The Ladykillers – as we celebrate the release of her memoir Yesterday When I Was Young.

Suzanne will share stories with legendary broadcaster Karyn Hay, from a career that saw her rise to fame in the late 60s, support Cat Stevens on tour, and perform alongside some of the world’s greatest musicians, as told in her new book, Yesterday When I Was Young. 

Then enjoy a live performance featuring Suzanne, joined by fellow C’mon star Shane Hales and guitar maestro Malcolm McCallum followed by a book signing.

Everyone is welcome at this event, so bring your friends and let's have a fun night filled with nostalgia!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
C.W Stoneking NZ Tour, After an unforgettable run of shows across Aotearoa in January, acclaimed troubadour,
C.W. Stoneking makes his much-anticipated return this spring.

Presale 10am (NZST), Friday 15th August
General on sale 10am (NZST), Monday 18th August
Tickets from Banished Music
Register for presale at banishedmusic.com/subscribe

With his unmistakable swagger, Stoneking moves effortlessly between the red dust of Alice Springs and the deep grooves of the American South. Drawing on a heady blend of vintage blues, New Orleans jazz, gospel, calypso, country and western kitsch, he conjures a sound that is both timeless and thrillingly original.
Audiences can expect zombie shuffles, gospel stompers, and tropical torch songs – all delivered with wit, charm, and musical brilliance. Rich in character, darkly funny, and steeped in storytelling, Stoneking’s music may evoke a bygone era, but his performances crackle with electricity.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CHORAL CONNECTIONS, NZ Secondary Students Choir + Aotearoa Academy Choir = CHORAL CONNECTIONS!
Don't miss this thrilling showcase of our best young singers in concert: Friday 26 Sept in Wellington Cathedral of St Paul. This is NZSSC’s first public concert for the 2025-26 cycle and a collaboration with Academy Choir, Gold Award winners at last years's World Choir Games. And to round off the At the end of the concert, conference delegates with join with the two youth choirs to form a massed choir of over 150 voices to sing under the direction of international choral clinician Dr Pearl Shankuan.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series Four Last Songs, Composed in the year before his passing, the 'Four Last Songs' are held by many to be Richard Strauss’ most beautiful, sensuous, and moving composition. They are songs of farewell and of gentle heartbreak. The words of the final song, 'Im Abendrot', speak of an elderly couple walking hand in hand, at rest from their wanderings, away from life. The final verse:

O weiter, stiller Friede! O vast and silent peace!
So tief im Abendrot So deep in sunset glow,
Wie sind wir wandermüde- How weary we are with wandering-
Ist dies etwa der Tod? Could this perhaps be death?

For this special premiere performance, Salina Fisher has arranged the 'Four Last Songs' for NZTrio and celebrated Australian soprano Emma Pearson.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series From Scratch, New Zealand’s oldest and most avant-garde chamber music ensemble, From Scratch, has been performing nationally and internationally since 1974, principally under the leadership of sound and intermedia artist Phil Dadson.

From Scratch have developed an original and innovative sound/performance style that includes large sculptural invented instruments (primarily percussion), and innovative hocket-style rhythms – where the performers’ individual parts interlock to create complex rhythmic and melodic structures.

The current collective core-group consists of Adrian Croucher, Shane Currey, Phil Dadson, Darryn Harkness and Chris O'Connor.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
CMNZ Series: Four Last Songs - Wellington, CMNZ Series: Four Last Songs - Wellington
This October, Chamber Music New Zealand is proud to tour Aotearoa's own NZTrio (Amalia Hall - violin, Somi Kim - piano, Matthias Balzat - cello) and Australian soprano Emma Pearson in Four Last Songs, a concert reflecting on the nature of goodbyes, endings, and renewals.

Named for Strauss' Four Last Songs which he wrote towards the end of his life — now arranged for piano trio and soprano — the songs reflect on the serene acceptance of mortality and a closeness with nature.

The concert also features Salina Fisher's Kintsugi, about the Japanese art of putting broken ceramics back together with gold and celebrating the beauty of a life not unmarred by difficulty, but made more beautiful by the resilience of overcoming hardship.

PROGRAMME

🎶 Elena Kats-Chernin | The Spirit and the Maiden
🎶 Salina Fisher | Kintsugi
🎶 Amy Beach | 2 Songs Op. 100 A Mirage and Stella Viatoris
🎶 Sergei Rachmaninoff | Vocalise
🎶 Richard Strauss (arr. Salina Fisher) | Four Last Songs (Vier letzte Lieder) TrV 296
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Cairo Knife Fight + Sheeps Live at Meow, After ten years, Cairo Knife Fight is finally returning to New Zealand for a limited series of intimate shows. Known for their powerful live performances and genre-bending sound, the duo
is set to bring their unmistakable energy back to local stages.
Since their last performances in New Zealand, CKF has continued to push musical boundaries, earning Billboard chart success with tracks like “Churn” and “Nothing at All.”
Their latest EP, Dream Season, showcases the band's ever-evolving sound—fusing intricate live looping,
intense rhythms, and ambient textures. This homecoming is more than a tour—it’s a full-circle moment for one of NZ’s most innovative exports.
Joining CKF at Meow will be Wellington based Sheeps. Described as Art Rock for the end times, Sheeps are definitely the right band at the right time to partner CKF in 2025.
Don’t miss the return of Cairo Knife Fight. It’s been a long time coming.

Capital Blues Concert Series - Bill Hickman's Deadly Sins, Capital Blues Concert Series - Bill Hickman's Deadly Sins
Dirty country folk meets blues-soaked storytelling in this powerhouse trio led by Wellington’s own Bill Hickman.

Joined by Tommy Joass and Adam Crawford, the Deadly Sins serve up tales of hard times, hard habits, and the kind of love that leaves a mark.

For those who are meeting Bill for the first time, if the smokier, darker edge of alt-country is where you like to dwell, if the likes of Steve Earle, Michael Stipe, Bruce Springsteen or Elvis Costello feature heavily on your favourite playlist then it’s time to check out Bill Hickman.

description:
Capital Blues Presents: Jess and Cam, Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.
She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.
Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.
Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.

description:
Capital Blues Presents: Simon Donald, Simon Donald. Chosen to support Ash Grunwald at meowNUI. Understated kiwi brilliance. His online presence is about everyone else.
We're making it all about him!
Capital Blues are thrilled to have Simon Donald taking the stage! If you’ve caught him live at meowNUI, Paekākāriki, or the Kapiti Boating Club, you already know: this guy plays from the gut. Blues, Americana, and that rare kind of tone that feels lived-in and honest.
He’s shared stages with Ash Grunwald, Sig Wilder, and National Sensation, and the feedback speaks for itself. As Ash put it:
“Hey brother you were amazing. Great to hear some good blues 🔥🔥🔥🔥”
Simon’s sets are all about feel. Deep blues, warm swing, and the kind of playing that makes you lean in and listen. Whether you’re a Thursday regular or just blues-curious, this one sure is worth showing up for.
🎫 Members get discounted entry and 10% off at the bar, so come on down, grab a drink, and settle in. Doors open early. Music starts at 7.

Lots of people were saying what a great show Simon Donald gave. Gritty blues, played with passion and skill. And played by a local musician too. What more can you ask for? So we booked him.
Simon Donald—understated kiwi brilliance. Chosen to support Ash Grunwald, and now taking the stage at Capital Blues. His online presence is about everyone else. This time, we’re making it all about him.

description:
Carmichael, Carmichael is back for a spooky session... will we be in your halloween plans?
Dress up and get ready to boogie because we have an especially danceable set planned for the spookiest night of the year... and you are all invited!

Carmichael is a six-piece jazz ensemble, based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Born from the darkest depths of jazz school, Carmichael was formed by a bunch of friends to make music that’s danceable as heck and have a good time doing it together.
Inspired by different global groove-driven collectives, such as Kokoroko, Ezra Collective, Nubiyan Twist & Fat Freddy’s Drop, their music blends elements of afrobeat, neo-soul and jazz fusion.

Featuring the beloved Carmichaelians :

Lily Atu - alto saxophone & vocals
Elisa Bird - baritone saxophone
Frank Paton - trumpet
Darcy Monteath - bass
Petar Tavich - guitar
Joseph Alexander - drums

Music from 9:30pm, FREE ENTRY

Carmichael is a six-piece jazz ensemble, based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Born from the darkest depths of jazz school, Carmichael was formed by a bunch of friends to make music that’s danceable as heck and have a good time doing it together.

Inspired by different global groove-driven collectives, such as Kokoroko, Ezra Collective, Nubiyan Twist & Fat Freddy’s Drop, their music blends elements of afrobeat, neo-soul and jazz fusion.


Featuring the beloved Carmichaelians :

Lily Atu - alto saxophone & vocals
Elisa Bird - baritone saxophone
Frank Paton - trumpet
Darcy Monteath - bass
Petar Tavich - guitar
Joseph Alexander - drums
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Chamber Dances, Chamber Dances
Wellington-based composer Keith Moss presents the premiere of his new work Chamber Dances, written for marimba, reed quintet, and percussion.

This piece for seven musicians brings two long-held personal wishes to life: to compose a work in collaboration with marimba virtuoso Naoto Segawa, and to create a reed quintet inspired by close friends in Belgium.

The Post praised Keith’s most recent orchestral work, performed by Orchestra Wellington and Arohanui Strings, as “a pleasant, multi-hued piece of tone-painting.” His latest compositions mark a return to a tonal vocabulary that is both approachable and emotionally resonant for audiences.

The concert program will also feature solo marimba works by Peter Klatzow, a marimba duo by Akira Yuyama, and a newly arranged reed quintet version of Grieg’s Holberg Suite. Keith’s fresh take on this beloved classic draws from both Grieg’s original piano score and the composer’s own string arrangement, distilling the spirit of the suite into a sparkling new form for reed quintet.

Taking the stage is marimba specialist Naoto Segawa, Principal Percussionist of Orchestra Wellington. He is joined by fellow OW musicians and NZSO Sub-principal Sam Rich, who brings a vibrant palette of exotic percussion to the performance.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Chamber Dances, New Zealand Premiere of Keith Moss’ Septet No.2 for Marimba, Reed Quintet and Percussion.
Naoto Segawa, joined by members of Orchestra Wellington, present works by Gareth Farr and arrangement by Moss of Grieg’s Holberg Suite.

description:
Christchurch - The Butlers 2025 Tour, Christchurch - The Butlers 2025 Tour
The Butlers have announced a five-date tour across Aotearoa this October and November to celebrate a decadent collection of new material while of course, paying homage to the decorated and beloved golden-olds.

Nearing a decade of sold-out tours across the country, The Butlers' trademarked infectious energy and presence within the room simply can’t be missed!

“If you are a casual fan and haven’t yet dipped your toes into seeing them live, do it, they are great. Also, the crowd The Butlers attract are such a lovely group of people, it feels like a community more than just a group of people.” - Sean Hollier, 95BFM.

Tickets on now at thebutlersmusic.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Christmas in the Quarters, All your favourite Christmas traditions play out across four Saturdays in November and December. The Wellington festive season has a suitably summer flavour with a host of fun activities brought to you by Wellington City Council. 
Christmas in the Quarters kicks off with Christmas crafts in Midland Park on Saturday, 22 November. There are five craft activities to enjoy, plus face painting. Kids can also post a letter in Santa’s letterbox. On Saturday, 29 November, the whole family can enjoy Christmas music and performances. There will be choirs, hip-hop dance, ukulele playing, and more. Chill out and absorb the sounds and sights of Christmas.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Christof Van Der Ven - “Is This What We’ve Become?” Album Tour, After 5 years Christof is coming back to New Zealand to tour his newly released album.

He plays at the Abandoned Brewery taproom in Petone on the 30th of October.

Christof van der Ven has built a truly impressive CV over the course of his career, from supporting the likes of Bon Iver, The Staves, Mel Parsons, Bear’s Den, Lisa Hannigan, and Nick Mulvey, to playing in front of thousands of fans across the world.

Hailing originally from Holland, Christof van der Ven moved to Galway in 2007 before settling in London. He has released two LPs, Empty Handed (2018) and You Were The Place (2019), alongside multiple EPs. His career has been supported by DIY, Clash, Gold Flake Paint and his music has been played on BBC6 Radio and Radio X.
NEW ALBUM “Is this what we’ve become?”

Throughout ‘is this what we’ve become?’ Christof speaks to loved ones and past selves, reflecting on years of promise, regret and loss. His storytelling is characterized by gentle melodies and rich, textured arrangements, as his younger selves confront him with unfulfilled ambitions and perceived failures. When Christof turns towards friends and family, he finds them too in moments of upheaval, in need of support. Amidst the unpredictable and uncontrollable, community and friendship emerge, providing roots, giving comfort as Christof ruminates on how he came to be - and can come to accept - who he is now.

Written by Christof, ‘is this what we’ve become?’ also features musical contributions from Jools Owen (Bear’s Den, Bess Atwell), Tommy Heap (Billie Marten, Matthew and the Atlas), Marcus Hamblett (Villagers, Bear’s Den), and Estilo String Quartet. The album was produced and recorded by Christof and Ian Grimble (Daughter, Manic Street Preachers, Matt Corby, Fionn Regan), who also mixed the LP. ‘is this what we’ve become?’ incorporates recordings from both studio sessions in London, as well as ad hoc recording sessions engineered by Christof across the UK.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour, Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour
Indie-Folk Artist Colette Rivers and her band will be performing her intimate new album, The Backyard Wonder.

Independent artist Colette Rivers is releasing her second full-length album, The Backyard Wonder, an intimate exploration of healing, change, and the quiet beauty of ordinary moments.

This album holds special meaning for Rivers: after being diagnosed with cancer in July 2023, her planned sophomore release had to take a back seat to recovery. But when the cancer returned in early 2025, she felt compelled to finish and release the album, not just as a legacy project, also as a celebration after hard times, with a focus on how “you can find the wonder in life, even in your backyard.”

A lifelong creative, Rivers records, mixes, and produces in her home studio in Masterton, and plays every instrument heard on The Backyard Wonder. Her debut album, Memory Lake (2020), was shaped by early years spent in the US, and her move to Taupō at age 11; this was followed by a nationwide tour. Now based in the Wairarapa and working as a secondary school drama teacher, Rivers continues to move between solo performance and full band sets, while staying rooted in the acoustic traditions that define her sound.

With her right arm partially paralysed following recent treatment, Rivers has gathered a group of close friends to help bring the songs of The Backyard Wonder to life (especially its intricate fingerpicking parts) for a run of live shows. She’ll be touring the Wellington and Wairarapa regions from August through October, finishing with a set at the Wellington Folk Festival.

Opening for Rivers is Beans:

Beans is a recent fixture in the Pōneke folk scene, importing a wild array of original songs and generally embodying the classic singer songwriter formula – introvert plus guitar. They are one third of folk trio 'Don & the Divorcees', but are known for solo shows which are rich with humour, honesty and interesting word choices. Expect to feel things.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Colette Rivers - The Backyard Wonder tour, Indie-Folk Artist Colette Rivers and her band will be performing her intimate new album, The Backyard Wonder. Band members are Kerrie McEwen, Tonnie ten Hove, & Momoko Sato.
Independent artist Colette Rivers is releasing her second full-length album, The Backyard Wonder, an intimate exploration of healing, change, and the quiet beauty of ordinary moments.
This album holds special meaning for Rivers: after being diagnosed with cancer in July 2023, her planned sophomore release had to take a back seat to recovery. But when the cancer returned in early 2025, she felt compelled to finish and release the album, not just as a legacy project, also as a celebration after hard times, with a focus on how “you can find the wonder in life, even in your backyard.”
A lifelong creative, Rivers records, mixes, and produces in her home studio in Masterton, and plays every instrument heard on The Backyard Wonder. Her debut album, Memory Lake (2020), was shaped by early years spent in the US, and her move to Taupō at age 11; this was followed by a nationwide tour. Now based in the Wairarapa and working as a secondary school drama teacher, Rivers continues to move between solo performance and full band sets, while staying rooted in the acoustic traditions that define her sound.
With her right arm partially paralysed following recent treatment, Rivers has gathered a group of close friends to help bring the songs of The Backyard Wonder to life (especially its intricate fingerpicking parts) for a run of live shows. She’ll be touring the Wellington and Wairarapa regions from August through October, finishing with a set at the Wellington Folk Festival.
For updates, and behind-the-scenes glimpses, visit www.coletteriversmusic.com or follow @colettemusic on Instagram and Facebook.
Opening for Rivers are artists:
Phil Masters
Phil Lively-Masters is an experienced, well travelled singer songwriter who specialises in writing the sort of Sun Kissed West Coast Laurel Canyon Americana that made Neil Young, Stephen Stills and the Byrds famous. With a powerful, honey soaked voice that has won praise and support slots from legendary American country rock pioneers like The Jayhawks and original cosmic cowboy Steve Young, Phil has 20 years worth of road worn original songs to pull on, including tracks from the critically acclaimed CANYON RYDE album 'Free To Be' and some choice country rock covers to weave a spell on any listener.
Saali Marks
A singer, songwriter, guitarist and multi-instrumentalist, Saali Marks hails originally from the
South Island, but has made Wairarapa his home for the last 20 years, where he lives on a farm
with his family and teaches music at Kuranui College.
Saali has played in numerous bands over the years, in a wide range of styles from proto-punk
to psychedelic dub, covers, originals and fully improvised music with no discernible genre, on
stages throughout Aotearoa since 1991. Currently he fronts the Wellington ska band Battleska
Galactica.
Throughout and alongside it all Saali has indulged his love for songwriting and solo
performing, developing a unique style, rooted in folk and blues, and inspired by greats from
across the decades. A skilled guitarist, Saali rarely plays straight ahead chords, and an
education in jazz has informed his ear for harmony, the beauty of dissonance, tension and
resolution, with unconventional song structures, alternate tunings and intriguing melodies.
Although not adverse to penning the odd love song, most of Saali’s lyrics tend to focus on
other aspects of the human condition, from religion and politics to our relationships with the
environment and our own minds.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Come Together – Led Zeppelin II, New Zealand’s most successful rock series ever, COME TOGETHER, celebrates five amazing years with one of the biggest albums ever!

This isn't just a concert; this is an immersive, once-in-a-lifetime experience where some of the most talented musicians in the country pour everything they have into recreating these albums with absolute precision and passion. Every guitar riff, soaring vocal, thunderous drumbeat, and intricate keyboard melody is delivered with an attention to detail that honours the original recordings while injecting new energy into these classic songs.

LED ZEPPELIN II
Prepare for a full-throttle rock and roll explosion. Led Zeppelin II is, hands down, one of the heaviest, hardest-hitting albums ever made. Our Come Together musicians LOVE performing Zeppelin, and this show is going to shake the foundations of every venue we hit.

Lineup
Jennie Skulander, Julia Deans, Seamus Johnson, Milan Borich, Brett Adams, Matthias Jordan, Mike Hall, Alistair Deverick, Finn Scholes & more.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Come Together — Kiwi vs Oz Rock Big End of Year Bash 2025, For decades, New Zealand and Australia have sung along to each other’s songs. We’ve traded bands and tunes across the Tasman. The team of famous Kiwi musicians at Come Together are now putting it all to the test. Kiwi vs Oz Rock Big End of Year Bash 2025 packs the biggest hits from both sides of the ditch onto one stage. Some of New Zealand’s most iconic rock musicians will tear through these legendary antipodean tracks in an all-out rock fest. You can decide who truly owns rock. Is it the swagger of Aussie pub rock or the grit and heart of Kiwi anthems? Perhaps it’s both. 
Get ready to hear the biggest tunes from AC/DC, Split Enz, Cold Chisel, The Datsuns, INXS, DD Smash, Silverchair, Australian Crawl, and Hello Sailor. That’s just for starters, so the showdown is set to be epic. Here’s the kicker — you help shape the setlist, and when the amps power down, you vote for which nation takes home the crown. 
This is more than a concert — it’s a massive celebration of the music we grew up to, the songs that built us, and the riffs that still get us moving. Grab your mates, grab your tickets, and get ready to make some noise.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Comfy Concert Number 8 🎻 Saturday 15 November, 4 - 6PM, Comfy Concert Number 8 🎻 Saturday 15 November, 4 - 6PM
� Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View �
Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music from The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, to benefit Kaibosh Food Rescue.

Comfy Concert Number 8 � Saturday 15 November, 4 - 6PM

Helene Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello) with Donald Armstrong (violin), Nicholas Hancox and Chris van der Zee (violas) performing:
Ross Harris – Long Hall Quintet (World Premiere)
Dmitri Shostakovich – Quartet No. 15
WA Mozart – Quintet in C Major K 515

Tickets:
$40 General Admission
$5 Under 18

Doors open from 3:30pm

Please join us for a cup of coffee or tea before and to get comfy before the performance starts after 4pm. Or you may like to bring a picnic snacks to sit outside and enjoy the amazing view!

Location:The Long Hall is a hidden gem - the intimate venue with the best view in Wellington! Couches, chairs, cushions… you choose your comfort level. The hall is on the hillside overlooking Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location. You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Comfy Concert at The Long Hall - The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble performance for Arohanui Strings+, � Join us for an afternoon of beautiful music and community spirit! �
Enjoy Beautiful Chamber Music with a View! Relax with a cuppa while listening to expertly curated chamber music featuring Helene, Rolf, and top musicians at an intimate venue in one of Wellington’s most stunning locations.
Helen Pohl (violin) and Rolf Gjelsten (cello), as the Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, are getting together with friends to play a series of intimate concerts that support some of their favourite causes – Arohanui Strings+ included (www.arohanuistrings.org).
Comfy Concert No.7 with Simeon Broom (violin) and Nicholas Hancox (viola) on 18 October, 2025, playing:
JS Bach - Suite No. 3 in C Major for cello solo
Dmitri Shostakovich – Quartet No. 5
Dmitri Shostakovich – Quartet No. 2
(programmes and artists may change - but hopefully not!)
The Comfy Concert series
The Comfy Concerts is a series of four beautiful concert experiences with two dates to benefit Kaibosh (20 September and 16 November) and two dates to benefit Arohanui Strings+ (Saturday 30 August and 18 October).
Thank you to Helene, Rolf and musicians of The Chamber Pot Pourri Ensemble, for generously donating time and talent in support Arohanui Strings+ and Kaibosh!
Learn more about these charities: arohanuistrings.org and kaibosh.org.nz
Location
The Long Hall overlooks Point Jerningham with views of Te Whanganui-a-Tara / Wellington Harbour. See the Google map location.
You can park on Maida Vale Rd or on Roseneath School tennis court and follow the signs. Or on foot or bike, use the footpath up from Carlton Gore Road or from Maida Vale Road near Roseneath School.
Dress warmly, and maybe bring a cushion and some slippers, as it's shoes off to protect the new floor.
It's going to be a wonderful afternoon of fabulous music, while supporting the next generation of musicians through raising funds for two fabulous charities.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Composer Series Jam: Duke Ellington, Step into the timeless world of Duke Ellington at the Composer Series Jam!

Join us as we celebrate one of jazz’s greatest composers with an evening of swinging tunes, lush harmonies, and inspired improvisation. From iconic classics to hidden gems, this jam invites musicians and listeners alike to dive into Ellington’s genius and keep his music alive.

Come down to Undercurrent on Wednesday 27th August at 7pm – Koha entry, all welcome.

House band: Oscar Lavën, James Illingworth, Dan Yeabsley, Mat Enright.

description:
Culture Embassy band Live at Nui Hui Festival, Culture Embassy is a Wellington-based 10-piece band, comprising musicians from diverse cultural backgrounds.
The ethno-cultural diversity of the band is also reflected in the sound of the music, hence the name "Culture Embassy"
A fusion of African musical styles, Roots Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro Latin rhythms.
Nui Hui is a one-night-only collision of sounds and scenes, bringing together rock, reggae, punk, grunge and a host of genre fusions and musical styles.

description:
Cumbia Blazera, Born on the pitch, raised on the dancefloor – Cumbia Blazera returns to the Rogue with a free gig that kicks harder than a Sunday League screamer.

As the musical wing of the legendary Sunday Blazers Football Club, we bring the same passion, rhythm, and camaraderie to our cumbia-infused grooves.

Expect Latin classics, Blazera originals, and a vibe that’ll have you moving like you just scored the winning goal.

description:
DJ HYBRID (UK) - Labour Sunday Day Party, Labour Sunday Day Party ft. DJ HYBRID (UK)
+ Support from BAEOLI, BPM RADIO b2b YUNG MO, CERBERUS, YOUNG GHO$T, FE b2b GOS, FRONTA b2b INTEC & SOUNDED
Powered by Breakaway Soundsystem
Ghost Media, Rhythm Output and Full Time Senders are joining forces for a massive day of dnb & jungle this Labour Sunday
We had so much fun hosting DJ Hybrid last year that we decided to bring him back for round 2!
A true legend of the scene, DJ Hybrid has been peddling the craft for over 20 years, with releases on some Donny labels such as Jungle Cakes, Liondub and Serial Killaz, as well as his own Audio Addict imprint. His sound seamlessly straddles drum n bass and jungle, with a rave-ready style that is both nostalgic and forward thinking.
On support we have pulled out the dream team, with a stacked lineup of representatives from all the crews and a range of local selectors. Things are gonna run from early til late for this one, so prepare for a shift.
Extra special thanks to Breakaway who have agreed to take their soundsystem off the rave bus and give it a run at The Garden Hotel. With a similar build to the Banshee system, expect things to get loud and deep!
$15 early birds are on sale from Humanitix - secure yours now and prepare for a full day of rolling beats and massive vibes.

description:
DJMALLGOTH / Sanctit(t)y_ROMance / BONDST, DJMALLGOTH / Sanctit(t)y_ROMance / BONDST
DJMALLGOTH is a drummer, VJ and music producer from Bristol, UK, creating a sound which both pushes sonic boundaries in production, and revives sounds that have undeservingly left the zeitgeist of modern electronic music. The forefront of the show is live percussion, with all drum breaks played out on a kit in time with heavy, morphing basslines and twisted, chopped vocals.

https://www.youtube.com/@heyyitsbenji

---

Sanctit(t)y_ROMance is a noise/dance project by Sophia Frudd. Harsh Drum Beats over echoing, billowy syncopations of desperate fallen angels, covered in tar. Aching, squealing one-liners to seethe and dwell in.

https://www.twitch.tv/videos/1996462460

---

BONDST makes their first foray into live electronic performance, with members combining their interests of free improvisation as Integument, shared love of techno parties, and hardware fetishist production. Expect morphing feedback loops driven by kick drums across instinct-led structures.

https://www.instagram.com/bondst.nz/

$15 presales via UTR
$20 on door

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Daniel Champagne (Australia) LIVE at Martinborough Town Hall (7pm Show), Show #1 - SOLD OUT
Second show announced by popular demand!
The young virtuoso recently described as “the finest guitar player of this generation” has spent the past few years selling out shows all over the globe and will be bringing his dynamite live act back to New Zealand in 2025 for a series of intimate regional concerts!
Seated show
Family friendly  
Cheaper $15 tickets for under 18s because live music is for everyone!
BYO (non alcoholic) drinks and nibbles 
October 19, 2025 @ Martinborough Town Hall
Doors open from 6:30pm / show starts at 7:00pm (8:10pm finish) 
Tickets are VERY limited. DON'T miss out!
WHAT THE PRESS SAY..
“The word Prodigy seems to entirely fall short of this soft-spoken young man’s skills, he coaxes sounds and melodies out of his instrument that literally drop jaws.”
The Calgary Herald, CANADA

“Today I saw the future of Folk – Festival goers flocking in the thousands towards the main stage to witness a young musical phenomenon from Australia dish out an absolute show-stopper.” The Firefly Column, USA

“Daniel Champagne is a crossroads. Fusing the strong traditions of Blues, Folk and other roots art with pop showmanship and admirable lyrical ability. I firmly believe that he will become an ambassador for roots music in a time where it desperately needs representation.” The Indie Blender, CANADA

“reinventing roots guitar” Rhythms Magazine, AUSTRALIA“Watching Daniel Champagne perform is a once in a lifetime experience. He is a true prodigy that plays like no one else could possibly play unless they spent at least two lifetimes studying the art.” BW Review, NEW ZEALAND

“Daniel Champagne exudes a natural ease on stage, as he sings poignant lyrics and beautifully crafted melodies that invariably whisk the heart up with grand romanticism. Coupled with an exhilarating guitar talent that transcends mere acoustic playing to replicate a whole band, Champagne is just magical” Themusic.com.au, AUSTRALIA

"You feel as if he just invented the instrument yesterday and was discovering its possibilities afresh” Ted Gioia (American jazz critic and music historian)
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Davey Griffiths & Celine Filbee Live at the RSC, Davey Griffiths & Celine Filbee Live at the RSC
Koha entry call 04 299 1658 to book a table. Davey and Celine have crafted their diverse set around shared love of the blues, a funky groove and beautiful ballads, including originals and covers, also encompassing americana and roots music. You can expect to laugh at their humorous take on some songs, cry at the beautiful ballads they partner on and be toe tapping to their groove. Davey’s acute ear and sound experience allow him to distil the very essence of a song and craft arrangements showcasing the underlying groove inherent in his playing. His voice, reserved, yet soulful and resonant along with his sympathetic guitar chops, elevate Celine’s and other songs to new and sometimes surprising places. Celine provides rhythm guitar and a powerhouse vocal performance, she can own the biggest banger, feel the suffering of a blues standard or dial it right back to expose all the sentiment in a ballad.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Debt Club EP Release Show W/ Model Home & Wiri Donna, Debt Club celebrate the release of their debut EP “Taste For Stout” with a special show in Pōneke, joined by friends and powerhouse live acts Model Home and Wiri Donna.
Formed in 2023, Debt Club have quickly made their mark with a dynamic, guitar-driven sound that blends anthemic hooks with thoughtful lyricism. Following the release of singles “Little Lines” and “Windows,” both featured on “Taste For Stout”, the band are set to mark this milestone with their biggest show yet.
Ōtautahi legends Model Home bring their kiwi take on midwest emo, earning massive attention with their 2023 debut album “…And Nobody Made A Sound” and a bunch of student radio hits.
Wiri Donna, led by Bianca Bailey, are a commanding indie rock force whose high energy shows and acclaimed EP’s Being Alone and In My Chambers have made them one of Aotearoa’s most exciting live acts.

description:
Donál Gunning, Every Wednesday, come down to Moon for FREE live music from 6.30pm, all pizzas $15 from 5.30-9pm

Dónal Gunning is a singer songwriter from Dublin, Ireland. He draws on rock, folk, indie and punk influences.

Now based in Wellington, New Zealand his debut solo single Homesick released in October 2023. Homesick is a song dedicated to the masses who have emigrated their motherland for opportunity and adventure. It tells the story of the struggle in leaving friends and family.

His debut EP Born to Perform released in May 2024. The EP was inspired and written while travelling New Zealand, Portugal and Ireland.

Donal has released two singles in 2025 Your 1 & Losing Weight both of which have received tremendous praise globally. He is set to release a second EP later this year. He knows how to work the crowd and always brings fun, energy and Irish charm through his thought-provoking lyrics and formative sound

description:
Doubtful Sounds at Wellington, Bryan Crump and the Doubtful Sounds are back in November!
If you love songs by Straitjacket Fits, The Beths, Don McGlashan, ABBA , Joni Mitchell and more, well, you’ve never heard the Doubtful Sounds sing them! High energy musical director Bryan Crump, of RNZ fame, leads the choir in original a cappella arrangements of pop songs from New Zealand and the world.
Doubtful Sounds won silver in the Pop Ensembles category at The World Choir Games in 2024, but they haven’t performed in Wellington for some time. The drought is over and you can see them in concert at 6.30pm on Saturday 8 November 2025 at Vogelmorn Upstairs in Brooklyn.
Come early to eat, stay on after the show to have a drink with the choir. The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm.
The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.
label: Music & Concerts

Armed with undeniably some of the heaviest riffs known to mankind, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 has established a reputation for uncompromising integrity with a slew of classic albums and today rides a resurgence of respect and esteem with a new generation. The band continually refines its unique take on death, grind, and hardcore with a combination of virtuosity and ferocity, inescapably catchy hooks, punishing breakdowns and a complete lack of pretension.

After 12 horribly long years since their last tour in Australia and in only their second appearance in New Zealand since 2009, 𝗗𝗬𝗜𝗡𝗚 𝗙𝗘𝗧𝗨𝗦 are well overdue to lash us unmercifully with their savage beatdowns and earth-moving grooves and grunt, equally designed to pulverize and mesmerize.

On their first slog into the antipodes, Cleveland death metal legends-in-waiting 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 serve up a brutal slab of old school death metal with a contemporary edge. Not for the faint-hearted, 𝟮𝟬𝟬 𝗦𝗧𝗔𝗕 𝗪𝗢𝗨𝗡𝗗𝗦 craft classic gore-themed savagery for themselves and like-minded brethren: thrill-seekers, carnage cravers, horror fans, and aficionados of the most extreme of metal.

www.facebook.com/200StabWounds

Dónal Gunning - Free Live Music Wednesdays, Every Wednesday, come down to Moon for FREE live music from 6.30pm, all pizzas $15 from 5.30-9pm
Dónal Gunning is a singer songwriter from Dublin, Ireland. He draws on rock, folk, indie and punk influences.
Now based in Wellington, New Zealand his debut solo single Homesick released in October 2023. Homesick is a song dedicated to the masses who have emigrated their motherland for opportunity and adventure. It tells the story of the struggle in leaving friends and family.
His debut EP Born to Perform released in May 2024. The EP was inspired and written while travelling New Zealand, Portugal and Ireland.
Donal has released two singles in 2025 Your 1 & Losing Weight both of which have received tremendous praise globally. He is set to release a second EP later this year. He knows how to work the crowd and always brings fun, energy and Irish charm through his thought-provoking lyrics and formative sound

description:
Echoes of Us - WJF 2025, Echoes of Us is a live, improvised music experience where you are the muse. In an evening of deep reflection, spontaneous creativity and genuine musicianship, a house band fronted by saxophonist and woodwind doubler Zoe Ioannou, invites you as the audience to share personal moments, memories, or themes—light-hearted, emotional, joyful, tender–anything you desire. These offerings are then to be transformed into rich, evolving soundscapes created in real-time by the musicians. Perfectly set in the warm, intimate and light atmosphere of Whisky and Wood, this event offers an invitation to slow down, listen deeply, and feel heard in a way words alone often cannot achieve. Come as you are—your story may become the music that moves and echoes us all at Wellington Jazz Festival 2025.
Doors open 4.30pm for a 5pm start.

description:
Enemy of the State, Enemy of the State
Enemy of the State spans new music, Romantic lyricism, and one of the most incendiary works in Shostakovich’s career, performed by outstanding guest artists.

The concert opens with the NZ premiere of John Psathas’ Next Planet. Commissioned and premiered by the Tonhalle Düsseldorf GmbH (management company for the Tonhalle Düsseldorf in Germany) and the Düsseldorf Symphony as part of their Green Mondays project, Next Planet was premiered in June 2024 as part of a cycle of twelve “Green Pieces.” Read more about the project and John's work here.

The programme continues with Alexander Glazunov’s Violin Concerto in A minor, a Romantic masterpiece notable for its warmth and lyricism. Composed in 1904, the concerto weaves together heartfelt themes across its uninterrupted movements, culminating in a brilliant solo cadenza leading to to the trumpet calls heralding the final Allegro. Orchestra Wellington is delighted to welcome back Benjamin Baker, violinist and Artistic Director of At the World’s Edge Festival, to perform this remarkable work.

Lady Macbeth of Mtsensk, Suite for Soprano and Orchestra, featuring internationally acclaimed lyric soprano Madeleine Pierard, will close the evening. Premiered in January 1934 as a massive success, in early 1936 the Russian newspaper Pravda denounced the opera in an article titled “Muddle Instead of Music,” sending Shostakovich’s life into a tailspin. The work was banned in the Soviet Union for almost thirty years, until 1961. Orchestra Wellington Music Director Marc Taddei has crafted a suite tracing the journey of the opera’s protagonist, Katerina, from isolation and passion to betrayal and despair, combining arias and orchestral interludes into a concentrated symphonic portrait. Alongside the forces of Orchesta Wellington, complemented by one of Wellington's very own A-grade brass bands, Pierard’s powerful voice brings Shostakovich’s heroine vividly to life, illuminating both the work’s humanity and the reasons it provoked such outrage.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
FUNKIN' DONUTS feat. DJ Audit (AK), FUNKIN' DONUTS feat. DJ Audit (AK)
We’re back for one last jam - and we’re going out with a bang! Join us for an extended party session at Parrotdog, with special guest DJ Audit from Auckland. The last time we teamed up at The Yotty (RIP) in Raglan, it was the stuff of legend. Let’s make it happen again - see you on the dancefloor!

FUNKIN’ DONUTS is a celebration of all things funky on the 7” 45 vinyl format. The brand’s name comes from the records themselves - small, round, and with a large hole in the middle, they’ve long been nicknamed “donuts.” Founded by Flex Webster in 2022, FUNKIN’ DONUTS began as a jam session with fellow 45 heads before evolving into a platform for original edits and future vinyl releases. With an ultimate vision of putting out 7” records, Flex has already released six albums of party edits under the brand, with plans for the first physical release coming soon. Now based in Bali, FUNKIN’ DONUTS is going global - relaunching with a fresh, dancefloor-focused energy.

Joining us from Tāmaki Makaurau: DJ Audit

Since 1998, Audit has been crafting an eclectic sound that transcends genres while staying rooted in Hip Hop culture. A lifelong record collector and open-format DJ, his sets seamlessly weave Disco, Hip Hop, Soul, Cumbia, and Latin rhythms into vibrant journeys. With decades of experience, a deep appreciation for musical diversity, and an instinct for reading the crowd, Audit creates electric atmospheres that keep the audience moving.

Host with the most: Flex Webster

Flex Webster lives and breathes music. A DJ, producer, and record collector with a career spanning almost three decades, his journey has taken him around the globe. Flex’s sound blends Afrobeat, Latin, Funk, Hip Hop, Reggae, Disco, and House, reflecting the soulful rhythms of the African diaspora. Don’t miss this rare B2B with old mate Audit - your last chance to catch Flex for a while, as he returns to Bali to bring his magic back to the Island of the Gods.

description:
First Reserve, Dropper & Elly Mae, Get ready for another memorable night out as First Reserve & Dropper share the bill with rising star Elly Mae. This will be an evening to feast your ears on a diverse soundscape of angular guitars, melodic goodness, and glorious noise.

Here’s the lo-down:

First Reserve is inevitable. Before adopting the moniker in 2023, Ryan Connaghan had been prolifically writing music that communicated their experiences in life, love, and loneliness. These themes are all approached on songs like “Last One” and “Me & My Friends” – the first offerings from First Reserve’s debut EP set for release in late 2025. On stage, their sound is both intimate and larger-than-life, combining influences from alt-rock, indie-folk, and pop.

Dropper combines intuitive songwriting sensibilities with wall-of-sound, guitar.  Blending noise and melody, Dropper is dynamic, song-centred, high-energy indie rock. Often compared to Bob Mould’s work with Hüsker Dü or Lou Barlow's early Sebadoh, they’ve been described by one review as having a "high energy stage performance punctuated by flawless musicianship and songwriting skills that seems beyond the years...Honestly, it’s hard to overstate how impressed I was with Dropper and am eagerly awaiting my next chance to see them live.”

Elly Mae's music encapsulates the bittersweet complexities of growth, relationships, time escaping, and the nostalgia embedded within. Her music is an amalgamation of folk, dreampop, shoegaze and whatnot.

Grab your general release tickets online for just $15! Or, even better, grab an early bird ticket for only $10 and secure your spot for a night of unforgettable live music. Doors at 8pm, first act on at 8:30pm.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Fizzwizard plays T-Bone Walker, Pōneke raised guitar slinger Aleister 'Fizzwizard' Campbell storms home from Tāmaki Makaurau to lead a stellar sextet through a set of sophisticated blues by electric guitar pioneer T-Bone Walker.
At the crossroads where Blues and Jazz meet, you'd be sure to find Aaron Thibeaux Walker. Better known to his fans as 'T-Bone', he pioneered the electric guitar in The Blues, directly influencing every great blues player who came after him, and through Chuck Berry on Rock 'n' Roll. Often performing with jazz musicians, his music was refined and sophisticated, infused with the perfect amount of rough edge and grit, and always devilishly swinging.
Joining Aleister for this one-off gig are a sensational Auckland rhythm section, an exuberant Wellington horn section, and special guest Paul Dyne making a rare outing on keys!
