description:
Frank Talbot presents The Franktastic Four, Presenting a range of his eclectic compositions and arrangements in an organ quartet format, Talbot promises to bring his music’s trademark humour and energy to the gig.
Joining Frank to complete a tremendous band are Jack Harré on trumpet, Ayrton Foote on keyboard, and Sean Anderson on drums.
You don’t want to miss this gig!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Freak Slug - Wellington, Manchester based musician Freak Slug - the project of Xenya Genovese - will be welcoming audiences in Pōneke Wellington and Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland into her dreamy indie-pop world this October.

Hugely influenced by ‘90s cult heroes including Ride, Mazzy Star and Stephen Malkmus, Freak Slug is all about hitting a mood. Everything that fuels her creative output is raw, authentic, sometimes weird, but always totally true self-expression. I Blow Out Big Candles is a strong statement of all of this and more. Down there, picking through the curious mix of sounds and feelings, from nostalgic, ‘90s-influenced and dreamy as well as eccentric and experimental, lives Freak Slug.

The 10-track project gives listeners a taste of what they will be in for at her Aotearoa shows, a journey of both soft soulfulness and sonic songwriting, all laid out on the table.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Free Status - Jazz Festival, Free Status is a jazz fusion band coming all the way from Auckland for one night only at Otto!
Free Status draws melodic inspiration from iconic artists like Herbie Hancock and 70s jazz/funk legends with electronic flair inspired by artists like Moby.
At the heart of Free Status is Tommy David on keys, an accomplished musician/composer in the early stages of his career. He has earned recognition in numerous jazz competitions and supported legendary rock acts such as Dire Straits Legacy Band, Nazareth, Hello Sailor, and plays with popular rockabilly band, Recliner Rockers. With composition at the center of his artistry, he can’t wait to share the exciting and genuine compositions he has created.
The rhythm section features Behzad Karakia (drums) and Tyler Diprose (bass), both veterans of performances with many of New Zealand’s jazz greats.
On lead alto sax is James Dawes, recently selected for an international touring band on a year-long cruise. His versatility extends well beyond jazz.
On keys is Sam Voyle, whose primary instrument is tenor saxophone. Performing with Tommy since their school days, he has built a strong musical bond that has led to major appearances, including the America’s Cup main stage and high-profile corporate events.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Friday Jazz at The Runholder, Friday Jazz at The Runholder
Join us at The Runholder for a late afternoon jazz concert with The Sunflowers Jazz Trio from Wellington.

Inspired by legends like Anita O’Day and Sarah Vaughan, The Sunflowers bring timeless jazz classics to life on the guitar, vocals & double bass, delivering renditions from the Great American Songbook with style, soul & swing.

From 4pm, you'll be able to sip a Lighthouse Gin & Tonic and enjoy a shared Runholder platter while listening to the jazz session. The concert will wrap up at 6pm and we invite you to stay and enjoy dinner with us.

$49 per person (payable on the evening) includes a Lighthouse Gin & Tonic on arrival, concert and shared platter at your table. Reserve your table at www.therunholder.co.nz/book

description:
Friday Launch Pad feat. Nam Chucks, Blast off into the weekend with a rotating DJ lineup broadcasting live from Moon Base every Friday 6-8pm. Free entry, happy hour on board!

Commanding the decks this week is Nam Chucks - expect an otherworldly sound journey through all things BASS from Roots, Reggae, Dubs, Dubstep Steppas, Jungle, booty bass, Bollywood & more

Nam Chucks, known formally as Namnita Kumar, is a DJ, selector, MC, and long time radio host at Radio Active FM.
Few selectors in this scene see critical acclaim, but Nam Chucks is a proud recipient of the Taite Music Prize, alongside the Outstanding Music Journalism Award from NZ on air.

Nam Chucks possesses a deep appreciation and respect for Soundsystem philosophy - dedicating her musical selections to the concepts of unity and inclusivity in rave culture. Soundsystem music serves as a vessel for her to heal others, guide the dance, and respect all things sacred & indigenous.

description:
Friday Launchpad feat. Jen Kyle, Blast off into the weekend with a rotating DJ lineup broadcasting live from Moon Base every Friday 6-8pm.
Commanding the decks this week is Jen Kyle - expect an otherworldly sound journey through disco, techno, acid, house & more
Jen currently hosts a monthly slot on The Late Late Breakfast Show with DJ Coda on RadioActive.FM. Prior to this she gained a cult following for her Drive Show of 12 years where she played everything from techno to disco, punk to funk, soul to hip hop, new wave and beyond. Out and about she's a regular at Taniwha's Den Festival and S-ence nights in the capital.
Having the musical freedom that a place like RadioActive.FM provides combined with living in Glasgow before heading to Aotearoa, working and dancing at legendary Glasgow clubs such as The Sub Club and The Arches has resulted in Jen having a broad musical spectrum. Her sets pull from that whilst being strongly influenced and moulded by her beloved Glasgow.
What to expect? Anything across the realms of disco and the darker side, acid, techno, house, wobbles and wonkiness.
Free entry, happy hour on board!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Funky Fridays Vol.7 - Not My Sister, Libbi K, Ben-Jammin, We're back for another night of house, techno, disco, bass & more at Moon with Funky Fridays Vol. 7!
Created to revive and celebrate the underground electronic scene, Funky Friday is more than just a night out—it’s a space for music lovers, dancers, and creatives to connect through rhythm and energy. Each edition features a rotating lineup of talented DJs, both local and international, ensuring a fresh and unique experience every time.
Come with an open mind and leave with tired feet.
This edition features legends Libby K, Ben-Jammin & our host Not My Sister!
$10 presales available now via UTR, or $15 on the door.
Times:
9-10 Not My Sister
10-11.30 Libby K
11.30-1 Ben Jammin
1-2 Not My Sister
-------------------------------------------------------
NOT MY SISTER
Not My Sister is a house music DJ born and raised in a little town in the north of Italy. Now based in Wellington, she started this project in 2024, and recently she has been lighting up dance floors across New Zealand, you may have already come across her sets at Twisted Frequency, Kiwiburn, Earthbeat, Cuba Dupa, Arkadien and other events across the country. Influenced by funk and disco, with a special focus on vocals and anything groovy, Not My Sister brings high energy and uplifting sets. Constantly developing as an artist, she always brings fun and passion to the dance floors. Expect a delightful fusion of melodic basslines, blending soulful, tech, garage, and deep house sounds.
www.soundcloud.com/not-my-sister
www.facebook.com/notmysista
www.instangram.com/not.my.sister

LIBBY K
From the vibrant streets of Wellington, Libby's fascination with music began at an early age with the smooth sultry
sounds of the clarinet and piano. Fast forward to her 20s where she stumbled into the hypnotic world of techno in
Berlin and a passion for 4/4 was ignited.
With a deep appreciation for the power of music to transform, Libby finds the greatest joy on a dance floor, where
the magic of music brings people together and gives us the freedom to be ourselves. Her sets are filled with
uplifting, emotive and tantalising sounds of downtempo, house and techno. Mixed with intention and a whole lot
of love xx
https://soundcloud.com/libby_k
https://www.instagram.com/libbykdj/
https://www.facebook.com/libbykmusic
https://www.twitch.tv/libbykdj

BEN-JAMMIN
Originally from Bristol, UK, Ben was immersed in soundsystem culture from an early age. He started collecting vinyl in his teens and developed a passion for the heavier side of electronic music. With his formative years spent mixing vinyl, studying African percussion and playing drums and recording for rock/rap group Band of Crooks, he moved on to play with some of the best underground DJ's, producers and musicians in Aotearoa, Australia and UK. Ben has played a myriad of parties and events including Newtown Festival, Cuba Dupa, Kiwi Burn, Little Monsters, Insomnia, Toots Suite Festival (Salmonella Dub, Laughton Kora, Pheonix Foundation), Breakaway Magical Doof Bus (Paige Julia, Y, Sorchalula,Young Gho$t, House MD), Cuba Dupa, Sydney Rd Street Festival (Melbourne), Cafe Blue (UK), Castros (UK).
Ben-Jammin can do what is needed to keep a dancefloor alive, comfortably switching between genres to suit the mood.
Always armed with bags of bass heavy treats expect a selection of new, classic and surprise music to help you release your spirit into the world.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
GENERAL KALA LIVE at Le Cafe, Picton, GENERAL KALA LIVE at Le Cafe, Picton
General Kala - Described as "Ultravox meets Kate Bush"
Founded in 2013, Wellington-based General Kala's first live performance was two years later, by which time they had a 90-minute set of original, synthesiser-driven music. The original lineup of Cusiel (vocal and synth), Spence (synths and vocal) and Mathiassen (drums) is still in place for 2025, with six EPs to be released this April and May (plus another six by 2026) through Pulse Science Recordings.
Taking their lead from classic analog-synth acts of the late 1970s and early '80s, as well as progressive and rock luminaries of both decades, Kala infuses visceral, soaring, melodic dance composition with vintage synthesis and syncopated rhythm
Now based in Auckland, the band will bring their singular sound to Le Cafe in Picton.
https://www.generalkala.com/
https://generalkala.bandcamp.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Girls Rock the Boys (Wellington), Girls Rock the Boys is bringing powerhouse vocals and legendary rock anthems to the stage. With Ashley Hale-Durham, Georgie Sullivan, Jude Madill, and Julie Lamb leading the charge, and a stellar band backing them up, it's bound to be a night of high-energy performances.

This from our last gig...

"Man did they ROCK! 4 very talented ladies and awesome band... the venue was rocking - check them out!"

An electrifying time warp! The 70s were a golden era for rock, with bands like Journey, Led Zeppelin, Whitesnake, and Deep Purple defining the sound of an entire generation. The idea of powerhouse female vocalists fronting a live band, belting out classics from these legends, is pure magic.

Early bird tickets are just $20, while door sales are $30—so it's definitely worth grabbing them early. This show is going to be an absolute blast, so securing those cheaper tickets ahead of time is a smart move.

description:

Twelve DJs. One room. Zero chance of sitting still. We’re back at The Pow Wow Room for another round of controlled chaos, running full open format — house, garage, RnB, breaks, bass, and the kind of late-night rollers that make you forget what time it is.

description:
Gordo And Teej Present: Craigslist, Craigslist are a party, record label and DJ outfit operated by Colter Carson (Public Possession) and Raffeal Hamblett. Since humble beginnings in 2020, the project aims to create shared moments of joy with an aesthetic centred on obscure records. The success of this manifesto is reflected in the consistently positive response gained from partygoers and label supporters alike, year after year.⁣
⁣
In the DJ booth, Colter and Raffy (Craigslist Soundsystem) strike a delicate balance between eclecticism and danceability that denotes a deep understanding of musical traditions and club culture. Defying the confines of genre and era, the pair bring a refreshing and joyous sound to the dancefloor.⁣

Gordo & Teej are proud to present iconic Ōtautahi due Craigslist, after dancing to these guys all summer at Flux, Smash Palace, Electric Ave and Two Minds festivals we just had to fly 'em up to show the Pōneke whānau how these guys get the dance floor cranking. Expect nothing less than the finest Italo disco grooves, chunky house beats and uptempo club music to transport you to a sun soaked festival light years away from the welly winter.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Gregory Alan Isakov,   American indie-folk artist Gregory Alan Isakov is a Grammy-nominated singer and songwriter. He’s bringing his intimate and lyric-driven show to Wellington in February. Audiences will be given a special opportunity to experience stripped-down acoustic arrangements. He’ll delve into favourites from six of his full-length studio albums, including his most recent ‘Appaloosa Bones’. 
This 2023 album was praised with an Associated Press reviewer saying, “His new songs are relentlessly majestic, a kind of musical morphine”. Gregory has amassed a devoted community of fans who have helped him garner over 1 billion streams on listening platforms to date.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Guns 2 Roses - World's Best Guns N' Roses Tribute, GUNS 2 ROSES
World's Best GNR Tribute
Guns 2 Roses, the UK’s most notorious Guns N’ Roses tribute band established in 2002, is set to perform in New Zealand for the first time. They will play the classic GNR debut album “Appetite For Destruction” in its entirety top to bottom, along with a set of fan favourites.

“THE MOST NOTORIOUS GUNS N ROSES TRIBUTE IN HISTORY EST 2002 – THE ONLY GNR TRIBUTE TO PLAY LIVE WITH 4 DIFFERENT MEMBERS OF GUNS N ROSES! THEY HAVE PLAYED ALL THE TOP VENUES AND FESTIVALS IN THE UK – EUROPE – DUBAI – INDIA & USA. GUNS 2 ROSES ARE THE LONGEST RUNNING, CLOSEST LOOKING AND MOST INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNISED G’N’R TRIBUTE IN THE WORLD!”

Having sold out shows worldwide, Guns 2 Roses aims to recreate the energy of GNR’s 1988 NYC Ritz performance. For fans of classic GNR, this is a performance not to be missed.

Don’t miss this opportunity to experience the ultimate GNR tribute live in New Zealand.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

label: Music & Concerts

description:
Halcyon Drift - Album Release Party, Halcyon Drift - Album Release Party
Come enjoy the release of Halcyon Drift's new album Fading Light!!

About this Event

Steve, Matt, Matthew, and Gregor from Halcyon Drift are thrilled to partner with The Abandoned Taproom in Petone to share our life's work with you, through our newly released album, Fading Light!!
Produced by our great friend and collaborator Craig Sengelow, the album features 12 of our favourite tracks, capturing the essence of everything we've poured into this journey.
We'll be performing the album in full, track by track, followed by a set of our best-loved songs from the rest. This is going to ROCK.
We're also excited to be joined by Jed Symonds our support act. A talented singer-guitarist who's been performing for six years, Jed’s music draws from his roots in country and expands into the gritty energy of 90s alternative and rock. He’s currently carving his path through live performances, and we’re stoked to have him open the night.
Let’s give Jed a warm welcome and show him your full support!
Note, there is an option to purchase on a vinyl copy of Fading Light when you purchase your ticket to the event.
label: Music & Concerts

description: Heaven & Earth: Celebrating 25 Years of Bold Sounds, Heaven & Earth marks 25 years of Stroma’s fearless exploration of sound and spirit since our inaugural concert Wind, Rain & Light in August 2000. We recall the theme of that first concert by similarly evoking musical impressions of the earth below and the sky above. Featuring a world premiere by New York-based NZ composer Leila Adu-Gilmore, the programme includes Olivier Messiaen’s ecstatic Louange à l’immortalité de Jésus, Gemma Peacocke’s Sky Fields, John Rimmer’s Where Sea Meets Sky 2, Michael Norris’s new piano trio The Spaces In Between, and—to mark the recent passing of Sofia Gubaidulina—her meditative Garden of Joy and Sorrow. Come join us in celebrating a quarter century of intrepid sonic exploration from the musicians of Stroma.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Helmet 2026 | Wellington, HELMET ANNOUNCE RETURN TO AOTEAROA IN APRIL 2026
"Helmet stripped away the excess, dialled in the precision, and redefined what heaviness could sound like without succumbing to clichés." Pitchfork
NYC Noise Rock Instigators Helmet return to Aotearoa / New Zealand for two shows in April 2026. Playing Wellington’s San Fran on Saturday 11 April, followed by The Powerstation in Auckland on Sunday 12 April. 
Tickets on sale Thursday 2 October 12pm from helmetmusic.com
Helmet has built a reputation as one of the most commanding forces in the underground scene. Born at the dawn of the rage-filled 90’s, Helmet fiercely holds space for multiple generations of alternative fans seeking the vital energy of hostile riffs and inventive metronomic groove. With a refusal to fit neatly into a genre, Helmet’s music creates an atmosphere best known live; part industrial, part hip-hop, part existential sermon. 

Formed in 1989 in NYC by Page Hamilton, Helmet has been crushing stages for over three decades. In that time they have only come to Aotearoa / NZ a handful of times, most recently in 2023 during their sold out Best of Helmet 1989-2023 tour, with 13th Floor declaring “a complete evening of essential music from one of heavy music’s most essential bands.” With 35 years of rocking behind them, Helmet are at the top of their game. Don’t miss Helmet in New Zealand next April. Tickets on sale Thursday 2 October, 12pm 
HELMET 
New Zealand April ‘26
Presented by Eccles Entertainment, 95bFM, Under The Radar

Sat 11 April 
San Fran | Wellington
helmetmusic.com
Sun 12 April 
Powerstation | Auckland
helmetmusic.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Hobnail and Friends, Rob, Jo, Hamish, Caroline and Murray are joined by special guests Wayne Mason, Alan Norman and Nicola Mitchell for a night of musical fun and excellence. The last time they got together was for a sold out show at Morgan's Clubhouse, described by the audience there as one of the best shows they had ever seen. Hobnail have criss-crossed NZ for 30 years now, making toes tap, feet dance and hearts soar with their “illustrious blend of celtic, folk, country and rock”. Dazzling instrumentation, award winning songwriting, and “vocals so tightly knit they could be family” add up to a truly memorable performance.
Joined by national treasure Wayne Mason, old mate and current Warratah Alan Norman, and the truly wonderful Nicola Mitchell "making waves with her enchanting vocals and songwriting prowess. " Nicola will play a short opening set, then the expanded 8-piece Hobnail will be playing 2 sets of favourites old, new, borrowed, but not so blue. Oh, and it's Rob's birthday!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Hobnail at Kapiti Playhouse, Hobnail are celebrating the release of their new album "Three Part" with a national tour. “Three Part” (out July 2025) is the 8th album from Wellington’s Hobnail. The new album features Hobnail’s take on songs by some of their favourite Kiwi and Australian bands and songwriters, including Don McGlashan, Barry Saunders, the Waifs, Nick Cave, and more.. These versions highlight the vocal and instrumental interplay between these 3 exceptional musicians.
Hobnail are a Wellington institution. They have played shows everywhere from Pittsburgh to Paekakariki, New Plymouth to Norfolk Island, Auckland to Amsterdam, Germany to Gore, the Canadian Praries to the Canterbury Plains. They are 3-time finalists at the New Zealand Music Awards (Best Folk Album and Best Country Song twice).
"Refreshingly down-to-earth and lovely with vocals so tightly knit they could be family"
label: Music & Concerts

Upstairs at the Vogelmorn Bowling Club.
Doors at 7pm, music starting at 730pm.
$15 from Under The Radar, or $20 on the door.
Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our
neighbours.
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com.

description: Illicit Love, Step into a world of secrets for this one-night-only prohibition-style speakeasy, packed with live jazz, bootleg cocktails, and a dance floor ready for rebels and romantics alike. Slip past the watchful eye of the ‘authorities’ and step into a world where love is bold, the drinks flow freely, and the music never stops. Enjoy handcrafted cocktails featuring The Bond Store’s award-winning spirits, paired with decadent bites designed for sharing. The night kicks off with big brass energy from a live jazz band, leading into a high-energy celebration of love, freedom, and the thrill of breaking the rules. Drape yourself in 1920s glamour, grab your partner in crime, and prepare for a night of indulgence, mischief, and unforgettable memories. But remember...loose lips sink ships, so keep the password hush-hush.

description:
Innermost Gardening Music, A picnic lunch and new music inspired by the Gardens!
Join Jake Baxendale and friends as they delve into new approaches to composition and improvisation in the beautiful seclusion of Mount Victoria's Innermost Gardens.
Inspired by writers in the environmental humanities such as Anna Tsing, Robin Wall-Kimmerer and Ursula Le Guin, Jake is on a journey to connect his practice to his relationship with the natural world. Setting a concert in the gardens is just one more step in this ever-evolving process.

description:
Jack Hooker - Live Music Wednesdays, Jack Hooker is an acoustic guitarist and electronic musician, known for his immersive electronic music and intricate fingerstyle guitar. His output spans solo guitar, the groups The Shocking and Stunning and Ambient Ousìa, and many international collaborations across Indonesia, the Philippines, Greece and beyond. He will be performing a set of original acoustic guitar works. Expect expansive steel-string soundscapes with intricate fingerpicking, tapping techniques, and open tunings.

As always, entry is free and $15 pizza specials will be available!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jade Merematira - Te Wiki o te Reo Māori ko Marama, Jade Merematira is a rising voice in Aotearoa’s scene, weaving honeyed vocals and heartfelt storytelling into every performance. With a sound that flows effortlessly between soul, R&B, and the rich emotional currents of her Cook Island Māori heritage, Jade invites listeners into an intimate space of warmth, reflection, and aroha.

Following the release of her debut single Finding Love, and its soulful follow-up The Siren, Jade is quickly establishing herself as a unique and powerful artist with a message worth hearing.

On September 17th, Jade brings her soulful energy to Moon Bar in Newtown, celebrating Te Wiki o te Reo Māori with a night of music that honours this land and it’s language. Expect stirring original tracks alongside tender covers of some of her favourite waiata – all delivered with grace and love.

Join us for an evening where soul meets whakapapa, and let Jade Merematira guide you through a night of connection, culture, and sound.

Free entry - all pizzas $15 all night
label: Music & Concerts

Jazz Composer Series | Blair Latham And Anton Wuts, Sh*t gets Wild

Anton and Blair at the Rogue!

Anton Wuts and Blair Latham are back orchestrating their head turning take on music for a large ensemble, but this time with a new twist. 
TWO quintets!

Drums and Bass and Harmony and Horns, Drums and Bass and Harmony and Horns, are they side by side or head to head?? Do they work in harmony, (so to speak), for the betterment of all ears or do they take a cue from the world around us??

Only the music can and will divulge its sonorous secrets.

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Callum Allardice, The eleventh concert in our series of Aotearoa jazz composers features award winning composer and performer Callum Allardice, with a new suite of music for rhythm section and strings; Ode to Sadness.
A collection of songs, old and new, presented alongside some of the works that inspired them. From intimate improvisations and poignant melodies to soaring strings, the music moves through moments of reverence, reflection, and quiet triumph. Sometimes solemn, sometimes radiant, but always beautiful, Ode To Sadness is a celebration of the beauty found in sorrow.

Callum is an award-winning composer and guitarist based in New Zealand. He is a three-time recipient of the APRA Best Jazz Composition award for his works ‘Sons of Thunder’ (2016), ‘Deep Thought’ (2017), and ‘Chungin’ (2019). In 2020 he and his group The Jac, received the Recorded Music NZ Best Jazz Artist award for their album ‘A Gathering’, and in 2022 he was the inaugural Te Kōkī - New Zealand School of Music jazz composer-in-residence.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.
Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Louisa Williamson, The ninth concert in this series of Aotearoa composers features the multi-talented saxophonist/composer Louisa Williamson.

Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other.  Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo.

This commission opportunity has come at a perfect time for me to process some recent grief and pain that’s inhabited my circles. Whilst composing this music, I’ve thought about ideas around mental health, specifically with youth in Aotearoa, and also honouring some friends who have passed. I think artists have the ability to turn heartbreak into beauty, and this music is an attempt at that. Although the inspiration which generated the music is heavy, the performance itself will hopefully feel light and reflective (turning heartbreak into beauty = darkness into light!), and will embrace and celebrate the talents of the musicians who are playing. I’ve brought together a beautiful group of people who I know will handle this music with care and fortitude

Bryn van Vliet - alto/flute
Tyaan Singh - alto sax
Louisa Williamson - tenor/flute
Eilish Wilson - baritone sax
Sylvester Green - trumpet
Kaia Johnstone - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Jakob Elijas - trombone
Anna Lee - euphonium
Sam Zhu - tuba
Leonardo Coghini - piano
Jacob Hurst - bass
Max Sheehan - drums

The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15 from Humanitix.com, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other.  Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo.
"This commission opportunity has come at a perfect time for me to process some recent grief and pain that’s inhabited my circles. Whilst composing this music, I’ve thought about ideas around mental health, specifically with youth in Aotearoa, and also honouring some friends who have passed. I think artists have the ability to turn heartbreak into beauty, and this music is an attempt at that. Although the inspiration which generated the music is heavy, the performance itself will hopefully feel light and reflective (turning heartbreak into beauty = darkness into light!), and will embrace and celebrate the talents of the musicians who are playing. I’ve brought together a beautiful group of people who I know will handle this music with care and fortitude"
Bryn van Vliet - alto/flute
Tyaan Singh - alto sax
Louisa Williamson - tenor/flute
Eilish Wilson - baritone sax
Sylvester Green - trumpet
Kaia Johnstone - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Jakob Elijas - trombone
Anna Lee - euphonium
Sam Zhu - tuba
Leonardo Coghini - piano
Jacob Hurst - bass
Max Sheehan - drums
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.
Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: John Rae, Award-winning composer and musician John Rae invites you to an
enchanting evening of Celtic-inspired music that promises to get your feet tapping and your ears thumping. This large ensemble draws on both new and traditional melodies, reimagined in a style that reflects Rae’s cultural roots and personal musical journey. Experience a vibrant celebration of Celtic heritage through engaging rhythms and rich harmonies that showcase the versatility and depth of contemporary Celtic music.
John has recorded over 30 albums as a leader and side man including two BBC Jazz Albums of the Year (2003 and 2004). He has performed with the Scottish National Jazz Orchestra, was the first ever Jazz Composer in Residence at Victoria University, has written music for the NZSO/Wellington Jazz Orchestra and RNZAF Concert Band, and has toured internationally with his eclectic chamber ensemble "The Troubles".

description:
Jess and Cam, Jess Deacon is a cross-genre vocalist and songwriter who embodies influences from jazz, folk, soul, classic rock and choral music. She is an engaging performer, has an ear for music that speaks to the soul, and writes songs that connect us as humans and challenge the expectations of the modern musician – following the ebb and flow of life as we know it.

She has fronted a number of bands, been commissioned as a composer, recorded on several projects, performed at a variety of festivals and events across Aotearoa, and has written a variety of original music.

Cam Steel is an amazing drummer and all-round beat master whose ability to produce a soundscape driven by rhythm is next level.

Together, Jess and Cam will give us a lunchtime of easy, groovy blues, a fine way to while away a Sunday afternoon.

Tickets $20 or $10 for Capital Blues Inc members.
10% discount at the bar for food and drinks for members.

description:
Jonathan Crayford [solo] - Wellington Jazz Festival, Experience an intimate evening of solo jazz piano with internationally acclaimed New Zealand pianist Jonathan Crayford.
Returning home from performances across Europe, Crayford will take to his stunning Steinway D Concert Grand at Meow NUI on Thursday 16 October, weaving an eclectic mix of original compositions and inspired improvisations. Known for his expressive artistry and fearless creativity, Crayford draws on a lifetime of musical exploration across New York, Cuba, Brazil, and beyond. This promises to be a rare chance to hear one of Aotearoa’s finest jazz talents in a powerful and personal setting.
Jonathan Crayford is one of Aotearoa New Zealand’s most acclaimed pianists, composers, and improvisers, with an international career spanning New York, Cuba, Brazil, and Europe. A highly original musical voice, he is celebrated for his adventurous compositions, stunning improvisation, and versatility across jazz, funk, Latin, and classical traditions.
Crayford has written numerous film scores and albums, collaborating with world-renowned artists including Kurt Rosenwinkel, David Binney, Amp Fiddler, Groove Collective, David Murray, Tony Allen, Questlove, Macy Gray, and in Cuba with Bobby Carcassés. His trio album Dark Light (2014) was nominated for Best New Zealand Jazz Album, while its follow-up East West Moon (2016) won the award outright. His film and theatre scores have also earned critical acclaim, awards, and multiple nominations.
Respected both at home and abroad, Crayford has been described by Jazz Times as “exploratory, thoughtful, soulful, focused,” while Jazz Local 32 hails him as “the embodiment of sonic shapes and forms.” Pianist Mike Nock calls him “one of the very finest creative musical talents to have ever come from Aotearoa
label: Music & Concerts

K A T E brings sultry soulful, ethereal blues.

Teamed up with some of Wellingtons greatest musicians, K A T E and her band have been known to bring an outerworldy experience to those who witness them live, leaving people feeling as though they are on a natural high.

Playing songs written by K A T E, that she truly believes she has channeled for the healing and expansion of not only her heart but all other hearts on this planet. Songs that deliver powerful messages and not only bring a presence to the room when played, but as the frequency of K A T E's voice radiates in and through the audience, people can't help but become engaged with their whole being.

A setlist of heartfelt music that you will also most definitely want to move your body to too.

Doors open 7pm for a 7.30pm start.

KORA tickets, Presented by: Eccles Entertainment
Kora are back - and sound bigger, deeper and more electrifying than ever. With a long-awaited new album on the horizon, and a tour to match, the iconic Aotearoa band is set to reawaken the hearts of fans both old and new.
Known as one of the country’s most powerful and dynamic acts fusing elements of roots, reggae, funk, rock, dub, and electronic music into a sonic identity that is entirely their own. Their music is heavy and melodic and grounded in kaupapa Māori, driven by innovation, storytelling, and groove.
Their performances bring together heavy bass, soaring vocals, and raw energy, blending musical mastery with raw power to create an immersive experience. Whether headlining major festivals or packing out venues around Aotearoa, Kora’s ability to move a crowd is unmatched.

description:
Kaylee Bell | Cowboy Up Tour | Wellington, Kaylee Bell | Cowboy Up Tour | Wellington
KAYLEE BELL ANNOUNCES FIVE DATE COWBOY UP TOUR THIS NOVEMBER. HER BIGGEST HEADLINE SHOWS TO DATE.

New Zealand country-pop powerhouse Kaylee Bell is hitting the road this November for her biggest headline shows to date, announcing the ‘Cowboy Up Tour’, a five-date tour through some of the country’s most iconic theatres.

The announcement comes off the back of a whirlwind 18 months that’s seen Bell cement her place as one of Australasia’s leading artists. From winning Best Female Artist at the 2024 Golden Guitar Awards, winning at Global Country Music Artist at the 2023 CMA awards, releasing her chart-topping album Nights Like This, to performing to her biggest ever live audience in March at CMC Rocks in Queensland, and becoming a first time mother, Kaylee’s star power continues to rise.

Beginning at Michael Fowler Centre in Wellington on Tuesday 4 November, the Cowboy Up Tour then heads north to The Civic in Auckland on Saturday 8 November, followed by three shows in the South Island. Thursday 13 November at Civic Theatre in Invercargill, Friday 14 November at the Regent Theatre in Dunedin with the grand finale at the iconic Christchurch Town Hall on Saturday 15 November.

Tickets for all dates go on sale Monday 7 July at 12PM from www.eccles.co.nz/kaylee-bell-2025

Fans can expect a full-throttle live show featuring Bell’s biggest hits — from the viral, banjo infused Cowboy Up and most recent single Red Dirt Romeo, to her smash radio singles Boots ’N All and Good Things, along with fan favourites.

These shows mark a major milestone in Bell’s touring career. It’ll be her first Wellington headline performance since 2023, and the first time playing venues of this scale in all five cities.

Kaylee Bell has carved out a career that bridges Nashville polish with Kiwi grit. This tour promises to be her boldest and most exciting yet, bringing people of all ages together for a night to remember.

description:
Keep Hush X Twisted Frequency | Te Whanganui-a-Tara Wellington, Twisted Frequency is teaming up with Keep Hush to bring a slice of Aotearoa’s outdoor festival culture into the city and broadcast to the world.
For the uninitiated, Keep Hush started as an intimate underground club night in London and has grown into a global platform celebrating underground dance music through live streams, pop-ups, and parties in unexpected places.
These folks have such a fantastic kaupapa that resonates deeply with what we are doing down here in Aotearoa and we couldn't be more stoked to work with them and share a bit of the Twisted community's creative passion with the world.
Featuring a carefully selected lineup of talent who are dedicated to creating original homegrown tunes, all representing a unique aspect of the country’s bass music melting pot. This will be a journey of sound from dub-infused taonga pūoro to home mulled jungle breaks and all stops between.

description:
King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience, It’s a global phenomenon hailed as the most electrifying celebration of the King of Pop’s music. ‘The King of Pop Show — Michael Jackson Live Concert Experience’ makes its way to New Zealand — and Wellington — for the first time. If you never had the chance to see Michael Jackson live, this is the closest you’ll ever get. From the famous moonwalk to the spine-tingling vocals, every moment of this production channels the spirit of the King of Pop at his peak. Witness the power of hits like Billie Jean, Thriller, Beat It, Smooth Criminal, and plenty more. 
The star of the show is TJ Cappola. His stunning vocals and commanding stage presence make for a flawless embodiment of Michael Jackson. With sold-out performances across Australia and Asia, thousands have been mesmerised by his performance. Backing TJ is a live band and world-class dancers. The replica costumes and cutting-edge lighting and visual display make this more than just a show — it’s an experience.

description:
Kuini Sheba - Free Live Music Wednesdays, Kuini Sheba - Free Live Music Wednesdays
Lift your midweek with Moon's Free Live Music Wednesday's! Your weekly escape to into the sonic stratosphere 💫

Every week, we feature a rotating lineup of incredible local musicians

Come by early for our $15 pizza specials, served hot 5.30-9pm 🍕

Perfect for date night, catch-ups, or just floating solo through the sound waves. Wednesdays at Moon are the place to orbit 👽

Kuini Sheba (Ngati Kuri) is a reggae/hip-hop/r&b artist from Central Auckland. She is, among other things, a vocalist, guitarist, and songwriter.

Her stage presence, vocals and personality can tend to leave the audience in awe and wanting more. Heavy inspiration and study of a wide range of her favourite artists, as well as delving into her own musical practice, has resulted in a personal and refreshing insight into her world; an insight into the generation to come in Aotearoa music.

She is currently in the process of releasing an album; the first single of which “Te Ahi o Mahuika” has just been released on all platforms. This is a reggae/dub track written by Kuini Sheba, fully in Te Reo Māori.

If you want to follow her journey, check out @kuinisheba on Instagram and other platforms.


*Lee Stuart can no longer make it this wiki, keep your eyes peeled for a new date tba soon!*

description:
Kuini Sheba - Free Live Music Wednesdays, Lift your midweek with Moon's Free Live Music Wednesday's! Your weekly escape to into the sonic stratosphere
Every week, we feature a rotating lineup of incredible local musicians
Come by early for our $15 pizza specials, served hot 5.30-9pm
Perfect for date night, catch-ups, or just floating solo through the sound waves. Wednesdays at Moon are the place to orbit
Kuini Sheba (Ngati Kuri) is a reggae/hip-hop/r&b artist from Central Auckland. She is, among other things, a vocalist, guitarist, and songwriter.
Her stage presence, vocals and personality can tend to leave the audience in awe and wanting more. Heavy inspiration and study of a wide range of her favourite artists, as well as delving into her own musical practice, has resulted in a personal and refreshing insight into her world; an insight into the generation to come in Aotearoa music.
She is currently in the process of releasing an album; the first single of which “Te Ahi o Mahuika” has just been released on all platforms. This is a reggae/dub track written by Kuini Sheba, fully in Te Reo Māori.
If you want to follow her journey, check out @kuinisheba on Instagram and other platforms.

*Lee Stuart can no longer make it this wiki, keep your eyes peeled for a new date tba soon!*

description:
Kāpiti Chorale presents: Mendelssohn's Elijah, Kāpiti Chorale presents: Mendelssohn's Elijah
An unforgettable story told in music that grips you from the first note.

Mendelssohn’s Elijah is one of the great Romantic oratorios. Packed with drama, rich harmonies, and powerful choruses, it tells the story of the prophet Elijah: his triumphs, struggles, and moments of quiet doubt. From fire raining down from the sky to the still small voice in the wilderness, this is music that moves!

Elijah has long been a favourite with choirs and audiences across Aotearoa. This is a rare opportunity to hear it live on the Kāpiti Coast.

Conducted by Eric Sidoti, this full-length performance features soprano Emily-Jane Stockman, alto Charlotte Secker, tenor Jamie Young, bass Joe Haddow, youth soloist Natalie Mower, and organist Jonathan Berkahn.

Tickets
$35 General Admission
$15 Students
Printed tickets will be available after 15 October at Moby Dickens’ Books (Paraparaumu Beach), Jenoa (Waikanae), and Books & Co. (Ōtaki).

description:
LEAO and Romi Wrights, This October, two of Aotearoa’s brightest talents come together for a one-night-only double headline show in Te Whanganui-a-Tara.
On Saturday, October 18th, 60s soul, funk, and R&B revivalists Romi Wrights & the Commotions join forces with fellow "niu-wave" sonic explorers LEAO for their debut headline performances in the capital.
Don’t miss this celebration of era-blending, electrifying Pacific journeys through sound.
Tickets on sale Friday August 1 at meow.nz

LEAO
Formed from a Pacific heart, LEAO is a Samoan musical project led byguitarist/vocalist David Feauai-Afaese, joined by bassistNavakatoa Tekela-Pule, Hawaiian-steel guitarist Levi Gemmell, and drummer Larsen Tito-Taylor.
With a deep adoration for Pacific musical reference points and a desire to explore new sonic ground, LEAO synthesises non-traditional tonalities with a fa‘asamoa spirit, creating
what some have called “niu wave” and “Pacific neo-psychedelia.”
A creative enigma and phenomenal live act since the release of their critically acclaimed debut GHOST ROADS in 2019, LEAO has continued to expand its vision with the 2024 single TAEAO / MEA UMA - a sparkling glimpse into a significant body of alternative Pacific music currently in development. The group is now actively
working towards the release of a new full-length album, deepening their bold contribution to contemporary Pacific sound.

Romi Wrights
Although she grew up on the sensibilities of US RnB and Hip-hop, when the Tokelauan singer-songwriter Romi Wrights shares her voice, it’s hard not to feel transported back to the spirit of the late 1960s soul/funk era by her incandescent melodies and stirring
stories of love, loss and the confusion that lies in between. Raised between Porirua and the Hutt Valley, Romi started writing diaristic poetry at age eight before beginning to set her words to music during her teenage years.

After finishing high school, she moved to Tāmaki Makaurau (Auckland) to study music at the EXCEL School of Performing Arts and pursue her dreams of being a singer. Several years later she formed the gospel, funk and soul band The Elected, who spent three years performing at venues like Portland Public House, Kings Arms and Golden Dawn.

Since 2021, she has been working alongside Mānuka Recordings co-founder Kenny Sterling and a cast of session musicians and backing vocalists, including Julien Dyne, Cory Champion, Olivia Wilding, JY Lee. In December 2023, Wrights opened for soul legend Lee Fields, at the Hollywood Avondale, and has since performed twice at Pōneke
festival CubaDupa. Via Mānuka Recordings, she has released 3 singles; Bring It Back, Without You and Capsized and has an album scheduled for release
mid to late 2025.

description:
Lacuna Presents - Us Two tickets, Presented by: Lacuna
Us Two is a high-energy house DJ act from the Midlands, UK, with releases on some of the world's most respected labels including Knee Deep In Sound, MicroHertz, and Eastenderz. Known for deep grooves, rolling basslines, and infectious crowd connection, Us Two has earned support from global heavyweights like Marco Carola, Jamie Jones, and Skream.
From European festival stages to Ibiza's 528 for a standout set with Knee Deep In Sound, Us Two's sound blends underground credibility with dancefloor-ready energy.
His latest release, "Simulation" (featuring Franksy), drops on Pete Tong's TSZR label, and has already earned plays from tastemakers like ANOTR, SG Lewis, LF SYSTEM, and SOSA, with early reactions going wild at Music On (Pacha Ibiza) and beyond.
For Lacuna, hosting Us Two’s debut in Wellington is about more than a headline — it's personal. We're thrilled to finally bring a dear friend's sound to our city and invite you to feel the energy first-hand on Saturday, 20 September 2025, at Meow Nui.
Packages
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Laura Collins and the Big Blues Band, Laura Collins, known for her soulful vocal delivery and upfront entertainment brings a show with a ‘whole lot of brass’. Expect blues, soul, boogie and swing, you’ll hear Etta James, Aretha Franklin, Fats Domino, Ray Charles and more. The emphasis is on having a hugely good time, with the brass enabling the dynamic energy to be turned up to 10!

Laura is joined by some of her long-time Wellington based musical companions, Wayne Mason, Kiwi music icon, being utilised here in his capacity as a master of boogie keys, John O’Connor on sublime lead guitar, George Barris and Richard Te One bringing a powerhouse rhythm section. Adding that soulful uplift, the brass /horn section are Manawatu locals, James Tait Jamieson (saxophone), Craig Collis (trombone) and Neville Lauridsen (trumpet).

Get your bling on and come out for a blast! We will be!
label: Music & Concerts

description: Laurel Canyon - Linda Rondstadt with The Eagles, Get ready for an evening of exceptional talent and timeless music as Sue Dyson, Todd Sutton, and Grant Wills pay tribute to two of the most iconic names in American music - Linda Ronstadt and The Eagles. Laurel Canyon isn’t just a tribute – It’s a celebration of a musical era that defined a generation. From Linda’s powerful ballads to The Eagles’ signature harmonies, this show captures the spirit, sound and soul of Southern California’s golden age of rock and folk.

description:
Lawrence Arabia Is Playing A Solo Show, It’s been six years since he last released an album and, like Richard Prebble before him, Lawrence Arabia’s been thinking.


When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.


The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.


With support from Frances Grass.

description:
Li'l Chuck @ The Shed, Li'l Chuck @ The Shed
Li’l Chuck is heading North for the first time in a number of years - since opening for Jimmy Buffet at The Wellington Opera House and is excited to play his first ever shows in Lower Hutt, Whanganui and the Taranaki region. He’ll be celebrating 10 years since his acclaimed album release ‘Blues in Full swing’ and the recent release of his new single ‘Gumption’

Li’l Chuck will present his full one man band plus a selection of his cranky home made instruments and Diddley bows and offering audiences the amazing opportunity to jam, skiffle and learn about his old time homemade music.

Having spent a lifetime rummaging through the drawers of 1930's - 50's music, Chuck’s songs are inspired by the sounds of the era - Blues, Early Jazz, Western Swing, Ragtime etc. and are uniquely presented in the style of street performers from those glory days. Sticking to the traditional one man band format, Chuck plays all the instruments simultaneously.
Captivating storytelling intertwines effortlessly with heart stopping harmonica. Multiple guitar styles are underpinned by his left and right feet frantically pounding the kick and hi hat. The listener is left simply wondering, "How the hell does he do that"?
Originally hailing from the UK, Li’l Chuck has been stomping his music in NZ since 2003.
Li'l Chuck has performed at many high profile events around New Zealand including opening for American legend Jimmy Buffet, Bluesman Jerron 'Blind Boy' Paxton and The Topp Twins, and festivals including Blues on Broadbeach, Gold Coast Australia, Dunedin and Wanaka Arts festivals, The Great Kiwi Beer festival, Canterbury folk festival and many more.
Up to 2025, He has recorded 5 solo one man band records to great acclaim by international Blues publications.
His 2017 album Utility Blues hit No’6 on the official NZ albums chart & has twice been the feature artist on Jesse Mulligan's Radio New Zealand’s Friday live.
In an age where we are rushing around at breakneck speed, where everything is instant, sugar coated, airbrushed and overly polished, Li’l Chuck brings us down to earth with some organic, all natural, whole grain, naked goodness.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Liam Cooper’s King of the Keys, He’s a modern-day piano man singing the songs of famous piano men. Australian Liam Cooper intends to thrill an audience at The Opera House with a concert of famous songs. In Liam Cooper’s show King of the Keys, the entertainer will celebrate the music of Elton John, Peter Allen, Billy Joel, Stevie Wonder, Freddie Mercury, Ray Charles, and more. A killer live band will help him negotiate a nostalgic catalogue of 40 classic songs from 15 musical legends. 
Along with faithful renditions of many songs, Liam will captivate you with the stories behind them. Learn about who Paul McCartney wrote ‘Let It Be’ for, and what Elton John’s ‘Bennie & The Jets’ satirises. You’ll get a new appreciation for the songs that have become anthems for generations. 
In a final twist, the audience gets to choose how the show ends. You’ll be able to use your phone to vote live in the theatre. Decide who is the one true ‘King of the Keys’ to influence the show’s unique conclusion.

description:
Loop Electronic: Tour 001 – Wellington, Loop Electronic: Tour 001 – Wellington
Loop Electronic: Tour 001 – Wellington

Saturday November 8 – Moon, Wellington

Zuke, Sanoi, Dylan C & Libby K

Loop are proud to announce the debut Loop Electronic Tour, a three-show series across Aotearoa this November celebrating the artists and sounds of Loop Electronic, the label’s new imprint dedicated to forward-thinking electronic music.

Experience performances from Sanoi, Dylan C, and Zuke, with local favourite Libby K opening the night. Expect deep grooves, emotive soundscapes, and dancefloor-ready energy as the Loop Electronic label takes over Mothership for one unforgettable evening.

SANOI
Sanoi crafts expansive, melodic techno that moves both the body and the mind - deep, groove-driven music designed for dancefloors and introspective moments alike. Whether delivering peak-time DJ sets or crafting Brainfeeder-esque studio productions, he brings precision, emotion, and prolific creativity to everything he touches.

The tour comes ahead of Sanoi’s upcoming new album, Augenblick, a 19-track journey through electronic textures and lo-fi beats. Out October 10, new single ‘Try It’ captures one of his most playful yet dancefloor-driven moments to date. Currently available exclusively on cassette, the album will be released digitally shortly.

ZUKE
Aotearoa’s underground gem, Zuke (the electronic alias of Ed Zuccollo) occupies a genre-fluid space where cinematic detail meets bass-weighted energy. His kaleidoscopic productions traverse ambient, jungle, and deep house influences.

Zuke’s 2024 album Come Closer was his long-awaited debut album. Expect tracks like this, and more from Zuke’s treasure trove of unreleased goodies, at this tour, with more new music to come before the end of 2025.

DYLAN C
Loops very own, Dylan C is a household name in the scene. Deep cuts, dub pressure, and a journey through the shadows - Dylan C doesn’t just play tunes, he sculpts atmospheres.

More on Loop Electronic
Loop Electronic [Instagram] -
https://www.instagram.com/loopelectronic/

Loop Electronic [More Info] -
https://www.loop.co.nz/releases/electronic/

Presented by Mānuka Phuel & Radioactive.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Lord Rochester - Scotland's Greatest Rock And Roll Band, CLEAN DiRT & Under the radar present ......

SCOTTISH ROCK AND ROLLERS - LORD ROCHESTER

AOTEAROA TOUR October 2025

In keeping with great Rock & Roll, Lord Rochester embrace the simplicity of sound and song using the maraca powered shuffle of artists such as Bo Diddley, Chuck Berry and Jimmy Reed to create stripped back, rhythm driven, rock and roll. A three piece combo that includes Russell Wilkins (The Milkshakes, The Delmonas, The Len Bright Combo and The Wildebeests) on Gretsch Electromatic Guitar (yes – the red rectangle!), Vocals and Harmonica and Saskia Holling (Sally Skull, The Nettelles and Thee Girl Fridays) on Bass and Vocals. Scotland’s best sounding (and best looking) rock and roll show have toured Japan, Australia (twice!) and Mexico, and played all over Europe and the UK. They have toured their native Scotland from the Borders to Aberdeenshire and from the Central Belt to the Highlands and not forgetting the Shetland Islands. Always entertaining and forever stylish, the band can bewitch an audience, large or small. Lord Rochester has performed live in session for the BBC, recorded at the famous Perrotti Studios in Gijon, Spain and provide the theme music for the ’Vic Galloway Show’ on BBC Radio Scotland. This October they venture to the far reaches of New Zealand ....

Local supports to be announced in the south island

Opening the shows in the North Island will be the one man band explosion simply known as Dirtbag!

October 2025 - Thursday 16th Petone at Abandoned Taproom

description:
Louisa Williamson Quintet, Louisa Williamson presents music from her latest album, Groundwork, plus more recent compositions.

Louisa Williamson is a saxophonist, flutist, composer and arranger based in Wellington. Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other. Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo. In 2016 Louisa was the first New Zealander to successfully audition for the JMI Jazz World Orchestra (consisting of the best young jazz musicians from around the world, aged 18-25), touring Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Slovenia and Croatia.

Featuring: Louisa Williamson 9saxophone), Callum Allardice (guitar), Daniel Hayles (piano), Johnny Lawrence (bass), Max Sheehan (drums).

description:
Ludovico Einaudi, His music has been performed live on an Arctic ice-floe and as soundtracks for Oscar and Golden Globe-winning films. Italian pianist and composer Ludovico Einaudi is returning to Wellington with a new album to explore with audiences. The Michael Fowler Centre will be filled with Ludovico’s special mix of neo-classical, pop, ambient, rock, and experimental styles. His modern soundscapes are renowned for being able to cross artistic and generational boundaries. Because of this, he has become one of the world’s most-streamed classical music artists. 
Ludovico began composing in the 1980s for theatre and ballet. He has since gone on to write for film and television and produce multi-million-selling albums. His most recent is ‘The Summer Portraits’. Written in 2025, it is the result of a cascade of personal memories triggered by sun, summer, and family holidays. Here, he returns to the lush full-band textures of earlier works. You’ll get to hear this first-hand, so don’t miss your chance.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MESH IX RETURN - LILA TIRANDO A VIOLETA, MESH began in 2018 as a queer collective looking to provide a playful space for live experimentation in Te Whanganui a Tara. We’ve finally heeded the call to bring it back to life and are beyond excited to host none other than sonic innovator Lila Tirando a Violeta.
With an extensive and varied output including releases for hallowed labels such as Hyperdub and N.A.A.F.I, Lila has been dubbed “one of the greats of modern electronic music.” As explained in a review of her most recent album Dream of Snakes, “her ability to traverse ambient, industrial, psychedelia, bass, and club music, as well as the various rhythms of her native Uruguay without ever tripping up on any one of them rates somewhere well beyond impressive.”
Lila will be joined by local artists Juniper May, Kolya and TOČKA for a night of all live sets, plus a spatial audio intervention by Metaxis. As always, please remember to respect the space and the people you share it with. This means being mindful of how you contribute to the collective experience and how your actions might impact those around you.
Feel free to send us a message on instagram if you have any questions. See you there x
label: Music & Concerts

description:
MESSIE - Wellington, MESSIE is taking Aotearoa’s electronic dance music scene to filthy new levels. As a former drummer, her passion for drumming was the pipeline for her falling in love with genres like Garage, Breakbeat, and Jungle. She has since expanded her sound and it’s safe to say each set will keep you guessing what will come next as she effortlessly merges genres such as Baile Funk, Ghetto Tech, Jersey Club, Juke, Afro beat inspired drums, Techno and many more global club soundscapes that encompass her high energy DJ sets. MESSIE’s sets are guaranteed to be bootleg heavy with something for everyone as she draws from her own music taste of rap and grime, to early 2000’s singalongs, girl-boss anthems and queer music culture in the form of edits you’d never expect.

Alongside her headline tour around Aotearoa in mid 2024, MESSIE has now brought her fresh, high-energy club music to Glastonbury, Reading & Leeds, R&V, Beyond The Valley, Wildlands, Love Saves The Day, Gemfest & Outro Festival. With slots at Pohoda Festival, Hidden Festival, Motion, Truck Festival, AIASOUND and All Points East locked in for the second half of 2025, there is no slowing her down.

description:
MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.
label: Music & Concerts

Paul has been tributing Queen for 12 years, and in this time the Show has performed all around New Zealand at private functions, clubs and theatres. Since the release of Bohemian Rhapsody, the show has been consistently selling out with all age groups attending the show.  One thing is for sure - “They will Rock You”!

Bee Gees 

Golden medallions, steaming disco boots, flares, discotheque mania: the Bee Gees are the icons of this magic era, firmly cemented into our minds as the men of “Night Fever.” This is all brought back to realistic life when New Zealand’s answer to the Bee Gees steps onto the stage and delivers a full production show packed with nostalgic hits such as Stayin’ Alive, Night Fever, Tragedy and much more.

description:
Make Some Noise - Choral Music That Matters, Supertonic is back with a programme of contemporary choral music that matters!

On the evening of Saturday 8 November, Supertonic will present Make Some Noise at the Lower Hutt Town Hall.

Make Some Noise highlights issues of social justice, including indigenous, women’s and civil rights and climate action. The programme is rich and varied, from Katerina Gimon’s arrangement of AURORA’s Apple Tree, a Norwegian pop song addressing the urgency of the global climate crisis, to Robert T. Gibson’s arrangement of the gospel standard This Little Light of Mine. Oliassa by Malika Tirolien utilises an invented language to invoke a call from the ancestors, while Alex Vollant titles their piece Auass meaning “child” in the Innu language to honour the generation of elders who survived the Residential Schools in Canada. The impact of sexual harassment and assault on women is highlighted in MILCK’s I Can’t Keep Quiet and Lillia Ruocco and Emmanuelle Ader’s Canzone rò curtiell’.

Closer to home, Make Some Noise features a set of waiata in teo reo Māori to highlight the importance of indigenous voices in Aotearoa New Zealand, including Ngoi Pēwhairangi’s Whakarongo. This waiata-ā-ringa incorporates Ngoi Pēwhairangi’s beliefs and methodology on teaching te reo Māori.

Led by Musical co-Director Virginie Pacheco, Supertonic offers Make Some Noise as an invitation to concert-goers to consider the causes that are important to them. In connecting with audiences through the striking and impactful works of the composers featured in this programme - by turns harmonious, raucous, gut-wrenching, resolute - the choir hopes to inspire those listening to make some noise in their own lives
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Malcolm Todd tickets, Presented by: Handsome Tours & Laneway
Handsome Tours and Laneway Presents are proud to present Malcolm Todd!
Los Angeles-born songwriter Malcolm Todd has gone from scooping ice cream to racking up millions of streams in just a few years. After a viral breakthrough with ‘Roommates’ and his mixtape Sweet Boy (2024), Malcolm Todd doubled down with his 2025 self-titled debut album – a record that blends humour, honesty and restless ambition into a singular voice.
Featuring Omar Apollo on the standout single ‘Bleed’ the album captures Todd at his most fearless, pushing his pop instincts into bold new territory. With a devoted fanbase and a reputation for chaotic, heartfelt live shows, Malcolm Todd now makes his Australian and New Zealand debut with headline sideshows in Sydney, Melbourne and Wellington.

The adored songwriter and producer’s work catapulted Mallrat across the globe with critical acclaim from NPR, Stereogum, NME, NYLON, PAPER Magazine, The New York Times, Billboard, Noisey and more, further affirming Mallrat as a beacon primed for the world stage in 2025.
Joining Mallrat on her New Zealand headline shows is none other than Aotearoa’s own indie pop darling, Riiki Reid — bringing her signature style and infectious energy to the stage for an unforgettable night of music.

Maracatui has evolved over the years, blending traditional sounds with original compositions and modern production techniques to create a sound that's both authentic and new.

Known for their infectious energy, Maracatui's performances are an irresistible invitation for audience participation. Their unique blend of powerful beats and beautiful melodies creates a communal experience that will leave you feeling uplifted.

Monteverdi Vespers (Vespro della Beata Vergine of 1610), Join award-winning choir The Tudor Consort for our major project of the year! This will be the first time this groundbreaking work has been performed in Wellington for over a decade.


Juxtaposing Renaissance melodies and polyphony with the rich virtuosity and colour of Baroque instruments, intimate vocal solos with a choir and orchestra of unprecedented grandeur, and dazzling opulence with striking emotional and spiritual depth, this will be an unmissable performance



We are thrilled to be joined by an incredible orchestra of top musicians from the NZSO and leading international artists! Come hear the striking tones of cornetti, dulcian, archlutes, Baroque recorders and more!



N.B. There will be a pre-concert talk at 7pm.

description:
Monthly Jazz Night: Les Tripes- Parisian Swing Trio, Get ready for a night of irresistible rhythm and sizzling jazz!

Swing clarinetist Oscar Lavën, guitarist Adrian Jensen, and double-bass raconteur Robert Henderson are "Les Tripes" (french for "The Guts") ; a hard-working interpretation of the irresistibly heart-pumping film-noir sound of Django Reinhardt's Quintette du Hot Club de France. Lavën, Jensen and Henderson are professional musicians based in Wellington, and have honed their project through years of performance in venues large and small.

Les Tripes will have you tapping your feet and swinging along as they infuse each performance with passion, precision, and a touch of French flair.

Don’t miss the chance to experience a night of pure, swinging magic!

Book now to join us for a French inspired Set Menu from 5.30pm (served in one of our dining rooms) before moving out to the show.
2 courses $55.
BOOKINGS ESSENTIAL.
Email reservations@thistleinn.co.nz to book.

description:
NZSM Big Band Showcase, The Te Kōkī Big Band is one of the flagship performance ensembles for the jazz programme and plays regularly throughout New Zealand.

Led by Daniel Hayles, the band shows off the next generation of Pōneke jazz talent in a signature swinging, brassy, high-energy style.

Expect music from the most revered composers and artists of the 21st century: Count Basie, Steely Dan, Charles Mingus, Stevie Wonder, Peggy Lee, Raye, and many more.

This performance will also showcase a number of compositions and arrangements by students in the band. The exciting NZSM Big Band 2 will open the show.

Join us for a night of multi-genre celebration, from swing-era gems, unexpected journeys through new territory, to slamming modern classics.

description:
NZTrio presents Fantastique, Renowned classical music ensemble NZTrio He Taonga Wairere present their extraordinary programme Fantastique.
Described as a "national treasure" and "New Zealand's most indispensable ensemble" (William Dart, NZ Herald), NZTrio combines warm kiwi stage presence with musicians at the top of their craft.
Amalia Hall (violin), Somi Kim (piano) and Callum Hall (guest cello) explore a lavish tapestry of styles and emotions in Fantastique, a programme of contrasts. Turina's Circulo depicts a single day through dawn, midday and dusk, while brooding disquiet meets stark intensity in Shostakovich's Piano Trio No.1 in C minor. Chen Yi's Tibetan Tunes creates a fusion of traditional Tibetan melodies referencing Buddhist god Du Mu, before the premiere of Angelus, a new commission by one of Aotearoa’s most acclaimed composers, John Psathas. Finally, Franck's youthful Piano Trio No. 1 in F sharp minor is as charming and intimate as it is powerful and explosive.

description:
Nana & Petal @ The RSC, Nana & Petal @ The RSC
The Nana & Petal set comprises an eclectic mix, self-penned songs, several by the prolific O’Dempsey, some co-written with brother Dylan, the pair also have a penchant for songs written by other friends and NZ songwriters such as Reb Fountain and Hammond Gamble. They include covers by the Uppity Blues Women, the Devil Makes Three, Mavis Staples and many by Tom Waits, with lesser-known compositions from songwriters such as the Black Pumas, William Elliott Whitmore, and the eclectic bluesman C.W Stoneking, which are all suited to Paul’s piano style. This duo spans blues, folk, and alt country, with Paul pinning down the groove on piano/organ with some blistering solos and a real sensitivity for accompanying a vocalist, showcasing Celine’s arresting vocal style, charisma and storytelling magnetism.

This is your chance to see their first full-length concert performance of 2025!

“The repertoire we sing in this choir is so diverse and fresh. It’s not choral music as you’d expect. The choir is one of the best sounding in Aotearoa, and we have so much fun performing the pieces. Anyone who sings in choirs or just for fun as a hobby should come and hear us perform”– 2023-24 NZSSC singer

Bring the whole family for an evening of choral excellence and entertainment!

description:
Nick Baucke-Maunsell Quintet, Led by saxophonist Nicholas Baucke-Maunsell, the group features Henry Sherris on trumpet — reuniting after a five-year break during which Henry honed his craft in New York.
The two first played together as teenagers in the Young Musicians Programme under the mentorship of the legendary Rodger Fox and now return to the stage for this special performance.
Joining them are Callum Allardice on guitar, Seth Boy on bass, and Abe Baillie on drums — an exceptional rhythm section known for their deep musical connection and expressive interplay.
The quintet will perform a dynamic mix of original jazz compositions. Each piece reflects moments from Nicholas’s recent journey — from touring internationally with the Rodger Fox Big Band to day-to-day insights gained through his work as a teacher.
The set will also feature compositions by Henry, offering reflections on his time living and studying in New York.
Don’t miss the chance to experience this heartfelt performance live.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds — Wild God Tour, Their music has long defied classification. For over 40 years, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds have delivered a sophisticated mix of post-punk, experimental, gospel, and blues to adoring fans. Now, in a New Zealand exclusive, Wellington gets to hear them live at TSB Arena in February. Renowned for their exhilarating and unforgettable performances, the band is regarded as one of the most thrilling to watch on stage. 
In 2024, they released their eighteenth studio album, ‘Wild God’. Now, Nick and the band are circling the globe on the ‘Wild God Tour’. They have finished the North American and European legs, and TSB Arena on Wellington’s waterfront is the next stop off. The band will perform a setlist drawn from the latest album alongside songs spanning the four decades of a storied career.
Brought to you in association with Aotearoa New Zealand Festival of the Arts. 
Tickets will go on sale to the public on Friday, 29 August at 10am.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Niels and the Cartertones in concert, DATE: Friday Sept 26
TIME: 7pm
LOCATION: The Offering – 65 Main St, Greytown
AGES:
COST: $25 pp at the door, bookings essential by txt to 02102361951 or booking link below. Max capacity 60
A collaboration between four extraordinary, Wairarapa-based musicians for a special concert, covering many of Leonard Cohen’s best-loved pieces. This concert is an alliance between:
Niels Gedge, fingerstyle guitar and lead vocals, is a well-known singer-songwriter on the folk scene, with two albums of original songs. He has also performed extensively in cafes and bars and at events in the UK and throughout NZ. Niels’s vocal range is very similar to that of Leonard Cohen.
Kate Marshall, multi-instrumentalist and vocals. As well as singing in a duo with her partner Bob Cooper-Grundy at clubs, pubs and festivals, Kate is a key member of the much-loved Raven Mavens, the all-woman Boogie/Blues band that plays regularly around the Wellington Region, and beyond. Bob is an Americana/blues musician who plays finger-picking guitar, mandolin, and slide guitar. Bob has opened for Americana Greats: Guy Clark, Townes van Zandt, Tom Russell, and Jimmy LaFave.
Steve Trotman, vocals and acoustic guitar. Inspired by the bands of the 1950s and 1960s, as well as singer-songwriters such as James Taylor and Paul Simon, Steve fronted various Wellington groups in the 1970s before heading overseas. He co-founded Verandah Band in the early 2000s, playing a mix of genres in every Wairarapa venue (and beyond) for the past 20-odd years, including Toast Martinborough and Summer Hummer.
Book your tickets here: https://greytownarttown.com/neilsandthecartertones/
label: Music & Concerts

description:
No mans heath album launch celebration, The same moon is the follow up record to the last no mans heath offering ‘ball of string’ that was released in 2017.
This show is a celebration of the finishing of the record.
Tom will be playing songs from the record and a few old favourites. With the help of one of Wellington’s most loved musicians Scott Pilgrim.
No mans heath aka Tom Kane is an English singer songwriter who has made Wellington his home. He songs are insightful and delicate and have been described as a beautiful exercise in restraint.
The wonderful Tessa de Lyon (also of Mystery Waitress) will open the evening with a set of piano songs. Tessa’s songs merge beautiful storytelling with wistful tunes that belong on film soundtracks. "A seemingly endless supply of comforting melodies" (RNZ).
Helpful information
Happy hour at the bar is 3pm to 6pm.

description:
Nota Bene and The Bach Choir of Wellington - Quiz Night, Nota Bene and The Bach Choir combine for a quiz night fundraiser to be held at the 1852 pub in Brooklyn on Sunday 31st August .

Please, invite friends, form winning teams in advance but remember you can also just build a team on the night with unaligned quizzers. Such randomly formed teams are great fun and have won on previous occasions.

The Quiz proper starts at 7pm but you can also have dinner there from 5pm by calling 1852 in advance and making a booking (04 801 9544)

This is the first opportuity for the two choir collaboration, and our Chamber orchestra Chiesa Ensemble to get together as we start rehearals leading to a performance of the masterwork, Weihnachts Oratorium (Bachs's XMAS Oratorio).

That concert will happen at 7pm on the 15th of November at St Mary of the Angels.
