description:
Nui Hui 7 - Fly High Brother Paul, Nui Hui 7 - Fly High Brother Paul
'In Rocking Memory of Paul Norris'
R.I.P Brother'

NUI HUI 7 – LIVE AT 14 WAIU STREET
Wainuiomata, Lower Hutt
Saturday 22 November 2025 | 4PM – LATE

Nui Hui is back – louder, prouder, and more unfiltered than ever. This grassroots music series is built for the people, by the people, shining a spotlight on bands who grind it out, carve their own paths, and keep live music alive.

Nui Hui 7 is a one-night-only collision of sounds and scenes, bringing together rock, reggae, punk, grunge, and soul against a true blue-collared backdrop. No industry machines, no corporate gloss – just raw, rising talent backed by the passion of locals and volunteers who believe in the power of music.

This year’s lineup is stacked with unsigned and upcoming artists from across the region and beyond:

4PM – Munkiez

With a sound as cheeky and chaotic as their name suggests, MUNKIEZ is a bluesy, funk-rock explosion that proves good times and great grooves go hand-in-hand. Hailing from Upper Hutt, this crew is all about embracing the raw energy of rock and roll while slathering on a thick coat of soulful, slinky funk.
They're not here to reinvent the wheel, but to make it spin faster, dirtier, and with a whole lot more swagger. With a dash of that no-nonsense, straight-outta-the-garage Kiwi attitude. MUNKIEZ are a band you feel in your bones, a sound that gets your head nodding and your feet moving before you even realize what's happening. They play it like they mean it, because they do.

5PM – The Groundsmen

Scott Paddock and Shane Martin formed The Groundsmen back in the heady days of 2017 and went through various drummers and bass players before finally finding stability with drummer Rowan Carlyle in 2018.

Since then they’ve played numerous gigs (one supporting Head Like A Hole in Gisborne at Smash Palace 30th anniversary) and released 3 singles on Spotify and other streaming platforms - Black Car, Supanova and Achtung Baby (check them out!).

They’ve recorded their debut album and are just about to mix it and release it.

Playing only original earthen rock punk, we always, always, perform at 110% energy levels and put on a great show with hooky uptempo toons!! With songs commenting on contemporary society and life at large all 3 members throw themselves fully into their performance and leave no energy unused. You will leave one of their shows changed.

See the excerpt from a review of a in Whanganui July 2020:

“After a quick change of equipment, The Groundsmen were next on the agenda. Proclaiming themselves to be Taranaki’s premier rock punk band, the trio wasted no time in belting out a hard and fast set of original, classic punk-inspired tunes that were lapped up by the growing gathering of punters. Bass player Scott Paddock is a tour-de-force; full of noise, energy and an appropriate rock-punk swagger. Along with guitarist Shane Martin and drummer Rowan Carlyle, The Groundsmen powered their way though and energetic set, and it was immediately evident that they were ecstatic to be back on stage and performing again after the recent enforced hiatus. The trio powered through a set of classic, no-frills, original punk inspired tracks that had almost everyone in the room either on their feet or gyrating in their seats. Definitely a crowd-pleaser, there is no doubt whatsoever that The Groundsmen were in their element, and clearly love what they do.”

….from Ambient Light, author Bridget Herlihy, 4th July 2020

6PM – Kaletta Band

Kaletta is a Latin rock band that brings together the rhythms of ska punk and gypsy sounds in Spanish. With musicians from Chile, Colombia, Argentina, Italy, the UK, and New Zealand, our sound is a blend of different beats and roots. We've had the privilege of being two-time national finalists in the Battle of the Bands (BOTB 2024 and 2025) and have performed at festivals like Island Bay and toured the top South Island. We're excited about our upcoming tours in New Zealand next year.

What we're passionate about is creating music that's true to ourselves. Each song is a journey, moving from calm to energetic moments that we hope will keep you engaged. Our lyrics touch on social and political themes, and we hope our performances will inspire thought and conversation. We're looking forward to sharing our music with you and creating memorable experiences through our dynamic sound and energy.

7PM – Burning Embers

Accustomed to breaching anything that requires sociable etiquette they still manage to pull off their unique brand of Wainuiomata rock.

From out of nowhere, they regroup, drink a few, set a plan, and do the complete opposite in tasteful fashion. Burning Embers have an uncanny habit of pulling off a great set, usually unscripted but full of the essence that is Rock n Roll. We're not here long enough to care, but we do love a great audience
Reminiscent of Days of the New and Alice in Chains they're definitely genuine entertainment

8PM – Stretch to Mould

Stretch to Mould is a rock band from Wellington New Zealand who formed in 2012. The band was founded by vocalist and guitarist Darrell Vickers, who has been the only constant member throughout multiple line up changes. Since 2024 the line up has consisted of Vickers alongside Chris Fursdon (bass guitar) and Thomas Fuller (Drums). Stretch to Mould are known for their high energy, hard hitting riffs, powerful vocals and all-round solid musicianship. The band released their debut album Shadows in 2012, EP Painting Faces in 2014 and are currently working on their next release.

9PM – Ras Judah and the Culture Embassy

a 10-piece NZ band of varying cultural backgrounds, hence the name.
The cultural diversity of the band is reflected in the sound of the music
a fusion of African styles, Reggae/Ska, Jazz and Afro-Latin rhythms.

We describe our sound as Afrocentric-World Music as much of what we play is based on African rhythms and songs, which is where our lead-singer ‘Ras Judah’ and two of our master drummers come from (Botswana, Ghana and Tanzania respectively), plus Roots Reggae. Though everyone contributes their own culturally inspired sound, with other band members from Cuba, England and Japan, and others with Greek, Kiwiana and jazz backgrounds. Not just a musical treat representing many parts of the world, but also a visual one; a carnival of ethnic diversity and collaboration on stage!

10PM – The Fabulous Pakehas

Were first conceived in London England, way back in the early 90s whilst on O.E's. Currently working on a album, & after 33 years, still in no rush.
With two of us having roots in WOA TFP are honoured to be playing a set of our originals for NUI HUI 7
The T.F.P original line up are, Antony Maddock, Scott McGill, Leslie Tearne, &
Bevan Ritchie.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

From soul-stirring grooves to fist-in-the-air anthems, Nui Hui 7 is more than just a gig – it’s a celebration of musicians who hustle, create, and share their art on their own terms.

Nui Hui: supporting local, celebrating original, and keeping the fire of live music burning

https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/tour/30764/Nui-Hui-7.utr

description:
O FORTUNA (Carmina Burana & Chichester Psalms), O FORTUNA (Carmina Burana & Chichester Psalms)
Prepare for a night of musical grandeur as Orpheus Choir Wellington and Auckland Choral, New Zealand’s largest city choirs, unite to present Orff’s monumental Carmina Burana. With its apocalyptic opening, O Fortuna, this masterpiece explores the capricious nature of fate, the joys and sorrows of life, and the boundless energy of human passion.

This performance will be mighty in scale, with nearly 300 performers on stage, including a children’s chorus, the combined power of two elite choirs, and the dynamic sound of the Wellington Brass Band. Add to this the extraordinary talents of soloists Emma Pearson (soprano), Coco Diaz (countertenor), and James Harrison (baritone), along with celebrated New Zealand pianists Jian Liu and Diedre Irons, and you have a musical event of epic proportions. From the raucous revelry of In Taberna (In the Tavern) to the sensual stillness of In Trutina (In the Balance), Carmina Burana is a visceral and unforgettable experience.

The concert opens with Bernstein’s radiant Chichester Psalms, a joyous blend of rhythmic vitality and heartfelt spirituality, providing the perfect prelude to the drama and intensity of Orff’s masterpiece.

RESERVE YOUR SEAT TODAY FOR THIS EPIC EVENT.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
O Fortuna!, Prepare for a night of musical grandeur as Orpheus Choir Wellington and Auckland Choral, New Zealand’s largest city choirs, unite to present Orff’s monumental Carmina Burana! With its apocalyptic opening, O Fortuna, this masterpiece explores the capricious nature of fate, the joys and sorrows of life, and the boundless energy of human passion. From the revelry of In Taberna to the tender beauty of Dulcissime, Carmina Burana is a visceral and unforgettable experience.

The concert opens with Bernstein’s radiant Chichester Psalms, a joyous blend of rhythmic vitality and heartfelt spirituality, providing the perfect prelude to the drama and intensity of Orff’s masterpiece. Both works will feature acclaimed pianists Jian Liu and Diedre Irons in little known arrangements

description:
OdESSA - Oak Park Avenue 20th Anniversary Show, Oak Park Avenue 20th Anniversary Show Oct 26th 5pm San Fran

Two decades ago, OdESSA kicked in the back door of the New Zealand
mainstream with their explosive debut Oak Park Avenue – a landmark
Indie-Funk record stacked with classics such as Bring The Money
Back, Baby Don’t Go Home, Promises Promises, Sugarpop, and I Could
Beat You In A Fight, the album captured the raw energy and swagger
of a band unafraid to push boundaries.

Now, 20 years later, OdESSA are back to celebrate the album that
started it all. On Labour Weekend, the band will take the stage at
Wellington’s iconic San Fran for a family-friendly early show,
performing Oak Park Avenue in full – plus a few surprises from their
wider catalogue. Expect high-octane grooves, infectious hooks, and the
kind of live energy that made OdESSA one of Aotearoa’s most beloved
live acts.

Joining them for this milestone event are rising stars of New Zealand’s
alt-pop scene Love Party. Known for their electrifying performances,
Love Party are the perfect complement to OdESSA’s funk-fueled legacy
– bringing fresh fire to a night that promises to be unforgettable.

Whether you were there in 2005 or discovering OdESSA for the first
time, this is a celebration of New Zealand music history you won’t
want to miss.

Tickets available now from moshtix.co.nz.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Old Friends - Ohau House Concert, Old Friends - Ohau House Concert
This very special folk event brings together Chris Priestley and Julian McKean of Acoustic Confusion and Angela Fox for a beautiful evening of song and guitar. Old friends, old favourites: the experience will be sublime listening!

Held at Dale & Don's Ohau home (address supplied on booking) on the Thursday night before Labour Weekend, these wonderful guests have a long rich history of playing together, harmonising and complimenting each other, and individually have exceptional voices, original songs and beautiful guitar. This concert has taken some years to find the perfect opportunity to invite them to play and I feel privileged to present Old Friends to you.

As usual, doors open around 7pm with parking in the adjacent flat paddock. Bookings are essential with payment on the night in cash please. Admission is a modest $20 pp so if you have the means and have enjoyed the night, there is a red box for any koha you may wish to give. Bookings are to Dale at , and a small supper contribution is appreciated, byo is also welcomed.

Because there may be self-contained folk travelling to Wellyfest, please consider coming and staying over in the paddock. Plenty of room and access easy for up to 7m approx. Phone contact for Dale is 027 2079695 if you have any questions. I do expect everyone to head out on Friday 24th as Wellyfest opens its gates.

description:
Original Sin (UK) | Wellington, FULL TIME SENDERS & JUICED UP PRESENT: ORIGINAL SIN - SATURDAY 20 SEPTEMBER | EVA, WELLINGTON

The jump-up king himself touches down in Wellington for the very first time. From tearing up the UK underground as one half of G Dub alongside Sub Zero, to unleashing solo anthems like Don’t Be Silly, Haunted and DNB Forever (Soz Nan), Original Sin has carved his name into the core of drum & bass.

With releases on RAM, Playaz, Souped Up, Crucast and Elevate, his sound is heavy, high-energy, and built for chaos. Having torn through festivals like Let It Roll and Boomtown, it’s finally Wellington’s turn to feel the full force of his basslines.

This one’s gonna be nasty. Backing him up is a stacked local roster, keeping the energy high from doors to close:

Molly (AKL) & Gusty
Procy (TIU) & Nos (TGA) + HP
Storm & Scholten
Freeman x Chano
Dkav
Stems

––––––––––––––––––

Welly… brace yourself.

description:
Other Futures Big Band - Wellington Jazz Festival, OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is about multi-disciplinary excellence and celebration of our individual and collective voices in new ways. In this episode, anticipate steaming and reverent swing alongside triumphant soul, dark and scenic textures, and dripped-out golden-age hip-hop cuts. We celebrate artistry with dignity, respect and above all, joy. We swing hard. We groove like humanity depends on it. Groove with us at Meow Nui this Wellington Jazz Festival!
=========
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is where musical dreams come alive. It’s about the spark of true individuality, nestled in the art and community of ensemble. The thrill and drama of the showband era re-envisioned for our time. Selections that signify deeper meanings and secret codes. Turntablism sensibility on a symphonic scale. Streamlined, momentous, nimble, angular, adapting, shape-shifting, pulsating with relentless joy and emotion.
OTHER FUTURES BIG BAND is an ongoing project by Daniel Hayles that looks to honour elements of the big band tradition while platforming music and artists unexplored within the style. Expect to hear distinct flavour in new interpretations of original music from Aotearoa and the world.
label: Music & Concerts

We invite you to join us for a night of Creedence Clearwater Revival and John Fogerty, as we celebrate the music of one of the world’s most iconic bands – from the songs they wrote, to the songs covered, to the songs they wrote for others.

From their album debut in 1968 to their last album in 1972, CCR was a juggernaut of phenomenal proportions.

No other band has created such an impact in such a short time.
The Creedence Clearwater Collective brings to the stage a band that captures the unique CCR sound.

You do not want to hear through the grapevine that you missed out on this fun, hit-packed live concert.

Join us, a real-life travelling band.

description:
PEBBLE - Free Live Music Wednesdays - Love In Every City, PEBBLE - Free Live Music Wednesdays - Love In Every City
Poems and Songs from the Road

After seasons of wandering through foreign cities, sharing songs with strangers, and capturing stories from the road. PEBBLE has spent the past few years on an open-ended journey: traveling across continents in search of the deepest stories, the wildest love, the purest expression of what it means to be human. From late-night train stations to hidden cafés, from sunlit rooftops to candlelit stages—PEBBLE has been gathering moments and melodies from everywhere he goes, transforming them into songs and poems that reflect a life lived wide open.

“Love in Every City” is the next chapter in that journey—a stripped-back, soul-forward performance that brings those stories home.

Backed by a vision to build a global movement of traveling artists who choose authenticity over perfection, connection over isolation, and creative ownership over compromise, PEBBLE’s work invites us to remember what we’re really here for: to live, to feel, to share.

This show is a moment of reflection and reconnection—
Join us for an intimate night of music, poetry, and storytelling at Moon in Newtown, Pōneke. A suitcase full of songs. A guitar by the table. A heart full of cities.

As always, free entry & all pizzas $15!

Listen >>> https://open.spotify.com/artist/2q9BwdeHhd7cmwTbsdPeil

description:
PapaSon in Paekakariki, For the first time in 10 years, father and son reunite on stage. PapaSon brings together Matiu and his talented, well-known musician son Nikau from Casual Healing, weaving generations of sound into one unforgettable night.
Expect deep grooves, soulful harmonies, and rhythms that move body and spirit. A celebration of aroha, whānau, and music that heals, this is a rare chance to witness their beats, voices, and wairua blend live under one roof.
📍 Paekākāriki Hall
🎶 Beats, grooves, harmonies & love for all present.
One night only – come be part of the story.

description:
Paul Ubana Jones Plays The Shed, He’s back!
Doors open 7.30pm for an 8PM start.
Don’t miss Paul up close and personal in this intimate 35 seat venue.
An intimate soulful performer, an acoustic guitar sensation, winner of three New Zealand Music Awards.
Paul has shared the stage and toured with the best: BB King, Bob Dylan, Taj Mahal, Keb Mo, Crowded House, Tuck and Patti… He has delighted festival audiences at the Dublin Blues Festival, Byron bay Blues festival, Vancouver Island Folk Festival, Blues at Bridgetown and many others in Europe.
“A national treasure; Paul Ubana Jones is so much more than one man with a guitar. He is a conjuror of unique and original songs, rooted in primal Blues and Soul”
“The most exciting Electro Acoustic Artist to visit our shores”
Good Morning News, Santa Monica
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Performance Season 2025, Performance Season 2025

The New Zealand School of Dance (NZSD) Performance Season is a highlight of the School calendar and a showcase of the extraordinary dedication and passion the students apply to their training throughout the year.

Students from both the classical ballet and contemporary dance streams will showcase their talent in a series of performances allowing audiences of family, friends, supporters and dance enthusiasts the opportunity to see the rising talent of the future.

This year’s event celebrates the huge contribution of the School to the dance landscape in Aotearoa and beyond, with many of the works created by and/or staged by NZSD graduates. The 2025 season demonstrates the diversity of the art form – showcasing luminary new choreographic voices of contemporary dance, while paying homage to the timeless foundations of classical ballet.

A season of 10 performances, showcasing two separate programmes of classical ballet and contemporary dance, where the students will display their extraordinary talent, to audiences of family, friends and dance lovers. The split programme this year features a bold selection of works showcasing both the technical prowess and artistry of these young dancers.

‍

Venue: Te Whaea: National Dance and Drama Centre

‍

Dates: Classical Ballet Programme

Wednesday 19th November – 7.30pm

Friday 21st November – 7.30pm

description:
Peter Hobbs - Live 3D AV Indietronica with Isaac Levi Tucker, Miss Leading and Gotal Bournier, Peter Hobbs - Live 3D AV Indietronica with Isaac Levi Tucker, Miss Leading and Gotal Bournier
To celebrate the upcoming release of his 11th album, ground-breaking electronic artist and composer Peter Hobbs is touring his new 3D AV show around Aotearoa in Oct-Nov 2025. He is joined in Wellington by drummer extraordinaire Isaac Levi Tucker, producer-performer-poet Miss Leading, Raiatea synth artist Gotal Bournier and dancer Tokyo dancer Misako Kikuchi.

Peter Hobbs
Known for his award-winning cinematic and emotional body of work in recordings and immersive art works, Hobbs' new album Panpsychism is a vehicle for his masterful songwriting driven by experimental beats on a highway of immersive synth soundscapes, through an immersive visual-reactive world.
He is performing his modular synths and immersive AV show alongside legendary percussionist and drummer Isaac Levi Tucker.
Miss Leading
An electronic music producer, singer and poet. Her music aims to widen your mind while moving your body with a mix of pop, hip-hop, spoken ambient and dance tracks with a conscious perspective in relation to race, feminism, sexuality and environment. Her debut album Minor Thing received five-star reviews and gained critical acclaim by independent music magazines across the UK, Brazil, Germany and the USA, including being labelled UK Artist of the Week by The Vinyl District.

Gotal Bournier
Gotal Bournier is a French electronic musician living between Tahiti and Tokyo. Between 2012 and 2017 he released four albums in Japan with the band Lo-shi. Since 2018 he has been based on the island of Raʻiātea, working on solo recordings and various live collaborative projects. His current solo project is a playful and wryly nostalgic live soundtrack to a video collage of Cold War Era science fiction films using the spectral, alien tones of twin modular synthesisers.

Misako Kikuchi
After studying classical ballet at an early age, Tokyo-born dancer Misako Kikuchi went on to explore modern ballet, contemporary dance, street dance and flamenco, while refining her own improvisational approach. Her performances create uncontrived moments of beauty that make you feel that being alive is not irreconcilable with being free
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Peter Hook and The Light, Bassist Peter Hook has intimate knowledge of the music of bands Joy Division and New Order. He’s one of the founding members of both British new wave bands. In July 2026, he is bringing his band The Light to The Opera House in Wellington. Together they will perform New Order’s album ‘Get Ready’ in full to celebrate its 25th anniversary. To make the concert even better, they will also perform a selection of greatest hits from Joy Division’s and New Order’s back catalogue. Get ready to enjoy songs like Disorder, Shadowplay, Transmission, Love Will Tear Us Apart, Blue Monday, and True Faith. 
The dark and ethereal sound of Joy Division and New Order ushered in the post-punk era and continue to be influential in the rock music scene. Peter Hook and The Light are careful to meticulously recreate their music in a live setting. Audiences are in for a show where treasured songs are played with the passion and energy they deserve.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pig Destroyer + Glassblower + Post Natal Abortion- Wellington - San Fran, PIG DESTROYER Australian & New Zealand Tour
September 2nd – 14th, 2025
with guests WORMROT – Australia only
Sept 2nd – Perth, Amplifier Bar w/ Bile Cannon, Allocer*
Sept 4th – Adelaide, Lion Arts Factory w/ Meth Leppard
Sept 5th – Melbourne, Max Watts w/ Tongue Scum
Sept 6th – Sydney, The Factory Theatre w/ Crown Street Militia
Sept 7th – Canberra, The Baso w/ Blight Worms
Sept 9th – Brisbane, The Triffid w/ Awful Noise
Sept 10th – Townsville, The Warehouse w/ Varrim*
Sept 12th – Auckland, Galatos w/ Imperial Slave, Sawnoff*
Sept 13th – Christchurch, Loons w/ Vixen Execution, Unyielding Desolation*
Sept 14th – Wellington, San Fran w/ Glassblower, Post Natal Abortion*
*Wormrot not appearing in Perth, Townsville or NZ
TICKETS ON SALE at:
PERTH, MELBOURNE, CANBERRA, TOWNSVILLE – www.oztix.com.au
ADELAIDE, SYDNEY, BRISBANE - www.moshtix.com.au
AUCKLAND - https://galatos.co.nz
CHRISTCHURCH - www.undertheradar.co.nz
WELLINGTON - https://moshtix.co.nz
PIG DESTROYER boil metal down to its muscle, sinew, and bone - razor-sharp guitar, percussive pummelling, and a lone, stark howl - and use them to commit a vicious assault. The lyrics paint loathsome, frightening images of pitch-black self-hatred and the frailty of the human experience. These musical manifestations only serve to cement their already legendary status. Having not been in Australia and New Zealand since 2008, PIG DESTROYER’s long overwaited return has just one goal. To unnerve the unprepared with a deranged, grisly intensity which very few, if any, can match.
Recently reforming to the original line-up, Singapore’s WORMROT resume their genius in unleashing exquisite noise together, with the announcement of a new album 'TNT'. Grinding faces with the best of them, their performances are intense, spectacular, furious, with a barrage of unrelenting, head-caving abuse, honed by a singular determination to destroy the competition.
www.facebook.com/TheRealPigDestroyer

www.facebook.com/wormrot

www.swdpresents.com
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pipe Band Centenary Dinner, Join us as we celebrate 100 years of the Scots College Pipe Band at a Centenary Dinner on 20 September 2025! This milestone event promises to be filled with nostalgia, reconnections, and memories with old and current friends. 
There are two parts to this exciting event: the Pipe Band Reunion Rehearsal, and the Pipe Band Centenary Dinner.
Pipe Band Reunion Rehearsal
On 20 September at 2pm, we invite all past and present band members to gather for a get together and a rehearsal. The music that we will rehearse at this session will be played at the Centenary Dinner, and this event will conclude around 4:30pm.
Pipe Band Centenary Dinner
We invite you to our very special Pipe Band Centenary Dinner starting at 7pm in the Scots College Hall, which includes Guest Speaker Sir Ashley Bloomfield, performances by past and present Band members, a Haggis ceremony, and reflections on 100 years of the Pipe Band at Scots College.
We look forward to celebrating this historical moment with you!
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Public performance: New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir — Part of Mahuru Māori 2025 series, We are delighted to welcome the New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir and their infectious joy in music-making to Te Whanganui-a-Tara. This will be their first public appearance of the 2025–2026 cycle. Come and hear our nation’s youngest and most talented choral singers as we celebrate Mahuru Māori.
We’re in for another treat this Mahuru Māori at the National Library. Last year, Te Rōpū Rangatahi Waiata o Aotearoa The New Zealand Youth Choir gave a public concert to celebrate this special month, and now the teina — The New Zealand Secondary Students’ choir (NZSSC) — will appear for a public performance as their tuakana did, performing waiata to celebrate te ātaahua hoki o te reo tūturu o Aotearoa.
Bring your hoa, your colleagues and your whānau kia whakanuia ēnei rangatahi me te reo rangatira — this concert is not to be missed!
Nau mai te katoa! Everyone is welcome!
About the choir
The New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir has achieved considerable success since its formation in 1986. NZSSC has won titles such as Children’s Choir of the World at Llangollen Eisteddfod 2022, and over their near 40-year existence, embarked on 15 international tours, including Canada, Singapore, China, the United States, South America, Australia, and South Africa.
Under the direction of Sue Densem, the NZSSC is a tira waiata of Aotearoa’s finest young voices (14–18) and offers a two-year membership where rangatahi tour throughout the country and learn from some of the country’s top choral teachers and composers. At the end of their two-year cycle, the rōpū rounds out their membership term by embarking on an international tour, performing concerts and competing in choral festivals.
New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir website: https://www.nzsschoir.com/
Image: Kaiwaiata of the New Zealand Secondary Students’ Choir perform in China (2024).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Pumpkinhead - SLOTH 30th Anniversary Tour, Pumpkinhead - SLOTH 30th Anniversary Tour
Pumpkinhead celebrate the 30th anniversary of their critically acclaimed album Sloth this year, performing three exclusive never to be repeated reunion shows.

Sloth entered the New Zealand Album Charts on 30 April 1995, peaked at number 28 and stayed in the charts for 4 weeks. Their single “I Like” made it to number 16 in the Official Top 40 singles chart 10 March 1995.

“Now “Sloth”, Pumpkinhead’s debut album, compresses the quintet’s live energy into a head spinning whirlpool of fierce punky rock, powerful pop, and tempo-hopping Faith No More style metal. Not for the innocent!” – 4.5 stars – NZ HERALD 1995

“Sloth is the sound of a band that’s already found its feet, the sound of a band that’s played 500 gigs before recording their debut album. What we’ve got here is a classy, polished debut. “I Like” these songs a lot” – Kevin List – RIP IT UP 1995
label: Music & Concerts

Queen and a tribute to the Bee Gees, Madsen Promotions brings you the ultimate tribute to Queen, We Will Rock You, Bohemian Rhapsody, Another One Bites the Dust plus many more! Fronted by Paul Madsen and band

description:
Queer Horizons presents Hot Mooch, Hot Mooch is a queer club night. Come to shake up koanga with a night of hot dance music. 
Spawned from the legendary Queer Horizons in Ōtautahi Christchurch, Hot Mooch is happening in te Upoko o te Ika Wellington - Valhalla to be exact - on 11 October. 
!!! THIS LINEUP !!!
🎶 DJ Thank U So Much (Te Whanganui-a-Tara)
🎶 Mr Meaty Boy (Ōtautahi)
🎶 AAKI (Ōtautahi)
🎶 Oil Grace (Tāmaki Makaurau)
Come to kanikani. Toi tū te Tiriti and free Palestine.
About Hot Mooch
Hot Mooch is for the bipoc and queer communities of Te Whanganui-a-Tara and their allies. It is intended as a night to dance and listen to loud music: in safety, as yourself, and with abandon. 
BIPOC and LGBTQIA+ front and centre: always.
Tino rangatiratanga: mō āke tonu atu.
FREE PALESTINE. 10% of sales go to Team Assal for their work supporting people in Gaza.
The night is dedicated to respectful, inclusive, and joyful space: we have no tolerance for any unsafe behaviour including racism, ableism, sexism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, fatphobia, or unwanted attention. 
Show lots of love and respect to our amazing performers and DJs and give them space to do their thing.
Take care of those around you, be aware of the space you inhabit and respect the needs of others. Ear plugs are available at the bar, and we encourage you to take time out, and check in with your friends. If you need help please ask the bar staff or organisers. 
  Accessibility details
Valhalla is wheelchair accessible with accessible toilets. If you have other accessibility needs, DM Abby on Insta @emmanuelcunnane
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Ravel’s opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges', New Zealand School of Music Classical Performance students present four performances Ravel's engagingly magical opera 'L'enfant et les sortilèges' at the Hannah Playhouse directed by Sara Brodie, conducted by Martin Riseley with the New Zealand School of Music orchestra.

Performed in French with subtitles, the show is suitable for all ages. The story involves a 'child' (L'enfant) whose awful behaviour brings an unexpected response: first the furniture rebels, the grandfather clock, the broken china cup, then the mathematics tutor and the Princess in the fairy tale book come to life, and eventually all the animals in the garden - squirrels, dragonfly, birds rise up - all of whom have good reason to 'teach the child a lesson'. It's a fabulous journey that we go on with the child who is confronted by all of these and indeed learns...

This is a project involving the whole of the Classical Performance programme: the voice students sing all the roles, each performing several roles, the NZSM orchestra will play for the performances, and the piano students are taking part as rehearsal pianists (répétiteurs) and playing in the orchestra.

Lighting design by Alex Fisher, set and costumes by Grace O’Brien, assistant director Theresa Hanaray, chorus master Kathryn Mosley, the show has been coordinated by NZSM Head of Classical Voice Jenny Wollerman in collaboration with the Toi Whakaari technical programme staff, graduates, and students
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Raven Mavens Quartette in concert, Raven Mavens Quartette
Suppose you can imagine the sound of the blues, spiced by flavours of the American songbook, folk, country, and even the rock and roll of Jerry Lee Lewis, driven by the unmistakable sound of boogie woogie piano. In that case, you have the Raven Mavens Quartette.  

It is both an accident and it isn’t that this is an all-female group. The group had its genesis a decade ago when piano player and singer-songwriter Cindy Muggeridge encountered the singing and clarinet skills of Marian Carter. They formed the Raven Mavens as a duo that included a core of folk and blues, and exploited the singing talents of the pair through finely crafted harmonies.  

The success of their combination in playing local gigs and folk festivals opened up opportunities with other musicians, and the next step was the inclusion of drummer Anje Glindemann, who has played in a list of local bands, including Tin Pan Alley, Hen Picked and more recently the Salty Hearts. Anje can also be seen performing with Kapiti Coast singer-songwriter icon Andrew London.  And finally, the addition of multi-instrumentalist Kate Marshall. “Kate is an amazing player”, Cindy says. “She can move as easily from piano accordion, to fiddle or flute, depending on what the song calls for - or she feels like playing!” And of course, like the other members of the group, she sings.  

The instrumental diversity of the line-up was now established, but what also distinguishes this group is the addition of Cindy Muggeridge’s original songs to the set. “Writing my own songs has been part of the musical journey for me”, says Cindy, “and it just led naturally to offering some of them to the other singers in the group”. The “fun” of their music and the unmistakable presence of four female musical masters is what they will be sharing when they play at The Offering as part of Greytown ArtTown.

Buy tickets in advance here or txt bookings to 02102361951.

Please note The Offering is fully licensed and will be serving snacks and drinks. Please note this concert replaces Bob McNeill and Emily Roughton due to illness.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Real Black For Me: Zoe Moon presents the music of Roberta Flack, Roberta Flack made an indelible mark on modern popular music.
Over the course of her career, Flack wrote and performed songs that blended jazz, folk, gospel, and R&B into something uniquely her own — music defined by elegance, intimacy, and emotional depth deeply rooted in celebration of black American culture.
From the quiet intensity of The First Time Ever I Saw Your Face to the gently insistent Killing Me Softly with His Song, her recordings
remain timeless, proven again and again by the ways they’ve been reimagined.
In Real Black For Me, artist Zoe Moon and her band — featuring a live string section — revisit and reimagine this extraordinary body of work through a shared sense of the “strange kind of power” of self defined identity.
These arrangements, which Moon has crafted alongside renowned Wellington big band leader, bass player and composer Seth Boy, bring fresh colour and sophistication to Flack’s most celebrated songs alongside lesser-known but equally captivating gems, tracing the arc of an artist whose voice could fill a room or break a heart with a whisper.
An evening for lovers of great songwriting, luminous vocals, and the enduring legacy of one of music’s finest storytellers.
Doors 6.30pm | Show 7pm
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Rebel Base with Stanton Warriors tickets, The Sandwiches Guy, aka Bryce, spent the ’90s in London—raving, clubbing, DJing, and throwing parties.
He returned to Wellington in 2000 and co-founded the event brand Sandwiches that November.
By 2003, Sandwiches had grown into a venue that became an iconic part of Wellington’s nightlife for over a decade, hosting both local and international artists. The brand also expanded into large-scale events, including outdoor music festivals such as Summerset at the Basin Reserve.
Now, The Sandwiches Guy and Meow Nui are joining forces to bring back a classic favourite from the Sandwiches days: Stanton Warriors!
Doors open at 8 pm, with Stanton Warriors hitting the stage at 10 pm. This one-off event is all about community—friends old and new coming together to dance, connect, and celebrate. Don’t miss your chance to be part of a night to remember.

description:

Drunken Piano, Banished Music and The Others Way festival are hyped to announce a huge debut NZ appearance on Friday 28th November 2025 for Canada’s Saya Gray at Wellington’s stunning Meow Nui. Support comes from UK producer DJ Karen Nyame KG and Te Whanganui-a-Tara local artist Mā.

Taking the stage in Wellington ahead of her Others Way Festival appearance the next night, Saya Gray will be performing material from her excellent record released earlier this year SAYA.

Saya Gray has earned a reputation for electric, hypnotic live performances, leaping between instruments and genres, beguiling and entrancing her audiences.

“The alt-pop experimentalist delivered a mesmerizing, emotional performance with a triumphant sense of self” – Range Magazine

Watch her NPR Tiny Desk performance here.

Sharing the Meow Nui stage with Saya is UK DJ, producer, vocalist Karen Nyame KG.

“Channeling a deeply rooted attachment to the African diaspora, KG’s innovative and percussive assemblage of dance music spanned amapiano, afrobeats, uk funky, gqom and beyond.” – Resident Advisor

You can check our her boiler room set at Primavera here.

Rounding out the evening is local artist Mā. With their second album “Blame It On The Weather” being released earlier this year, Mā told RNZ “I’d rather talk about how we can move forward, how we can evolve, how we can work together better”.

Don’t miss this celebratory evening of creative expression and artistic genius. With Saya Gray and KG performing for the first time in New Zealand, tickets are on sale now from ticketek.co.nz

description:
SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt, SECOND SHOW! Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt
The original 28 November show is now SOLD OUT.

DON'T MISS OUT ON THE SECOND AND FINAL WELLINGTON REGION SHOW IN '25!

Tickets on sale NOW! Don't miss out...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.

description:
SOLD OUT: Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt : SOLD OUT, SOLD OUT: Darren Watson sings John Hiatt - Lower Hutt : SOLD OUT
All tickets to this show have sold. Second show announcement soon...

This will be Darren's first performance in the Wellington region in almost half a decade! Strictly limited tickets so book early to avoid disappointment.

Enjoy an amazing night with legendary blues artist Darren Watson. Darren is a seasoned singer-songwriter and blues musician with over three decades of experience in the music industry. Based in Aotearoa/New Zealand, Darren has built a reputation for his authentic blues sound, combining traditional influences with contemporary themes. His music is characterised by thoughtful lyrics, skilled guitar work, and a voice that carries both grit and soul.

With Darren for this intimate Shed appearance will be stellar double bassist Steve Moodie, and once wunderkind but still wunderful guitarist Chris Armour.

Darren first gained recognition in the 1980s as the leader and frontman of the New Zealand band Chicago Smoke Shop. Since then, he has pursued a successful solo career, releasing a series of well-received albums. His 2020 album, Getting Sober for the End of the World, was widely praised for its sharp social commentary and musical craftsmanship, earning airplay and accolades both locally and internationally. It saw Darren nominated as a finalist for the 2021 Aotearoa Music Award for Best Folk Artist.

Watson's new album 'Darren Watson sings John Hiatt' is due for release in late 2025.

description:
SUB-TRIBE Red Earth Tour - Wellington, SUB-TRIBE Red Earth Tour - Wellington
Friday, October 10 @ San Fran - Wellington
With special guests!
From the raw, roots-driven frequencies of Aotearoa (New Zealand) comes SUB- TRIBE. Rolling in thick with bottom end, glitchy beats and soaring harmonies, expect to be taken on a journey across genres. From blues drenched dub, chunky skank reggae to jazz hop and ragga dancehall, SUB-TRIBE leave no groove base unturned. This 7-piece dub-fusion outfit offer a distinctive and exciting approach to the bass and reggae culture movements with captivating, high-energy live performances and feel-good vibes that leave crowds skanking for more.
This run of shows will be their biggest headline tour to date. See SUB-TRIBE live as they hit the road in New Zealand for their October Red Earth Tour, taking on Wellington’s San Fran, Hamilton's The Last Place, and Leigh's Sawmill Cafe.
Support for each show to be announced.
Tickets are on sale from www.subtribemusic.com

description:
Sam Bambery - Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs, Sam Bambery - Live at Vogelmorn Upstairs
Sam Bambery is an artist and impresario from Ōtautahi/Christchurch, currently based in Naarm/Melbourne. Exploring his love of semi-psychedelia through a twisted folk-rock lens, Bambery writes effectual and spacious songs burrowing into emotional identity and exhaustion. His sophomore album Rubricator released in 2024 with micro-label Under Underground Records, edging at outsider-pop influence.


"...very considered, like Bambery lived with the album in his head for a while before bringing it into the world...a hint of mystery hangs over things...it's as ornate as these well-crafted tunes" - Tony Stamp, Radio New Zealand

"Rubricator confirms the emergence of a real talent" - Graham Reid, NZ Listener

Sam Bambery is joined by Michael Llewellyn

description:
Serenades across cultures, Join Lala Simpson (vocals),  Dayle Anderson (piano), and Jonathan Berkahn (accordion) for an enchanting evening of music, where the soulful melodies of French chanson legends like Edith Piaf and Jacques Brel blend seamlessly with the haunting rhythms of Malagasy icons such as Bessa and Fanja Andriamanantena. Be serenaded by heartfelt songs of love, loss, and romance—an unforgettable night of timeless classics that capture the essence of passion and longing.
Join Us for an Unforgettable Concert Experience – A Night of Music with a Heartfelt Purpose!
Last year, as part of our Cultural Immersion Tour, I had the profound privilege of visiting Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, alongside Stuart Simpson, Rose Ruane, and my nieces and nephews. Located on the eastern side of Antananarivo, the capital, the orphanage was founded by the incredible Madame Hary in 2012. What started as a humble project from her own home has grown into a haven for 54 children, some of whom were rescued from areas where twins are sadly believed to be cursed.
Despite the challenges, the orphanage continues to thrive, relying entirely on the kindness of visitors. They grow their own rice, maintain a small chicken farm, and have a vegetable garden to sustain themselves. But their greatest need is for ongoing support and resources to continue providing for these beautiful children.
By attending our concert, you’ll be helping make a direct impact on the lives of these children. All profits from this concert will go toward completing the construction of a much-needed training center at Mamitiana Orphanage in Madagascar, helping provide valuable education and support to the children in their care.
label: Music & Concerts

With Chris CK on the mic alongside Blair Gowan (keys), Will Hanlon (sax), Max Sheehan (percussion & effects), Ciaran Egan (drums), and Alex Cooper (bass), this band will take you deep into the crate for a groove-filled night you won’t forget!

Shan Solo, The Undercurrent presents... Shan Solo!
Shan started out playing the piano at 7 and then writing songs at 12. She studied music in her later years was a part of various bands and other music acts. A recent highlight was playing Gardens Magic at the Botanical Gardens two nights in a row at the beginning of this year and releasing EP’s and albums under SHAN, Kingston High All Stars and The Julie Lamb Outfit.
Shan's songs and vocals have been noted for their power and strength and likened to SIA, Bic Runga and Kate Bush.
She is currently working on a new batch of original songs and in between playing live music for various bars around Wellington.
SHAN will be supported by Hannah Simpson and Helena & Philip.

description:
Shaun Kirk | Live @ Le Cafe - Picton, NZ (Less than 30 tickets left!), Shaun Kirk | Live @ Le Cafe - Picton, NZ (Less than 30 tickets left!)
🚨LESS THAN 30 TICKETS REMAINING!🚨

More info & tickets >>> https://bit.ly/41W7UR4

With special guest: Nick Herbison

Hailing from the music-filled streets of Melbourne, Australia, Shaun Kirk is an award-winning blues and soul troubadour recognized for his exceptional talent as a born entertainer. His unique talent has not only earned him many accolades but also much praise from fellow artists, such as three-time Grammy Award Winner Fantastic Negrito, who has declared his show as "One of the best one-man shows he’s ever seen!"

Kirk's vocals exude a gritty, soulful depth that seems to transcend far beyond his years, with critics continually acclaiming him as "one of the finest blues voices Australia has ever heard" (Buzz Mag). Complementing his vocal artistry, Kirk's vintage guitar tones and raw grooves pay tribute to the timeless influences that have shaped his musical journey, resulting in a distinctive sound fast becoming his own.

Shaun’s musical journey has taken him to stages all over the world, where he's not only performed but consistently sold out shows, leaving audiences enthralled by his magnetic presence. From iconic festival stages like Bluesfest Byron Bay, where he's become a familiar name, to sharing the billing with legends like Robert Plant of Led Zeppelin, John Mayer, Paolo Nutini, John Butler Trio, and The Teskey Brothers; Kirk's artistic prowess is in esteemed company. Moreover, he's also had the honour of opening for household names such as blues maestro Joe Bonamassa, soul sensation Allen Stone, and the indomitable Beth Hart; further solidifying his place in the landscape of contemporary music. This remarkable journey is a testament to Kirk's unmatched talent and ability to connect with audiences across genres and generations.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shawn James - Wellington, Shawn James – New Zealand Tour October 2025
Christchurch • Wellington • Auckland
For the first time ever, acclaimed American singer-songwriter Shawn James is bringing his powerful, soul-stirring music to New Zealand. Known for his raw vocals, heartfelt lyrics, and a genre-defying blend of folk, blues, rock, and soul, Shawn has captivated audiences around the globe.
Following a massive international tour and the rise of his hit song "Through the Valley" -featured in the critically acclaimed The Last of Us series - Shawn is thrilled to announce his debut run across Aotearoa.
Catch him live this October for three unforgettable shows:
Wednesday, October 15 - Loons, Christchurch
Thursday, October 16 - San Fran, Wellington
Friday, October 17 - Double Whammy, Auckland
Tickets are on sale this Friday the 30th of May at 1:00 pm
Pre sale starts tomorrow, Thursday the 29th of May at 1:00 pm
Don't miss this rare chance to experience the intensity and emotion of Shawn James in an intimate live setting. Tickets are expected to move fast - secure yours now!
"Hey there, this is Shawn James. I’ve had way too many writers think they could sum me up & relay what I’m about from an hour long conversation so they could write my “bio” but I’ve had it. Screw that. I’ll tell it in my own words.
I was born & raised in Chicago, Illinois. I grew up on the south side of the city where I attended a gospel church. I was always around a lot of heartfelt soulful music & hardworking, real, down to earth people. Although I no longer abide by any religion, I value the times I had and how they shaped me to be what I am now. I’ve moved around quite a bit living in all different parts of the US.
While absorbing all sorts of different cultures from here & around the world, I’ve developed my own sound. I started releasing my own music in 2012 and haven’t stopped since. I play a wide range of music from folk to blues, r&b, Gospel to rock, metal & alotta things in between. The main constant amongst all the genres would be that it’s all done with emotion, feeling, heart & a lotta soul. I mean what I say & deeply feel what I play.
I play covers of songs I dig sometimes and although some people may only know me because of those, I’m hardly just a cover artist.
If you come see me play live and expect just one style or aspect of what I do, you may be disappointed to learn that our shows are a roller coaster of emotions, musical styles, intensity & energy. I get bored easily & love to mix things up. Be ready & bring your ear plugs just in case..
I’ve always been the underdog so to speak since I’ve never had the backing of a large record label, big marketing firm or massive PR company & I truly like it that way. I feel as though I’ve earned what I have through hard work, determination, a good bit of luck & the great relationships with people I’ve made along the way. I’ve learned a lot of lessons the hard way being in this “music business industry” and that’s alright by me.
I’ve seen that with your support (the listeners out there) I can make my wildest dreams come true.
If you want to listen to an artist that’s authentic, genuine & original then you’ve come to the right place. I hope you enjoy the music & will join me on this journey that I’m so extremely grateful to be on.
Thank you all so very much.
Love,
Shawn James"
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Shostakovich Unpacked | NZSQ + Ghost Trio, Introducing Shostakovich: Unpacked. A four-part concert series presented by New Zealand String Quartet and friends to commemorate the 50th anniversary of Shostakovich’s death.
Across four night-time gatherings, the NZSQ will take to the stage with Orchestra Wellington, Antipodes Quartet, Ghost Trio, and pianist Jian Liu to explore the raw emotional power of one of the 20th century’s most troubled, yet defiant, musical voices.
Each concert features a specially curated selection of the chamber music of Shostakovich, paired with the unique voices of Aotearoa composers. From duets, to quartets, to a full chamber orchestra, we're getting up close to the celebrated chamber music and lasting legacy of Dimitri Shostakovich, 50 years after his death.
We invite you to join us on the journey of “Shostakovich: UNPACKED”, as together we explore and question what this powerful music meant in the time Shostakovich wrote it, but also how vitally important the composer’s artistic voice still is today.
Concert Three: Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ x Ghost Trio
Artists onstage: NZSQ / Ghost Trio
Shostakovich: 4th String Quartet, Five Pieces for Two Violins and Piano, 2nd Piano Trio
Unpacked: The music of Robert Burch
Spotlight: Feel the past merge with the present, as beloved former NZSQ member Monique Lapins joins current violinist Peter Clark in Shostakovich’s delightful work for two violins and piano. Ghost Trio conclude the evening with their celebrated virtuosity and emotional intensity in the second piano trio.
Tickets: $15 - $55
In order:
Wednesday 9 July, 6:30pm & 8:30pm, NZSQ + Orchestra Wellington
Wednesday 6 August, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Antipodes Quartet
Wednesday 1 October, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Ghost Trio
Tuesday 25 November, 6:30pm, NZSQ + Jian Liu

description:
Sir Dave Dobbyn — Selected Songs, He’s a treasured musical voice in New Zealand culture. Sir Dave Dobbyn has over 45 years of experience as a singer, songwriter, and recording artist. For one special night, he will be singing in Wellington at The Opera House. Many of his songs have acted as a backdrop to Kiwis’ lives and shaped the sound of the country’s popular music scene. Some of Dave’s songs are so famous that they have become anthems. You’ll get to hear many of them along with rich pickings from his back catalogue. 
Diagnosed with Parkinson’s Disease in 2022, Dave declared it “business as usual” — and continues to inspire with his unmistakable voice and enduring stage presence. Recognised with a Knighthood in 2021 for his services to music, Dave remains one of New Zealand’s most revered cultural figures.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sirens: LadyReign, Edera, Cryfor, LadyReign presents SIRENS on the 17th Sept 2025 at Valhalla Tavern, featuring three of Wellington's most eclectic female fronted artists: LadyReign, Cryfor & Edera.
With a lineup designed to increase in intensity, the tunes of these baddies will make you cry, headbang and two-step. At the same time you ask? Come find out.
Edera is an alt-rock–indie–sad girl artist from Te Whanganui-a-Tara, delivering romantic yet callous songwriting that makes you want to dance, cry, and maybe do both at once. Ederacore blends lush indie textures with gritty rock energy, brought to life by melancholy rock legends Aidan Thomas-Inwood (guitar), Lily Hodgson-Bell (bass), and Taiki Yoshino (drums) - Together, they create an immersive live experience—intimate, cathartic, and impossible to forget.
LadyReign is a six-piece alternative-metal band blending soul-stirring harmonies with the raw
intensity of heavy metal breakdowns. Fronted by two powerful female vocalists, the band
creates a captivating contrast that draws inspiration from both soulful icons like Lianne La
Havas and the crushing heaviness of bands like Spiritbox. LadyReign fuses vulnerability with
aggression in a sound that is both haunting and refreshing.
With their fearless blend of metal and soul, LadyReign is a band that leaves an unforgettable
mark on the Wellington and wider Aotearoa music scene.
In faith to the literal etymology of the term 'metalcore', Cryfor combines Bridge 9, Deathwish era hardcore with golden era melodic death metal. As hard as they are brutal, Cryfor aims to bring real deal spin kickers and battle jacket bros together in the same pit.
Originally starting as the bedroom recording project of vocalist and lyricist Ella O'Neill, Cryfor is a band dedicated to reviving and breathing new life into 2000s style metalcore.
After recruiting drummer Fionn Lawley, and guitarist/backing vocalist Daniel Jenner (ex King Hit HC & Temperatures Rising) in late 2024 and bassist Daniel Walters in early 2025, Cryfor has been a rolling tank of non-stop hatemosh force.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sleaford Mods tickets, Presented by: Handsome Tours
Handsome Tours are proud to present Sleaford Mods 2026 Australian & New Zealand Tour
This will be Sleaford Mods first time back to Australian and New Zealand soil since May and June of 2023, where they performed at events like Sydney's Vivid LIVE and Hobart's Dark Mofo.
“We took a year off ’cause I needed to get my nails did, and now we’re itching to get back out there and play live”, says Sleaford Mods' Jason Williamson. “We released a new single Megaton last month, it’s an absolute banger so we’re buzzing to play that live for the first time. Who knows, we might have a few more new tracks to drop by then. Either way, it’s been a while since we toured, and we’re gagging for it.”
Sleaford Mods has partnered with PLUS1 to support War Child. $1.15 inc GST from every ticket sold will help War Child to protect, educate, and stand up for the rights of children affected by war.
www.warchild.org.uk

description:
Sofa Session with Frida & Na'amah, See Frida Flacks and Na'amah Cheiban live in the comfort of Wellington's favourite community living room for an afternoon of harmonies, soul and original music.
~
Na’amah Cheiban is an Auckland-based singer-songwriter, session musician, teacher, and co-founder of Wāhine In Jazz. A graduate of the University of Auckland’s jazz programme, her music reflects the raw honesty of navigating relationships, faith, and mental health in her 20s. With solo guitar and soft, alluring vocals, she crafts intimate jazz-folk songs layered with lyrical melodies and intricate grooves.
~
Frida Flacks, a rising voice from Wellington’s scene, draws inspiration from artists like Lianne La Havas and Melody Gardot. A graduate of the New Zealand School of Music, she blends harmony, improvisation, and melodic textures to create performances that feel dreamlike and ever-changing.
~
After first collaborating at the 2024 Wellington Jazz Festival, Na’amah and Frida have built a close artistic bond. Their voices blend together like honey, offering audiences an experience both soulful and comforting—a warm embrace of harmony to start your festival weekend.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Soft Bait - Life Advice Album Release Tour (Wellington), Tāmaki Makaurau post-punk outfit Soft Bait are hitting the road this September in celebration of their new album Life Advice, out July 25 via Flying Nun Records.
Known for their sharp lyricism, driving basslines and chaotic-but-considered live shows, the four-piece are bringing their wiry energy and weird charm to stages across the motu. Life Advice is a hook-heavy record full of tightly wound rhythms, jagged guitars and lines that sound like overheard wisdom from a mate you probably shouldn’t be listening to.
Tickets on sale now.
With support from Buffcat and True Mets.

description:
Something Something Club Presents: The Darlings, Raffla and B-TELLO, Something Something Club Presents: Live music event featuring three acts:

RAFFLA
Raffla brings bass heavy skanks, groovy rhythms and infectious vibrations, causing a recent spread of the swamp across Te Whanganui-a-Tara. Their genre-less sound draws heavily from influences of reggae and dub, with fast paced skanks of ska, and groovy rhythms of dance music.

THE DARLINGS
Female-led five-piece band The Darlings bring the “fun music” back to Wellington with their wild mix of rock, funk, and R&B. Listen out for reckless genre-bending and theatrical performances that keep the energy high, and the boredom low.

B-TELLO
An upcoming DJ based in Pōneke (Wellington), NZ. He takes the sonic reigns and throws down tasty Garage dubs, Hardgroove heaters accompanied by old school Breaks, Dub and Techno to keep the dancefloor moving. B-TELLO specialises in dance rhythms from 120 to 160 bpm.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Songwriter Showcase 106, Every 3rd Sunday of the month we showcase four local songwriters and celebrate the rich culture and depth of talent we have here in Aotearoa.

This month we present.. The Vorn String Trio, Emily de Vegt, CP3o, and Banjo Ben and the Breeze


The Vorn String Trio..
Wellington songwriting legend Vorn needs no introduction! But since I have to write something in this box and you seem compelled to read it, let’s both reflect on the wonder of a 25-year career spent labouring in prolific obscurity, across 9 albums of songs which veer from sublime to ridiculous, often within a single verse. Fresh off releasing The Late Album (the only NZ indie album ever to beat terminal cancer), Vorn and the ludicrously talented Charley Davenport (cello) and Thomas Liggett (violin) will present a selection of the best songs ever written in this country. You should come listen!

https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/track/a-safe-pair-of-hands
https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/track/all-along-the-shore
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MqYKO64nHuM
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=L7CoOPc6AX8
https://www.facebook.com/Vornmusic/

Emily de Vegt..
Taranaki’s Emily de Vegt brings a cosy, whimsical charm to the girl-with-a-guitar flavour of singer-songwriter. Her songs draw from her background in classical piano and pay tribute to melancholic modern artists like Radiohead and Lana Del Rey.

https://soundcloud.com/emilydevegt/birds-hawera-2023
https://soundcloud.com/emilydevegt/somygardengrows-hawera-2023
https://facebook.com/emilydevegt/videos/718456777591120

CP3o..
Barry Carter's CP3o give you original songs with a Jazz-Acana feel.

https://www.youtube.com/@CarterParkerTrio-CP3o/videos
https://www.facebook.com/people/CP3o-Carter-Parker-Trio/100091844075290


Banjo Ben and the Breeze
Banjo Ben and The Breeze are a new 4-piece indie-folk comedy band based in Wellington,
NZ. They are known for their iconic beanies, their regular evening busking sessions on
Cuba Street, and their theatrically charged gigs which are packed full of catchy lyrics, wild
stories and plenty of laughs.

https://youtu.be/ejM7pZYBMYI?si=Rc_CSQEt2zQYvewW
https://www.instagram.com/banjo_ben_and_the_breeze
https://www.facebook.com/people/Banjo-Ben-and-The-Breeze/61578992621362/
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Songwriters' Saturday, These Wellington, Kapiti and Golden Bay singer-songwriters have put together an evening of original music for your enjoyment.

Opening the evening is Hanne Jøstensen on piano, followed by Nick Feint on guitar, Rachel Hird on piano, and duo Waireka, featuring Cameron Te Moananui on guitar and Juli Usmar on and ukulele.

More about the artists:
Rachel Hird is a Wellington based singer-songwriter. She grew up playing the piano and studying classical music. Nowadays she writes and performs her own songs best described as ‘songs from the heart'. She is constantly inspired by people she meets in the music community and her songs tell of people, places and events of the past and present. Rachel is planning an EP release later in the year.

Hanne Jøstensen is a Wellington based singer-songwriter, originally from Norway. She will take you on a journey in true Scandinavian minimalist style to remote lighthouse islands and the polar night sky. Her single ‘The Lighthouse’ is now out on all major streaming platforms and will be followed by an EP later this year.

'Singer-songwriter Nick Feint has an innate ability to bring in depth stories to life in his songs with heart and good humour. Bearing traces of Billy Bragg, Nick’s musical mix of wordplay and direct emotion makes for a strong and satisfying set.' Charlotte Yates, Musician.
‘Touching on life’s moments big and small, Nick performs his own heartfelt songs with integrity and confidence’. Jane Dixon, Mussel Inn.
Nick’s album “Next Exit From Babylon” is available on Spotify.

Waireka are a couple who sing and play together, mostly in harmony. Cameron plays guitar and Juli, the cajon and ukulele. Their songs are written by Cameron.

The Realm is a family friendly venue with a great vibe, good food, including children's menu and a good range of refreshing beverages available at the bar.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Sonic Delusion Smoooth Single Release Tour Greytown, To mark the release of his brand-new single “Smoooth”, Sonic Delusion is hitting the road for a special six-date release tour. Known for his infectious grooves, playful looping, and feel-good folk-pop energy, Sonic Delusion brings audiences a mix of fresh tunes and crowd favourites — all wrapped in the joy and honesty that make his shows so irresistible.
Audiences can join the celebration at:
Saturday 15 November – Lakeside Playhouse, Opunake
Sunday 16 November – Wood St, Kakaramea
Thursday 4 December – Globe Theatre, Palmerston North
Friday 5 December – Firebird Cafe, Levin
Saturday 6 December – Hilltop House Concerts, Wellington
Sunday 7 December – Janette House Gig, Studio 73, Greytown
From Taranaki to the lower North Island, each stop promises to be a night of rhythm, laughter, and community. With “Smoooth” as the soundtrack, Sonic Delusion invites audiences to protest the madness of the world in the best way possible — by coming together, dancing, and choosing to live smoooth.

description:
Soundscape Series: Danica Bryant, Danica Bryant is a force to be reckoned with. A pop-folk singer-songwriter with a gritty rock-edge, her music tackles provocative themes from celebrity culture to neurodiversity through an unabashedly queer feminist lens.

Her “playful indie pop” (Rolling Stone) has seen her open for legends like Elton John and Robbie Williams, hit #2 on the NZ Hot Singles Chart with her 2024 release ‘Acid’, and undergo mentorship with Kiwi icon Bic Runga. Bryant has undergone multiple successful New Zealand tours and played festivals including Gardens Magic, Outfield and Cuba Dupa.

With her debut album 'Feast' out this August, Bryant is “venomous yet passionate” (Ambient Light), “cynical but emotional” (NZ Musician), and an unapologetically fresh voice on the pop music scene.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. Designed for music lovers who want more than a background soundtrack, this series celebrates live performance with a diverse range of acclaimed performers.

Saturday 21 June — Nick Granville Trio

Saturday 26 July — Seth Boy Trio

Saturday 30 August — Michelle Velvin Harpist

Saturday 20 September — The Weather Machine

Saturday 27 September — Rameka Tamaki

Saturday 25 October — Danica Bryant

Doors 7:30pm, with events starting at 8pm. Each event will be 60—90 minutes in two sets.

These events will take place inside at The Bond Store, Paraparaumu and are seated with general admission.

The Bond Store is located at 21 Birmingham Street, Paraparaumu. It operates as The Tasting Room which serves food and beverages.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Soundscape Series: Rameka Tamaki, People can expect a level of artistry and mastery over the guitar. Rameka will be playing a selection of Classical Guitar pieces which include places like Spain, Japan, South America, and also his own compositions. These will range from Baroque, to Romantic, and Modern, with elements of different genres that encompass different cultures and time periods from around the world.

Rameka Tamaki (Tūhoe, Maniapoto, Samoan, Tongan, Irish) is a Classical Guitarist from Aotearoa, New Zealand who has performed in festivals and shows around the world. With a passion for the guitar and Māori culture he completed his Bachelor of Music with First Class Honours at The New Zealand School of Music, Victoria University. His performances include ASIA Topa, The New Zealand Opera Company, Performance Space at Carriageworks Sydney, the Matariki Ahi Kā Festival, Gardens Magic, and Los Angeles for Kapa Haka.

description:
Soundscape Series: The Weather Machine, The Weather Machine brings an electrifying blend of soulful longing, theatrical glam, and retro-nostalgic indie rock to the stage. Their live shows are dynamic and heartfelt, weaving together lush arrangements, unexpected instrumentation, and soaring vocal performances. With violin, sax, clarinet, and layered harmonies in the mix, audiences can expect a genre-blurring experience that feels both intimate and cinematic. Whether it’s a delicate folk tune or a full-throttle rock anthem, The Weather Machine delivers each moment with passion, precision, and a deep love for musical storytelling.

The Weather Machine began as the brainchild of Portland, Oregon songwriter Slater Smith. What started as a DIY indie-folk project in the city’s vibrant underground scene has since evolved into a professional, internationally touring band. Over the years, they’ve shared stages with acts like The Lumineers, Alabama Shakes, and Cold War Kids. In 2021, Smith relocated to Te Whanganui-a-Tara, Aotearoa, bringing the project with him and forming a new Wellington-based lineup. Now spanning two continents, The Weather Machine continues to expand its sound with a fresh, collaborative spirit.

About the Mostly Music Soundscape Series

A curated series of intimate live music experiences showcasing the depth, texture and emotion of sound. Each performance invites you to immerse yourself in a new soundscape, informed by genre, sonic craft, and music as an art form. description:
Soweto Gospel Choir, The sound of close harmony singing from South Africa is set to ring out across the St James Theatre in March. The Soweto Gospel Choir is a 30-member ensemble that blends African gospel, spirituals, reggae and American popular music into rousing concerts. For its Wellington concert, the choir will present songs and anthems from Nelson Mandela’s Freedom Movement in South Africa and the Civil Rights Movement of Dr Martin Luther King’s America. There will also be contemporary classics. Hear songs by legendary artists Elvis Presley, Sam Cooke, Cynthia Erivo, Stevie Wonder, and Aretha Franklin. 
Since it formed in 2002, the Soweto Gospel Choir has performed around the world. The choir is dedicated to celebrating the unique and inspirational power of South African Gospel music. It’s won numerous awards, including three Grammy Awards for Best Traditional World Music Album.

description:
Stan Bicknell Live: The Drum Clinic Tour - Wellington, Stan Bicknell Live: The Drum Clinic Tour - Wellington
Stan Bicknell Live: The Drum Clinic Tour You Don’t Want to Miss!
Fresh off stages across the UK and Europe with pop icon Natasha Bedingfield, and recently handpicked from over 6,200 submissions to audition in LA for U.S. alt-rock legends Primus, Stan Bicknell is now bringing his powerhouse skills and elite drumming insight to Musicworks clinics.

With a career spanning more than 25 years, Stan has toured and recorded with artists including Georgia Lines, Kimbra, Black Comet, Miami Horror, Tonight Alive and more. He is also the force behind MasterMindDrummer.com, where thousands of drummers worldwide are elevating their technique, creativity, musicality, and mindset.

From viral drum content to a feature on Drumeo, from global masterclasses to major festival stages, Stan has become a leading voice in modern drumming. His clinics are an informative, no-fluff deep dive into leveling up both on and off the kit - covering his approach to chops, dynamics, creativity, and what it really takes to be a professional drummer in today’s world.

This is your chance to experience it live and up close. Don’t miss out!

Presented by Musicworks.

Supported by Yamaha Drums, Istanbul Agop Cymbals, SE Microphones, and Remo

description:
Star Time Live @ Meow, Star Time Live @ Meow
Wellington's own 10 piece Afrobeat Jazz powerhouse, Star Time, have been setting the city's dancefloors on fire since their debut at the WLG Jazz Festival in 2024. They have just come fresh out of the studio where they finalised their debut album, to be released later this year.

Star Time’s contagious on-stage energy and personality quirks tend to leave audience members stunned and begging for more, not to mention the urge to dance at their shows is stronger than life itself.

Rhythms hit like fireworks, locking hips and feet into motion whether you planned to move or not. Anyone who has been to a Star Time show can attest: the true stars of the night are undeniably the audience. The sheer levels of energy and uninhibited dance are nothing short of cinematic. The collective passion of the audience becomes an integral, unforgettable part of the band's Afrobeat Jazz experience.

Star Time is an all new emergence of fellow musicians from all around the country, linking with the experiences of fellow African musicians Francois Judah (lead vocals) and Modi Shemmi (percussion).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Stardew Valley: Symphony of Seasons [WELLINGTON], Join us on a musical journey from your first day in the valley all the way to your arrival to the summit, with the brand new Stardew Valley concert Symphony of Seasons!
Curated by ConcernedApe, Symphony of Seasons features a 35-piece orchestra performing the most memorable music from the game, and a screen above the stage playing gameplay footage plus original content created exclusively for this tour.
Concert-goers can look forward to hearing the game’s most cherished songs as they watch their farm grow throughout the seasons and explore some of the valley’s most memorable locations, from Pelican Town to the Skull Cavern, Ginger Island to Calico Desert, the Submarine to the Wizard’s Tower and much more.
Conducted by Sarah-Grace Williams, the shows will be performed by The Metropolitan Orchestra (Sydney, Brisbane, Wellington, Auckland), Christchurch Symphony Orchestra (Christchurch), Australian Pops Orchestra (Melbourne), Perth Symphony Orchestra (Perth) and Southern Cross Symphony (Adelaide).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Steph Casey @ Raumati Social Club, Excited to let you know I’ll be playing an all-originals show at the Raumati Social Club on Sat 30 August. I’ve written some songs for piano so I’ll have my keyboard with me, plus my looper for adding drums, harmonies and lead guitar - the full worksburger! Looking forward to playing my old and new songs for you
. It’s a small cosy venue so best to book a table (come for dinner - the food is delish) to secure a seat. Free entry - with a koha tin collection. x
Steph Casey’s debut album charted in the NZ top ten and she released her second album to glowing international reviews. Her songs are primarily indie-folk/americana in genre, with her most recent work embracing more grit and distorted guitar, as her sound evolves. Her songs have over half a million plays across platforms, and were licensed for the award-winning feature film ‘Poppy’.
She has featured on TV3’s The Cafe, in Next magazine, and on RNZ’s NZ Live.
“This second album by the acclaimed indie-folk singer Steph Casey confirms a strong and unique talent.”
– Graham Reid, NZ Herald

description:
Stewart Copeland — Have I said Too Much?, He’s had an incredible life as a performer, musician, entertainer, and writer. Stewart Copeland is one of the great rock drummers. He comes to Wellington for the first time in January with his show, ‘Have I Said Too Much?’ It features Stewart in conversation with acclaimed media host Sarah Tout (RTR FM). Fans also have the opportunity to ask questions by submitting them before the show. 
Stewart’s remarkable talent helped drive The Police to world fame between 1977 and 1986, and then again in 2007 and 2008 when the band was reunited. He is a multiple Grammy Award winner and, in 2003, was inducted into the Rock and Rock Hall of Fame. He has written best-selling books, directed documentaries, formed supergroups, made films, and composed music for ballet, opera, and classical concerts. This is a rare opportunity to get an insight into a performer’s fascinating life.
label: Music & Concerts

Auckland DJ Lady Fee and Wellington violinist Ana Henderson unite their talents through a shared love of hypnotic beats, soaring melodies, and emotive dancefloor experiences. Lady Fee’s meticulously mixed sets are complimented by Ana’s classically trained violin, adding a soulful, improvisational edge, shaped by influences from Balkan folk and gypsy jazz to Americana and swing.

description:
Super Position, Welcome to an unforgettable night of pulsating beats and mind-expanding rhythms at our exclusive Psytrance Party! This event promises to take you on a sonic journey through a diverse array of psytrance genres, carefully curated to showcase both the depth and variety of this vibrant scene. Local DJs will be taking the stage, each bringing their unique flavor and energy to create a seamless flow of hypnotic melodies, intricate basslines, and cosmic soundscapes that will keep your spirits lifted and your mind engaged.
We’ve teamed up with Void Acoustics, renowned for their powerful and crystal-clear sound systems from the UK, to ensure that every beat hits with maximum impact. Their state-of-the-art audio technology will immerse you in a rich, full-bodied sound experience that amplifies the intricate layers of the music and keeps the dance floor alive with energy. Whether you’re a seasoned psytrance enthusiast or new to the scene, the immersive sound will undoubtedly keep you on your toes, encouraging you to lose yourself in the rhythm and movement.
Adding to the visual feast, a talented lineup of local VJs will be performing abstract visuals designed to stimulate your eyes and ignite your imagination. Their mesmerizing visuals will synchronize perfectly with the music, creating a multidimensional experience that blurs the boundaries between sound and sight. Prepare to be transported into a vibrant, surreal realm where the music, visuals, and energy combine to craft an evening that promises to be both exhilarating and transformative.
