description:
TARN PK - LIVE AT MOON, ~ DON'T GET F.O.M.O ~
Tarn PK is bringing his new EP ’F.O.M.O’ to live audiences in Wellington on the 14th of September 6pm at MOON, with support from Sig Wilder & Friends and Josh Glennie.
With his newly formed 3 piece band, they’re stripping his sound down to the essentials; funky drum breaks, soaring synths and crunchy guitars, bringing a whole new dimension to the sound from the EP.
F.O.M.O, is a reflection on burnout, ambition, and identity in a digitally overwhelmed world. It draws inspiration from urban isolation and the weight of expectations. Tracks from the EP have landed on major Spotify and Apple playlists. Reflecting the office environment, familiar to many, this performance will bring to life the themes from the EP in a host of ways.
With over 2.2 million streams across platforms and 1.8 million on Spotify alone, his impact is growing. Releases have landed on global and regional editorial playlists. His EPs—Fantasy, Monarch, SugarCoated and now F.O.M.O —have consistently showcased his range and evolution as an artist.
Sig Wilder & Friends blend kiwi authenticity with American grit, bringing you a well-worn handwritten journal of lived experiences rendered through metaphor, poetic prose, and the stylistic conventions of folk, alt-country and late-night heartbreak radio.
Josh Glennie is a soulful singer/songwriter based in Wellington, New Zealand. He's made a name for himself playing in bands around Wellington and is now striking out with his own solo material. Together with Tarn, they have produced a new EP of songs that cut to the bone, focused around acoustic guitar and Josh's striking vocals. His New EP is expected late 2025/early 2026.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
TGIF: Blast from the past - Katrin Eickhorst (recorder), Corrina Connor (cello) and Michael Stewart, Katrin Eickhorst and Corrina Connor, both experienced baroque cellists, are challenging the perspective of the continuo assuming a servant’s role. This programme offers opportunity to “swap” parts, cello taking the upper part, recorder the bass line, both playing equal parts, and on their own. Michael Stewart joins with the missing harmonies, and an additional highlight on the harpsichord.
The programme culmination in Corelli’s “La Folia” gives a lively demonstration of equity between treble and bass parts.
Entry by koha

description:
TOI & Friends present: Kirikā (burning, feverish), TOI & Friends present: Kirikā (burning, feverish)
The dancefloor is set to light up this October when Wellington's finest soul/funk/roots collective TOI get together with some of their best buds to pay homage to Aotearoa’s criminally overlooked 1970s boogie scene.

The soul/funk/disco magic of the likes of Dalvanius, Mark Williams, Collision, Prince Tui Teka, The Yandall Sisters, 1860 and Tina Cross had a new light shone on it with the release of John
Baker and Alan Perrot’s 2017 compilation Heed the Call: Whakarongo Ngā Tamariki. Now the capital has a chance to celebrate the music live as TOI rediscover and reimagine these sonic taonga.

Comprised of a stellar lineup of Aotearoa’s leading musicians, for over a decade TOI have been bringing crowds together to groove all across New Zealand and Australia in both headline spots and as support for the likes of Red Hot Chili Peppers, Ocean Alley, Fat Freddy’s Drop and Tash Sultana. Don’t miss your chance to see them for this one-night-only exploration of one of Aotearoa’s most interesting and dynamic scenes.

Featuring the vocal stylings of Wellington’s own leading lady of soul Lisa Tomlins, TOI’s Conway Jeune (aka C-Way Green from Fat Freddy’s Drop) and another very special guest to be announced. TOI is Conway Jeune (Guitar, Lead Vocals), Bryn Van Vliet (Saxophone & BVs), Jules Blewman (Lead Guitar), Luther Hunt (Drums & BVs), Kaito Walley (Trombone & Percussion), Daniel Hayles (Keys & Synths) and Johnny Lawrence (Bass).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Terrace Dynamics: Pipes & Strings on the Terrace, Kemp English (organ/piano) with Yuka Eguchi (violin).
 
In 2024, renowned Kiwi organist Dr Kemp English gave concerts in the Auckland, Dunedin and Adelaide Town Halls. This year, it’s Wellington’s turn to host this virtuoso solo organist as Kemp comes to town to play the newly restored Croft organ at St. Andrew’s on the Terrace. Kemp is joined by Yuka Eguchi, violinist extraordinaire, who has been Assistant Concertmaster of the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra for the last ten years, combining her orchestral role with a busy chamber music schedule. Before making her home in New Zealand, she was Solo Concertmaster of the Japan Philharmonic Orchestra and Tokyo Mozart Players and a guest Concertmaster throughout Japan.
This concert will include a wide variety of musical treats such as well-known organ music by Bach, Lefébure-Wély and Sousa, music for violin and organ by Mons Takle & W.S Lloyd Weber, and even an early taste of Christmas with an arrangement of Sleigh Ride by Leroy Anderson!

The Wellington Organists Association is delighted to promote this event, which is sure to appeal to anybody with a love of music and an appreciation of fine musicianship, and we are grateful for sponsorship received from the Lion Foundation and The Pelorus Trust.

Admission is free – koha welcome to help offset costs.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Terry Shore, Terry Shore has been a real stalwart around the local Wellington music scene for over 30 years, playing his own original music both solo and with the Volun Terry Band.

He has 5 albums, 2 more on the way, and 3 EP's to his credit since releasing his first Poly Rhythm album in 2010. For the last 20 years he has run a programme on Wellington Access Radio showcasing unknown songwriters called Terry's Songwriters Show which airs on Saturdays at 2:30pm.

Terry has written memorable original catchy pop songs such as Anything, Dancing On The Line Island Love, Galactica Calling, The Daleks Are Coming In and many more.

He will be playing at the Undercurrent on Sunday 24th August from 5:30pm performing his originals with electric acoustic guitar and MP3 backing tracks. Stay on after the Sunday Jazz and see Terry for a good entertaining show!

Sunday 24th August
5:30pm
$15 online/ door
$20 for entry and CD

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

description:
Testpot presents - Friend of Friends, Wellington alternative indie rock trio Testpot present Friends of Friends. An afternoon-into-evening celebration of music, community, and connection. From afternoon grooves to electric evening highlights, this is more than just a gig; it’s a gathering, a celebration, and one we'd love you to join us for.
Pack a picnic, bring the whole family, bring your mates, bring drinks, bring a smile.

Friends of Friends is celebrating the connections that hold us together. Every band on the line-up is connected through friendships, side projects, and shared stages, making this a rare chance to see a community of musicians in one place.
So come meet some new friends, old friends, hang out with and get to know:
PLANET
BEANS AND DON
SAM R SAFFERY
BUFFALO BUFFALO BUFFALO
TESPOT
AGATHA PANTHA
KINGSTON HIGH ALL STARS

Experience all of these great bands in the beautiful and iconic setting of Breaker Bay Hall.
BYO friend, food and drinks.
Seatoun village is a stone's throw away, so just nip out, grab some cold ones and some fish and chips or something to bring back to the hall and enjoy.

Can't wait to see you there.

* * * * T E S T P O T * * F R I E N D S * *O F * *F R I E N D S * * * *

PLANET - A mix of traditional bagpipe airs with post punk riffs and a dollop of vaudevillian good humour. It could be world music, it could be underground indie rock. It could be psychedelic folk music. But it's always approachable and certainly a lot of fun.
https://planetband.nz

BEANS AND DON - A dynamic duo beautifully sculpting a path of folky ballads through love, loss, and much, much more.
https://www.facebook.com/people/Don-and-The-Divorcees/61552936937584/

SAM R SAFFERY - From rural New Zealand to the subways and bodegas of New York, Samuel R. Saffery’s musical journey is unquestionably linked to place and movement.
Blending indie folk, alternative rock, and classical influences, his songs are delivered with a distinctive, melodic voice, as haunting as it is sweet.
Instagram: www.instagram.com/slamsafari
Bandcamp: www.samuelsaffery.com
Twitter: @samuelsaffery

BUFFLAO BUFFLAO BUFFLAO - A seven-piece herd of instrument addicts play a mix of electronic and acoustic to produce pop-rock that is equal parts playful and whimsical. Catchy indie-pop licks, lush harmonies, and hooks that stick, the enigmatic, multi-faceted group Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo – so good they named the band three times.
https://www.instagram.com/buffalothree/

TESTPOT - Alternative indie rock trio colliding sonic inspirations from bands such as Radiohead, Animals as Leaders, and Duran Duran. A sonic commentary on social media, corruption, AI, surveillance, and the other goodies we’re all told we have to live with. A side project of Buffalo Buffalo Buffalo member Hayden Overton, joined by the talented Scott Roy and the percussive brilliance of Lachie Kendric, doing whatever it is we do.

AGATHGA PANTHA - Expect the unexpected from Wellington-based Agatha Pantha - a folk/rock four-piece whose sounds range from bouncing rhythms to dark, tangled ballads to anthemic rock numbers. The product of four unlikely allies joined by musical fortitude and lived experience, here to provide a therapeutic soundtrack to the everyday.
https://agathapantha.bandcamp.com

KINGSTON HIGH ALL STARS - The Kingston High All Stars are a Wellington-based band founded by 5 friends who are inspired by the brilliant, hypnotic and incredibly rhythmic music coming out of the Western Sahara. KHAS has since developed their signature style, blending desert blues, psych-rock, middle eastern classical, reggae and funk.

https://on.soundcloud.com/AbWAV1ZLdrs7cgOvf2
https://www.facebook.com/p/Kingston-High-All-Stars-100092946333859/
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Thabani Gapara at Wellington Jazz Festival, Award-nominated saxophonist and composer Thabani Gapara presents Dzindza — a powerful celebration of African jazz fusion.
Nominated for Best Jazz Album at the 2025 Aotearoa Music Awards, Dzindza showcases Gapara’s deep connection to his Southern African heritage, blending the sounds of Afrobeat, Highlife, Mbaqanga, and Mbira with influences from across the African diaspora, including Zouk, funk, and soul. This dynamic live show features a high-energy ensemble delivering rich musical storytelling, infectious grooves, and genre-defying improvisation. Dzindza is both a tribute to ancestral roots and a bold expression of contemporary African jazz
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Beatniks x IVY - NZ Tour 2025 - Wellington, The Beatniks x IVY - NZ Tour 2025 - Wellington
‘IVY’ and ‘The Beatniks’, two of the biggest independent artists coming out of Ōtepoti, are both known for their highly-captivating live performances. Melancholic in one instance, and packed full of noisy energy the next - now geared up with new material to showcase, the art-rock and surf-punk stylings of each of these young acts are tighter than ever.

‘IVY’ are held in the highest of regards when it comes to emerging kiwi artists. Nestling within the realm of dark and brooding tones, and immense, layered chorus, IVY know how to deliver a powerful and emotionally-resonant set; their sharp growth has quickly turned heads nationwide. From appearing on festival lineups such as Snow machine and OUSA Ori, playing with the Dunedin Youth Orchestra, and earning the SRN 2024 People’s Choice Award, IVY are ready to take their breathtaking art-rock performance around Aotearoa for the first time.

‘The Beatniks’ have been playing together since 2021, and have quickly become a ‘must-see’ live act within Aotearoa. After playing large-scale festivals last year, such as Rhythm & Alps, their recent release has delivered a more mature sound. Yet still soaked in their signature surf-grunge style. Having not toured the North Island since their debut album ‘Archetype’ in 2023, they’re ready to show you a whole new layer of alt-rock spirit on the stage.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Cattlestops, Celebrating twenty-one years of fine musicianship, this cowboy jazz country quartet are back on the road sharing their excellent songs and performance with and all.

With three CDs under their belt, of all original songs, and having performed on and contributed music for the NZ film ‘Secondhand Wedding’, featuring none other than the celebrated John Rowles, this band from the Kapiti Coast are performing the last in their latest mini cluster of great shows.

James Cameron on bass, Wayne Mason on keys, Evan Williams on drums and Andrew London on guitar will have you rocking and singing along to their stellar collection of songs.

RNZ NZ Live: The Cattlestops “Dance in the Rain”
www.youtube.com/watch?v=NdluyY8WHYs

To book: simply email bluegrass@xtra.co.nz
Include your name, phone contact and the number of tickets required
and you’ll be booked once you receive a reply to your email.

Come for dinner before the show!
Abandoned Taproom Petone have plenty of tasty treats, and grab a drink (or two) as well.

description:
The Cattlestops, The Cattlestops
Celebrating twenty-one years of fine musicianship, this cowboy jazz country quartet are back on the road sharing their excellent songs and performance with and all.

With three CDs under their belt, of all original songs, and having performed on and contributed music for the NZ film ‘Secondhand Wedding’, featuring none other than the celebrated John Rowles, this band from the Kapiti Coast are performing the last in their latest mini cluster of great shows.

James Cameron on bass, Wayne Mason on keys, Evan Williams on drums and Andrew London on guitar will have you rocking and singing along to their stellar collection of songs.

RNZ NZ Live: The Cattlestops “Dance in the Rain”


To book: simply email
Include your name, phone contact and the number of tickets required
and you’ll be booked once you receive a reply to your email.

Cinematic Light Orchestra - a seamless blend of lush, filmic melodies and rich harmonic textures, infused with the daring spontaneity of jazz improvisation. Drawing inspiration from cinematic scores and the heart of jazz tradition, the music is crafted to move you — emotionally, viscerally, powerfully.

A captivating and evocative set from one of Aotearoa’s leading jazz voices.

https://callumallardice.bandcamp.com/album/cinematic-light-orchestra

Part of the Wellington Jazz Festival 2025

The Country Superstar Experience Comes to Wellington!, The Country Superstar Experience Comes to Wellington!
Saddle up, Cowboys and Cowgirls! 🤠

￼
Dust off your cowboy boots and two-step your way to our ranch for a night of dancing under the stars to the biggest country anthems from the decades! ￼

description:
The Cowpokers + Tyson Smith, THE COWPOKERS: Foot-tappin' Onekaka Swamp Rock, World Famous in Golden Bay!
Golden Bay's finest local boys are rounding up and riding North to bring their unique brand of rock, blues and ska to the capital. What if swamp rock wasn't born in Louisiana, but in Takaka you ask? What if Iggy Pop and the Stooges had been Marlborough dairy farmers? What if Hendrix had settled in a Tukurua art gallery selling homemade jewellery crafted from shells and bone? The answer to all these questions and more can be found at a Cowpokers gig: a raw, barn-storming, rural-rock-and-roll sensation that 23 years of gigging has utterly failed to hone, polish, or refine.
TYSON SMITH: Wellington-based guitarist/singer/songwriter Tyson Smith will be bringing his unique, original music combining elements of rock, blues, folk, world music and freeform improvisation.
Tyson has worked as a guitarist with acts ranging from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra to vocalist Hollie Smith, before focusing on his own music in the last few years.
In 2024 he celebrated 10 years since the release of his album The Hollow Tree with Rick Cranson and Ed Zuccollo, and released his new single Wolves. Tyson has been performing regularly around various New Zealand venues and festivals with his raw and exciting sound both with the trio and solo (utilising multiple amps and a bass drum).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Dancing & Drinking Society, The Dancing & Drinking Society (or DADS for short), is New Zealand’s premier exponent of authentic 1920s Blues & Jass.

Their repertoire includes many of the Rags, Rambles, Shuffles, Drags, and Blues that our great-grandparents would have shimmied to in the juke joints, speakeasies, woolsheds and Memorial Halls of 1920s New Zealand.

Although this combo has a mere 4 members, it has the impact of a full Syncopating-Orchestra, with multiple instruments being played simultaneously by multiple band members.

Blair “Sweet-Lips” Latham - Clarinet, Bass Clarinet, Tenor Saxophone
Mat “Mon Colonel” Enright - Trumpet, Resonator Guitar, Vocals
Adrian “AJ” Jensen - Gypsy Guitar, Bass Drum
Daniel “Pappy” Yeabsley -Tuba, Hi-Hat.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Fab Four, It’s the uncanny, note-for-note renditions of classics that have earned them fans around the world. The Fab Four has been described by the LA Times as “The greatest Beatles show in the world”. The tribute act is making its way to The Opera House in Wellington in March 2026. The four singers stand out for their remarkable authenticity and attention to detail, bringing the essence of The Beatles to life in every show. 
The Emmy award-winning Fab Four will recreate many of the songs you love, like Can’t Buy Me Love, Yesterday, A Day In The Life, Twist And Shout, Here Comes The Sun, and Hey Jude. You’ll get to explore the early days of Beatlemania through to the later, more experimental phases of the band’s career. 
Witness a performance that perfectly captures the spirit of The Beatles. Their memorable music defined the rock genre.

The Fleetwood Mac Experience, Embark on a musical journey through the iconic era of Fleetwood Mac with “The Fleetwood Mac Experience”.
Immerse yourself in the timeless classics and chart-topping hits that defined a generation, as our talented Musicians faithfully recreate the magic and allure of Fleetwood Mac's unforgettable sound.
From the haunting melodies of Stevie Nicks to the soulful rhythms of Lindsey Buckingham, “The Fleetwood Mac Experience” captures the essence of one of the greatest bands in rock history.
Join us for a night of nostalgia, as we pay homage to the legendary Fleetwood Mac and invite you to experience the passion, the drama, and the extraordinary music that continues to resonate with fans around the world.

Get ready to relive the magic – because with "The Fleetwood Mac Experience" the spirit of Fleetwood Mac lives on.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Grogans - 'Stagger' Tour NZ 2025 | Wellington, Ready to take these new tracks on the road, The Grogans new album Stagger is out, plus the band are excited to announce a headline tour across New Zealand. Exploring another side of The Grogans' music, Stagger is a patchwork of different sounds and sonic inspirations that all come together in the one album, "it came from this idea that it was a jagged and stylistically different album track to track", explain The Grogans.
Kicking off their tour at Loons in Christchurch on Wednesday 3 September, the band then head to Yonder in Queenstown on Thursday 4 September, San Fran in Wellington on Friday 5 September before wrapping up at Double Whammy Auckland on Saturday 6 September. Prior to their Aotearoa dates, the trio will also be playing a seven date tour throughout Australia along with stops in LA and New York for North American shows this June.
Capturing the magnetic energy of their live shows, Stagger touches on themes of mental health, taking care of yourself and your loved ones, the occasional love song, and more. As the catchy chorus first single and album opener ‘Oh Boy’ leads into
sonic powerhouse of a tune ‘Come Up (Goes Down)’, ‘In My Heart’ slows it down to a new easy listening direction, followed by ‘Have a Little Dream’ - as dreamy as the title suggests - and the big open echoed instrumentation of ‘Once In A While’. Adding new textural effects in ‘Roll Back’ and last single ‘Roundabout’, ‘Happier Man’ dips into a heavier psych realm with a reminder that "striving to be a better and happier person should be a goal for everyone." ‘Worry About Everything’ is an upbeat tune sure to have you worrying about nothing, and feel good album closer ‘All My Days’ ends on a more serious note that outlines the beauty and the beast of live music and the personal struggles that come with the lifestyle and touring.
Tickets go on sale 12pm, Wednesday 28 May.
label: Music & Concerts

Playing a mix of standards and originals, you’ll hear the music of Ornette Coleman, Mark Lockett, Steve Grossman, and Isaac Randel.

This upcoming group is surely one of a kind that is not to be missed.

description:
The Kugels, Klezmer is European folk music born in Eastern and Central Europe and is currently enjoying a worldwide rebirth of interest and popularity. With passion and sensitivity, The Kugels play not only the wild and haunting tunes of traditional Klezmer, but also evocative original works by eminent NZ composer Ross Harris, and thrilling new works by band members Nick Tipping and Robin Perks.

With Nick Tipping, bass, Robin Perks, violin, Rebekah Greig, accordion and Debbie Rawson, clarinet/sax.


Feel free to bring a bag lunch to enjoy during the concert. Koha.

description:
The Lighthouse Trio at Inverlochy Art School, Join us as we explore some new interpretations of familiar melodies and unheard compositions! The trio will play original arrangements of favourite tunes as well as come brand new original songs. Expect mysterious ballads, soulful blues, and exhilarating bop.
The Lighthouse Trio is made up of three of Wellington's busiest players; Alex Trask, Jeremy Grant, and Elijah Mulheron. Alex is a highly regarded alto saxophonist who is seen all around town leading bands and playing for some of the leading musical organisations, including the RNZAF band and formerly the Rodger Fox Big Band. Elijah is the busiest bassist in town and often appears with Wellington legends such as Callum Allardice and John Rae. Jeremy is an extremely captivating guitarist and the creative force behind the arrangements you will hear.
The trio is celebrating the release of their debut EP with a tour of their own backyard, playing for the first time in Pito-one and Raumati, and finishing with a gig in central Wellington. Come along for an evening of fresh music presented in a relaxed setting, we hope to see you there!
Door sales available
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Martinis Play Chet Baker and Gerry Mulligan, The Martinis serve jazz up cool and refreshing. Smooth interweaving melodies and harmonies float on the breeze as you take in the sounds of tunes once performed by Chet Baker and Gerry Mulligan.
With a caramel baritone and golden trumpet, this will be a nice chill escape from the hustle and bustle. All tone and melody, with gentle counterpoint.
Featuring Daniel Yeabsley on baritone saxophone, Mat Enright on trumpet, Jack Harris on double bass and Jacob Randall on drums.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The New Zealand Swing Quartet, Join dynamic saxophonist and frontman Oscar Lavën and The New Zealand Swing Quartet as they blast out the joyous party music of the New Orleans French Quarter, made famous by Louis Armstrong and Jelly Roll Morton. You'll be dancing before you know it.
The lineup includes these seriously clever cats: Oscar Lavën (clarinet/sax/tomfoolery), Mat Enright (trumpet and vocals), Ayrton Foote (piano), Adrian Jensen (guitar), Dan Yeabsley (bass), and Jacob Randall (drums).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Nigel Patterson Quartet, The Nigel Patterson Quartet was formed in 2007 out of a love for jazz and a vision for composing and performing original jazz inspired compositions. The NPQ combines expert musicianship with passion and creativity.
Led by Nigel Patterson, one of New Zealand’s finest keyboardists/composers (The Black Seeds, Fly My Pretties) with support from Blair Latham (The Little Blast Orchestra, Jazz Robots) on tenor saxophone, Johnny Lawrence on bass and Peter Elliot on drums.
Inspired by such greats as Thelonious Monk, Duke Ellington, Mal Waldron, McCoy Tyner and many others, the NPQ creates a contemporary, sophisticated take on the jazz idiom.
From alternative metres through mood ballads and up-tempo swings, the NPQ seeks to bring through the edgier side of jazz while retaining the melodic and emotional character of the music.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Night Watch: LA NOTTE, The Night Watch presents LA NOTTE
Closing an exciting 2025 Season, LA NOTTE brings to Te Whanganui-ā-Tara a sultry, virtuosic evening of music from the Italian Baroque.
We are thrilled to welcome again guest soprano Carleen Ebbs in intoxicating works by Tarquinio Merula and Barbara Strozzi, and to spotlight our own Kamala Bain in Vivaldi's Recorder Concerto in G Minor 'La Notte'.
We're delighted to present guest violinist Anne Loeser (NZSO), who joins us as a soloist in Vivaldi's Violin Concerto in E Minor 'La Stravaganza' alongside our principal baroque violinist Miranda Hutton, and principal lute/theorbo/baroque guitar George Wills. We are joined again our principal keyboard player Rachael Griffiths-Hughes, viola da gamba Imogen Granwal, and welcome also guest percussionist Benjamin Whitton.
Continuing the theme of our 2025 Season, LA NOTTE explores different facets of the night through music that is, by turns, dream-like, sensual, and vibrantly rhythmic; featuring works by Barbara Strozzi, Isabella Leonarda, alongside many others,
Join us for a vivid, hot-blooded evening of music-making, featuring some of Aotearoa's finest specialists in early music.
THE NIGHT WATCH | co-directed by Luka Venter and Imogen Granwal
$30 - General Admission
$10 - Student Deal + Community Service Card holders
label: Music & Concerts

Come down for an epic night in the heart of Wellington with. The RVMES (pronounced The Rooms for the new). These lads are a high energy alt-rock band from Tāmaki Makaurau Auckland who are releasing their fourth album Boundary Issues and hitting the road for a 9-date tour around Aotearoa.

SUPPORT FROM!

An Auckland based alternative funk fusion up-and-comer. They lay down 70s funk grooves blended with hip-hop production and live showmanship that'll set your heart on fire ❤️‍🔥

Fortuna

Growing up in Germany with a vibrant family of musicians with Italian and African heritage. Fortuna's passion for music and dance was ignited from an early age 💃

Her adventurous spirit and love for experimentation have now driven her to promote her own events in Wellington. With her mesmerizing and melodic beats, Fortuna takes to the decks, captivating audiences with her hypnotic and uplifting sounds.

- http://for-tunes.com
- http://fortuna.for-tunes.com/

ROY (93silva)

Freshly returned to the Pōneke shores from his hometown-Taranaki, 93silva returns with a suitcase full of bouncy rhythms, groovy basslines, and infectious vocal dubs. With a sound that’s constantly evolving.
93silva is here to keep you guessing, keep you sweating, and most of all—keep you dancing.

Fortuna and 93silva will be performing together and we cannot wait to see what they come up with!

description:
The Racket Lounge: Evolve, Come along to the FINAL Racket Lounge concert for 2025 to hear some brand new music written by local composers and soak in the good vibes!
The Racket Lounge: Evolve
Wednesday 8 October, 6.30pm
Book now through the link above

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!
Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!
A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.
All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.
Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
Supported by Wellington City Council.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight, When you think of hard rock and metal, you might not naturally connect them to the refined sounds of classical music. The Rock Orchestra by Candlelight has done just that. After entertaining 700,000 people across the UK, USA and Europe, it’s coming to Wellington. 
Prepare for a spellbinding 90-minute spectacle infusing rock and metal anthems with beautiful orchestral energy. A band of 13 classical musicians will accompany the fiery tunes. Through a wall of distortion, you’ll witness the unexpected union of classical and metal music. 
In an ethereal candlelit setting, you’ll experience the music of famous bands. Hear Metallica, AC/DC, Rage Against the Machine, My Chemical Romance, Linkin' Park, SOAD, Guns N’ Roses, Evanescence, Aerosmith, The Cranberries, and more.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Rocky Horror Show, Dust off your corset, strap on your heels, and get ready to Time Warp like it’s 1973. After a 15-year hiatus, The Rocky Horror Show is back. The musical, written 50 years ago by New Zealand national treasure Richard O’Brien, stars a phenomenal West End cast. This high-energy stage spectacular features all the catchy songs you know and love: Sweet Transvestite, Dammit Janet, and the pelvic-thrusting, showstopper Time Warp. 
The show follows two squeaky-clean college kids, Brad and Janet. The couple find themselves stranded outside a mysterious mansion. Inside awaits the fabulous and flamboyant Dr Frank’n’Furter, and a wild adventure full of fun, frolics, frocks, and frivolity. 
The Rocky Horror Show is the longest continuously running contemporary musical in the world. It has thrilled over 35 million theatregoers, been staged in 30 countries, and translated into 20 languages. Get dressed up, let loose, and be your fabulous self at the biggest glitter-soaked party in town.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Saints '73-'78 | meowNUI, Wellington, The Saints ’73-’78 announce their New Zealand debut this spring, with concerts at The Powerstation in Auckland on 31 October and Meow Nui in Wellington on 1 November, before they head north to the UK and US.
24-hour presale begins 9am Tuesday 25th February at plus1.co.nz
Tickets are on general sale at plus1.co.nz from 9am Wednesday 26th February.
The band’s New Zealand shows follow their hugely successful Australian tour last year to crowds of 12,000 people across 12 shows.
The Saints ’73 -’78 carry on where the original band left off in 1978 performing the material from their three incendiary albums (I’m) Stranded (1977), Eternally Yours (1978) and Prehistoric Sounds (1978).
Featuring founding Saints members, guitarist Ed Kuepper and drummer Ivor Hay alongside honorary Saints; singer Mark Arm of Seattle rockers Mudhoney, former The Birthday Party / Bad Seeds guitarist Mick Harvey and bassist Peter Oxley of Australia’s legendary Sunnyboys.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Saints 73-78, The Saints ’73-’78 announce their New Zealand debut this spring, with concerts at The Powerstation in Auckland on 31 October and Meow Nui in Wellington on 1 November, before they head north to the UK and US.

Feel and Plus1 proudly present the band’s New Zealand tour which follows their hugely successful Australian tour in 2024 to crowds of 12,000 people across 12 shows.

Featuring founding Saints members, guitarist Ed Kuepper and drummer Ivor Hay alongside honorary Saints; singer Mark Arm of Seattle rockers Mudhoney, former The Birthday Party / Bad Seeds guitarist Mick Harvey and bassist Peter Oxley of Australia’s legendary Sunnyboys.

The Saints '73-'78 carry on where the original band left off in 1978 performing the material from their three incendiary albums (I’m) Stranded (1977), Eternally Yours (1978) and Prehistoric Sounds (1978).

“The Saints first three albums rank among the best records ever made. They have been a part of my life since stumbling upon them in the early 80s. Their influence looms large in Mudhoney world. I am stoked, stunned, and humbled that I get to joi in on this Rock ‘n’ Roll Reality Camp with Ed, Ivor, Peter and Mick!”– Mark Arm

The tour also comes off the back of arecent 4 LP box set of 1977’s ground breaking debut (I’m) Stranded which features the original album remastered forvinyl for the first time in over 40 years, the previously unreleased 1976 mix of the album, a 5-song live performance from April 1977 at Sydney’s Paddington Town Hall, a full live show from the London’s Hope and Anchor in November 1977 plus all recordings from the 1977 Top 40 charting This Perfect Day and 1-2-3-4 ep sessions.

“Rock music in the ’70s was changed by three bands—the Sex Pistols, the Ramones and the Saints” – Sir Bob Geldof.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Shake-'Ems | Rogue & Vagabond, From amidst the wreckage of our capitalist wasteland they rise, like a phoenix soaring through a bowl of molasses... The Wellington City Shake-em-on-Downers ARE BACK proving themselves to be the most resilient life form on the planet, giving even the cockroaches a run for their money. Middle New Zealand's favourite dadaist swing cult phenomenon are back with a vengeance, serving up a fiery primordial soup of fresh tunes for your listening and dancing 'pleasure'. Prepare for the stupidest gags, hottest horn solos, stonkiest grooves and pea-brained banter as we reign supreme in the battle of wits and people's attention against the existential crisis rectangle, otherwise know as the iPhone. Don't miss this exuberant show, or you may regret it for the rest of your miserable life.
----------------------------------------
Grab your tickets online from Under the Radar!
General Admission: $15 +BF ($20 on the door)
Students/Unwaged: $10 +BF ($15 on the door)
LIVE at The Rogue & Vagabond, Wellington - Saturday 23rd August.
----------------------------------------
Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/ShakeemonDown

Youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCCX29VHaEGi9ZxRZX20aQIQ

description:
The Temple / Jack Woodbury / Alter Natural, The Temple / Jack Woodbury / Alter Natural
On the heels of their sold-out Lōemis festival show ATOMS, The Temple returns to Pyramid Club with a writhing, distorted reimagining of the atomic sound world. Supported by solo sets from ambient/glitch sound wizard Jack Woodbury, and explorer-of-distant-noises Alter Natural sculpting a live set with his homemade suite of digital granular synthesis tools.

The Temple is a trio composed of producer Jack Woodbury, drummer/percussionist Nathan Carter (aka Alter Natural), and saxophonist Peter Liley, based in Pōneke. The Temple's broad palette of influences reaches into minimalism, electronica, ambient, funk, doom metal, new age, sound art, and jungle, creating a beguiling, kaleidoscopic sound. Their shows explore vast musical territories, and every performance is a ritual devoted to the present moment.

---

Jack Woodbury is a Wellington-based composer and audio engineer. His compositional work focuses on juxtaposing noise and glitch textures against ambient materials. His work has been presented in the UK, USA, Australia and New Zealand.

---

Alter Natural is a New Zealand-based musician, composer/producer of electronic music, and multi-media sonic artist. As a music composer/producer, much of my work takes inspiration from visual art and real-world subject matter, driven by my deep passion to express beauty and philosophical sublimity through sound.

---

Peter Liley is a saxophonist (alto/bass) exploring the far reaches of technique on the instrument, known for unflinching brutalist soundscapes and endless rippling sequences, achieved using circular breathing.


https://templenz.bandcamp.com/album/vastness-vastness

$20 presales via UTR

Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Undercurrent All-Stars, The best and brightest of Undercurrent’s resident musicians are coming together again for their first ever evening show!

They will play two sets of the finest tunes from the All-Stars repertoire, including many previously unheard numbers. Brand new arrangements of favourite standards will awe and entertain you! Thrilling solos will soar over lush horn lines and fascinating rhythms. Relax in the comfortable atmosphere of the Undercurrent, grab a drink as you listen, and enjoy some exciting music.

Personnel:
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Blair Latham - Tenor sax, Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Lockie Bennett – guitar
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums

Wednesday September 10th
Doors 7pm/ Gig 7:30pm
$20 on the door & online

Complimentary snacks, wine, beer & soft drinks, tea & coffee, and of course...books available for purchase!

The Wellington City Shake-'Em-On-Downers | WJF '25 Brunch Edition, The Wellington City Shake 'Em On Downers, Aotearoa's very own cult-favourite dadaist New Orleans style party band, are back with yet another unmissable brunch show at this year's Wellington Jazz Festival.
In addition to their fiercely joyful signature sound, the Shake Ems are delighted to feature vocalist Ella Dunbar-Wilcox, freshly returned from Los Angeles USA, for what promises to be the wildest brunch gig yet.
Witness the carnage. Half time oranges. Full chicken dinners for the band during the gig. How good.

description:
The Wellington Mingus Ensemble, The Wellington Mingus Ensemble is a unique and powerful all-star jazz orchestra dedicated to paying tribute to the music of Charles Mingus, one of the most notable composers of the 20th century and a revered icon of Black American Music, blues, improvisation, and art.
Disarmingly charismatic melodies meet dense impressionistic orchestration and deep raging blues language in a tribute to some of the most stunning music of the last century.
Put on by Capital Blues NZ, located in the jazz basement bar at Jack Hacketts.
Tickets $20:
label: Music & Concerts

description:
The Wooden Box Band Play The Shed, The Wooden Box Band Play The Shed
The Wooden Box Band are known as Wellington's folk darlings. This six piece outfit has been writing and playing music around Wellington and beyond since the 2000s and has just released their latest album, Broken River.
The album grew out of a time of loss and confronting circumstances faced by band members, society as a whole, and the natural environment over the past few years. Personal experiences are made universal with beautiful harmonies and soaring guitars and trumpet.
Think electric energetic folk with an eclectic touch, fine melodies, engaging choruses you'll want to sing along to and quite a few smiles along the way.
Doors open 7pm for a 7.30pm start.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

description:
The Wooden Box Band at Greytown Upclose and Personal, The Wooden Box Band in concert 4pm 19 October in Cobblestones Museum new gallery.
The Wooden Box Band has some of Wellington’s best known musicians getting together and having fun playing the kind of music they love.


Songster Jessie Moss came from Jessie James and the Outlaws which was a staple of the Newtown scene a few years back. Newtown Rocksteady musician Jeremy Desmond has been in the Wooden Box band for many years bringing an array of guitar tones on his bright red Gibson 335 and effects pedals. On bass is the busiest bassist in town, Murray Costello, who cut his musical teeth in the Mockers during the eighties and has been playing hard ever since.

He plays an electric upright to bring bottom end to the urban folk sound. Together with Jessie Moss the other main songwriter in the band is local luthier Paddy Burgin, who’ s also busy with the Zimmermans and other acoustic and electric groups around the capital. He features on acoustic guitar, slide guitar and keyboards. The front row of singers is completed with Emily Clemmett who also brings her trumpet and fiddle to the party, and together with Jessie and Paddy these three produce thrilling harmonies reminiscent of the Mamas and the Papas.

On drums we have Search for Yeti man Sean Barker who keeps a very lively beat going behind the rest of the musicians. He’s also on quips and humour.
Their music has a sixties vibe with the tones and harmonies. They believe in adventurous tuneful songs with universal themes that people can relate to. And they perform them in a very engaging manner. Expect to be toe- tapping and even singing along!
The Wooden Box Band’s latest album, Broken River, was released over the winter. You can find them on Spotify for a preview.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Them Sundries LIVE - Abandoned Brewery Petone, Them Sundries LIVE - Abandoned Brewery Petone
Fresh. Bouncy. Boogieable. Them Sundries are laying claim to Abandoned Brewery in Petone...FOR FREE!!

Come along and soak up the vibes, have some drinks, some kai and a cheeky dance.

Creators of a hard slog of sounds; from fuzzy funk, synthy soul, to rambunctious rock - Them Sundries channel influence from Daptone Records, College of Knowledge, and Colemine Records, collectively expressing their love of jams and collaborations for a solid hit on the dance floor.

See you there xox
label: Music & Concerts

description:
This Silent Divide EP Release Show With Kaletta and Adult Friends, Wellington rock band This Silent Divide celebrate the release of their new EP with a show at Moon in Newtown with locals Kaletta and Adult Friends in support.

This Silent Divide mix driving drums, wall-of-sound guitars and melodic overtones to create catchy, high-energy songs. The band released their single City Lights in July, with Loud Enough? Magazine labelling it a lively piece of modern rock with a twist of punk attitude. A gritty, energetic music video accompanied the release of City Lights, filmed in Wellington's Eastern Suburbs and featuring fellow musicians and fans.

Following time in the studio in early 2025, again working with local producer Toby Lloyd at Tiny Triumph Recordings, the band has played a range of live shows. Upcoming single 'Rockets' is out in September, ahead of the release of their new 4-song EP in October.

In 2024 the band released single 'In This World' which Flash-Trax labelled “an absolute belter of a track” and 2023 singles 'Outside', 'Beautiful Creature' and 'Morning', received positive reviews and radio play in New Zealand, the US & UK, taking the band's music to a wider audience.
Check out the City Lights music video on YouTube, and the band's music on your favourite music streaming platform.

Kaletta
Kaletta is a high-energy band that blends Latin rhythms with punk rock and ska influences, creating a unique sound that's infectious and danceable.
Kaletta's been making waves on the live scene playing the Island Bay Festival, embarking on a tour of the top of the South, and reaching the national finals of the Battle of the Bands competition twice. The band is currently working on new material and a music video.The band's momentum is building and they're grateful for the support of their fans and the music community.

Adult Friends
Adult Friends are a Wellington-based guitar-centric, post-punk/post rock act, inspired by bands like At The Drive In, Failure, and The Cure. 2025 has seen the band release their album Find Me In The Inferno, along with a music video for single 'Greyhounds'. Regulars on the local scene, the band recently supported Toronto punks Pup at their Wellington show.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Threads of Harmony: An Evening With Vocal FX and Friends, Vocal FX is a group spanning over 20 years of growth, success, and change. This concert is inspired by the themes of the 2025 National Barbershop Convention He Awa Whiria, weaving the braids of connection within our barbershop community like a river braid.
Throughout its history, Vocal FX has sewn threads of connection far and wide; we plan to highlight some of these relationships across the evening, while acknowledging the changes we are making to who we are, from within.
This concert will feature songs acknowledging the past, recognising new beginnings, and looking into the future, with who we strive to become.
Thank you to everyone new and old on this journey with us, we are looking forward to performing with, and for, all of you.
label: Music & Concerts

Thunder Road Opening - NZ's Newest Honky Tonk, Dust off your cowboy boots, New Zealand… the wait is almost over
We’re cranking the Thunder Road playlist on repeat and putting the finishing touches on Wellington’s newest honky tonk bar. Expect cold beer, crispy fried chicken, and the best country + rock soundtrack in town.

3:00pm
21 Blair Street, Wellington

description:
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn, Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.

Doors at 7
Music at 7.30

The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at

-----------------

Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.

Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.

-----------------

Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.

Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.

Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.

-----------------

Vogelmorn Upstairs is not a wheelchair accessible building. There is an accessible bathroom in the space. This is an all ages venue but those under the age of 16 must be accompanied by a designated adult after 8pm. The Vogelmorn Precinct is a community space located in a residential area. With that in mind, the team ask that you be kind to others' and that when you leave the gig, you do so quietly to avoid disturbing our neighbours.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Tommy Emmanuel CGP — Living In The Light Tour, He’s a world-renowned guitarist and master entertainer. Tommy Emmanuel, CGP, is bringing his beloved Maton guitar to The Opera House stage in Wellington. He is considered a living legend in the acoustic guitar world. The Australian musical legend has enthralled audiences around the globe with his dazzling technique. The concert promises to be an inspiring journey as Tommy strums and plucks his way through jazz, rock, country and pop music. Fans will be captivated by the diverse musical landscape he creates. 
Since his career began in the 1960s, Tommy has toured with luminaries like Eric Clapton and John Denver. He has won a Grammy Award and performed for a televised audience of more than two billion at the 2000 Sydney Olympics. Collaborations include guitar greats like Les Paul, Mark Knopfler, Joe Walsh, and Richard Thompson. 
Tommy’s hero, legendary guitarist Chet Atkins, bestowed the title of Certified Guitar Player (CGP) on him. He is one of only four players in the world with the title. Tommy Emmanuel CGP continues to push the boundaries of what is possible on the acoustic guitar.
label: Music & Concerts

Brought to you by freestyler extraordinaire Tommy Midnight, anticipate a night that begins with heartfelt songwriting to wash away your winter woes, transitioning through to high energy conscious hiphop, soul and Raumati groove complete with horns, in his full band the Midnight Sun.

description:
Tony Lindsay (USA) with Stirling Hern, Tony Lindsay is a GRAMMY award-winning vocalist and was the lead singer for Carlos Santana. He performed with Santana during their most successful period, from 1995 to 2015, including singing on the 30m-seller, Supernatural.
Lindsay has also performed with many other world-leading acts including Steve Winwood, Al Jarreau, and Aretha Franklin.
“We know and we revere Donny Hathaway, Stevie Wonder and Ray Charles. Tony Lindsay is on par with all three of those,” says GRAMMY-winning producer Narada Michael Walden.
Local Wellington favourites Stirling Hern, provide the backing, featuring Michael Stirling (guitar and vocals), Geoffrey Hern (bass and vocals), Deane Hunter (guitar), and Andrew Richardson (drums) with special guests Andre Paris (saxophone), and Damian Forlong (trombone).
This is a one-off chance to get up close to a world-class vocalist, and multi-million selling artist.
Do not miss this one.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Topless Picking Flowers Release Tour // WELLINGTON, Sophie Songbird makes her solo debut this spring, stepping into the spotlight with a voice and vision all her own. Known for her work with the beloved band Dr. Reknaw, Sophie now unveils a fresh chapter — touring in celebration of her first solo release and sharing a collection of unreleased, vintage-inspired originals that blend nostalgic charm with a modern twist.
Drawing from the rich traditions of jazz, blues, and country — with a touch of psychedelic flair — Sophie’s songwriting is both timeless and distinctly her own. Her stories are laced with wit, warmth, and a hint of mischief, offering a refreshing take on classic genres.
Her debut single, “Topless Picking Flowers” — set for release on September 19th — is a dreamy fusion of classic country and smooth Hawaiian tones. On stage, Sophie captivates with exceptional rhythm guitar work and a honey-toned voice that soars effortlessly.
with support from ABBEY EVE AND FRANCES GRASS
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Transvision Vamp tickets, Presented by: PLUS1
British rock band Transvision Vamp are bringing their 80’s smash hits down under for the first time in three decades next February!
Says charismatic singer Wendy James: “I am so very excited to be coming back to New Zealand to play the songs which started my whole musical journey! I remember vividly so many incredible moments gigging in New Zealand , moments of enormous success, enormous love and enormous fun.”
The band enjoyed 5 Top 40 singles in NZ, including worldwide smash hits I Want Your Love, Baby I Don’t Care, and The Only One.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin, Traskforce! ft. Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin
Two of Wellington’s most enthralling vocalists perform with a powerhouse octet in a celebration of the sublime songs of the jazz repertoire.

Tickets here!
https://www.undertheradar.co.nz/gig/98187/Traskforce!-Ft.-Wallace-Gollan-And-Eugene-Wolfin.utr

Starring Wallace Gollan and Eugene Wolfin on vocals, the octet will present a fizzing set of big band swing, Broadway hits, and gorgeous ballads. Hear the fine lyricism of the 20th century sung by two of Wellington’s most exciting performers.

Exhilarating original compositions and arrangements will tug at your feelings in new and compelling ways. Daring solos from some of the finest musicians in the country will awe and shock you as the turbulent horns sing out.

Witness the union of big band attitude and chamber music intimacy as this very special band play their hearts out to you.


The performers:

Consistently connecting the dots between genres and influences, Wallace Gollan’s artistic identity has become uniquely recognizable, with her jazz training and distinct harmonies captivating audiences around the globe.

For the last 8 years vocalist Eugene Wolfin has been a regular of Wellington music scene performing in a wide variety of genres including Jazz, Blues, and Rock ’n’ Roll. He has had a hand in a few local Musical Theatre productions performing lead roles in ‘Chess’ and the modern hit ‘If/Then', and is a regular in front of Jazz Orchestras including the Royal New Zealand Air Force Band and the Rodger Fox Big Band.

Traskforce! is bandleader Alex Trask’s most swinging musical organisation. They play fresh arrangements of original compositions, classic swing, and Broadway love songs. This includes songs from the Basie repertoire, Bob Mintzer, Oliver Nelson, Quincey Jones, and Lionel Bart's Oliver! to name a few. The five horn arrangements allow for the power of a big band and the subtlety of a quartet to shine side by side. The band is made up of Wellington’s top players, including members of the Rodger Rox Big Band, the RNZAF band, NZSM faculty, and rising stars.


Door sales $20, Pre-sales $15, Student/Concession $10


Personnel:

Wallace Gollan – vocals
Eugene Wolfin – vocals
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Oscar Laven – tenor saxophone
Kaito Walley – trombone
Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass
John Rae – drums
label: Music & Concerts

This includes songs from the Basie repertoire, Bob Mintzer, Oliver Nelson, Quincey Jones, and Lionel Bart's Oliver! to name a few. The five horn arrangements allow for the power of a big band and the subtlety of a quartet to shine side by side. The band is made up of Wellington’s top players, including members of the Rodger Rox Big Band, the RNZAF band, NZSM faculty, and rising stars.

Door sales $20, Pre-sales $15, Student/Concession $10

Personnel:
Wallace Gollan – vocals
Eugene Wolfin – vocals
Alex Trask – alto saxophone, arrangements
Mike Taylor – trumpet
Oscar Laven – tenor saxophone
Kaito Walley – trombone
Daniel Yeabsley – baritone saxophone
Duncan Haynes – piano
Elijah Mulheron – bass

description:
Twisted Frequency - Techno Taster, This year for the first of our annual pre-parties we’ve gone around the country to gather a lineup of creators working at the intersections of techno, delving into influences from bass, breaks, psychedelia, club music and beyond, all underpinned by elements of dance music's most enduring genre.
We believe each one of these acts is currently pushing the needle forward for underground club culture in Aotearoa, and are thrilled to host them all together at Valhalla to push their vision across the almighty Third Eye Hi-Fi soundsystem.

ELI HØFF — Abyssal Soundworks / PHTM
Producer and DJ, Eli is undoubtedly at the forefront of Aotearoa’s underground dance scene.
Those who have kept their ears tuned to the innovative underground have no doubt stumbled upon the tribalistic, psychedelic, and focused sounds emanating from the mind of Auckland-based producer Eli Høff. With a string of releases on Berlin-based PHTM, Tāmaki Makaurau-based Gypnotica, and an impressive catalog of self-releases, he consistently showcases his singular and original interpretation of dance music.
Instagram.com/e.li
elihoff.bandcamp.com
abyssalsoundworks.bandcamp.com

HUNTER — Hang the Saints / Haven
Raised in Kaikōura, Aotearoa, Hunter's dark and atmospheric sound often contrasts the beautiful environment she grew up in. Her direct approach to techno draws influence from heavy percussion, bold rhythm and industrial soundscapes. After spending two years finding inspiration in clubs overseas, she has returned to Ōtautahi with a refined style that’s ready to make people dance. As the co-founder of “Hang The Saints” and resident of “Haven”, Hunter is all about creating safe, inclusive spaces for people to connect through the music she loves.
https://www.instagram.com/sspoonsnake/
https://soundcloud.com/hunter-mccrory-334790608
https://on.soundcloud.com/bC3qeA6pUxBoMo7P9

LUDUS & RIZZO — Tonic Collective
Tonic Collective is the recent endeavour of Ludus and Rizzo, inspired by the people, places and spaces of their experience touring China with BIRDPARTY and Vera Ellen. Both acts are individually known for their versatile and innovative sound, bringing a wide range of influences and inspirations to the dancefloor. In the short time since establishing the collective, they’ve already hosted Kaishandao and Bone Chapel, established a space, and debuted a monthly radio show on Mouthfull that explores sound from across the genre spectrum, both in the club and out.
https://www.instagram.com/ludus.etc/
https://www.instagram.com/alicerizzoofficial
https://www.instagram.com/tonic.collective/
https://soundcloud.com/l-s.../416life-support-cl1n1c-chengdu
https://soundcloud.com/racquetclub-info/mix-series-016-ludus

SHLI — Echo Train Records / Warehouse Rave / Holding Hands
Shli is the alias of Ōtautahi-via-Pōneke DJ and Producer Tim Ward. Steadily releasing works over recent years through local labels like Echo Train and the Big Fresh Collective, he is carving out a sound of his own.
Stitching together infectious rhythms layered over low-end pressure, Shli’s sets draw influence from across the hardcore continuum and beyond. Creating dancefloor moments from trippy rhythmic states to unleashing sheer bass weight.
https://www.instagram.com/____shli/
https://echotrainer.bandcamp.com/.../ech009-bracing-set...

We’ll journey through the music of eight classic Ghibli films, performing inventive arrangements of their iconic main themes intertwined with other musical moments from throughout each soundtrack. 

The soundtracks have been reimagined in a jazz context while staying true to the original cinematic sound, so the music will have something new for seasoned Ghibli fans and newcomers alike.

description:
VEGYN (DJ SET) | WELLINGTON | MEOW, Sprawling with obtuse bass lines, sharp digital peaks and asymmetrical drum machines, Vegyn’s music doesn’t walk a straight line so much as trip over itself beautifully.
The London-born producer, artist, DJ and label head returns to Australia and New Zealand this October for a rare run of headline shows, supported by NYC producer amr*.
Across everything he touches - from surreal club sets to production work for Travis Scott, JPEGMafia and Frank Ocean - Joseph Thornalley makes music that’s hard to pin down and harder to forget. His productions are jagged and abstract, built from negative space, ambient haze and rhythms that never quite resolve. There’s hip hop in the DNA, but it never plays by the rules, always veering towards something stranger, softer, rawer.
Through his label PLZ Make It Ruins, Vegyn has built an entire world. His 2019 debut Only Diamonds Cut Diamonds felt like a manifesto; the 71-track Text While Driving If You Want To Meet God! followed as a chaotic, genre-agnostic statement of intent. Since then, he’s ventured further leftfield, releasing The Head Hurts but the Heart Knows the Truth under the alias Headache, followed by the 2024 masterpiece The Road to Hell Is Paved with Good Intention, and the unexpected arrival of Blue Moon Safari - an output that feels made more for himself than for any audience. Dreamlike, disjointed and deeply personal.
As a DJ, Vegyn shifts between industrial breaks, ambient drift and warped club memories. This October, he returns to Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, Wellington and Auckland - a rare chance to slip through the cracks and step inside his world.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Vorn and his Prog Consort / Thagomizer, Wellington legend Vorn Colgan has been writing and releasing extraordinary and odd popular music from bedrooms across Aotearoa and the world since 1999, a career which was scheduled to be cut short in 2019 by a terminal cancer diagnosis. 2023 saw him release his surprisingly non-posthumous hit The Late Album, and given his demonstrated inability to die he was left with maybe the world's most wonderful problem: what to record for his 10th album?
The answer is The Aeronaut, a 60ish minute meditation on Wellington, the universe, and everything, hewn from purest regionally-sourced prog rock and presented in a single baffling and hopefully pleasant serving. The Aeronaut is currently still a work in progress; this evening offers keen punters a chance to watch Vorn and his frighteningly good band (Nick Brown - Drums; Charley Davenport - Bass, Thomas Liggett - Violin) iron out the final kinks on a future Kiwi classic. Be there so you can say you were!
https://vornpowertool.bandcamp.com/
Thagomizer is the dino synth project (dinosaur themed dungeon synth) of Caspar Kneale (yes, he is related, in fact mr Birchville Cat Motel is Caspar's Dad). Inspired by the vibe of retro dinosaur media, Thagomizer aims to summon a Mesozoic mood to transport you back in time. As far as we know, Thagomizer is the only dino synth project in the country.

$17.50 presales available via UTR
Special thanks to CNZ for supporting Pyramid Club's programme

description:
WJC presents The Louisa Williamson Quintet, Louisa Williamson presents music from her latest album, Groundwork, plus more recent compositions.
Louisa Williamson is a saxophonist, flutist, composer and arranger based in Wellington. Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other. Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo. In 2016 Louisa was the first New Zealander to successfully audition for the JMI Jazz World Orchestra (consisting of the best young jazz musicians from around the world, aged 18-25), touring Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Slovenia and Croatia.
Featuring: Louisa Williamson 9saxophone), Callum Allardice (guitar), Daniel Hayles (piano), Johnny Lawrence (bass), Max Sheehan (drums).
label: Music & Concerts

description:
WJF - Andrew Faleatua Trio, The Wellington Jazz Cooperative opens its Wellington Jazz Festival Popup club with the Andrew Faleatua Trio. Featuring: Andrew Faleatua (piano, fahūfagu), Seth Boy (double bass), and Isitolo Alesana, who plays both ukulele and traditional Samoan percussion instruments.

Andrews' ensemble will present a series of original compositions developed during his time as the 2024 Jazz Composer-in-Residence at Te Herenga Waka—Victoria University of Wellington. These works reflect a compositional approach shaped by both the harmonic and improvisational sensibilities of contemporary jazz pianists such as Brad Mehldau, Robert Glasper, and Aaron Parks, and the rhythmic, melodic, and resonant qualities of indigenous Samoan music, drawn from my own cultural heritage. This synthesis seeks to articulate a distinctly Pasifika jazz sound. This performance marks the live debut of the full suite of compositions, which have been recorded and are set to be released later this year.

description:
Wahine In Jazz X The Listening Collective Collaborative Jam, Rooted in the values of connection, care, creativity and community, Wāhine in Jazz (AKL) and The Listening Collective (WLG) are two kaupapa-driven initiatives, aimed to uplift women and gender diversity in improvised musical spaces across Aotearoa. They invite you to join, improvise and collaborate this Wellington Jazz Festival.
The jam will weave influences from Wellington-based saxophonist, composer and educator, Dave Wilson’s model for improvisation; Finding Common Ground - fostering environments for musicians of all abilities to come together and improvise. Let this session invite you to a space where improvisation becomes a language of belonging.
Wāhine in Jazz is a Tāmaki Makaurau based organisation that advocates for and promotes the development of female and gender diverse jazz musicians in Aotearoa.
The Listening Collective is a Te-Whanganui-a-Tara based group of female and gender diverse musicians that aim to create spaces that uplift and empower individuals in the presentation of their creative work
Check out WIJ x TLC New Standards Collaboration:
https://events.humanitix.com/wahine-in-jazz-x-the-listening-collective-present-new-standards

description:
Waterfront concert with Orongorongo Rovers, Hello Wellington!

We’re the Orongorongo Rover Crew, your local Rover Scout group, and we’ve got something special lined up for you.
Date: Monday, 13 October
Time: 7:00 pm – 9:00 pm
Location: Opposite Frank Kitts Park on the Wellington Waterfront
We’ll be putting on a small concert as we pick up the recorder again. many of us haven’t played them since primary school, and we want to share our music (and nerves!) with the community. It’s a chance for us to push ourselves, grow musically, and connect through performance.
We’d love for you to come and support us. Bring your friends, your curiosity, your ears. Let’s fill the waterfront with sound together, cheer each other on, and enjoy a pleasant evening by the harbour.
See you there!
— Orongorongo Rover Crew

James Cameron on bass, Wayne Mason on keys, Evan Williams on drums and Andrew London on guitar will have you rocking and singing along to their stellar collection of songs.

description:
Wendyhouse / DSLB / vegetable.machine.animal, Wendyhouse are Bryce Galloway and Daniel Powell (AKA Mr Pudding and EE monk). The pair met at the Elam School of Fine Arts. Wendyhouse got their name from debut performances at Art Space (Tāmaki Makaurau) where they sang songs set in the year 2032 from inside a Wendy house (Soundwatch ’92). A prolific creative period followed before EE monk relocated to Europe in 1995. Wendyhouse output has been somewhat sporadic ever since, but with EE monk’s recent return, the pair have returned to performing live.
Wendyhouse music was initially played on toy musical instruments, the kind that fit inside a Wendy house. Real instruments were added as the band moved out of the house and onto the stage.
The music is best described as lo fi inverted pop music, with lyrics about unlikely topics. For example, the two newest songs in the Wendyhouse are an existential treatise on real estate and a love/hate ode to Futurist Luigi Russolo. Guitar, toy keyboard and vocals are the Wendyhouse instruments of choice.
---

DSLB
DSLB is the solo project of Chrissie Butler (the shouty bass playing half of the now sleeping duo, mr sterile Assembly). An offshoot from Chrissie's other band Ditzy Squall, DSLB (Ditzy Squall's Lunch Box) is a showcase for a love of long endings and the hum things make when you hold them close to your ear. Performed live, DSLB is an improvised mash-up of ancient record players, purring keyboards, kitchen utensils and found objects. Soundtracks for short films and hand drawn comics are also residents in the lunch box. Recordings are released by skirted Records.
https://skirtedrecords.com/dslb/
---
vegetable.machine.animal
New solo project courtesy of Mr Sterile, in which living fungal and plantlife inform a modular synthesiser with biofeedback. This signal acts upon the synth changing the pitch, tone, rate and more in the delivery of sound. These ‘curated’ sounds are then responded to with percussion. VMA explores the intersections between spontaneous playing, electronic music, and science-informed inter-species collaboration.
https://mrsterileassembly.bandcamp.com/.../my-daughter...
label: Music & Concerts

description:
What About Us?, Dive into the deep end of rhythm and harmony as we tackle the sprawling, genre-bending catalog from the critically acclaimed Grammy Award winning band, Snarky Puppy.

Our ensemble What About Us? will deliver a faithful, fiery and original tribute to the living legends. We'll be navigating their labyrinthine compositions with precision and passion.

Come experience the high octane solos and grooves from tunes such as Shofukan, Bad Kids to the Back, Bet and many more, performed with energetic ferocity and precision.

This won't be a gig you want to miss so mark the date and get your dancing shoes on and make your way to Rogue and Vagabond.

The band is comprised of Sylvester Green and Kaia Johnstone on Trumpet, Cameron Boyle and Josh Schonberger on Alto and Tenor Saxophone, Tim Honis on Keys, Aslan Rowlands on Guitar, Robert Henderson on Bass Ranu Wijesuriya on Percussion and Cameron Brizzle on Drums

Fans can also expect requests from across their three-decade career, a cherished tradition at Wheatus headline shows for almost 20 years. It’s a joy to behold. See for yourself.

World Tandem Ensemble, Some of the best and brightest composers and players of Aotearoa converge for a swinging sound: from anger to solemnity, free to bop… From the heart.
After a stint in Auckland, Wellington is returning this group the favour with a hip gig at Hackett's. Not a gig to be missed!
The World Tandem Ensemble includes Iggy Nama Ruci (alto/bari sax, flute), Isaac Randel (tenor sax), Miro Holland (rhythm section), Jack Harris (double bass), Finn McNeil (drums), and Ryan Tomov (piano/bass). description:
Wunderhorse with Dropper | Meow Nui, Wellington - FINAL TICKETS, Wunderhorse with Dropper | Meow Nui, Wellington - FINAL TICKETS
UPGRADED DUE TO OVERWHELMING DEMAND! TICKETS ON SALE NOW ⚡️

TICKETS: https://bit.ly/wh25_tktnz

Handsome Tours are pleased to present Wunderhorse in Wellington with support from Dropper!

Wunderhorse are Jacob Slater, Harry Fowler, Peter Woodin & Jamie Staples. 2022 saw the release of their debut album Cub, a collection of songs which found fans in Zane Lowe, NME, and BBC Radio 1, and took the band on tour with the likes of Fontaines D.C., Pixies, Sam Fender, and Foals, whilst also selling out their own headline slots along the way. Midas is out now.

Adopting an organic, unpolished recording process, Midas captures the visceral atmosphere of Wunderhorse’s raucous live performances. “We wanted it to sound like your face is pressed up against the amp,” frontman Jacob Slater told The Guardian. “No frills, no polish – just pure, uncut rock’n’roll.”

Indeed, the album’s rugged hooks, unfiltered noise, and fierce melodic sensitivity set Wunderhorse up for a year that will see them firmly established as an endlessly addictive and rousing generational talent.

Existing ticket holders for previously announced Sydney and Wellington dates will be contacted directly with ticketing details.

description:
Wāhine In Jazz X The Listening Collective Present New Standards, Celebrate the New Standards of tomorrow with the vibrant force of Wāhine in Jazz (AKL) and The Listening Collective (WLG) joining forces to showcase female and gender minority musicians that are shaping the sound of jazz in Aotearoa.
Taking inspiration from Terri Lyne Carrington’s New Standards: 101 Lead Sheets by Women Composers, this showcase will feature original works, and arrangements that highlight the breadth of voices often underrepresented on the bandstand.
WIJ and TLC invite you to collaborate with them in whatever capacity you are moved to. Charts can be found via this link: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1jQju30yLpi54QPdfRGnZ2x4FZBIUnjUz?usp=drive_link
Wāhine in Jazz is a Tāmaki Makaurau based organisation that advocates for and promotes the development of female and gender diverse jazz musicians in Aotearoa.
The Listening Collective is a Te-Whanganui-a-Tara based group of female and gender diverse musicians that aim to create spaces that uplift and empower individuals in the presentation of their creative work.

WIJ and TLC are also hosting a jam on Thursday 16th October at 4pm. All welcome, koha entry, more info here: https://events.humanitix.com/wahine-in-jazz-x-the-listening-collective-collaborative-jam
label: Music & Concerts

description:
XCOMMUNICATE, The formidable powerhouse duo COMMUNICATE return to Wellington in November with their clubnight, XCOMMUNICATE, for one night only.
Known for their long sets that incorporate decades of sound, Cyril Orson and Heylady have been punishing dance floors across Aotearoa since they joined forces 3 years ago. Off the back of a monstrous summer, which saw them play 19 shows up and down the country, the pair have spent most of 2025 in the studio finessing their own brand of audio alchemy and preparing to release their label, also named XCOMMUNICATE.
Usually XCOMMUNICATE is a 6 hour journey though decades and sonic realms, however as Heylady is still recovering from a mighty dose of burnout they’ve roped in a couple of their good friends, who happen to be some of Wellington’s finest, to join them as they lay down four hours of four to the floor. 
Halo is a mainstay on Wellington dancefloors and it was a no brainer asking her to be on this lineup. A DJ since 2000, she has played festivals across the country and never fails to rock her slot. Her set at Taniwha’s Den last summer was a big highlight and one of the best of the festival. Halo’s ability to drive forward thinking sound and her clever construction of sets are just two reasons you need to be on her floor.
DJ Coda is the godfather of techno in New Zealand. With a career that spans decades, he isn’t just a DJ but a dedicated promoter and one of the owners of NZ’s longest running student radio station, Radioactive. Part of the COMMUNICATE family from the get go (and a longtime collaborator of Heylady’s), DJ Coda is a master of his craft and never fails to deliver. Armed with knowledge , taste and a hefty love of Detroit, DJ Coda is the man when it comes to rocking the dance floor.
First release tickets are on sale now, grab yours before they are gone and come and dance the evening away with four of the best. We recommend arrive early so you don’t miss out on any of the sets, they are all going to be killer.
IMPORTANT INFO:
Our event is a safe space for all. If you or someone you know is feeling unsafe or harassed, please approach one of the DJs or bar staff. If you are behaving badly and impacting others ability to have a good time safely, you will be removed. Please act with respect and care for your fellow attendees at all times, no means no and this goes for conversations as well as more intimate requests.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
YT | WELLINGTON | MEOW, YT | WELLINGTON | MEOW
UK’s breakout rap sensation YT hits Australia & New Zealand this October.

Sign up for presale and get first access to tickets 👉🏻 https://go.astralpeople.com/YT-PS

YT has carved out a lane entirely his own — a sound built on electrifying jerk beats, autotuned hooks that stick in your head, and a razor-sharp lyrical style that’s as witty as it is unapologetic.
From his cult SoundCloud tape #SWAGRENAISSANCE to his viral hit “Black and Tan” with Lancey Foux, he’s established a distinctive British sound that’s turning heads worldwide.

In just two years, he’s gone from Oxford student to millions of streams and headline shows across Europe. Tracks like Prada or Celine and MVP have only fuelled the fire, and his latest tape OI! proves why he’s one of the most exciting voices in rap right now.

This October, YT lands in Auckland, Wellington, Melbourne, Sydney and Perth for his debut shows in Australia & New Zealand.

Expect raw energy, chaos, and the sound of rap’s next wave coming alive on stage.

2025 is already moving at full speed — and YT is only just getting started.
